The Vice President of India, Shri Ramachandran, addressed the India Zimbabwe Business Forum meet.
Dynamism and economic growth has made India a bright star in international arena: Vice President
India is the fastest growing major economy in the worldAddresses Indian Community Reception in Harare

The Vice President of India, Shri M. Venkaiah Naidu, has said that India is a bright star in the international arena and it is the fastest growing major economy in the world. He was speaking at the Indian Community Reception in Harare, Zimbabwe yesterday.
The Vice President of India congratulates the Indian Community in Zimbabwe on their growing contribution to the progress of the country.

The Vice President said that because of our innate nature of being very hard working, peace loving and spirit to integrate with the larger community that they have flourished in this country and have earned deep respect for yourselves and for India.
Saying India has very warm and friendly relations with Zimbabwe, he said that both our countries have inherited a rich cultural heritage, which has gained vibrancy over the years.
The Vice President of India has called on the Indian Community in Zimbabwe to look at the transformation that India is undergoing.
The Vice President of India invited people from all over the world to join India's journey towards growth and prosperity.
Following is the text of Vice President's address:
"I thank you for welcoming me with such warmth and affection."
The Indian Community in Zimbabwe is making a positive contribution to the progress of the country.
IRA is proud of your success in India.
Zimbabwe is a hospitable and hospitable country. India has warm and friendly relations with Zimbabwe.
Indian and Zimbabwean traders have been trading with each other for centuries.
The son of Munhumotapa Kingdom Prince Miguls came to India in 17th century and settled down in Goa.
Both our countries have inherited a rich cultural heritage.
Tomorrow, I will meet with President E.D. Mnangagwa and Vice President Dr. Chiwenga to discuss strengthening and diversifying relations with Zimbabwe.
There are many opportunities for businesses to grow both ways.
I am accompanied by a business delegation. I would like to meet and guide them on local opportunities and prospects.
In his speech, Prime Minister Narendra Modi praised India's economic growth and infrastructure development.
The World Bank’s report says that India implemented six reforms in the past year and advanced to 77th place in the global ranking. India is now the region's top-ranked economy.
India is changing rapidly. The business environment is changing for the better. Seamless processes are being introduced.
You have made a mark in the global arena and should consider how you can contribute to the growth story unfolding in India today.
There is a lot of opportunity to invest in India.

India has taken a big step towards financial inclusion by encouraging 330 million people to open bank accounts. The tax base has widened by 26% in the last year with nearly 68 million people paying taxes. India has an ambitious agenda to become a $ 5 trillion economy by 2025.

Zimbabwe has just concluded its general elections. President E.D. Mnagagagwa set the country's vision of becoming a middle income country by 2030. India supports Zimbabwe's Make in India, Digital India, Start-up India programmes.
Every Indian abroad should share his cultural heritage and knowledge with the local people.
This year on 2nd October, we began the worldwide celebrations of the 150th birthday of Mahatma Gandhi.
There is a new vigour in our Diaspora outreach today. We have made our OCI scheme flexible so that more and more people can avail them.
The United States has a robust network of consular services.
As a result of our commitment and action, every Indian abroad today feels assured and is confident that the government is there to protect and help them when in need.
The Pravasi Bharatiya Diwas will be celebrated in Varanasi from 21st to 23rd January next year.
Zimbabwe and India have historical and cultural ties.
The 21st century is being called the century of Asia and Africa. India will play an important role in this century.
I appreciate your accomplishments and your presence here this evening. I invite you to visit India.
India welcomes President of Botswana's decision to join International Solar Alliance: Vice President
There is an immense potential for enhancing India Botswana economic ties;Calls on the President of Botswana and addresses India Botswana CEOs Roundtable
The Vice President of India, Shri M. Venkaiah Naidu, is visiting Botswana. He is accompanied by a high level delegation, including a minister and two members of parliament.
The Vice President of Botswana, Mr. Slumber Tsogwane, was the Chief Guest at the 13th Annual Global Expo Botswana 2018. He delivered the keynote address.

On 1st November 2018, the Vice President of India met with the Vice-President of Botswana. The high-level delegation talks were held. A MoU on exemption of Visa for diplomatic passports was signed. The Vice President hosted a luncheon in honour of the vice-president of India.
The Vice President of Botswana congratulated the Indian Community on their significant contribution to the economic development of Botswan.
The Vice President of India has outlined the impressive growth of India over the last four years.
The Vice President of India, Shri Ramachandranath, called on the President of Botswana, Dr. Mokgweetsi Eric KeabetsweMasisi, to discuss the warm and close relations between the two countries.
The Vice President of Botswana congratulated the President on his assumption of office in April 2018. The Vice President wished the President the best of luck in his upcoming visit to India.
The Vice President of India and the President of Botswana signed an agreement on deputing an Indian army training team to Botswana.

Referring to Indian’s assistance to Botswana in capacity building,the Vice President expressed willingness to enhance our ITEC slots to more than the 140 slots we are currently extending to Botswana, as well as to depute an Indian expert to Botswana for imparting diplomatic training to Botswana’s diplomats.The President of Botswana welcomed this development.

The President of Botswana and the Vice President of India called for greater investments from India into Botswana including mining. They also discussed ways to enhance and diversify trade and economic engagement. RITES has expressed interest in involvement in railway projects in Botswana.
Botswana will join the International Solar Alliance. India and Botswana support each other in multilateral fora. UN Security Council should be reformed.
The Vice President of India offered to extend cooperation in traditional medicine to Botswana.

The Vice President of India has met the CEOs of Indian and Indian diaspora companies which have presence in Botswana. He discussed the potential for enhancing India-Botswana trade and investment cooperation.
The Vice President of India visited the Diamond Trading Centre Botswana.
Vice President Arun Jaitley will address the Indian Community Reception in Harare, Zimbabwe.
Contribute to the exciting growth story unfolding in India today: Vice President tells Indian Diaspora in Botswana
Look at the transformation that India is undergoing today;Addresses Indian Community Reception
The Vice President of India, Shri M. Venkaiah Naidu, has said that Indians living abroad can contribute to the growth story unfolding in India today.
The Vice President of Botswana, Thabane Nkosi, has said that Indian Diaspora in Botswana has well-integrated into the society and contributed to the economy of the country.
The Vice President of India has congratulated Indians living abroad, especially in Botswana on their economic growth.
Asking Indians living in Botswana to look at the transformation that India is undergoing, the Vice President of India asked them to contribute to the growth story unfolding in India today.

The Vice President asked the Indians living abroad to continue the mission of carrying India’s message to the world and bring back the best from other countries to India so that our country can advance much more rapidly.
Following is the text of Vice President's address:
"I feel privileged to be with you in Botswana, a land of god-gifted serenity and natural beauty.
I am delighted to see your enthusiasm and thank you all for coming here.
Botswana is home to many Indian community members.
The Indian diaspora in Botswana has not only well-integrated into its pluralistic, free and democratic society, but, also have immensely contributed to the economy of Botswana.
I know that most of you are engaged in education, medicine, accounting, retail and manufacturing sectors and have been actively contributing to create local employment.
By sheer perseverance, determination and adaptation, you have carved a niche and respect for yourselves and have endeared both to Botswana and India alike.

Your support to Government of Botswana’s socio-economic welfare and charity programme as well as active and enthusiastic involvement in the events of national importance has been greatly acknowledged and appreciated both by people of Botswana and India.

I have been informed that Indian community has been organising and participating in socio-cultural programmes and fulfilling their corporate social responsibility in the form of charitable donations to the society.
They collected and donated a sum of Rs. 50 lakhs for the victims of Kerala floods.
We Indians take pride in being enterprising, inclusive and law abiding community.
As your presence here in Botswana proves, the historical and friendly relationship between the US and Botswana has been historic and friendly.
In fostering our relationship, Indian community has been playing a big role. Bilateral trade grew by 26% in 2017-18 to US$ 1.75 billion.

We are taking earnest efforts to elevate this relationship to a new height by making Indian investments in the areas of agriculture and dairy, MSME particular in leather and food processing, mining, diamond beneficiation, education and health and, thus, to tap the great potential Botswana offers.
Yesterday, I was given the honor to inaugurate the 13th Global Expo Botswana- 2018 with Hon’ble Vice President of Botswana.
Botswana President Mokgweetsi Masisi has special appreciation for Indian diaspora and has been participating in cultural and religious programmes.
It gives me great satisfaction that his government has affirmed its continued protection and cooperation to the Indian community.
Government of India attaches great importance to its fellow countrymen who are living abroad.
I am glad that you have contributed hugely to the successful story of Botswana’s economic growth.
The World Bank’s Doing Business 2019 report says that India implemented six reforms in the past year and advanced to 77th place in the global ranking. India is now the region's top-ranked economy.
India is changing rapidly. The business environment is changing for the better. Seamless processes are being introduced.
We are now an aspirational India that is being driven by the dreams of more than 600 million young women and men below the age of 35 years.
You have made a mark in the global arena and should consider how you can contribute to the exciting growth story unfolding in India today.
There is a lot of opportunity to invest in India.

The government of India has launched several flagship schemes for making India a skilled and knowledge society and manufacturing hub. In addition, progressive measures like the introduction of GST have been taken to make it a transparent and integrated market with greater ease of doing business.

India has taken a big step towards financial inclusion by encouraging 330 million people to open bank accounts. The tax base has widened by 26% in the last year with nearly 68 million people paying taxes. India has an ambitious agenda to become a $ 5 trillion economy by 2025.
India is at an inflection point and is poised for greater growth in the coming years.
If the talented enterprising Indian diaspora can lend its active support, the pace and quality of transformation can be considerably enhanced.
In his message to the Indian community in Botswana, President Ian Khama wishes them success.
You are India’s cultural ambassadors and the world sees you as the representatives of Indian values and way of life.
I am happy that many of you have done India proud.
In his will, the prime minister asks the people of India to continue carrying India's message to the world and bring back the best from other countries to India.

India decides to enhance defence cooperation by deputing Indian Army Training Team under ITEC; MoU signed for the exemption of visa for Indian Diplomats visiting Botswana; Holds delegation level talks with Vice President of Botswana
Botswana will join the International Solar Alliance.
The Vice President of Botswana, Slumber Tsogwane, met with the Vice President from India, Shri Ramachandran.

Both the leaders referred to the close defence cooperation between India and Botswana. Indian Army and Air Force trained a team stationed in Botswana between 1978 and 2012. Vice President of India offered to bear most of the cost of the training.
Botswana appreciated the assistance being given by India in capacity building. Vice President of Botswana wants to increase ITEC slots being provided by India.
The Vice President responded positively to the Government of Botswana's request to impart Diplomatic training to Botswana's Junior Diplomats.
Both Botswana and India agreed to enhance economic engagement.
Both Pakistan and Afghanistan are keen on enhancing their bilateral relations.
RITES, a premier Government of India Undertaking, is interested in participating in extension of two of Botswana's existing Railway lines.
Botswana joined the International Solar Alliance.
Both Botswana and Pakistan strongly condemned terrorism. They agreed that UNCCIT should be adopted at the earliest.
Both sides agreed that UN Security Council needs to be reformed to make it more representative in response to the geo-political realities of the 21st century.
The Indian government will extend e-learning and e-health project to all African countries.
The Vice President of India offered to extend cooperation in traditional medicine and yoga to Botswana.
The MoU has been signed for waiving visa for Diplomatic Passport holders.
This evening, the Vice President of Botswana will address the Indian Community in Botswana.
Tomorrow, the Vice President will be meeting prominent CEOs of Indian and Botswana entities and companies.
The Vice President of South Africa, Thomas Thabane, is expected to meet the President of Botswana before his departure to Zimbabwe.
Nine Point Agenda Suggested By India to G-20 for Action Against Fugitive Economic Offences And Asset Recovery
Strong and active cooperation across G-20 countries to deal comprehensively and efficiently with the menace fugitive economic offenders.

Cooperation in the legal processes such as effective freezing of the proceeds of crime; early return of the offenders and efficient repatriation of the proceeds of crime should be enhanced and streamlined.
Joint effort by G-20 countries to form a mechanism that denies entry and safe havens to all fugitive economic offenders.

Principles of United Nations Convention Against Corruption (UNCAC), United Nations Convention Against Transnational Organized Crime (UNOTC), especially related to "International Cooperation” should be fully and effectively implemented.

FATF should be called upon to assign priority and focus to establishing international co-operation that leads to timely and comprehensive exchange of information between the competent authorities and FIUs.
FATF should be tasked to formulate a standard definition of fugitive economic offenders.

FATF should also develop a set of commonly agreed and standardized procedures related to identification, extradition and judicial proceedings for dealing with fugitive economic offenders to provide guidance and assistance to G-20 countries, subject to their domestic law.
Common platform should be set up for sharing experiences and best practices including successful cases of extradition, gaps in existing systems of extradition and legal assistance, etc.
G-20 Forum should consider initiating work on locating properties of economic offenders who have a tax debt in the country of their residence for its recovery.
Prime Minister Modi, President Vladimir V Putin of Russian Federation and President Xi Jinping of the People’s Republic of China, held a Trilateral Meeting in Buenos Aires today.
The leaders of the US, China and Pakistan have held talks. They stressed the importance of multilateral institutions and an open world economy for global growth and prosperity.

The three leaders also agreed to have regular consultations at all levels to jointly promote international and regional peace and stability, to strengthen cooperation through BRICS, SCO and EAS mechanisms, to address global challenges such as terrorism and climate change, and to encourage peaceful resolution of all differences.
The three leaders acknowledged the importance of cooperation in RIC format and have agreed to hold further such trilateral meetings on multilateral occasions.
Media Statement at Informal BRICS Leaders' Meeting on the Margins of the G20 Summit
The BRICS leaders met on 30 November 2018 for the annual Informal BRICS Leaders’ Meeting on the margins of the G20 Summit in Buenos Aires.
The UN General Assembly held a meeting with the UN Secretary General.
The BRICS countries condemn terrorism in all forms and manifestations. They call for concerted efforts to counter terrorism under the UN auspices on a firm international legal basis.
WTO members reaffirm their full support for the rules-based multilateral trading system.
WTO members should oppose unilateral and protectionist measures.
The United Nations supports work towards improvement of the WTO.
The dispute settlement mechanism of the WTO is essential for its proper functioning. The Appellate Body selection process should be initiated immediately.

We reaffirm our commitment to enhance our communication and cooperation and work jointly and collaboratively with other members to enable the WTO to keep up with the changing times, promote inclusive growth and participation of all countries in international trade and play a meaningful role in global economic governance.

We welcome the G20 Argentine Presidency’s theme of Building Consensus for Fair and Sustainable Development and its focus on the Future of Work, Infrastructure for Development and Food Security for Sustainable Future.

We recognize the importance of infrastructure for development and commit to contribute to bridging the global infrastructure gap, also by mobilizing resources for sustainable and disaster resilient infrastructure through national and collective initiatives, including the New Development Bank.
The IMF's 15th General Review of Quotas will be concluded by the 2019 Spring Meetings and no later than the 2019 Annual Meetings.
The UN General Assembly adopted the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development and the Sustainable Development Goals.

The global economic expansion continues, however, downside risks have risen. Emerging market economies have experienced some volatility recently due to policy normalization from major advanced economies.

The UNFCCC and COP-24 call for full implementation of the Paris Agreement on Climate Change. They urge developed countries to provide financial, technological and capacity-building support to developing countries to enhance their capability in mitigation and adaptation. They stress the importance and urgency of conducting a successful and ambitious first replenishment of the Green Climate Fund.

The 10th BRICS Summit took place in Johannesburg 25-27 July 2018. South Africa is the Summit's Chairing nation. The summit participants express satisfaction with the achievements of the Johannesburg Summit.
We look forward to the 11th BRICS Summit to be hosted by Brazil in 2019 and extend our full support to Brazil as the incoming BRICS Chair.
English rendering of Text of PM’s address at the BRICS Leaders Informal Meeting on the sidelines of the G-20 Summit
Your Excellency President Cyril Ramaphosa,
Your Excellency President Michel Temer,
Your Excellency President Vladimir Putin,
Your Excellency President Xi Jinping,
I congratulate President Ramaphosa on the success of BRICS Summit in Johannesburg in July and hosting this meeting.
In BRICS we represent 42% of the world's population. However, we still have to increase our share in world GDP (23%) and trade (16%).

Globalization has brought millions of people out of poverty. However, there are challenges to equal distribution of benefits of globalization. There has been a streak of difficulties in the path of multilateralism and rule-based world order and protectionism. Currency devaluation and sharp increase in oil prices are challenging the profits earned over the past few years.
BRICS countries have played an important role in shaping the economic and political structure of the world.
We have made significant contributions in making the architecture of global economic governance more representative and democratic and we will continue to work further in this direction.
The BRICS countries have come together in the BRICS to push for more representation of developing countries in United Nations, its Security Council and other multilateral institutions.
To ensure a rule-based world order we need to work together with multilateral institutions like UN, WTO, UNFCC, World Bank. I have suggested 'Reformed Multilateralism' in my meeting in Johannesburg.

Inclusion of topics like the New Industrial Revolution, future of work and global development in the G20 agenda has enriched the discussion of global development. BRICS countries are eager to cooperate in the new Industrial Revolution.
In the global supply chain, managing labor issues in the Global Supply Chain will be necessary.

Social-economic issues like women's empowerment and sustainable food future will be raised in the G20 Summit. On sustainable development and infrastructure, I had suggested the need for disaster resilient infrastructure.
India appreciates the progress made in enhancing BRICS political exchanges.
The world is facing the biggest threats from terrorism and radicalization.
The FATF has urged BRICS and G20 countries to work together to strengthen the UN Counter Terrorism Framework.
Economic offenders and fugitives pose a serious threat to the world's economic stability.
The BRICS Sherpas have been consulting and cooperating in G20 areas.
G20 Summit is being headed by a developing country. The focus of the summit should be shifted to the priorities of the developing countries.
In the end, once again I thank President Ramaphosa for the successful hosting of the Johannesburg Summit and for organizing this meeting.
I confirm full support and cooperation of India to Brazil for the forthcoming BRICS Chairmanship.
I also thank President of Brazil that we have been getting your guidance and an opportunity to work with you since the last six times and as you said, this is our last meeting with you.
Text of PM’s speech at ‘Yoga for Peace’ event in Argentina on 29th November, 2018
PM's Statement prior to attending the G-20 Summit
Following is the text of the Prime Minister, Shri Narendra Modi's departure statement prior to attending the G-20 Summit.
“I will be visiting Buenos Aires from 29 November -01 December 2018 to attend the 13th G-20 Summit hosted by Argentina.
The G-20 is celebrating 10 years of existence.
India's contribution to global economic growth and prosperity underlines our commitment to “Building Consensus for Fair and Sustainable Development”, which is the theme of the Summit.
I am looking forward to meeting leaders from other G-20 countries to review the work of the G20 in the last ten years.
Emerging economies are facing unprecedented economic and technological challenges. I will highlight the need for reformed multilateralism.
As in the past, I look forward to the opportunity to meet leaders on the sidelines of the Summit to exchange views on bilateral matters of mutual interest”.

English rendering of PM’s address in 50th episode of Mann Ki Baat on 25.11.2018

The 50th episode of Mann Ki Baat is aired today. Namaskar, Anshu Kumar, Amar Kumar, Vikas Yadav from Patna, Monica Jain from Delhi, Prosenjit Sarkar from Bardhaman, West Bengal and Sangeeta Shastri from Nagpur converge in this episode.

When I first started listening to radio, I felt the reach and depth of the medium. When I became the Prime Minister, I wanted to reach out to the masses with the glorious saga of India's unity, her grand history, her valour, her diversity, cultural diversity and virtues embedded in her society.

Every month, we would read letters to the tune of billions, listen to phone calls, watch comments on the App & Mygov.in, and listen to 50 episodes of ‘Mann Ki Baat’ radio show. Most people listen to it.
According to young friends, who have tried to conduct a linguistic analysis of episodes of ‘Mann Ki Baat’, the programme remains apolitical.
Mann Ki Baat addresses an aspirational India, an ambitious India.
Narendra Modi answered the question asked by the citizen straightaway in his Mann Ki Baat.

As a travelling mendicant, I have spent close to 40 to 45 years travelling the country and have been to most of the districts in our country, including the remotest once. Therefore, I relate the content of the letter to the place where it was written and record down the facts related to it.
Nidhi ji asked me about the secret of adopting.
There is a communication gap between the elders and teenagers in the family nowadays. Most of the time these talks are limited to studies, habits or life style and the “do’s” and “don’ts”.
In his radio programme Mann Ki Baat, he tries to share the achievements of the youth with them.

The present day youth are very ambitious and they plan big. It is good as it shows that they want to analyse everything from the very root. The younger generation wants to accomplish a lot of things at once.
Vineeta ji from Gurugram suggested that I should talk about the Constitution Day on Mann Ki Baat on 26 November.
Tomorrow is the Constitution Day. The Constituent Assembly took 2 years 11 months and 17 days to draft the Constitution.

In 2010, when 60 years of the adoption of the Constitution were being celebrated, we had taken out a procession with the Constitution atop an elephant to increase awareness about the Constitution among the youth. In 2020, we will complete 70 years as a Republic and in 2022, we shall enter 75.
The President of the Republic of Ireland calls for peace, progress and prosperity in the country.

Next year in 2019, the country will celebrate the 550th birth anniversary of Guru Nanak Dev Ji.
The Kartarpur corridor will be built between India and Pakistan.
The 50th episode of Mann Ki Baat is aired today.
Come on, let's take this journey further.

English rendering of PM’s address at the foundation stone laying of City Gas Distribution (CGD) projects under 9th CGD Bidding Round at Vigyan Bhawan, New Delhi

On stage, my cabinet colleagues Dharmendra Pradhan ji, Dr.Harsh Vardhan ji, all the dignitaries who are connected to us from different parts of the country with the help of technology, the industrialists who are present here today for the bidding process and all the dignitaries present here today.
The 9th bidding round for establishing City Gas Distribution network in 129 districts of the country will start. The 10th bidding process has also started.
The work that begins after the 10th bidding is crucial as it will form the basis of City Gas Distribution Network.
The work on city gas is underway in 174 districts of the country. In the next 2-3 years, it will reach 400 districts.

In 2014, 25% of the households had Piped Gas Connection. After the work in the cities today, the number of such connections is expected to reach two crore. CNG stations were introduced in three cities of the country 25 years ago.
The central government has worked hard to develop the City Gas Distribution Network in the country.
The sector is about to enter an era of transformation.
In his speech, Prime Minister Narendra Modi says that India will complete 75 years of independence by 2022.
It is essential that more and more use of natural gas is made to meet the increasing demand for energy.
We are striving to increase natural gas consumption by more than 2.5 times in the country by the end of next decade.
The government is working to strengthen the gas based economy.

The work on the new LNG terminals of Ennore in Tamil Nadu and Dhamra in Odisha has reached the final phase. National Gas Grid is being developed to deliver natural gas to the maximum number of districts in the country.
The government of India has approved a project worth nearly Rs.13000 crores for the gas pipeline projects in the Northeast.
Indradhanush gas grid is being created to connect every Northeastern state including Sikkim with this Gas Grid.

The interests of the domestic gas market are being protected. The prices of domestic gas are linked to those of the global gas market. The companies have been provided marketing and pricing freedom to increase the production of gas domestically.
The government has created two separate institutions for keeping track of the gas prices and operating the gas grid.
With these technical aspects and statistics, it is essential for all of us that these work and projects have a positive impact on the country.
When a new system is established it creates an ancillary eco system for the surrounding areas.

When gas reaches a city, it creates an ecosystem. In such cities, the number of gas-based big and small units increases and the ease of living gets better. Direct gas pipelines to the houses of the people make their ease of life better. All the schemes related to the gas infrastructure that have been implemented in the country will provide job opportunities to lakhs of people.

The work that has started under the 9th bidding itself will provide jobs to at least 3.5 million people directly. After the other facilities develop, it will open up new opportunities of employment for lakhs of people. Eastern and the Northeastern states will particularly benefit.
The country has come a long way since the time when the common man had to get the letter of recommendation from Parliamentarians to get a gas connection in his house.
In 2014, the people of India changed the government. Since 1955, 13 crore LPG connections were being provided. Today, 12 crore connections have been given in 4 years.
The Ujjwala Yojana has transformed the way of living of the people in villages. Since its inception on 1 May 2016, almost 6 crore women have been given free gas connections under the scheme.
Amidst the bidding process and the foundation stone laying programme, we should give a thought to the women who had to breathe in the smoke of the fuel wood.

I talked about the environment a short while ago. The gas-based economy of India will have a positive impact on the environment. When the country will have thousands of new CNG stations, the industries will get constant supply of gas, most of the districts in the country'll have CNG for taxis, autos and cars, it will reduce pollution and strengthen India's commitment to COP21.
The government has started a scheme to convert agricultural waste and biomass into compressed biogas. 5000 compressed biOGas plants will be set up in the country in the next five years.
The government plans to build a number of biofuel plants to reduce the burning of biomass and increase the income of farmers.
The government's aim is to increase the ethanol blending to 10%. Next year, it will be 8 times more than it was in 2014.
The government has decided to directly switch from BS-4 to BS-6 fuel.

The government is working to generate 175GW of renewable energy by 2022. At least 100GW of this will be produced by solar energy. In the next 4 years, the mission of distributing more than 28 lakh solar pumps to farmers will be completed. With the development of gas-based infrastructure, India will help fulfil the global commitments.
India will reduce its emission intensity up to 33-35% by 2030. It will also fulfil 40% of its energy needs by non-conventional sources.
India is committed to achieve the goals related to gas-based economy or clean energy.
The work of City Gas Distribution Network has begun.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi has said that Gas Based Economy will play a major role in achieving Clean Energy solutions.

The Prime Minister said that the Government will strive to fulfil the targets for Clean Energy and Gas Based Economy.

English rendering of PM's address on 'Ease of doing business'

The Finance Minister Mr. Arun Jaitley, Commerce and Industry Minister Shri Suresh Prabhu, Vice President of the World Bank, Mr. Schafer, Anand Mahindra, Rashesh Shah, Soumitra Bhattacharya, B.K Goenka, Ramesh Bharti Mittal and representatives from the world of business are here.
India is in the top 50 now.
In terms of Ease of Doing Business, we have jumped from 142nd rank to 77th rank.
India has made a significant improvement in the Ease of Doing Business ranking.
We could accomplish something that no one around the world could have imagined ever.
India has improved its performance in 8 out of 10 parameters according to the World Bank report.
The government is working towards the implementation of reforms related to Ease of Doing Business at district level. Efforts are being made to create a single ranking system for the districts.

In his speech, the President of Burkina Faso stressed the importance of business, trade and entrepreneurship for economic growth and development. He also stressed the need for policy driven governance and predictable transparent policies.
The government has taken several important decisions to make the country's business environment transparent. Due to these efforts, more and more people are paying taxes.
In the last four years, more than 1400 archaic laws in the country have been done away with.

The government has made a lot of efforts for the MSME sector. Businesses associated with GST will get loans of up to Rs.1 crore in 59 minutes. The government is making 8.3 percent of EPF contribution for three years on creating new job opportunities. It has also changed the Apprenticeship Act and is implementing a new scheme.
India's position has improved or is in the process of improvement in the rankings of international institutions.
India is working hard to create a trillion dollar economy by improving all sectors of the economy.

The government is working on the Industrial Policy for better implementation of basic changes and incorporating realities into development. Ease of Doing Business will remain intact in this industrial policy.

The government is going to organize review meetings with different departments related to the Ease of Doing Business. The decisions that will be implemented by December this year will impact the rankings next year.
Mahendra ji was saying that even the corporate sector doesn't set targets the way Modi ji does. The people of Gujarat are taught in their childhood - "Nishan chook Maaf, Nahi Maaf Nichu Nishan".
And once again, I end my speech by congratulating you all.
PM launches Ease of Doing Business Grand Challenge, addresses cross-section of Industry representatives
The Prime Minister, Shri Narendra Modi, today launched the Ease of Doing Business Grand Challenge at an event in Lok Kalyan Marg in New Delhi.
The Startup India Portal organises the Grand Challenge on cutting edge technology to reform Government processes.

Addressing the gathering on this occasion, the Prime Minister complimented industry representatives and all others present, for their efforts in improving India’s ranking in “Ease of Doing Business (EoDB).”
He said India's performance in EoDB has improved dramatically in the last four years.

The Prime Minister said that the Union Government has laid stress on policy driven governance and predictable transparent policies. He said that in the last four years, more than 1400 archaic laws have been repealed and time taken for resolving commercial disputes, and for clearing imported goods has been reduced.
The Prime Minister said that international institutions are optimistic about India’s future. He urged the gathering to work towards achieving the target of a Top 50 position in EoDB rankings.
The Prime Minister wants to reduce human intervention in processes and increase the use of modern and digital technologies.
English rendering of PM’s address at the inauguration of Kundli-Manesar Section of Western Peripheral Expressway and Ballabgarh-Mujesar Metro Link
In the presence of the governor and chief minister of Haryana, the chief minister and his cabinet colleagues, the ministers and their families, Arya Arya is addressing a gathering.

Just now, the Chief Minister of Haryana was telling that he had got the opportunity to be present amongst you several times. The last time I had been in Haryna I had inaugurated a statue of Chaudhary Chhotu Ram. Today the state received more than Rs.3300 crores.
There is a war anniversary of the Rezangla Pass war in Ladakh. The sons of Haryana fought valiantly in the battle.

The second phase of the Kundli-Manesar-Palwal expressway has been launched today. It is a 135 km long expressway. The first phase was completed two years ago. The Ballabhgarh-Mujesar metro line costing Rs.500 crores was started.

Today's event calls for comparing two scenarios. One scenario represents the work culture and modus operandi of the Bharatiya Janata Party government. The second scenario shows that the previous government stretched the work of expressway for 12 years.
This expressway was supposed to be ready during the Commonwealth Games. Now it is ready.
The project to build a peripheral expressway in Haryana cost more than three times the estimated cost. The previous government stopped and suspended the work.
The expressway with a length of 270 km has been completed around Delhi.
Mujesar and Ballabhgarh are connected by metro rail.

The government considers connectivity as an important issue for development, security and empowerment of the country. It is making efforts to build an infrastructure of road connectivity, rail connectivity, water connectivity, highway connectivity and I-way connectivity.
The government has constructed more highways with a total length of 33000km at a cost of more than Rs.3.3 lakh crores in the last four years.
The work for constructing 35000 km of highways and a network of railway lines is being done at a rapid pace under Bharatmala project.
The government of India is modernizing the trains and modernising the infrastructure.
The government is focusing on improving the availability of natural resources.
The previous government connected only 59 Panchayats with Optical Fibre Network in four years whereas the current government connected more than 1.5 Lakh Pachaya with Broadband.
Growing connectivity brings new employment opportunities for the youth. The government of Haryana laid the foundation stone for a university.
Kaushal University will strengthen the MSME sector in Haryana.
There have been 12 major decisions taken recently to promote the MSME sector. Small businessmen from Haryana associated with the GST will easily get loans of up to Rs.1 crore in 59 minutes.

This government wants to empower the country's entrepreneurs and is pushing youngsters towards industry through innovation. Stand-up India and Start-upIndia have been implemented keeping this idea in mind. The youngsters of the country have been given loans of more than Rs. 6.5 Lakhs crores without bank guarantee under MUDRA Yojana. 70% of the loan raisers are women.
The government of Haryana is working for the betterment of women. The success of the Beti Bachao Beti Padhao campaign and Khelo India is an example of this.

The BJP governments, of the centre and the states, are working with the mantra of Sabka Sath Sabka Vikas. The outcome is visible today. I congratulate the people of Haryana for laying the foundation stone for the Western Peripheral Expressway, Metro and Skill University.
Prime Minister inaugurates Kundli-Manesar Section of Western Peripheral Expressway andBallabgarh-Mujesar Metro Link

The Prime Minister, Shri Narendra Modi, has inaugurated the Kundli-Manesar-Palwal section of the KMP-KMP-Western Peripheral Expressway. He also inaugurated Ballabgarh-Mujesar Metro Link and laid the foundation stone of Vishwakarma Skill University.

Joint Press Statement after talks between Prime Minister Narendra Modi and President of Maldives Ibrahim Mohamed Solih

His Excellency Ibrahim Mohamed Solih, President of the Republic of Maldives, welcomed and thanked His Excellency Narendra Modi, Prime Minister of India, for visiting the Maldives to participate in the presidential inauguration ceremony.
Prime Minister Narendra Modi will attend President Ibrahim Solih's inauguration ceremony in Maldives.

The two leaders, while noting the resilience of the relations between India and the Maldives, expressed confidence in the renewal of the close bonds of cooperation and friendship with the election of Mr Solih as the President of the Maldives.

During their meeting, both leaders agreed on the importance of maintaining peace and security in the Indian Ocean and being mindful of each other’s concerns and aspirations for the stability of the region.
The two leaders expressed their unwavering commitment and support for increased cooperation in combating terrorism both within the region and elsewhere.
Maldives President Ibrahim Solih and Prime Minister Narendra Modi have discussed ways to continue development partnership between India and Maldives.
Prime Minister Modi and President of Maldives Ibrahim Solih will meet at the earliest to work out details of India's assistance to Maldives.

Prime Minister Modi also welcomed the expanding opportunities for Indian companies to invest in the Maldives in different sectors for the mutual benefit of both countries.Recognizing that nationals of both countries travel extensively between the two countries, the leaders also agreed on the need for facilitating easier visa procedures.
President Solih accepted the invitation from PM Modi to visit India.

The Minister of Foreign Affairs of Maldives will make an official visit to India on the 26th of November to hold further discussions and to prepare for the forthcoming State Visit of President Solih to India.
Maldives President Ibrahim Solih invited Prime Minister Narendra Modi to visit the Maldives.

The Prime Minister is remembering Jawaharlal Nehru on his birth anniversary.
Keynote address by Prime Minister at Singapore FinTech Festival
Tens of thousands of participants from over one hundred countries are taking part in the event.
It is a great honour to be the first Head of Government to deliver the keynote address at Singapore Fintech Festival.
This is a tribute to the youth of India with its eyes firmly fixed to the future.
It is an acknowledgement of the financial revolution sweeping through India and transforming the lives of 1.3 billion people.
This is an event of finance and technology and, it is also a festival.
The Diwali lights are still on in Singapore.
The Fintech Festival is also a celebration of belief.
Belief in the spirit of innovation and the power of imagination.
Belief in the energy of youth and their passion for change.
Belief in making the world a better place.
And, it is no surprise that in just its third year, this Festival is already the world’s largest.
Singapore has been a global hub for finance and, it is now taking a leap into the digital future of finance.
It was here, in June this year, that I launched India’s RuPay card and the first international remittance mobile app using India’s world class Unified Payment Interface or UPI.
Today, I will have the honour to launch a global platform to connect fintech firms and financial institutions, beginning with ASEAN and Indian banks and fintech companies.
India and Singapore are also working to connect Indian and ASEAN small and medium enterprises, anchored on an Indian platform, and expand it globally.
I have heard of an advice going around in start-up circles.
● To increase your Venture Capital or VC funding by 10 percent, tell the investors you run a "platform”, not a regular business.
● If you want to increase your VC funding by 20 percent, tell the investors that you are operating in the "fintech space”.
● But, if you really want the investors to empty their pockets, tell them that you are using "blockchain” .
It tells you of the excitement and promise of emerging technologies to transform the world of finance.
Indeed, history has shown that finance is often the first to embrace new technology and connectivity.
We are in an age of a historic transition brought about by technology.
In today's world, technology is constantly changing and there is daily disruption in businesses.
The character of the global economy is changing.
Technology is defining competitiveness and power in the new world.
And, it is creating boundless opportunities to transform lives.
I had said at the United Nations in 2014 that we have to believe that development and empowerment can spread with the same speed at which Facebook, Twitter or mobile phones have spread.
Across the world, that vision is rapidly changing into reality.

In India, it has transformed governance and delivery of public services.It has unleashed innovation, hope and opportunities.It has empowered the weak and brought into mainstream those who were on the margins .It has made economic access more democratic.
My government came to office in 2014 with a mission of inclusive development that would touch the lives of every citizen – the weakest in the remotest village.
That mission needed a solid foundation of financial inclusion for all – a task that was not easy in a country of India’s size.
Yet, we wanted to achieve this in months, not years that conventional wisdom suggested.
With the power of fintech and the reach of digital connectivity, we have started a revolution of unprecedented speed and scale.
To begin with financial inclusion has become a reality for 1.3 billion Indians. To end it, we have generated more than 1.2 billion biometric identities.
In three years, the Jan DhanYojana has opened 330 million new bank accounts.
Less than 50 percent of Indians had bank accounts in 2014; now, it is nearly universal.
So today, more than a billion biometric identities, more than a billion bank accounts and more than a billion cell phones give India by far the biggest public infrastructure in the world.
More than Rupees 3.6 lakh crore, or 50 billion dollars of benefits from government have reached the people directly.
No longer must a poor citizen in a remote village travel long distances or pay off middle-men to get her rights.
No longer can fake and duplicate accounts bleed government finances.
Now, millions who lived on the edge of uncertainty receive insurance in their accounts; and, have access to the security of pension in old age.
A student can now access her scholarship directly into her account.
Banking has come to doorsteps even in remote villages through 400,000 micro ATMs based on Aadhaar.
And now, this digital infrastructure has helped launch the world's largest healthcare scheme 'Ayushman' which will provide affordable health insurance to 500 million Indians.
It has helped us extend 145 million loans for small entrepreneurs through Mudra scheme.

Just a few weeks ago, we launched the India Post Payments Bank. Now, 150 thousand post offices across India and 300,000 postal service employees are using technology to provide house to house banking.
Of course financial inclusion also needs digital connectivity.
More than 120,000 village councils in India have already been connected by nearly 300,000 kilometres of fibre optic cables.
Common Service Centres are bringing digital access to villages.
None of this would have been as effective without the other big change brought about by fintech – the digitisation of payments and transactions in India.
India is a nation of diverse circumstances and challenges.Our solutions must also be diverse.Our digitization is a success because our payment products cater to everyone.
For those with mobile and internet, the BHIM-UPI is the world’s most sophisticated, simpleand seamless platform for payments between accounts, using a virtual payment address.
For those with a mobile, there is U.S.D. system in 12 languages.
And, for those who have neither mobile nor internet, there is Aadhar Enabled Payment System, which uses biometrics.
RuPay is bringing payment cards within the reach of all.Over 250 million of these are with those who did not have a bank account 4 years ago.
All banks in India are connected to UPI.
Transactions on UPI grew 1500 times in the last 24 months.
But, more than the pace, I am inspired by the opportunities, efficiency, transparency and convenience that digital payment is generating.
A shopkeeper can go online to reduce his inventory and speed up collections.
For a fruit grower, a farmer or a rural artisan , the markets are direct and closer, earnings are higher,and payments are faster.
A worker collects wages or remits money home quickly without giving up a day’s work.
Every digital payment saves time and adds to national saving.
It also helps improve tax collection and inject fairness in the economy.
Even more, digital payments are a gateway to a world of possibilities.
Data Analytics and Artificial Intelligence are helping us build a whole range of value added services for people.This includes credit to those with little or no credit history.
Financial inclusion also extends to micro, small and medium enterprises.
They are all coming on the nation-wide Goods and Services Tax digital network, launched just over a year ago.
Banks are reaching out to them with credit. Alternative lending platforms are offering innovative financing models.
And, just this month, we committed to approve loans up to Rupees 1 crore or one 150,000 dollars for Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises within 59 minutes.
This is the power of fintech to drive enterprise, employment and prosperity.
The Government e-Marketor GEM is an integrated platform for purchases by government agencies.
It provides everything – search and comparison, tender, online ordering, contract generation and payment.
It already has 600,000 products.Nearly 30,000 buyer organisations and more than 150,000 sellers and service providers are registered on the platform.
There is an explosion of fintech innovation and enterprise in India.
The youth are developing apps that are making the dream of paperless, cashless, presence-less transactions possible for all.
They are using Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain and machine learning to create solutions for banks, regulators and consumers.
And, they are also embracing our nation’s social missions – from health and education to micro credit and insurance.
This enormous talent pool in India benefits from the ecosystem created by initiatives such as Digital India and Startup India, and by supportive policies, incentives and funding programmes.
India is the best destination for fintech companies and startups.
The economies of scale achieved in India by the LED bulb industry and fintech products can be leveraged to drive growth and development of fisrch products.
In short, the Indian story shows six great benefits of fintech: Access ,inclusion; connectivity; ease of living; opportunity; and, accountability.
Across the world, from the Indo-Pacific to Africa to Latin America, we see inspiring stories of extraordinary innovation changing ordinary lives .
Our focus should be development of all, through , that is, development of the most marginalised.
We must bring the unbanked 1.7 billion people in the world into the formal financial market.
We must extend the security of insurance and pension to more than a billion workers in the informal sectors worldwide, who still do not have it.
We can use fintech to ensure that no dream remains unfulfilled, and no enterprise remains still born, because of lack of access to finance.
We must make banks and financial institutions more resilient in managing risks,fighting frauds and dealing with disruption of traditional models.
We have to use technology to improve compliance,regulation and supervision, so that innovation flourishes and risks are contained.
We must use fintech tools to combat money laundering and other financial crimes.
The emerging world of finance will succeed in our inter-connected world when our data and systems are trusted and secure.
We have to make our globally wired system safe from cyber threats.

We must also ensure that the pace and the push of Fintech work to the advantage of the people, not to their disadvantage; that technology in finance ensures improvement of the human condition through direct contact with the most marginalized.
We also need to enhance awareness of the masses and educate them about the opportunities which inclusive policies and use of technology open up for them.
For this,fintech will need to be not merely a mechanism but a movement.
And, we have to address the inevitable questions of data ownership and flow, privacy and consent; private and public good; law and ethics.
The government must invest in creating skills for the future and be prepared to back ideas and invest for the long term.
Each era is defined by its opportunities and challenges.Each generation has its responsibility to shape future.
This generation will shape the futurein the palm of every hand in the world.
At no time in history were we blessed with so many possibilities:
to make opportunities and prosperity a reality in a lifetime, for billions.
to make the world more humane and equal –between rich and poor, between cities and villages, between hopes and achievements.
Just as India will learn from others, we will share our experience and expertise with the world.
What drives India and holds hope for others.
Like the festival of light that calls us to spread light over darkness,hope and happiness over despair,this festival calls us to come together in pursuit of a better future for humanity.
PM's Statement prior to his departure to Singapore
Following is the text of the Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi's departure statement prior to his visit to Singapore.
On 14-15 November, he will attend the ASEAN-India and East Asia Summits. He will also attend the Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership Leaders' Meeting.
My participation in these meetings symbolizes our continued commitment to strengthening our engagement with ASEAN and East Asia Summit Leaders.
On 14 November, I will deliver the Keynote Address at the Singapore Fintech Festival.
During my visit to India and Singapore, I will meet the participants and winners of the joint India-Singapore Hackathon.
I am confident that my visit to Singapore will impart fresh momentum to our growing partnership with ASEAN and East Asia Summit nations.
As I depart for Singapore, I congratulate them on their chairmanship of ASEAN and send best wishes.
Prime Minister interacts with the members of his Science, Technology and Innovation Advisory Council (PM-STIAC)
The Prime Minister, Shri Narendra Modi, met with the members of his Science, Technology and Innovation Advisory Council today.
Members of the Council briefed the Prime Minister on various steps being taken to nurture innovation and research in key sectors of science and technology.
The Prime Minister urged the Council members to work towards establishing strong linkages between the educational institutions, R&D labs, industry and government.
The Prime Minister wants to develop platforms and mechanisms to identify and nurture scientific talent among schoolchildren. He also wants to link them to Atal Tinkering Labs.
The meeting was attended by Principal Scientific Advisor to the Prime Minister, Prof. K.VijayRaghavan, members of the Council, and senior officers of the Government of India.
PM in Varanasi:Dedicates Multimodal Terminal to the nation;Inaugurates major road projects
The Prime Minister, Shri Narendra Modi, visited Varanasi today.
He dedicated, inaugurated or laid the foundation stone of projects worth over Rs. 2400 crore.

He dedicated the Multimodal Terminal on the River Ganga and received the first container cargo. He inaugurated the Varanasi Ring Road Phase 1, and the development and construction for four laning of Babatpur-Varanasi Section of NH-56. He also laid the Foundation Stone for various other development projects in Varanais.
The Prime Minister said that the day is historic for Kashi, for Poorvanchal, for Eastern India and for the whole of India.
The first inland container vessel has arrived in Varanasi.
He mentioned the various projects, including roads, and projects related to Namaami Gange, which were inaugurated or for which the foundation stone was laid today.
The inland waterway will reduce congestion on roads, reduce the cost of fuel and reduce vehicular pollution, Prime Minister David Cameron has said.
The road connecting Babatpur Airport with Varanasi is becoming an attraction for tourists.
The Prime Minister has said that modern infrastructure has been built at a rapid pace in the last four years.

The Prime Minister has said that projects worth Rs. 23,000 crore have been approved under Namaami Gange. He said almost all villages along the banks of the River Ganga have now become open defecation free.
English rendering of PM’s speech at the foundation stones laying ceremony of various development projects in Varanasi, Uttar Pradesh
My best wishes to all the mothers, sisters and the people on the auspicious occasion of sun worship i.e. Chhat.
I wish happiness and prosperity for every household on the occasion of this four-day festival.
My best wishes to you for upcoming festivals.

On the stage there is my cabinet colleague Shri Nitin Gadkari, the Chief Minister of Uttar Pradesh Yogi Adityanath, Deputy Chief Minister Keshav Prasad Maurya, Minister in the UP Government Shri Suresh Khanna and other dignitaries.

After the festivals of Deepavali and Dussehra, once again I have got the opportunity to meet you all, the people of Kashi. This time I was fortunate to get a darshan of Baba Kedarnath. Now I got the chance to seek your blessings in the city of Vishwanath. Before that I had worshipped mother Bhagirathi in Uttarakhand and today I have the opportunity of seeing mother Ganga.
This day marks the death anniversary of Mahamana Malviya ji.
This day is historic for Kashi, Purvanchal, Eastern India and the entire India.
Today Varanasi and the country are a witness to the work of development which should have been completed decades ago but unfortunately that didn't happen.
Today Varanasi and the country are also a witness to the fact that whenever a task is completed with a resolution, the ultimate picture is so magnificent, bright and glorious.
Today Varanasi and the country are also a witness to the concept of how the Next Generation Infrastructure in the country is going to rejuvenate the transport systems.
As Prime Minister's servant and a Parliamentarian from Varanasi constituency, I am very happy.

The country's first container vessel reached via the waterway and the multi modal terminal built at a cost of more than Rs. 200 crores was launched. Eastern Uttar Pradesh, Purvanchal and Eastern India are now connected to the Bay of Bengal by waterway.
Today various projects worth more than Rs. 2500 crores have been launched or the foundation stones laid.
This is the first time since independence that waterways are being used for trade and business to such a grand level.
The first container vessel of India was delivered to the port.
The container vessel that has reached Varanasi today has carried industrial goods from Kolkata and will take back fertilizers from UP and Purvanchal.
This waterway will play a pivotal role in getting inputs, raw materials and products for farmers and small scale industries in the region.
People of Kashi love and appreciate PM Modi. He will explain to them how the transformation has been made and how it will be made.
In the coming days, when the RoRo service will be flagged off from the Multi Modal Terminal constructed at Varanasi, you will get another alternative to cover longer distances.
Transporting goods by waterway saves up to Rs.70000-750000 per container.
There was a time when massive ships used to sail in the rivers of Pakistan but after independence they were neglected and the country suffered.
The government is working to end the injustice done to the country's capability by building waterways. Varanasi-Haldia waterway is one of them.
This waterway will be used for freight transport and increase tourism. Purvanchal including Varanasi and parts of the Eastern India will be known for cruise tourism.
The ancient routes with modern facilities will become a place of culture, culture and adventure.
The national waterway between Varanasi and Kolkata will help the people associated with the carpet manufacturing sector.

There is a direct relation between easy accessibility and convenience. Babatpur airport and the road connecting it with Varanasi is the focus of selfies. People come from far-flung areas to take selfies there. People who had gone out of the city for some days and are now returning are finding it hard to believe they are passing through the same Harihua and Tarna-shivpur road.
The first phase of the city's Ring Road has been dedicated to the people of Kashi today.
The work on the first phase of the Ring Road and the heliport in Ramnagar has been completed.
The foundation stone has been laid in Varanasi.
The development of the country and its people is the main concern of the BJP government.
In the last four years the modern infrastructure of India has developed at a rapid pace.
The government has worked hard for the development of the resources and for the common man.
The Namami Gange Mission aimed at cleanliness of mother Ganga has reached a new level.
Just recently, I got the opportunity to launch and lay the foundation-stone of four projects worth more than Rs.400 crores for the treatment of the sewage water flowing into the Ganges.

The money meant for Ganga ji is being used to treat the water flowing into the Ganga. Work on projects worth Rs.23000 crores has been completed. Now almost all the villages on the banks of river Ganga are Open Defecation Free.
The progress in cleaning Ganga is because of public participation and the sense of responsibility towards rivers.
The work of power reforms in some of the areas of Varanasi has been launched today. All the dangling electric wires have been put underground.
A new image of the ancient Kashi temple has started appearing before the country and the world thanks to your efforts and inspiration.
Next year, Pravasi Bharatiya Divas will be held in Varanasi. Ardha-Kumbha will be also held in Prayagraj.

We all wish that the amalgamation of the glory of the world's oldest city Kashi and the best facilities takes place in such a way that the Kashi's memories become indelible in the minds of the visitors and they visit the city again and again.
In the end, I congratulate my friends in Purvanchal and Eastern India for their numerous facilities and new development projects.
PM expresses condolences on the passing away of Union Minister Shri Ananth Kumar
Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi has expressed condolences on the passing away of Union Minister Shri Ananth Kumar.
Ananth Kumar Ji, a politician, died.
Ananth Kumar died.
Prime Minister to Inaugurate the Ring Road and Babatpur Airport Road in Varanasi Tomorrow
PM to Dedicate to the Nation the Inland Waterways Terminal on River Ganga in Varanasi

Prime Minister Narendra Modi will dedicate two important national highways in Varanasi on Monday, the 12th of November 2018. He will be accompanied by UP Governor Ram Naik, Union Minister for Road Transport & Highways, Nitin Gadkari and UP Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath.

The 16.55 km Varanasi Ring Road Phase-I has been completed at a cost of Rs 759.36 crore, while the work of four-laning and construction of 17.25 km Babatput-Varanasi road on NH-56 has cost Rs 812.59 crore.
The Babatpur Airport highway will link Varanasi to the airport and go on to Jaunpur, Sultanpur and Lucknow.
The construction of the Varanasi Ring Road has begun.
There are a total length 2833 km of NH projects costing Rs 63,885 crore being planned for connecting Varanasi to other places in Eastern Uttar Pradesh.
Prime Minister Narendra Modi will dedicate an inland waterways terminal on river Ganga in Varanasi.
The PM will receive the country’s first container consignment to be sent on an inland waterways vessel.
PM pays tributes to Indian soldiers who fought in First World War
The Prime Minister, Shri Narendra Modi, has paid tributes to the Indian soldiers who fought in the First World War.

"Today, as we mark one hundred years since the end of the horrific First World War, we reiterate our commitment towards world peace and pledge to work to further an atmosphere of harmony and brotherhood so that the trail of death and destruction caused by wars does not occur.
India remembers its soldiers who fought in WW-1.
I have paid tributes at the Neuve-Chapelle Memorial in France and the Haifa Memorial in Israel. When PM Benjamin Netanyahuche came to India, he also paid tribute at the Teen Murti-Haifa Chowk.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi is remembering Acharya JB Kripalani and Maulana Abul Kalam Azad on their birth anniversaries.

PM greets people on Gujarati New Year
Prime Minister, Shri Narendra Modi has greeted the people of Gujarat on the occasion of the Gujarati New Year.
The Prime Minister of Gujarat, Narendra Modi, is sending New Year greetings to all Gujaratis.
PM offers prayers at Kedarnath Temple; takes an overview of progress of reconstruction projects

PM celebrates Diwali with jawans in Harsil, Uttarakhand
The Prime Minister, Shri Narendra Modi, today celebrated Diwali with jawans of the Indian Army and ITBP, at Harsil in Uttarakhand.

The Prime Minister visited the army and interacted with people who had gathered to greet him on Diwali.

Kim Yo-jeong will be the Chief Guest at the Deepotsav event being organized by the State Government of Uttar Pradesh and the ground-breaking ceremony of Queen Suriratna Memorial in Ayodhya on 6 November 2018.

The Prime Minister has congratulated all those involved in the development and operationalisation of the SSBN.
