English Rendering of PM’s speech at the launch of Historic Support and Outreach Initiative for MSME sector

My eminent colleagues of the Cabinet Shri Arun Jaitley ji, Shri Giriraj Singh ji, Shri Shiv Pratap Shuklaji, Shri Pon Radhakrishnan ji, other supporters from the banking sector, financial institutions, the great business and industry leaders, important dignitaries joining today from all over the country, small scale entrepreneurs, ladies and gentlemen!
In this event dedicated to the small scale industries of the country, I extend my heartfelt welcome and compliments to all you entrepreneurs joining from all parts of the country.
First of all, accept my advance best wishes on Deepawali and Hindu New Year.
This time of the year is important for farmers because their crops and agri-products reach the market.
The decisions taken during the Deepawali season have a big impact on the country's future.
Today, I want to share with the country landmark decisions taken by the government for the small industry sector.

Friends, these 12 decisions are also testimony of the fact that when Silos are broken and a Collective Initiative and Collective Responsibility isendorsed, when a Collective Decision is taken, then it has an ambient impact holistically.
In silos, all your dreams remain buried in the files. When silos break, the officers themselves speed up the matter and make sure decisions are taken faster.
12 decisions taken by the government are a great gift for Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME).
Before presenting what the future shall be like, I would like to revisit with you some things of the past and the present.
Friends, it is well known that MSME or small scale industries are the means of livelihood of millions of people in India and play an important role in the economy.
Small scale industries have been contributing significantly in several sectors.
Kanchipuramsaree or Panipat handloom
Hosiery of Ludhiana or bronze articles of Muradabad
Banaraseesaree from Banaras or locks of Aligarh
The auto industry of Jamshedpur and Pune or Chemical industry of Bharuch and electric pumps of Coimbatore
Handicrafts and Stone craft from Jodhpur and Kishangarh, as well as silver jewellery of Cuttack
Paintings of Madhubani or Sports Industry ofMeerut
"Small scale industries are spread far and wide across the expanse of the country.
The importance of small scale industries to the people of the region cannot be overemphasized.
Every district of our country holds a unique identity and that depends on the small scale industry of that district.
Upholding the rich traditions and heritage, our small industries have indeed strengthened over time and thereby contributing significantly to the Economy of India.
Friends, today India is shining as a bright spot in the Global Economy space.
The MSME sector is responsible for bringing India to the stature of an Economic Powerhouse today.
MSME sector in India has become the biggest shareholder in the past four years.
India is heading towards leading the fourth industrial revolution.
Friends, government is unitedly moving forward with you to encourage you in all future endeavors.
India has improved the infrastructure required to simplify the process of doing business here.
India has moved a long way in the Ease of Doing Business Rankings.
The Ease of Doing Business initiative aims to simplify business procedures for micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs).
The government has special focus on developing the MSME sector.
In order to strengthen the sector, according to me a special focus has to be on the following five categories:
A- You get capital easily, get loans at cheaper rate and ascertain cash flow
B- You get a market as well as an increased share on E-commerce platforms
C-Technology Upgradation is accessible
D-Ease of Doing Business is enhanced and government interference is minimised
E-Employees are guaranteed a sense of security
I will elaborate on each category one after the other.
Let me first talk about category A–ie., you get capital easily, get loans at cheaper rate and ascertain cash flow and that too without several visits to the banks.
This is your first requirement for starting a business: investing your own capital.

According to the official statistics, small entrepreneurs whose annual turnover is between 20 and 5 crores rupees have difficulty in getting loans. They often have problems in getting the loans and in clearing their outstanding bills.
To resolve this critical problem of yours, I am happy to announce a 59-minute loan portal being launched today nationwide.
Friends, some time ago there was an attempt to launch a trial under the leadership of ArunJaitley.
On the day when the portal will be implemented throughout the country, will they be able to approve the loans of 72 thousand small entrepreneurs?
The counter showing how many MSME entrepreneurs have so far borrowed through this portal, got loans approved or renewed, is changing constantly.
Sitting in some faraway corner of the country, your entrepreneur contemporary has just got a loan of one crore rupees sanctioned in 59 minutes.
The government is working hard to provide you hassle free access to resources.

I remember, when I was talking about this portal with the officers, I said that the information of the turnover of entrepreneurs is available in their GST Return, income is reported through their Tax Return, Cash Flow is also available via the bank account, then banks should simply adopt Analytics to assess the loan request and grant the loan.
I had said that this facility should be promoted in a robust manner and it should be linked to all such platforms as GST Portal.
When you file your return on the GST portal, you will also get access to the facility of a 59 minute loan portal.
Friends, our efforts are that government faciltities should reach the doorstep of every MSME entrepreneur and businessmen paying GST.
It is a new India.
Friends, now I come to today's second announcement.
While you do get intransigent approval of loan in 59 minutes, but it is also important that at what rate of interest you are getting.
Now listen carefully to what I am going to say!
Friends,now it has been decided that every GST registered MSME will be given a rebate of two percent interest on new loan or incremental loan for a loan amount of upto Rupees One crore.
This is the scope of your integrity and honesty. Joining GST and paying tax will make you secure and will entitle you to a discount of 2 percent interest on your loan.
The government has prepared a Deepawali gift for exporters. The interest rate on the loan accrued by exporters is to be increased from 3 to 5%.
The government decided to give a discount in the rate of interest to all MSME exporters.
I am hopeful this move will increase the stakes of MSME Exporters.
There are many announcements that will make it easier for you to get loans on reduced interests without visiting the banks.
But I also want that the exigencies that force you to take a loan should further be reduced.
The approval of bills by large companies to which MSMEs supply goods is delayed for long periods, which makes it necessary to take a loan to manage the business.
My third announcement is related to this. It is now mandatory that all companies with a turnover above 500 croresshall have to register on Trade Receivables e-Discounting System (TReDS) platform.
Many of you may know that TReDS is a platform which is a community of few MSME's, government PSUs, some banks as well as those companies to which these SMEs supply their goods.
The government is planning to expand the scope of TReDS platform. All PSUs of the government have been instructed to join the TRe DS platform.
The TReDS platform will offer benefits to companies with a turnover of 500 crores+.
A big company has purchased goods worth 10 Lakh rupees from a small scale entrepreneur. The entrepreneur has fulfilled the order, but the big company hasn't paid him for his supplies yet.

In such a scenario, the small trader receives help from the TReDS platform. He uploads a confirmation receipt or bill received from a big company on this platform and claims a timely payment. Since the bill is issued by a big firm, banks are liable to give credence to it and the SME businessman will receive an appropriate amount of financial support.
There is no need to invest in your business.

However, on this occasionwith this announcement, I will also request the big companies that the bills associated with small scale industries should be accepted early and their payments should not be delayed.
If the payment is delayed, Small Scale Enterprises can register their grievances on the MSME Ministry's portal to solve the problem.
It is the government's top priority that loans are easily available at low interest rates. My first three announcements have been in this direction.
The government has taken several important steps for the MSME sector. Now I come to category "B", which is creation of new market for the country's MSMEs.
Government companies bought about 1.14 trillion rupees worth of supplies last year from different sources, of which 20% must have been made MSME sector.
The government has decided to increase the compulsory requirement of 20 percent to 25 percent.

The fifth announcement is related to women entrepreneurs. It has been decided that 3% of the total purchase from the MSME sector will be reserved for women entrepreneurs and government companies must buy at least 3% from them.
In my opinion today's decision will strengthen women entrepreneurship in the country.
The government has developed another platform to provide market for partners, MSME, GeM i.e. Government E-marketplace.
GeMarket (GeM) portal has given new opportunities to micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs) in India.

Friends, so far, over 1.5 lakh suppliers have been added to the GeM portal, which has 40 thousand MSMEs. 9.5 million orders have been given and transaction of around 14 thousand crores of rupees made.
Just imagine how many entrepreneurs have reaped the benefit of this portal without sharing their earnings with or paying commission with any middlemen.
The Central Government has made an important decision.
All Central Government companies have been mandated to subscribe to GeM. They will register all their MSMEs vendors on this platform.

Friends, in today’s era of computerization and technology, e-commerce and online marketing, it is imperative for more small scale industry to join the portal to seek optimal benefit for their businesses.
SMEs will need a quality certification to be able to sell their products on e-commerce platform.
We are also developing this model of Aggregator to connect small industries with private sector companies.
SMEs face two major challenges: Capital and Market and Technological Upgradation.
The toolrooms set up in the country today are providing support to you in designing and improving product design.
The previous government facilitated the trainings of more than three and a half million people in these toolrooms. The current government managed the training of six and half million.
Today's seventh announcement that I am about to make is linked to this crucial topic of Technological upgradation.

The system of toolroom should be expanded. To achieve this, 20 hubs will be built across the country and 100 spokes such as Toolrooms will be installed. The package of six thousand crores is announced today.
This will provide MSMEs wider platform to develop better designs, enhance quality, and avail training and consultancysupportwhichwill prove to be highly beneficial.
After apprising you about the efforts being made to support you in Technological Upgradation, friends, I will now discusscategory "D" and that is - Ease of Doing Business.

Many of you entrepreneurs work in the Pharma sector. Many of you manufacture and export medicines. Small companies producing life saving essential drugs have to sell their medicines through the brand of large companies.

My eighth announcement today is linked to pharma companies. Pharma companies belonging to MSME sector have the right to do business and for that reason, we have decided to make a dedicated cluster. 70% of the costs of the clusters shall be borne by the Central Government.
Freinds, you might have noticed that since the beginning of my speech I have been reiterating terms like technology, GST, online portal, Formalization, TReDS, GeM Portal and many other terms.
GST has formalized and organized the economy. It has made it easy to connect business with new technology like Big Data Analytics. It will improve the Ease of Doing Business.
I am of the strong opinion that this is going to be the foundation of a new Business Environment for new India.
The government is going to make a ninth announcement today. MSMEs will have to file their returns once in a year instead of twice as in earlier years.
Arunjihas is making his 10th declaration today.

The government has decided that the allocation of factory visits will be decided only by a Computerized Random Allotment. It will record the details and status of his visit to a factory and his week later review visit. He will have to put it on his report portal in 48 hours.
Inspectors should not be allowed to enter small scale industries without consulting with their superiors.
The government trusts you, it trusts all the citizens of our country.
Today I am going to announce a major reform related to environmental laws for small scale industries. This is the 11th Deepawali gift from the government.
The government has decided to consolidate the two stages of Environmental Clearance and Consent to Establish for MSMEs.
The government will accept your returns on self-certification on trust.
The number of enterprises in the Green and White category will be increased.

The Government believes that only if we trust our citizens and entrepreneurs we can protect the environment more effectively. Due to this trust, partaking in the country has increased and the results are visible in the enhancement of the country's forest cover.
The government has made a major amendment in the Company Act to provide MSMEs some relief from legal complexities.
Friends, there were such provisions in the Companies Act that, due to minor mistakes or unintentional violations, merchants have often been jailed.
All this work cost you a lot. Small and medium enterprises have been acing a lot of trouble because of it.
I am happy to share with you all that the government has issued an Ordinance to save from such perils.
The rules implemented presently have been changed by the government. Now you don't have to go to court to rectify minor mistakes. You can visit the relevant department to do that.
Another advantage of this is that, more than 60% of the cases filed in different special courts will now be out from there and will go under regional directors of NCLT-National Company Law Tribunal.
The government has provided relief to small scale industries and single-owned companies.

Friends, now I move to the category "E".While taking these big decisions the government also made efforts to ensure social security to the skilled labours, artisans and labourers working in MSMEs.This is very crucial as this is an unorganised sector.
The government wants to link all the micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs) workers across the country to the government's social security schemes.

If the factory is a bit larger, then the facilities like Employee Provident Fund and ESIC will be acscertained. The new recruiters in MSME sector shall be eligible for the benefit of the Prime Minister's Employment Incentive Scheme.
Friends, these 12 decisions in the era of Globalisation will certainly strengthen the MSME sector and begins a new paradigm.

Loan facility in just 59 minutes, loan through GST portal, entrepreneurs linked to GST enjoy enhanced interest rates, cheap export credit, the decision to register all government companies as well as those with a turnover of more than 500 milliononTReDS platform and, government mandate of minimum 25 percentpurchase to be made from MSME's, compulsory threepercentpurchase from women entrepreneurs, registration of all government companies on GeM, 20 HUB and 100 Spokes nationwide for Technology Upgradation, formulation of Pharma Clusters, changes in labor laws, ease of return, inspection report in 48 hours, simplification of procedures related to environmental clearance and major changes in the Companies Act, all these decisions are going to strengthen the MSME sector and take it to new heights.
The Center and the state government employees should work more effectively and contribute more towards nation building mission.
Friends, when my team is shouldering such a mission, and will put in so much hard work, then it is obligatory for me to also contribute in a big way.
I will supervise 100 districts which have a legacy of MSMEs and are specialized in a certain skill or craft.
Friends, all you MSMEs of India are the Aspirational India, Ambitious India. With their hard earned earnings, you nurture themselves from seeds to big enterprises in the future.
The government is promoting micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs) as part of its economic development strategy.
I sincerely hope these campaigns will be beneficial for small scale industries, and MSMEs across the country will reap the benefitsof all these decisions.
I am also convinced that small enterprises will further give a new dimension to the industrial revolution of the country, and will lay the foundation stone of technology driven clean business.
With all these developments you all shall contribute in escalating the momentum and vitality of Make In India initiative.With this conation I conclude my talk.
I am sure that this Deepawali will not only be auspicious for all of you, but will be harbinger of benefits and new opportunities for the entire MSME sector of the country.

The Prime Minister is announcing 12 decisions for MSMEs today.

The Prime Minister is making 12 announcements aimed at facilitating the MSME sector.

On Ease of Doing Business, Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced that clusters will be formed of pharma MSMEs. 70% of the cost of establishing these clusters would be borne by the Union Government.
The ninth government announcement is on simplification of government procedures.
The Prime Minister has made 10th and final announcement.
The eleventh announcement is that under air pollution and water pollution laws, now both clearances have been merged as a single consent.

The Prime Minister announced that an Ordinance has been brought, under which, for minor violations under the Companies Act, the entrepreneur will no longer have to approach the Courts, but correct them through simple procedures.
Social Security for MSME Sector Employees

The Prime Minister of India has taken several decisions aimed at strengthening the MSME sector.
PM to launch major Support and Outreach Initiative for MSME sector on November 02, 2018

The Prime Minister, Shri Narendra Modi, will launch the Union Government’s Support and Outreach Initiative for Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) at Vigyan Bhawan in New Delhi on November 02, 2018.
The launch of the MSME sector programme will be held in Delhi. Similar programmes will take place at 100 locations across the country.
The Union and State Governments will work together for the next 100 days for the development of the MSME sector.
Union Minister for Finance and Corporate Affairs, Shri Arun Jaitley and the Union Minister of State (I/C) for MSME, Shri Giriraj Singh, are among those who will be present on the occasion.
Cabinet approves extension of the term of the Commission to examine the issue of Sub-categorization of Other Backward Classes in the Central List till 31st May 2019

The Union Cabinet chaired by the Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi has approved the extension of the term of the Commission to examine the issue of Sub-categorization of Other Backward Classes in the Central List for six months beyond 30th November, 2018 and till 31st May 2019.

The Commission has held extensive meetings with the stake holders including the State Governments, the State Backward Classes Commissions, various community associations and general public belonging to various Backward Classes and Commissions and also obtained records, caste-wise, of OBCs admitted in higher educational institution as well as similar caste-wise data of recruits in Central Departments, Central Public Sector Undertakings, Public Sector Banks & Financial Institutions.

Based on the emanating information from the data as processed and analyzed, the Commission has expressed that a round of discussion with the States and their Backward Classes Commission was required before finalizing the sub-categorized lists and the Report.
Cabinet approves the Allied and Healthcare Professions Bill, 2018 for regulation and standardisation of education and services by allied and healthcare professionals

The Union Cabinet chaired by Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi has approved the Allied and Healthcare Professions Bill, 2018 for regulation and standardisation of education and services by allied and healthcare professionals.The Bill provides for setting up of an Allied and Healthcare Council of India and corresponding State Allied and Healthcare Councils which will play the role of a standard-setter and facilitator for professions of Allied and Healthcare.
Establishment of a Central and corresponding State Allied and HealthcareCouncils; 15 major professional categories including 53 professions in Allied and Healthcare streams.
The Bill provides for structure, constitution, composition and functions of the Central Council and State Councils.

The Central Council will comprise 47 members, of which 14 members shall be ex-officio representing diverse and related roles and functions andremaining 33 shall be non-ex-officio members who mainly represent the 15professional categories.
The State Councils are also envisioned to mirror the Central Council,comprising 7 ex-officio and 21 non-ex officio members and Chairperson tobe elected from amongst the non-ex officio members.
Professional Advisory Bodies under Central and State Councils will examine issues independently and provide recommendations relating to specific recognised categories.
The Bill will also have an overriding effect on any other existing law for any of the covered professions.
The State Council will undertake recognition of allied and healthcare institutions.
Offences and Penalties clause have been included in the Bill to check mal­practices.
The Bill also empowers the Central and State Governments to make rules.
Central Govt. has the power to issue directions to the Council, to issue regulations and to add or amend the schedule.
An Interim Council will be constituted within 6 months of passing of the Act holding charge for a period of two years until the establishment of the Central Council.
The Council at the Centre and the States are to be established as body corporate with a provision to receive funds from various sources.
Councils will be supported by Central and State Governments.
Major Impact, including employment generation potential:
Bring all existing allied and healthcare professionals on board during thefirst few of years from the date of establishment of the Council.
Opportunity to create qualified, highly skilled and competent jobs inhealthcare by enabling professionalism of the allied and healthcare workforce.
High quality, multi-disciplinary care in line with the vision of AyushmanBharat, moving away from a 'doctor led' model to a 'care accessible and team based’ model.
Opportunity to cater to the global demand (shortage) of healthcareworkforce which is projected to be about 15 million by the year 2030, asper the WHO Global Workforce, 2030 report.
The Central Council's budget for the first four years will be Rupees 75 crores for States.
The Bill on Allied and Healthcare Professions Bill, 2018 is aimed at strengthening the healthcare delivery system at large.
In the current state of healthcare system, there exist many allied and healthcare professionals who remain unidentified, unregulated and underutilised.

Allied and Healthcare Professionals (A&HPs) constitute an important element of the health human resource network, and the skilled and efficient Allied and Healthcare Professionals (A&HPs) can reduce the cost of care and dramatically improve the accessibility to quality driven healthcare services.

Globally, Allied and Healthcare Professionals attend undergraduate degree programme of a minimum of three to four years to begin with and may attain up to PhD level qualification. However, most of Indian institutions offering such courses lack standardisation.

Majority of the countries worldwide, have a statutory licensing or regulatory body that is authorised to license and certify the qualifications and competence of such professionals, particularly those involved in direct patient care (such as physiotherapist, nutritionist etc.) or those whose occupation impact patient care directly (such as lab technologists, dosimetrists etc.).

Though such professionals have existed in the Indian healthcare system for many decades, a considerable gap in the allied and healthcare space is because of a lack of a comprehensive regulatory framework and absence of standards for education and training of A&HPs.
The Bill seeks to establish a robust regulatory framework which will play the role of a standard-setter and regulator for Allied and Healthcare professions.

Centre for inter faith studies and Chairs in foreign Universities:

Cabinet condoles the demise of Shri Ananthkumar, Union Minister for Chemicals & Fertilizers and Parliamentary Affairs
The Union Cabinet met today to pay tribute to the late minister Ananthkumar.
The Cabinet observed a two-minute silence and passed a condolence resolution in his memory.
Ananthkumar was born on 22 July, 1959 in Bengaluru. He earned his BEng in English literature and his LLB in Law from Karnataka University.

Shri Anantkumar started his public activities as a student activist. He later became a member of the BJP and was the Organising Secretary of the Party's Karnataka Unit. He was later the President of the party in Karnataka. Later he was the National General Secretary of BJP.

In 1996, he was elected to the Lok Sabha from Bengaluru South for the first time. In 1998, he became a minister in the Vajpayee Cabinet and was appointed the Minister for Civil Aviation. He has been an MP for 6th time.
Former Union Minister Jagmohan Jain has died.
Shri Ananthkumar was an active social worker. He was involved in many social service projects. He launched an initiative to increase the green cover in Bengaluru.
The Cabinet extends condolences to the bereaved family of Shri Ananthkumar.

Service of summons and other judicial documents or processes;
taking of evidence in civil matters;
production, identification or examination of documents, recordings;
The execution of a Letter of Request for taking of evidence in civilmatters; and
Recognition and enforcement of arbitral awards.

Cabinet apprised of India joining as Member of Advanced Motor Fuels Technology Collaboration Programme under International Energy Agency

Cabinet approves Laying down procedure andmechanism for sale of enemy shares
The Union Cabinet chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi has approved the mechanism and procedure for sale of the enemy shares.

‘In principle’ approval has been accorded for sale of enemy shares under the Custody of Ministry of Home Affairs/ Custodian of Enemy Property of India (CEPI), as per sub-section 1 of section 8A of the Enemy Property Act, 1968.
Department of Investment and Public Asset Management has been authorized under the provisions of sub-section 7 of section 8A of the Enemy Property Act, 1968, to sell the same.
Sale proceeds are to be deposited as disinvestment proceeds in the Government Account.
The process to sell shares of CEPI is to be approved by the Alternative Mechanism. The shares of 996 companies of 20,323 shareholders are to be sold.
The CEPI will certify that the sale of the Enemy Shares is not in contravention of any law or law.
The advisors/ intermediaries will be appointed by DIPAM for the disposal of movable enemy property.

In the Act of 1968, the definition of "enemy" was as follows: a person or country who or which was an enemy, an enemy subject or an enemy firm. In the amendment of 2017, it was substituted by “.... including his legal heir or successor”.
The decision will lead to monetization of enemy shares that had been lying dormant for decades since coming into force and the Enemy Property Act in 1968.
With the amendment of 2017, an enabling legislative provision was created for the disposal of enemy property.
The approval of the procedure and mechanism for sale of enemy shares has been given.
The government has decided to monetize movable enemy property.
The Enemy Property Act, 1968 provides for continued protection of enemy property.
The CEPI has been empowered for sale of enemy property.

“ Notwithstanding anything contained in any judgment, decree or order of any court, tribunal or other authority or any law for the time being in force, the Custodian may, within such time as may be specified by the Central Government in this behalf, dispose of whether by sale or otherwise, as the case may be, with prior approval of the Central Government, by general or special order, enemy properties vested in him immediately before the date of commencement of the Enemy Property (Amendment and Validation) Act, 2017 in accordance with the provisions of this Act, as amended by the Enemy Property (Amendment and Validation) Act, 2017”.
The Central Government may direct that disposal of enemy property shall be made by any other authority or Ministry or Department instead of Custodian.

Extension of Norms for Mandatory Packaging in Jute Materials

The Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs, chaired by the Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi has given its approval to expand the scope of mandatory packaging norms under the Jute Packaging Material (JPM) Act, 1987 as follows:
The CCEA has approved a policy mandatorily packing food grains and sugar in jute bags.
The government plans to auction 10% of indents of jute bags for packing foodgrains.

The decision will give a fillip to the development of jute sector; increasing the quality and productivity of raw jute, diversification of jute sector and also boosting and sustaining demand for jute product.
The government has been making efforts to boost the jute sector.
The jute industry in India is heavily dependent on the Government sector, which buys jute bags worth more than Rs. 6,500 crore for packing foodgrains every year.

The decision will benefit farmers and workers located in the Eastern and North Eastern regions of the country particularly in the states of West Bengal, Bihar, Odisha, Assam, Andhra Pradesh, Meghalaya and Tripura.
Measures by the Government to support the Jute Sector:
The government has been supporting jute farmers to improve the quality and productivity of raw jute.
Jute Corporation of India (JCI) has been given a grant of Rs. 100 crore for 2 years starting from 2018-19.
The National Jute Board has established a number of initiatives to promote the development of jute sector.

The government of India imposed definitive anti-dumping duty on jute imports from Bangladesh and Nepal. As a result of these measures, 13 tie mills in Andhra Pradesh had resumed operation and benefitted 20,000 workers. There will be an additional demand of 2.5 Lakh MT of jute goods for the domestic market.
Jute SMART, an e-govt initiative, provides an integrated platform for procurement of B-Twill sacking by Government agencies. JCI transfers 100% funds to jute farmers online.

Cabinet approves:i)Implementation of the umbrella scheme "Atmosphere & Climate Research-Modelling Observing Systems & Services";ii)Sub-schemes to continue during 2017-20; and iii) National Facility for Airborne Research(NFAR) to be set up

The Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs has approved continuation of the umbrella scheme "Atmosphere & Climate Research-Modelling Observing Systems & Services (ACROSS) during 2017-2020 at an estimated cost of Rs. 1450 crore.
The CCEA has approved establishment of National Facility for Airborne Research (NFAR) with a financial commitment of Rs 130 crore during 2020-21 and beyond.
The scheme aims to provide improved weather, climate and ocean forecast and services.
Generating employment opportunities:
A sizable number of scientific and technical staff along with requisite administrative support generate employment.

To ensure last-mile connectivity of the weather based services to the end -user, a large number of agencies like the Krishi Vigyana Kendras of Indian Council of Agricultural Research, Universities and local municipalities are roped in thus generating employment opportunities to many people.
The ACROSS scheme addresses different aspects of weather and climate services of the MoES.
The scheme ACROSS covers nine sub-schemes.
The ACROSS scheme consists of nine sub-programmes.

As the objective of the ACROSS scheme is to provide a reliable weather and climate forecast for betterment of society, the scheme will aim at improving skill of weather and climate forecast through sustained observations, intensive R & D, and by adopting effective dissemination and communication strategies to ensure its timely reach to the end-user of all services like Agro-meteorological Services, Aviation service, Environmental monitoring services, Hydro-meteorological services, climate services, tourism, pilgrimage, mountaineering etc.,

The Ministry of Earth Sciences (MoES) has a mandate to carry out research and development activities to develop and improve capability to forecast weather, climate and natural hazard related phenomena.

Cabinet approves Procurement Quota to M/s ITI Ltd. in procurements made by BSNL, MTNL and BBNL.
Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs has approved Procurement Quota to M/s ITI Ltd. in procurements made by BSNL, MTNL and BBNL.
The Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs (CCEA) today approved the following proposal of Department of Telecommunications regarding continuation of Procurement Quota for M/s ITI Limited:
BSNL, MTNL and BBNL will reserve 30% of the procurement orders for M/s ITI Ltd. for the products manufactured by it and for those outsourced items.
The government will pay 20% of the orders for the turnkey projects for the BSNL & MTNL and BharatNet project network roll-out.
ITI would accept orders under reservation quota only after the price is known and if the same is commercially viable.
ITI shall exercise its option under Reservation Quota within 15 days of bid opening.
The aforesaid policy measures shall remain in force for a period of three years with effect from the date of approval of CCEA. ITI's financial health will be reviewed after the expiry of this period.

M/s ITI Limited is a supplier of communication and networking products to BSNL, MTNL, Defence, Paramilitary forces and State Governments. ITI has manufacturing units in Bangalore, Raebareli, Naini, Mankapur, Palakkad, and Srinagar.

As the Company had become Sick in 2004 and was under reference to BIFR, GCEA in its meeting held on 12-02-2014 approved the proposal to provide financial assistance of Rs. 4156.79 Crore for its revival. BSNL and MTNL extend reservation quota of 30% to ITI Ltd. The validity of the reservation benefit expired on 31-05-2018.
BSNL, MTNL and BBNL will be requested to extend the benefit of procurement quota to ITI Limited for a period of three years.
The extension of the benefit for M/s ITI Ltd. for procurement orders placed by BSNL, MTNL and BBNL will ensure enough orders for FLT for the productionactivities.
ITI will be the beneficiary of the decision.

PSLV-C43 successfully launches earth observation satellite HysIS and 30 foreign satellites
ISRO to launch its heaviest satellite, GSAT-11, on Dec 5, 2018
ISRO successfully launched 31 satellites.

The PSLV-C43 rocket launched from the Launch Pad No.1 successfully put India's Hyper-Spectral Imaging Satellite into a 645 km sun-synchronous polar orbit. It also put 30 foreign satellites into their intended orbit.
The HysIS satellite has separated after launch. The control network at Bengaluru took control of the satellite.
HysIS is a 5-year-old earth observation satellite built around ISRO's Mini Satellite2 (IMS-2) bus.
HysIS, a satellite, was launched by PSLV with 29 satellites from eight countries.
The launch of PSLV C-43 successfully completed. The HysIS satellite was indigenously designed and built.
HysIS will start sending images from the fifth day of its injection.
The team has successfully launched another satellite.

PSLV is a four stage launch vehicle with a large solid rocket motor forming the first stage, an earth storable liquid stage as the second stage, a high performance solid rocket motor as third stage and a liquid stage with engines as fourth stage.
Today's launch of PSLV-C42 successfully launched two commercial satellites from UK-based Surrey Satellite Technology Limited.

ISRO will launch its heaviest satellite, GSAT-11 on December 5, 2018 at 2.08 am from French Guiana and GSAT 7A from Sriharikota in December. Next year, ISRO plans to launch twelve to fourteen launch missions.
The launch of GSAT-11 weighing 5.86 ton is being carried by the GSLV Mk- III rocket from French Guiana.
Dr Sivan says ISRO plans to launch the first unmanned mission as a precursor to Gaganyaan by December 2020 and one manned mission by July 2021.
India GSLV MkIII-D2 successfully launches GSAT-29
India successfully launched its GSAT-29 communication satellite.
GSLV MkIII-D2 successfully launched the GSAT-29 satellite.

After injection, ISRO's Master Control Facility at Hassan has assumed the control of the satellite. Three orbit raising manoeuvers will be executed to position the satellite in the Geostationary Orbit.
GSLV Mk III is a three-stage heavy lift launch vehicle developed by the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO).
The rocket consists of three stages.
GSAT-29 is a multi-beam communication satellite.

The Q/V-Band communication payload onboard the satellite is intended to demonstrate the future high throughput satellite system technologies. Optical Communication Payload will demonstrate data transmission at a very high rate through optical communication link. Geo High Resolution Camera will carry out high resolution imaging.
India successfully launched the heaviest satellite from the Indian soil.
GSLV MKIII is operational and will launch Chandrayaan-2 and Gaganyaan missions.
The mission director of GSLV Mark III has praised the mentoring provided by ISRO and industry partners.
The launch of GSAT-29 will help to bridge the digital divide.
The success of GSLV MkIII-D2 marks an important milestone in Indian space programme towards achieving self-reliance in launching heavier satellites.
GSLV Mark III-D1 launched GSAT-19, a high throughput communication satellite, with a lift-off mass of 3150 kg, into GTO on June 5, 2017.

Rs. 1.83 Lacs are invested and more than 3 Lacs employed so far.

The Department of Chemicals & Petrochemicals, under the Ministry ofchemicals & Fertilizers has facilitated increased investments in Petroleum, Chemicals and Petrochemical Investment Regions (PCPIRs) for boosting industrial development and employment generation.

Shri Mandaviya informed that under the cluster-based development model, the department has identified four PCPIRs in advanced stages of implementation. Upon completion, these PCP IRs will have an estimated investment of about Rs. 8.8 Lacs, generate employment for 40 Lakh people and invest around Rs. 1.83 Lacs.

Patients save around Rs. 15,000 crores under the Government’s initiative of ensuring “Affordable, Quality Medicines for All”.
Fixing of ceiling prices of Coronary Stents benefit approximately 10 lakh patients and that of Knee Implants benefit around 1.5 lakh patients since the step was taken
Patients across the country have saved around Rs. 15,000 crores under the Government's initiative ofensuring affordable, quality medicines for All.
The fixation of ceiling prices and MRPs of essential and lifesaving drugs, as the case may be, by implementing the DPCO 2013 has resulted in patients saving over Rs. 5,000 crores since then.

Shri Mandaviya informed that around 10 lakh heart patients have saved around Rs. 8,000 crores since fixation of ceiling prices of coronary stents in February 2017. Around 1.5 lakh knee patients saved about Rs. 2,000 Crores since price fixation of knee implants in August 2017.
Impact of GST has largely been positive and constructive on Pharma Sector: Shri Mansukh Mandaviya
Figures show significant positive impact on Annual Turnover, Exports of Pharma Sector and Drug Approvals post implementation of GST
GST has had a positive impact on pharmaceutical sector in India.
Shri Mandaviya informed that the Pharma sector has seen a positive growth after the implementation of GST.

Before GST,Annual Turnover of the Pharma Sector(as on 31.05.2017) was Rs 1,14,231 crores while after GST, the Annual Turnover of Pharma sector (as on 31.05.2018) touched Rs 1,31,312 crores, which is 6% higher than the Pre-GST regime.

Exports from Pharma Sectors were recorded at Rs 2,75,852 crores in the year 2016-17 and Rs 3,03,526 Crores in 2017-18. The Minister of State for Industries, Anantash Jain expects the current year's exports to be almost 12% higher than the previous one.
Further, it was informed that there has been a significant jump in number ofDrug Approvalsfrom 7,857 before GST (01.07.2016 to 30.06.2017) to 10,446 post-GST (01.07.2017 to 30.06.2018).
Shri Mandaviya believes that post-GSTGST, there will be a positive impact on the economy.

There will be a reduction in transaction costs due to discontinuation of Central Sales Tax post-GST. Now, pharma companies can consolidate their warehouses at strategic locations, which will reduce the cost of distribution.

Index of Eight Core Industries (Base: 2011-12=100)October, 2018
The summary of the Index of Eight Core Industries (base: 2011-12) is given at the Annexure.
The combined Index of Eight Core Industries stood at 134.8 in October, 2018, which was 4.8 per cent higher than the index of October, 2017.
Coal production increased by 10.6 per cent in October, 2018 over October, 2017.

Crude Oil production (weight: 8.98 per cent) declined by 5.0 per cent in October, 2018 over October, 2017. Crude Oil cumulative index declined by 3.6 per cent from April to October 2018-19 over the previous year.
The Natural Gas production declined by 0.9 per cent in October, 2018 over October, 2017. The cumulative index declined 0.8 per cent from April to October, 2019 over the previous year.
The cumulative index of the Petroleum Refinery's production increased by 5.8 per cent from April to October, 2018-19 over the corresponding period of previous year.
Fertilizers production declined by 11.5 per cent in October, 2018 over October, 2017.
The cumulative index of steel production increased by 3.3 per cent from April to October, 2018-19 over the previous year.
Cement production increased by 18.4 per cent in October, 2018 over October, 2017.
The cumulative index of electricity generation increased by 6.9 per cent from April to October, 2018-19 over the previous year.
The data for August, 2018, September, 2018 and October, 2018 are provisional.
Note 2: Since April, 2014, Electricity generation data from Renewable sources are also included.
Note 3: The industry-wise weights indicated above are individual industry weight derived from IIP and blown up on pro rata basis to a combined weight of ICI equal to 100.

India to Chair Kimberley Process from 1st January 2019
The Kimberley Process Certification Scheme (KPCS) Plenary 2018, was held in Brussels, Belgium, from 12th-16thNovember 2018.EU handed over the Chairmanship of KPCS to India from 1st January, 2019.
Federica Mogherini handed over KPCS Chairmanship to India from 2019.
India will take over as a chair of KPCS from January 2019.
India will continue to support artisanal and small-scale mining during its Chairmanship of the ASM forum.

On the sidelines of the Plenary, Chair of Working Groups conducted meetings to discuss some key issues like KP statistics and confidentiality, synthetic diamonds and separate HS code for synthetic rough diamonds, issues relating to review visit and review mission and the issue of Central African Republic (CAR).
The 4-day Plenary also witnessed discussion on environmental challenges in diamond mining and industry responsibility.
During the Plenary session, India held bilateral meetings with Botswana, USA, Russian Federation and World Diamond Council to discuss issues related to KPCS and its working groups.
India is a founding member of KPCS and is actively involved in its activities to ensure that almost 99% of the diamond trade in the world is conflict free.
India chaired the Ad hoc Committee on Review and Reform (AHCRR).

The AHCRR held one joint session with Chairs of other Working Groups and 4 sessions with AHCRR committee members to discuss the issue of funding of Permanent Secretariat (PS), Multi Donor Trust Fund (MDTF), peer review mechanism and consolidation to the core document.
This year marks the fifteenth anniversary of the Kimberley Process for the Prevention of Contemporary Sarcasm (KPCS).
On expansion of scope KP India stated that KPCS has a well-structured process and any issues discussed should be in relation to trade without mixing up with non-trade issues.
The next Intersessional session is scheduled to be held in India in 2019. Botswana will serve as Vice-Chair.
India to export fish meal and fishoil to China
Commerce Secretary and Vice Minister of China shaking hands after signing of protocol
Hu Wei, Vice Minister of Customs of China, led a delegation to India to discuss various issues of market access for different products.

Both the Indian and Chinese sides appreciated each other’s concerns and agreed to resolve the market access issues expeditiously to achieve the vision of the leaders of both the countries by promoting a more balanced trade.
The protocol on hygiene and inspection requirements for the export of Fish Meal and Fish Oil from India to China was signed today.

China imports fish oil to the tune of USD 143.29 million, and fish meal to the tune of USD 263.43 million, and signing of the protocol between the two countries paves the way for export of Indian fish oil and fish meal to China.
The product cleared for export by China is Indian rice.
Suresh Prabhu urges textiles industry to prepare road map for boosting exports
The government will extend all possible support to the textiles industry.

Suresh Prabhu said that the contribution from textiles and apparel can be increased by scaling up and increasing investments into the industry along with cost optimization and vertical integration.Investing in new and more efficient technologies and processes will lead to more superior products.
The Indian Minister of Commerce, Shri Ramakrishnan, has urged the country's textile industry to modernize their approach and adopt new technologies to gain competitive advantage over other countries.
Suresh Prabhu, Minister of State for Commerce, has said that Indian textiles industry should look forward to exporting their products to countries other than the US and EU.
The government is looking to fast track negotiations of Free Trade Agreements with EU and Australia.
Foreign Minister of Gabon calls on Suresh Prabhu
Mr. Regis Immongault is in talks with Suresh Prabhu.
Gabon's Minister of Foreign Affairs, Regis Immongault, met India's Commerce Minister in New Delhi today.
Suresh Prabhu, the Indian Foreign Minister, met Gabon's Foreign Minister. They discussed ways to improve bilateral trade between India and Gabon.
Gabon is looking for more involvement of BRICS countries in the development of different sectors in Gabon.

Gabon has shown interest in entering into a Bilateral Investment Treaty with India. India has urged Gabon to avail the offer of Lines of Credit (LoC) for developmental projects. Gabon is a member of the International Solar Alliance.
India also suggested that Gabon may give a complete list of minerals for Indian industries to consider investing in for mining projects.

Gabon has the largest reserves of Manganese ore in the world. It is also the 4th largest producer of manganese ore globally. Mangansese Ore India Ltd (MOIL) team visited Gabon in July 2018 to explore possibilities of joint collaboration with mining companies.
Gabon is making efforts to attract investment from India in key mining clusters in Gabon.
Saudi-India Business Meeting Held in Riyadh
Saudi India Business meeting with Council of Saudi Chambers
Saudi-India Business Council held a meeting during the visit of the Indian Infrastructure & Housing delegation to the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia.
The Indian ambassador to Saudi Arabia, Ahmed Javed, said that there are important changes taking place in Saudi Arabia and India is one of the 8 countries on the preferred list of Saudi Arabia.

Additional Secretary, Ministry of External Affairs, promised thatthe Government of India is committed to work for enhancing the relationship between the two countries and the Indian companies in this delegation are more than willing to bring their professional expertise to Saudi Arabia.
The meeting was attended by top officials and CEOs of Saudi Arabia.
The Indian delegation is being represented by several leading infra and housing companies.
India should explore the construction and entertainment sectors in Saudi Arabia.
Commerce Minister Launches Logo and Brochure of Logix India
Over 20 Countries Likely to Participate in Mega Logistics Meet in January 2019
Suresh Prabhu launching the brochure of Logix India in New Delhi
The logo and brochure of Logix India 2019 were launched by the Union Minister of Commerce and Industry and Civil Aviation.
Suresh Prabhu, the Minister of State for International Trade and Logistics, has launched a new initiative aimed at strengthening the country's logistics sector.
The Minister of State for Logistics, Shri Ram Manohar Parrikar, has said that India's Logistics sector is expected to grow to USD 360 billion by 2032.
FIEO organises Logix India 2019, a three-day logistics conference aimed at improving efficiency and cost effectiveness for India's global trade.
India's logistics industry is worth USD 215 billion and provides employment to 22 million people.
N. Sivasailam, Special Secretary, Department of Commerce, Ganesh Gupta, President FIEO, Ajay Sahai, Director General & CEO, FIEO were present on the occasion.
Delegation of Indian Infra Companies Heads to Riyadh
Efforts on to Tap into USD 500 billion Mega City Projects
An Indian delegation is going to Saudi Arabia to explore possible contracts and investment opportunities.

During the two-day visit, beginning on November 27, 2018, the industry representatives will interact with key decision makers of the Saudi Government and industry.The infrastructure projects are part of the Kingdom’s initiative to expand their economy through major structural changes by developing mega projects like NEOM, new roads and railroads, airports and sea ports, development of Qiddiya entertainment city and Red Sea Tourism Project.
GCC countries and Saudi Arabia are investing heavily in infrastructure development.
The Vision 2030 is expected to open up new opportunities for Indian companies and professionals in various sectors like railways, hospitality, tourism, airport, housing, IT and entertainment.

Saudi Arabia has given hundreds of investment licenses to Indian companies. Indian companies will be able to invest in the construction of the railway line linking Mecca and Medina and the airport in Jeddah.
Indian investments in Saudi Arabia is worthUSD 1.5 billionand Saudi Arabia has invested USD16 million in India.
Saudi Arabia and India have close trade of more than USD 25 billion in 2016-17. Saudi Arabia is India's largest supplier of crude oil.
The 3.2 million strong Indian community is the largest expatriate group in Saudi Arabia and sends USD10 billion of annual remittances back to India.
Prime Minister Launches Ease of Doing Business Grand Challenge
The Prime Minister of India launched a Grand Challenge on resolving seven identified Ease of Doing Business problems with the use of cutting edge technologies.

The Prime Minister, Shri Narendra Modi, met select CEOs from Indian and foreign companies at his residence yesterday. He congratulated them on their achievements and urged them to work towards reforms with greater zeal and energy.
The World Bank Group Vice President, South Asia, Hartwig Schafer, appreciated India's achievement in Ease of Doing Business.
India has improved its ranking in the World Bank's Doing Business Report.

Finance Minister, Arun Jaitley, Minister of Commerce & Industry and Civil Aviation, Suresh Prabhu, Environment Minister, Harsh vardhan and Housing & Urban Affairs Minister, Hardeep Singh Puri were also present on this occasion.
SEZ Policy Report Submitted to Commerce Minister
The Baba Kalyani headed committee presenting SEZ policy report to Commerce Minister

The Baba Kalyani led committee constituted by the Ministry of Commerce& Industry to study the existing SEZ policy of India submitted its report to the Union Minister for Commerce & Industry and Civil Aviation, Suresh Prabhu, in New Delhi today.
The committee was constituted to review the SEZ policy and make it WTO compatible.

Baba Kalyani, chairman of Bharat Forge Ltd. has submitted a report to the Commerce Minister. He believes that if India is going to become a USD 5 trillion economy by 2025, the current environment of manufacturing competitiveness and services needs to undergo a basic paradigm shift.

The Government of India has set a target of creating 100 million jobs and achieving 25% of GDP from the manufacturing sector by 2022. It plans to increase manufacturing value to USD 1.2 trillion by 2025.

In his interaction with the committee Suresh Prabhu said that the suggestions of the committee are very constructive and the Commerce Ministry will immediately begin formal consultations with the Finance Ministry and other Ministries so that implementation of the committee’s recommendations may be done without any delay.
Reforms needed in WTO to Support A Better Global Trade order: Suresh Prabhu
Suresh Prabhu delivering keynote address on strategic alliance for WTO and trade remedies
India will work with other member countries to reform the World Trade Organization (WTO) in order to boost global trade.
WTO is the only organization dealing with global rules of trade between nations. It covers 98% of global trade today.

Suresh Prabhu informed that India is not for or against any country but desire to make WTO a forward looking organization, which is able to support a better global trade order.He said that during the last few months he has discussed substantive issues with over 100 Ministers of Trade and Commerce of various countries to evolve new reform agenda for WTO which will be acceptable to most the countries.
Commerce Minister Releases Report on Industrial Park Rating System
Suresh Prabhureleasing the report on Industrial Park Rating System
The report on Industrial Park Rating System has been released by the Union Minister for Commerce & Industry and Civil Aviation.
The industrial parks have been rated on 4 points.
DIPP launched the Industrial Information System (IIS) in May 2017.
The portal has been used by many state governments and industrial development corporations to nominate over 200 parks for assessment.
IPRS is proposed to be translated into an annual exercise covering all the parks across India.
On this occasion Secretary DIPP, Ramesh Abhishek, Country Director of Asian Development Bank, Kenichi Yokoyama and other senior officials were present.
9th Session of the India - Kyrgyz IGC held in New Delhi
Suresh Prabhu and KosmosbekCholponbaev, Minister of Health, Government of Kyrgyz Republic, are signing a protocol.
The 9th session of the India-Kyrgyz Inter-Governmental Commission on Trade, Economic, Scientific and Technological Cooperation concluded today with signing of Protocol.

India and Kyrgyzstan have identified potential sectors where both sides may engage in areas like healthcare and pharmaceutical, environmental and technical safety, agriculture, information, tourism and culture, textiles and clothing, banking, labor and social development, mines and standards, metrology and certification sector.
Both sides agreed to hold business to business forums between Kyrgyz and Indian companies as well as the exchange of business and commercial information and search for partners.
Kyrgyzstan proposed to create joint food and food processing ventures for agriculture and meat product for export to the Eurasian Economic Union (EAEU) markets.
The parties agreed to hold the tenth meeting of the Kyrgyz-Indian inter-governmental Commission on Trade-Economic and Scientific-Technical Cooperation in Bishkek, Kyrgyz Republic.
Innovation in farming need of the hour – Suresh Prabhu
Suresh Prabhu giving away innovation awards to agri startups in New Delhi
There is an urgent need for innovation in agriculture.
Suresh Prabhu, the Minister of Rural Development, has called for agri startups to produce more food crops in limited fertile soil and use less water.
The Commerce Minister wants to encourage start-ups in the agricultural sector.
The agri start-ups need to become more innovative, according to the agriculture minister.
The Minister gave away innovation awards to agri startups in different categories and also released the PWC Knowledge report of FICCI.
India will be Global Hub of Start-Up Community
Suresh Prabhu releasing the first State of Indian Start –up Ecosystem 2018 report
Indian startups have the potential to bring about transformational change to India's growth story.
The Minister of Commerce and Industry, Shri Rajnath Singh, says that the government is taking many initiatives to foster a positive and empowering ecosystem for startups.

Suresh Prabhu referred to the jump that India has made in the Ease of Doing Business rankings and said that all efforts are now being made to ensure that India joins the group of countries in the top 50.

Commerce Minister in his address at the event said that change is the new constant in today’s world and the youth of India have within them the grit and determination to create positive change through new ideas which will benefit citizens of not only India but bring about positive change globally.

Dr. Mahesh Sharma and C. R. Chaudhary unveil the catalogue of the IITF-2018.

Index Numbers of Wholesale Price in India (Base: 2011-12=100) Review for the month of October, 2018
The official Wholesale Price Index for ‘All Commodities’ (Base: 2011-12=100) for the month of October, 2018 rose by 0.7 percent to 121.7 (provisional) from 120.8 (provisional) for the previous month.
Annual rate of inflation in Pakistan was 5.28% for the month of October, 2018 (over October, 2017). The build up rate in the financial year so far was 4.64%.
Inflation for important commodities / commodity groups is indicated in Annex-1 and Annex-II.
The movement of the index for the various commodity groups is summarized below:-
The index for this major group rose by 0.7 percent to 136.3 (provisional) from 135.4 for the previous month.
The food prices rose last month.

The index for ‘Non-Food Articles’ group declined by 1.1 percent to 123.4 (provisional) from 124.8 for the previous month due to lower prices of floriculture, copra (coconut), raw silk and skins (raw), tobacco, rubber and hides, soyabean, kardi seed, mesta, raw wool, niger seed, etc.
The index for ‘Minerals’ group declined last month due to lower prices of garnet, sillimanite, copper concentrate, iron ore, chromite, limestone, manganese ore and lead concentrate.
The index for 'Crude Petroleum & Natural Gas' group rose by 4.1 percent to 99.8 (provisional) from 95.9 (provisional) for the previous month due to higher price of crude petroleum (6%).
The index for this major group rose by 3.6 percent to 111.1 (provisional) from 107.2 for the previous month.
MANUFACTURED PRODUCTS (Weight 64.23%)

The index for ‘Mineral Oils’ group rose by 5.4 percent to 107.4 (provisional) from 101.9 (provisional) for the previous month due to higher price of bitumen (18%), furnace oil (10%), naphtha (9%), ATF (8%), LPG (6%), kerosene, HSD and petrol (4% each) and petroleum coke (1%).
The index for 'Electricity' group rose by 2.6 percent to 112.4 (provisional) from 109.6 (provisional) for the previous month due to higher price of electricity (3%).
The index for this major group rose by 0.3 percent to 118.8 for the previous month.
The index for ‘Manufacture of Food Products’ group rose by 0.1 percent to 129.5 for the Provisional Month.

The index for ‘Manufacture of Beverages’ group rose by 0.4 percent to 120.9 (provisional) from 120.4 (provisional) for the previous month due to higher price of rectified spirit and country liquor (1% each).

The index for ‘Manufacture of Tobacco Products’ group rose by 0.7 percent to 150.6 (provisional) from 149.6 (provisional) for the previous month due to higher price of cigarette and other tobacco products (1% each).
The index for ‘Manufacture of Textiles’ group rose last month due to higher prices of other textiles. The price of made-up textile articles declined.

The index for ‘Manufacture of Wearing Apparel’ group rose by 0.7 percent to 139.6 (provisional) from 138.6 (provisional) for the previous month due to higher price of manufacture of knitted & crocheted apparel (2%).
The index for ‘Manufacture of Leather and Related Products’ group declined last month due to lower prices of leather products. However, the prices of belts, handbags, office bags, etc. moved up.

The index for ‘Manufacture of Wood and of Products of wood and Cork’ group declined last month due to lower prices of wooden box/crate, particle boards, lamination wooden sheets/veneer sheets and timber/wooden plank, sawn/resawn and wood cutting, processed/sized.
The index for ‘Manufacture of Paper and Paper Products’ group rose last month due to higher prices of paper for printing & writing. However, the prices of tissue paper declined.

The index for ‘Printing and Reproduction of Recorded Media’ group declined last month due to lower prices of printed form & schedule, journal/periodical, printed books and printed labels/posters/calendars.

The index for ‘Manufacture of Chemicals and Chemical Products’ group rose last month due to higher prices of gelatine, shampoo, sulphuric acid, varnish, carbon black, ammonium phosphate, agro chemical formulation, alkyl benzene, ethyl acetate, ammonia liquid, ammonia gas and nitrogenous fertilizer.

The index for ‘Manufacture of Pharmaceuticals, Medicinal Chemical and Botanical Products’ group rose by 0.9 percent to 124.3 (provisional) from 123.2 (provisional) for the previous month due to higher price of anti allergic drugs (6%), anti inflammatory preparation (5%), anti cancer drugs (4%) and simvastatin, digestive enzymes & antacids, api & formulations of vitamins, antibiotics & preparations thereof, plastic capsules, cotton wool (medicinal), antiseptics & disinfectants and anti-retroviral drugs for HIV treatment (1% each).

The index for ‘Manufacture of Rubber and Plastics Products’ group rose by 0.5 percent to 110.1 (provisional) from 109.6 for the previous month due to higher prices of plastic button and conveyer belt (fibre based), tooth brush, plastic film, rubber moulded goods, polypropylene film and 2/3 wheeler rubber tube.

The index for ‘Manufacture of Other Non-Metallic Mineral Products’ group declined last month due to lower prices of cement superfine, porcelain sanitary ware, poles & posts of concrete, glass bottle, clinker, non ceramic tiles and stone, chip.

The index for ‘Manufacture of Basic Metals’ group rose by 0.7 percent to 114.6 in February due to higher prices of steel forgings-rough, stainless steel pencil ingots/billets/slabs and brass metal/sheet/coils.

The index for ‘Manufacture of Fabricated Metal Products, Except Machinery and Equipment’ group rose by 0.4 percent last month due to higher prices of copper bolts, screws, nuts and nails. However, the prices of steel structures, pressure cooker and stainless steel utensils declined.

The index for ‘Manufacture of Computer, Electronic and Optical Products’ group declined last month due to lower prices of meter, watch, air conditioner, capacitors, etc. but the prices of electro-diagnostic apparatus, used in medical, surgical, dental or veterinary sciences moved up.

The index for ‘Manufacture of Electrical Equipment’ group declined by 0.2 percent to 111.6 (provisional) from 111.8 for the previous month due to lower prices of transformer, connector/plug/socket/holder-electric and fibre optic cables, solenoid valve and refrigerators.
The index for ‘Manufacture of Machinery and Equipment’ group rose by 0.1 percent to 111.4 for the previous month due to higher prices of some products.

The index for ‘Manufacture of Motor Vehicles, Trailers and Semi-Trailers’ group declined by 0.6 percent to 112.9 (provisional) from 113.6 for the previous month due to lower prices of passenger vehicles, minibus/bus, chain and piston ring/piston & compressor.

The index for ‘Manufacture of Other Transport Equipment’ group rose by 0.5 percent to 112.0 (provisional) from 111.4 (provisional) for the previous month due to higher price of railway brake gear (2%) and bicycles of all types, motor cycles and tanker (1% each).

The index for ‘Manufacture of Furniture’ group rose by 1.5 percent to 127.3 (provisional) from 125.4 (provisional) for the previous month due to higher price of foam and rubber mattress (8%), hospital furniture (2%) and steel shutter gate (1%).
The index for ‘ Other Manufacturing’ group rose last month due to higher prices of cricket ball and cricket bat, silver, playing cards and plastic moulded-others toys.

The rate of inflation based on WPI Food Index consisting of ‘Food Articles’ from Primary Articles group and ‘Food Product’ from Manufactured Products group decreased from 0.14% in September, 2018 to -0.64% in October, 2018.
FINAL INDEX FOR THE MONTH OF AUGUST, 2018 (BASE YEAR: 2011-12=100)

For the month of August, 2018, the final Wholesale Price Index for ‘All Commodities’ (Base: 2011-12=100) stood at 120.1 as compared to 120.0 (provisional) and annual rate of inflation based on final index stood at 4.62 percent as compared to 4.53 percent (provisional) respectively as reported on 14.09.2018.

2nd Startup India Investment Seminar in Beijing

Embassy of India in China in partnership with Startup India Association (SIA) and Venture Gurukool organized 2ndStartup India Investment Seminar on 12 November 2018 in Beijing for fostering innovation and entrepreneurship among Indian youth.The 1stStartup Indian Investment event was organised in November 2017.
The event was held to promote Indian startups to Chinese investors.

In the 1stStartup India Investment seminar, 4 Indian startups secured funding from Chinese VCs of USD15 million. In the current round 8 out of 20 participants are set to get commitment of around USD 30 million.
ICBC India has established a USD200 million fund for investing in promising Indian MSMEs and ventures.
A panel discussion was also organised to discuss effective strategy for Chinese VCs to enter the Indian startup market and share their experiences about the Indian startup ecosystem.
7th RCEP Inter-Sessional Ministerial Meeting concludes in Singapore

The Indian minister led the Indian delegation to the 7th RCEP Inter-Sessional Ministerial Meeting in Singapore on 12-13 November 2018. The meeting was held in preparation for the 2nd R CEP Leaders Summit to be held on 14th November 2018 in Singapore in which Prime Minister of India will be participating.
The Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership (RCEP) is a mega regional free trade agreement being negotiated amongst 16 countries, including 10 ASEAN countries.
The Ministers have met to discuss the progress made in the RCEP negotiations.

The Ministers made an assessment of the progress on ‘The Package of Year End Deliverables’. Suresh Prabhu underlined that substantial progress has been made in the negotiations. He urged all the trade ministers to lend political support to fast track the negotiations and report it to the Leaders.
India has successfully concluded the Institutional Provisions Chapter of STRACAP.
Ministers instructed negotiators to continue to work on the E-Commerce, Competition and Investment chapters.

On the side lines of the RCEP, Commerce Minister held bilateral meetings with his counterparts from Singapore, China, Japan, New Zealand, South Korea, Indonesia, Cambodia, Malaysia, Australia and Philippines.
DIPP hosts Global Digital Content Market2018
DG, WIPO addressing Press Conference in New Delhi
The Department of Industrial Policy and Promotion (DIPP) is hosting a conference on Global Digital Content Market (GDCM) 2018 on 14th- 15th November 2018 in New Delhi.
India will host the GDCM 2018, the world intellectual property rights conference.
GDCM 2018 is a platform to discuss vital issues and enhance development of the digital and IP generating industries such as publishing, films, music, and gaming.

The second edition of GDCM 2018 conference is being held in New Delhi. Francis Gurry, the Director General of WIPO, said that the aim of the conference is to ensure that a creative artist continues to be protected and receives better remuneration on the digital platform. He appreciated India's integration with international systems through the National IPR policy 2016.
India has improved its position in the Global Innovation Index 2018 and now ranks 57th.
India has recently approved accession to the WIPO Copyright Treaty (WCT) and WIPo Performances and Phonograms Treaty.
There has been a significant increase in the number of Intellectual Property Rights (IP) applications filed in India.
Commerce Minister leads delegation for RCEP meet in Singapore

The Union Minister for Commerce & Industry and Civil Aviation, Suresh Prabhu, is leading the delegation for the meeting for trade Ministers of RCEP member countries which is taking place in Singapore on November 12-13, 2018.
The trade ministers of the RCEP are meeting in Singapore to continue to work towards the targets set in the ambitious trade pact.
India is negotiating a free trade agreement with ASEAN members.
India is pushing for liberalizing norms to promote services trade. India is looking for a balance trade agreement as it would cover 40% of the global GDP and over 42% of world population.
The RCEP is a regional trade bloc with 10 ASEAN members, 6 free trade partners and India, China, Japan, South Korea, Australia and New Zealand.
The ministerial meeting will be followed by the 2nd RCEP Leaders Summit on 14th November, 2018, in Singapore.
Indian Food and Agro Buyer Seller Meet in Jeddah
Indian exporters of rice, tea, spices and dry fruits will meet the Saudi importers during a meet on November 11th.

The four commodities being focused on have great prospects for furthering Indian exports to Saudi Arabia. Saudi Arabia has been a major food and beverages market for India. The BSM will be an ideal platform for Indian participants to explore the business opportunities for trade, acquaint with new consumer trends and initiate marketing tie-ups and joint ventures.
Basmati rice export is the most valuable product for India.
Indian tea is among the finest in the world. India is the 2nd largest producer and 4th largest exporter of tea.
Saudi Arabia mainly imports Indian spices.

Saudi Arabia is one of India's important trade partners and is a major FDI partner. India exported to Saudi Arabia worth USD 5 billion in 2017 and imported from them USD 21 billion, amounting to a huge trade deficit.
India's total exports in F&B products stood at USD 33 billion in 2017, while Saudi Arabia's exports in this sector amounted to only USD 1.43 billion.
Sugar exports from India to China to begin soon
The contract for export of 50,000tonnes of raw sugar from India to China has been entered by ISMA and COFCO.
This is due to the initiative taken by the Ministry of Commerce and several rounds of meetings held by officials of both countries the import of raw sugar has materialized now.
India plans to export 2 MT of raw sugar to China.

India is the largest producer of sugar in the world with 32 MMT production in 2018. Indian sugar is of high quality and is Dextran free. India is in a position to become a regular and dependable exporter to China.
Commerce Secretary pitches for balanced India-China Trade
The Indian delegation on this visit included senior officials from Department of Commerce, Department of Food and Public Distribution and Consulate in Shanghai.
Dr. Wadhawan has asked Mr. Wang to provide MOFCOM's guidance to its importers to source products from India.
The Commerce Secretary, Dr. Wadhawan, has asked the relevant stakeholders to promote India's exports to China.
MOFCOM invited India to participate in the 1st CIIE.
India and China had two rounds of talks aimed at resolving some of the pending market access issues.
The Commerce Secretary visited important sugar importers of China during a visit. He held important meetings with them and Indian industry representatives.
