India’s country pavilion at CIIE in Shanghai showcases India’s strength
India has set up a Country Pavilion in the 1st China International Import Expo (CIIE) which was inaugurated today at the National Exhibition & Convention Centre in Shanghai.
The India Country Pavilion in CIIE, Shanghai is focusing on key sectors with significant global presence.
China and India have a total trade worth $100 billion.
The government of India is promoting its exports to China.
The Indian Commerce Secretary inaugurated India pavilion today. He will meet China's Vice Minister for Commerce on 6th November.
Cabinet approves Procurement Quota to M/s ITI Ltd. in procurements made by BSNL, MTNL and BBNL.
Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs has approved Procurement Quota to M/s ITI Ltd. in procurements made by BSNL, MTNL and BBNL.
The Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs (CCEA) today approved the following proposal of Department of Telecommunications regarding continuation of Procurement Quota for M/s ITI Limited:
BSNL, MTNL and BBNL will reserve 30% of the procurement orders for M/s ITI Ltd. for the products manufactured by it and for those outsourced items.
The government will pay 20% of the orders for the turnkey projects for the BSNL & MTNL and BharatNet project network roll-out.
ITI would accept orders under reservation quota only after the price is known and if the same is commercially viable.
ITI shall exercise its option under Reservation Quota within 15 days of bid opening.
The aforesaid policy measures shall remain in force for a period of three years with effect from the date of approval of CCEA. ITI's financial health will be reviewed after the expiry of this period.

M/s ITI Limited is a supplier of communication and networking products to BSNL, MTNL, Defence, Paramilitary forces and State Governments. ITI has manufacturing units in Bangalore, Raebareli, Naini, Mankapur, Palakkad, and Srinagar.

As the Company had become Sick in 2004 and was under reference to BIFR, GCEA in its meeting held on 12-02-2014 approved the proposal to provide financial assistance of Rs. 4156.79 Crore for its revival. BSNL and MTNL extend reservation quota of 30% to ITI Ltd. The validity of the reservation benefit expired on 31.05.2018.
BSNL, MTNL and BBNL will be requested to extend the benefit of procurement quota to ITI Limited for a period of three years.
The extension of the benefit for M/s ITI Ltd. for procurement orders placed by BSNL, MTNL and BBNL will ensure enough orders for FLT for the productionactivities.
ITI will be the beneficiary of the decision.
“India elected as a Member of the International Telecommunications Union (ITU) Council for another 4-year term (2019-2022)”: Manoj Sinha
India has been re-elected as a Member of the ITU Council for another 4-year term.

By securing 165 votes, India ranked third among the 13 countries elected to the Council from the Asia-Australasia region, and eighth among the 48 countries elected to the Councilglobally.The ITU has 193memberstates who elect representatives to the Council.
India is a member of the ITU Council again.
India has been an active member of ITU since 1869 and a regular member of the ITU Council since 1952.
India will set up the ITU South Asia Area Office and Technology Innovation Centre in New Delhi by January 2019.
President gives assent topromulgation of the Companies Amendment (Ordinance), 2018
The Companies Amendment Ordinance, 2018 has been assented to by the President of India.
The main amendments to the Ease of Doing Business Ordinance have been made.
Shifting of jurisdiction of 16 types of corporate offences from the special courts to in-house adjudication.
The penalty for small companies and one person companies has been reduced to half of that applicable to normal companies.
Instituting a transparent and technology driven in-house adjudication mechanism on an online platform and publication of the orders on the website.

Strengthening in-house adjudication mechanism by necessitating a concomitant order for making good the default at the time of levying penalty, to achieve the ultimate aim of achieving better compliance.
enlarging the pecuniary jurisdiction of Regional Director by enhancing the limit up to Rs. 25 Lakh as against earlier limit of Rs. 5 Lakh.
vesting in the Central Government the power to approve the alteration in the financial year of a company under section 2(41); and
vesting the Central Government the power to approve cases of conversion of public companies into private companies.

Recommendations related to corporate compliance and corporate governance include re-introduction of declaration of commencement of business provision to better tackle the menace of ‘shell companies’; greater disclosures with respect to public deposits; greater accountability with respect to filing documents related to creation, modification and satisfaction of charges; non-maintenance of registered office to trigger de-registration process; and holding of directorships beyond permissible limits to trigger disqualification of such directors.
Cabinet approves MoU with Mauritius on Consumer Protection and Legal Metrology
The Union Cabinet chaired by Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi has approved MoU between India and Mauritius on Consumer Protection and Legal Metrology
The countries of Pakistan and Bangladesh have signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) on Consumer Protection and Legal Metrology.
26th General Conference on Weights & Measures in a historic decision unanimously redefine World’s standard definition of kilogram, Second&Metre
A landmark moment in scientific measurement, New International System of Units based on fundamental constants of nature to come into force from 20th May, 2019
The 26th General Conference on Weights and Measures (CGPM) held in Versailles, France, November 13-16, 2018, voted to redefine the SI unit of kg.
India was represented at the CGPM meeting.

The International Bureau of Weights and Measures (BIPM) defines the International System of Units (SI). The dissemination of SI units for the welfare of society and industries in India is the responsibility of Legal Metrology, Department of Consumer Affairs, Government of India.

Out of five draft resolutions the revision of the International System of Units and the definition of timescales are the most important. The definition of the seven base units namely, second, metre, kilogram, ampere, Kelvin, mole and candela has been changed from being linked to artefacts to being based on the fundamental constants on nature.

The International Prototype of Kilogram (IPK) is kept at BIPM, Paris and serves as the international standard of kilogram. Replicas of the IPK are kept at different National Metrology Institutes. The national prototype of kilomass (NPK), NPK-57, is kept in CSIR- National Physical Laboratory and sent periodically to BIPm for calibration.
NPL-India in association with Department of Consumer Affairs, Government of India is developing Kibble balance for 1 kg.

The advantages of Kibble balance would be that the NPK need not to be sent to BIPM for calibrations and the accuracy and stability of Kibble balance is very high which is very important where low weights with high accuracies are essential, for example in pharmaceuticals and biotechnologies.
The kilogram’s definition is changing officially on 20th May, 2019.
The introduction of the SI unit marks the beginning of a new era for metrologists.

South Asia Youth Peace Conference as part of Celebrating 150th birth anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi, inaugurated in the capital
The South Asia Regional Youth Peace Conference was inaugurated by ShriKrishna G Kulkarni, great grandson of Mahatma Gandhi at Gandhi Darshan in New Delhi yesterday.
Shri Krishna Kulkarni, the president of South Asia Youth Pacific Conference, talked about the Mahatma Gandhi's philosophy and worked towards promoting peace and sustainable development in South Asia.

Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Bhutan, Maldives, Nepal, Sri Lanka, and others from under-represented countries have come together to create an action plan to power the Sustainable Development Goals.

provide basic amenities for visitors

BAE Systems and Mahindra Defense will assemble 155mm, 39 Calibre Ultra Light Howitzer in India.

The first ten K9 Vajra 155mm/52 calibre guns have been imported from South Korea and assembled by L&T in India. The balance 90 guns will be manufactured in India with some major assemblies coming from Seoul.
An indigenously developed 6x6 field artillery tractor by Ashok Leyland was also formally inducted to provide the much awaited replacement for the ageing fleet of Artillery Gun Towing Vehicles.
The Indian Artillery displayed their latest weapons and systems at an event.
Bilateral Exercise Between Indian & Republic of Singapore Navies – SIMBEX 18 - marks Silver Jubilee this Year
Singapore and India will hold their annual maritime exercise SIMBEX.
Indo-Singapore bilateral relations have been on an upswing. In November 2015, the relationship between the two countries was elevated to ‘Strategic Partnership’ status.

In June this year, Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong of Singapore inked many agreements under the ‘Defence and Strategic Partnership Sectors’. One of them is the Implementation Agreement between Indian Navy and Republic of Singapore Navy concerning mutual coordination, logistics and services support for Naval Ships, Submarines and Naval Aircraft.
Both the Prime Ministers of Singapore and Malaysia have signed a joint agreement on maritime security.
This year's SIMBEX is being held. Indian Navy and INAS are conducting exercises over an extended geography.

The Republic of Singapore Navy is being represented by two Formidable Class stealth frigates, one Littoral Mission Vessel - RSS Unity, two Missile Corvettes, RSS Vigour and RSS Valiant, an Archer class Submarine, RSS Swordsman, a Fokker F50 maritime reconnaissance aircraft, embarked S70B helicopters and Scan Eagle unmanned aerial systems.

This year's edition of the Fleet Review is being conducted under the command of Rear Admiral Dinesh K Tripathi, NM, Flag Officer Commanding Eastern Fleet. The Deputy Commander Task Group from Singapore Navy will be SLTC Ho Jee Kien, CO 188 Missile Corvette Squadron for Sea Phase 1 and SLTC Lim Yu Chuan, CO 185 Formidable Class Frigate Squadron for Second Sea Phase.

SIMBEX 2018 will be the largest edition since 1994. The initial harbour phase will be held at Port Blair from 10 to 12 November and the second one at Visakhapatnam from 16 to 19 November. There will be a silver jubilee celebration to mark the 25th anniversary of SIMBEX.
This year's annual naval exercises will be the largest ever conducted by the Indian Navy and the Royal Navy.
MOD enhances Financial Powers of Vice Chiefs of Tri-Services by Five Times
The Ministry of Defence has delegated greater financial decision-making powers to Vice Chiefs of the three Services.
Raksha Mantri Smt Nirmala Sitharaman has taken this important decision to augment the arms and ammunition reserves of the Armed Forces to enhance their operational preparedness.
33rd Annual Day Celebration in AFGJI
Air Force Golden Jubilee Institute, Subroto Park celebrated its 33rd annual day on the 3rd of November 2018 on the theme ‘RAS TARANGINI’.
The annual report of the school was presented by the principal and students.
The school held a dance-drama “RASTARANGINI” with over 350 students in the auditorium.
Indian Navy’s Deep Submergence Rescue Vessel (DSRV) Capability
The Indian Navy has inducted a Submarine Rescue System with a Deep Submergence Rescue Vessel (DSRV) along with associated equipment.

The Indian DSRV has the capability to rescue personnel from distressed submarines up to a depth of 650 m. James Fishes Defence, UK, supplies the Indian Navy with this capability. The Indian Navy ordered two systems based on the West and East Coast of India to provide redundancy, high operational availability and early response to a submarine contingency.

The Rescue System has recently undergone extensive Sea Trials. The DSRV dived to over 666 m, the Remote Operations Vehicle (ROV) dived up to 750m, and the Side Scan Sonar dived 650m. Live undersea matings with different types of submarines have been achieved simulating the rescue of personnel from submarines.
India has a submarine rescue capability.
The DSRV is likely to be inducted in the Indian Navy by end of this year.
Naval Commanders’ Conference (2018/ 2) concludes

The second edition of the bi-annual Naval Commanders’ Conference concluded today. The Hon’ble RM praised the Indian Navy for its operational tempo and efforts towards indigenisation, self-reliance and support to the ‘Make in India’ initiative.
Nirmala Sitharaman praised the Indian Navy for its outstanding rescue operations during the recent floods in Kerala.

The Hon’ble Raksha Mantri also expressed her satisfaction with which both the Navy and the Ministry of Defence were performing their tasks in a constructive and a cohesive manner to ensure that the capability shortfalls are mitigated in the shortest possible time.

The Conference on Navy Modernisation discussed the induction of aircraft carrier, ships, nuclear powered submarines, conventional submarines, re-vitalisation of the aviation and sub-surface assets and induction of certain state-of-the-art weapons, sensors and equipment.

Chairing the conference, Admiral Sunil Lanba, Chief of the Naval Staff, addressed the Naval Commanders on various important issues pertaining to operational readiness, capability enhancement, maintenance, op logistics, infrastructure development and human resource management.
The Chief of Naval Staff (CNS) has encouraged the Commanders of the Indian Navy to implement innovative and modern ideas towards achieving operational efficiency.
Seminar on Planning, Design and Construction of Long-Span Bridges
The seminar on planning, design and construction of long-span bridges has been inaugurated by a minister.

Dr. Singh in his inaugural address highlighted that in overall development of nation connectivity plays a vital role. Director General Border Roads (DGBR) Lt Gen Harpal Singh highlighted that the topic of the Seminar is a vital subject to boost the pace of development of infrastructure in the country.
The seminar on long span bridges will be held by Bridge Engineers.
The construction of bridges across water bodies has always been a challenging task for the Engineers. Long Span bridges have a significant role to play at such difficult locations.

Engineer-in-chief Lt Gen SK Shrivastava, MD NHIDCL Shri NN Sinha, MD, National High Speed Rail Corporation Shri AchalKhare and Chairman Technical Committee of Indian Institute of Bridge Engineers Shri Mahesh Tandon shared the dais with Minister.
Air Marshal MSG Menon, VSM takes over asDirector General (Wks & Cer) of IAF

Air Marshal MSG Menon VSM was commissioned in Administrative Branch of IAF in Dec 1982. He holds a Bachelor of Science degree from Calicut University. He has undergone Higher Air Command Course from College of Air Warfare. He is an alumnus of Defence Service Staff College Wellington and the National Defence College.

The Air Marshal is a Cat 'AYE' Air Traffic Controller and has commanded an operational radar unit at a major flying station. He was a member of the first UN Mission to Sudan. He has tenated the appointments of Chief Administration Officer at AF Station Jalahalli, Director National Defence University and Principal Director Ops (Air Traffic Services). He was promoted to Air Vice Marshal and appointed as Assistance Chief of Air Staff (Org & Ceremonial).
For his distinguished service, the Air Marshal was commended by the VCAS in the year 2007. He was awarded Vishisht Seva Medal (VSM) by the President of India in 2016.
Prior to taking over as Director General (Wks & Cer), he was the Assistance Chief of Air Staff (AF Wks) at Air HQ.
He is married to Mrs. Lakshmi Menon and they have a daughter.
Opening Ceremony: INDO - Japan joint militaryexercise DHARMA GUARDIAN 2018

Exercise DHARMA GUARDIAN - 2018, a joint military exercise between Indian and Japanese Armies, started at Counter Insurgency and Jungle Warfare School, Vairengete, Mizoram, India on 01 November 2018. The Japanese contingent is being represented by 32nd Infantry Battalion and the Indian side by 6/1 Gorkha Rifles.
The first ever joint military exercise between Pakistan and Afghanistan is being conducted from 01 November 2018 to 14 November 2018.
Both sides will conduct a joint urban warfare exercise.
33rd Army Aviation Day celebrated on 01 Nov 2018
Army Aviation Corps celebrated its 33rd Raising Day on 01 November 2018. A wreath laying ceremony was held at the Amar Jawan Jyoti at India Gate, New Delhi.
Army Aviation Corps is the aerial manoeuvre arm of the Indian Army. It provides vital air support to soldiers safeguarding the borders and providing relief to the common man.
AFWWA celebrations at head quarter Western Air Command:Subroto Park, New Delhi
Mrs Devika Harikumar kicked off the celebrations of Air Force Wives Welfare Association (Regional) regional level.
The day started with the board meeting of AFWWA.
The main attraction of the day was the grand fete and Mela organised at the Subroto Park sports ground. The proceeds from the Mela go to fund welfare activities of the AFWWA in WAC.
The event would be on for two days and will end on 18 November at 1800 hrs.
All the presidents of AFWWA(Local) are meeting in one place to discuss their future plans for the organisation and review their work done in the current year.
Lt Gen P S Rajeshwar assumes charge as Chief of Integrated Defence Staff to Chairman, COSC
Rajeshwar took over as the 12th Chief of Integrated Defence Staff to Chairman, COSC today. He paid homage to the martyrs at Amar Jawan Jyoti and India Gate.

Rajeshwar is a Lieutenant General of the Regiment of Artillery. He has served in operational environments such as High Altitude Area, Counter Insurgency area in the North East, Counter Terrorist Operations in Jammu and Kashmir and United Nations Peacekeeping Operations.

The General Officer has commanded an Artillery Regiment during Operation Parakram, an Infantry Brigade at the Line of Control, a Counter Insurgency Force in Jammu and Kashmir and a Corps in the desert sector.

Prior to assuming the appointment as Chief of Integrated Defence Staff to Chairman, COSC, the Lt Gen P S Rajeswar was Director General (Perspective Planning) at the Integrated HQ, Ministry of Defence.
Air Marshal Pradeep Padmakar Bapat VSM takes over as theAir Officer-in-Charge Administration of IAF

Air Marshal Pradeep Padmakar Bapat VSM took over as the new Air Officer-in- Charge Administration of the Indian Air Force on 01 Nov 2018. He is a post graduate in Zoology from Vikram University Ujjain. He was commissioned in the Indian Armed Forces as a Fighter Controller on 28 May 1983. He has also served as Senior Administrative Officer and Chief administrative Officer of a Su-30 base. He participated in a joint exercise with South African Air Force named Golden Eagle.

Air Marshal PP Bapat is a keen sportsman and has represented Madhya Pradesh state in National Cycle Polo tournament twice. He was associated with the Air Force Cycle Polo team as a Manager for three years. He also worked as the Manager to Indian Cycle Polo Team during last year.
Tri-series tournament between India, Pakistan and Nepal held at Jodhpur.
In recognition of his meritorious service and exceptional professionalism, he was awarded ‘Vishisht Seva Medal’ by President of India in 2014.
Air Marshal is married to Smt. Smita and they have two sons.
DoNER Minister Dr Jitendra Singh asks North Eastern States to expedite fund utilization
The Union Minister of State (Independent Charge) Development of North Eastern Region (DoNER) has asked the North Eastern States to expedite fund utilization.
The delay in utilising Central Budget funds for the development of the Northeast is a cause of concern for Dr Jitendra Singh.
The amount of funding allocated to the North Eastern States has increased significantly in the last four years.
Dr Jitendra Singh wants the State Governments to fully utilise the funds made available to them in the budget.

At the meeting, it was decided that in the next coming months, the Ministry of Northeast and North Eastern Council will embark on hi-tech Digitization programmes for all the eight States and commemorative programmes to observe the 150th birth centenary of Mahatma Gandhi will be held at Northeast.
Secretary DoNER Shri Naveen Verma, Secretary NEC Shri Ram Muivah and other senior officers were present at the meeting.
DoNER Minister reviews progress of Hostel for North Eastern students at JNU Campus
Minister asks for expediting the work for completion in time-bound manner
The Minister of State for Development of North Eastern Region, Dr. Jitendra Singh, reviewed progress of the hostel for North Eastern students at Jawaharlal Nehru University campus.
The project to build a hostel for 424 students in Agra is being funded by the Ministry of Development of North Eastern.
The Minister for North Eastern Development, Dr. Jitendra Singh, has announced a number of projects for the development of north east India.
The construction of a hostel for Northeastern students in JNU campus is likely to begin in the next one or two months.
Speed of sanitation coverage is India’s pride: Prime Minister
Swachh Bharat Mission leads Countrywide World toilet day celebrations
It is World Toilet Day.
The Prime Minister of India, Shri Narendra Modi, has congratulated on increasing sanitation cover in the country.
The World Toilet Day culminated today with massive community activities across States and districts.

In a special event, CEO NITI Aayog, Amitabh Kant and Secretary, Ministry of Drinking Water and Sanitation, Shri. Parameswaran Iyer emptied a toilet pit and took part in Toilet Parliament in village Vajidpur in Firozabad district of Uttar Pradesh.
Shri. Parameswaran Iyer congratulated the village and the district for achieving ODF status. Shri. Amitabh Kanth stressed the importance of manure coming out from twin pit toilets.
The Districts and States who have taken the best set of initiatives during the World Toilet Day will be awarded by the MDWS at national level.
Swachh Bharat Mission to celebrate World Toilet Day tomorrow with nationwide activities
The Swachh Bharat Mission (Grameen) will celebrate World Toilet Day tomorrow with mass awareness and mobilization activities across States and districts.
The central part of the celebrations is the district-level Toilet Day Contest 2018. States and districts are working on a competitive mode since 9th November.
Since the inception of the Swachh Bharat Mission, the rural sanitation coverage of India has increased significantly.

In recognition to the work done by the Swachh Bharat Mission (Grameen), the Ministry of Drinking Water and Sanitation, is receiving a Lifetime Achievement Award at the World Toilet Summit in Mumbai tomorrow.
Sanitation on Ganga Bank gets Big Push as Uma Bharati holds back to back People’s Convention
Fourth Ganga Gram Swachhata Sammelan held in Bithoor, Kanpur

Union Minister for Drinking Water and Sanitation Uma Bharati today held the fourth Ganga Gram Swachhta Sammelan within the last two weeks to strengthen Sanitation based all round development in the villages on the bank of Ganga.
The community should build on the ODF status achieved in Ganga villages and add Solild and Liquid Management initiatives to it, says India's Minister of Environment, Smruti.
The Minister held a Convention in Kannauj.

Ganga Gram is a concept to transform banks on the river Ganga into ideal villages with emphasis on ODF, Solid and Liquid Waste Management, Water Conservation, Ground Water Recharge and modern crematorium.

The Minister appreciated the efforts made by the officials of her Ministry, the State and the district teams, Panchayat representatives towards faster realisation of Sanitation coverage in rural areas, .
Shri Akshay Rout, Director General, Special Projects in the Ministry of Drinking Water and Sanitation, highlighted the collaborative nature of the Ganga Bank Project.
People’s representatives and Senior officials from Centre and State were present.

Later, Ms. Uma Bharati visited an exhibition where district administration and local producers had demonstrated various components of Ganga Gram, local products and models of twin pit toilet and SLWM strategies.
Uma Bharati calls upon villagers on Ganga bank to raise sanitation levels
Third Ganga Gram Swachhata Sammelan held in Kannauj
People living on the banks of Ganga have been asked to improve their sanitation standards.

Ganga Gram is a concept to transform banks on the village of River Ganga into ideal villages with emphasis on ODF, Solid and Liquid Waste Management, Water Conservation, Ground Water Recharge, modern crematorium, tree plantation, organic and medicinal plant agriculture being the main components.
The Minister of State for Kannauj has congratulated the district team on making it Open Defecation Free.
She highlighted the importance of public participation in the success of SBM program across the country.

Ms. Archana Pandey, State Minister, Government of Uttar Pradesh and Shri Akshay Rout, Director General, Special Projects, MDWS, spoke to highlight the roles played by the state and central government in the area of Sanitation.
People’s representatives, government officials from Centre and State were present.
Uma Bharati visited Ganga and Ganga bank villages. She asked people to clean the Ganga waters and planted trees.
Rural Jharkhand declared ODF, West Bengal commits to become ODF by December 2018
Eastern States held a regional review meeting in Kolkata, West Bengal, to discuss key aspects of sustainability.

In his opening address, the Minister of Public Health Engineering, Government of West Bengal, Shri Subrata Mukherjee, stressed on the importance of sustaining safe sanitation practices and shared the State's commitment towards achieving open defecation free status.
The team from Jharkhand declared the State as Open Defecation Free today. The team from West Bengal committed to declare rural West Bengal ODF by December 2018.
Shri Akshay Rout, Director General, Special Projects, Ministry of Drinking Water and Sanitation, shared details of the ongoing Swachh Bharat World Toilet Day Contest.

Shri Samir Kumar, Joint Secretary, Ministry of Drinking Water and Sanitation, spoke about the importance of undertaking solid and liquid waste management activities as ODF-plus interventions in all districts.
The review meeting was held in Kolkata. The Swachh Bharat Mission officers and the State Mission team visited villages in the outskirts of Kshitata for a visit.
All North Eastern States commit to declaring ODF by December 2018
A regional review meeting of the North Eastern States was held in Guwahati, Assam today.
Key aspects of sustainability such as geo-tagging, verification of ODF villages, conversion of dysfunctional toilets, IEC expenditure and Swachhagrahi engagement were reviewed.
The meeting was held to discuss the progress made under the SBM program.

The teams from the ODF States of the region spoke about efforts to sustain their ODF status. Sikkim highlighted the solid and liquid waste management initiatives being undertaken in the first ODF State of the country.
Non-ODF States committed to declare themselves as ODF by December 2018.

Shri Akshay Rout, Director General, Special Projects , Ministry of Drinking Water and Sanitation pointed to the criticality of the sustainability phase of SBM and the necessity for the managers for regular monitoring.
The review meeting was held for the National Rural Drinking Water Programme (NRDWP) at the same time as the one for the Drinking Water and Sanitation Programme.
Other senior officials taking part in the review were Shri Hiranya Borah, Deputy Director General, Shri Samir Kumar, Joint Secretary, and Mission Directors from the participating States.
The Dy Commissioners of Assam and the Central Team held a video conference. The conference was followed by media interaction with eminent media persons and media houses from across the North East.
Pilot Ganga Grams will be the role model for village cleanliness
Sustainable behavior towards better sanitation is everyone’s responsibility: Union Minister Uma Bharati
Everyone's responsibility towards better sanitation is everyone's responsibility, according to the minister.

Ganga Gram is a concept to transform villages on the bank of river Ganga into ideal villages with emphasis on Open Defecation Free, Solid and Liquid Waste Management, Water Conservation, Ground Water Recharge, modern crematorium, tree plantation and organic and medicinal plants. All 4465 Ganga Bank villages are ODF now.
Mr. Munna Tiwari, MLA, senior officials from the Centre and the State and leaders from nearby Panchayats attended the Ganga Gram Swachhata Sammelan.
Jharakhand to become ODF by by 15th of this month
Public participation is the key to make Ganga Gram Successful: Uma Bharati
Jharkhand will become open defecation free on foundation day.
Uma Bharati, the minister of drinking water and sanitation, launched a campaign to transform all Ganga Bank villages into ideal villages.
In rural India, sanitation coverage has gone up from 39 to 95% in the past four years. According to the secretary, this would have saved about 3 lakh lives by October 2019.
Shri Anant Kumar Ojha, MLA from Rajmahal area and Secretary, Department of Drinking Water and Sanitation, Jharkhand Aradhana Patnaik also spoke at the event.
The Union Minister laid foundation of Maskalaiyya Crematorium and ghat, Municipal Waste Water Project at Rajmahal and inaugurated Ganga Gram Exhibition.
Swachh Bharat Mission announces World Toilet Day Contest for District Collectors
The Ministry of Drinking Water and Sanitation has announced the Swachh Bharat World Toilet Day Contest for districts and States.
Districts across the country will compete on a range of Swachhta activities to sustain and reinforce the behaviour change outcomes achieved so far.
The Ministry of Environment, Works and Sanitation has called upon districts and States for high participation in the contest and for qualitative Swachhta activity.
The Contest does not apply to the five States of, Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Telangana and Mizoram.
Districts can apply for the World Toilet Day Contest from November 19, 2018 to November 30, 2018.

Cabinet approves:i)Implementation of the umbrella scheme "Atmosphere & Climate Research-Modelling Observing Systems & Services";ii)Sub-schemes to continue during 2017-20; and iii) National Facility for Airborne Research(NFAR) to be set up

The Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs has approved continuation of the umbrella scheme "Atmosphere & Climate Research-Modelling Observing Systems & Services (ACROSS) during 2017-2020 at an estimated cost of Rs. 1450 crore.
The CCEA has approved establishment of National Facility for Airborne Research (NFAR) with a financial commitment of Rs 130 crore during 2020-21 and beyond.
The scheme aims to provide improved weather, climate and ocean forecast and services.
Generating employment opportunities:
A sizable number of scientific and technical staff along with requisite administrative support generate employment.

To ensure last-mile connectivity of the weather based services to the end -user, a large number of agencies like the Krishi Vigyana Kendras of Indian Council of Agricultural Research, Universities and local municipalities are roped in thus generating employment opportunities to many people.
The ACROSS scheme addresses different aspects of weather and climate services of the MoES.
The scheme ACROSS covers nine sub-schemes.
The ACROSS scheme consists of nine sub-programmes.

As the objective of the ACROSS scheme is to provide a reliable weather and climate forecast for betterment of society, the scheme will aim at improving skill of weather and climate forecast through sustained observations, intensive R & D, and by adopting effective dissemination and communication strategies to ensure its timely reach to the end-user of all services like Agro-meteorological Services, Aviation service, Environmental monitoring services, Hydro-meteorological services, climate services, tourism, pilgrimage, mountaineering etc.,

The Ministry of Earth Sciences (MoES) has a mandate to carry out research and development activities to develop and improve capability to forecast weather, climate and natural hazard related phenomena.

Union HRD Minister launches ‘Institution’s Innovation Council (IIC)’Program of MHRD’s Innovation Cell through video conferencing
The Higher Education Institutions’s Innovation Council (IIC) has been launched by the minister of human resources development.
The Minister for Human Resources Development (MHRD) announced the formation of network of Institution’s Innovation Councils.
The Union Minister, Manmohan Singh, said that Indian universities are the main research centres of developed countries. Indianuniversities are setting up research centres.
Education Minister Arun Jaitley praised the efforts of MHRD and AICTE to bring out this program.

Shri R. Subrahmanyam, Secretary (HE), MHRD, Prof. Saravana Kumar, Joint Secretary (TE), Prof. Anil Sahasrabudhe, Chairman, AICTE, Dr. BhushanPatwardhan, Vice-Chairman,UGC and Dr. Abhay Jere, CIO, MIC were present on the occasion.
Dr. Satya Pal Singh Launches Leadership for Academicians Program (LEAP) and Annual Refresher Programme In Teaching (ARPIT) for higher education faculty.

Satya Pal Singh, Minister of State, Ministry of Human Resource Development, launched two new initiatives; Leadership for Academicians Programme (LEAP) and Annual Refresher Programme In Teaching (ARPIT) today at New Delhi.
Shri Prakash Javadekar in his video message lauded the initiatives which are aimed at improving quality of teaching and developing leaders in higher education.
The launch event was attended by a number of higher education officials.
Shri R Subrahmanyam, Secretary (HE) believes that the initiatives to create transformative teachers and leaders will create leaders.

Leadership for Academicians Programme (LEAP) is a three weeks leadership development training programme for second level academic functionaries in public funded higher education institutions.

Annual Refresher Programme in Teaching (ARPIT) is a major initiative of online professional development of 15 lakh higher education faculty using the MOOCs platform SWAYAM. 75 institutions have been designated as National Resource Centres (NRCs) in the first phase of ARPIT.

Thereafter, the Board consisting of Chairperson and ex-officio members will co-opt (5) alumni from each of the IIMs, who will normally be the current serving members, except in cases of ineligibility.
In the first meeting of the Board, the regulations for selection of (4) eminent persons and two faculty members will be framed. They are expected to be completed before 15th December 2018.

Digital Transactions Registered Tremendous Growth

In the last two years, digital payment transactions in India have witnessed tremendous growth. New payment modes - Bharat Interface for Money-Unified Payments Interface (BHIM-UPI), Aadhaar-enabled Payment System (AePS), National Electronic Toll Collection (NETC) and Pre Paid Instruments (PPI) - have been introduced. Debit cards, credit cards, Immediate Payment Service (IMPS) and PPI have also witnessed substantial growth.
Significant Increase in Digital Payment Transactions:

The number of digital payment transactions in the month of October, 2016 was 79.67 Cr, which has increased by 207% to 244.81 Cr in August, 2018. The total value of transactions in Oct, 2016 amounted to Rs.108.7 Cr, whereas in August 2018 it reached Rs. 204.86 Cr.
High Growth of New Payments Platforms:

Growth of BHIM-UPI2:In Oct 2016, the number of transactions on BHIM-UPI was 1.031 lakh with a value of Rs 48 Cr., which has increased to 48.236 Cr transactions with a value of Rs 74,978.27 Cr in Oct 2018.
The number of transactions on AePS increased from 2.57 Cr transactions in October 2016 to 15.07 Cr transactions with a value of Rs 5893 Cr in October 2018.
Growth in Bharat Bill Payment System (BBPS) as Utility Bill Payments4:In Oct 2016, there were 0.035 Cr transactions on BBPS. There were 2.94 Cr transactions in Oct 2018.
The number of electronic transactions using FASTAG at toll plazas using NETC amounted to 2.22 Cr in Oct 2018.
Source : RBI, NPCI, Data provided by 56 Banks to MeitY

India gets UN Environment award for combating transboundary environmental crime

United Nation Environment has awarded Wildlife Crime Control Bureau (WCCB), Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change, Government of India with Asia Environment Enforcement Awards, 2018 for excellent work done by the Bureau in combating transboundary environmental crime.

Congratulating the Bureau Union Environment Minister said that theAsia Environmental Enforcement Award, recognizes the excellent workdone by Government officials and teams from the bureau who are diligently involvedin combating trans boundary environmental crime.
The Asia Environment Enforcement Awards celebrate excellence in enforcement of environmental laws.
WCCB has been awarded this award for its innovative enforcement techniques.

This system has been successfully used to analyse trends and for successfully carrying out operations such as Operation SAVE KURMA, THUNDERBIRD, WILDNET, LESKNOW, BIRBIL, ThUNDERSTORM and LES KNOW-II.

The award was decided upon by a selection panel set up by the UN Environment andthis is the second time in a row the awards are being given by UN Environment to India.
Address of Union Environment Minister at BASIC ministerial meet in New Delhi.
The Union Environment Minister Harsh Vardhan delivered a welcome address at the ministerial meet of BASIC countries in New Delhi.
The BASIC Ministerial Meeting on Climate Change is taking place in Delhi.

This Agreement is particularly significant as it represents the faith that countries, especially the developing countries, have placed in the multilateral processesknowing well that their actions towards addressing climate change will have a strong developmental impact.

BASIC group of countries is the leading emerging economies but they have a significant percentage of the world's poorest people. They have a number of National Development Goals (NDD). Their NDCs aim to create opportunities for sustainable livelihoods and sustainable development for the poor.

To further these objectives, we need to ensure that the Paris Agreement Work Programme (PAWP) is prepared in accordance with the agreed principles of Equity and Common But Differentiated Responsibilities and Respective Capabilities (CBDR-RC) as enshrined in the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) and its Paris Agreement.
In addition, anchoring the COP 24 outcomes in the vision of equity will help deliver climate justice not only to the present but also to our future generations.

The developed countries must fulfil their climate obligations expeditiously. They must take the lead in the fight against climate change by their actions and provide enhanced financial and other support to developing countries to enhance their climate ambition.
Lack of ambition of developed countries and their unfulfilled promises should not place additional burden on developing countries to further enhance the level of ambition of their NDCs.
We must ensure that the progress on NDCs at COP 24 does not yield an outcome that is
Mitigation-centric but it should address all elements including mitigation, adaptation,
finance, technology development and transfer and capacity building.
Barriers continue to impede the progress of Renewable Energy and Energy Efficiency deployment. High patent cost and non-facilitative IPR regimes need to be addressed by the Financial Mechanism.

We need to explore possibilities to fund research and development of climate friendly technologies and shorten technology deployment cycle in absence of which transformative development would be delayed.
The developing countries must focus on climate change adaptation as part of their National Development Goals (NDC).

The reporting under the transparency framework should be based on the principle of differentiation, providing greater flexibility to developing countries, and should also provide relevant information on the support provided by developed countries to developing countries.

A balanced approach towards development of Modalities, Procedures and Guidelines for the Enhanced Transparency Framework that enhances global action and financial support will serve us well in the negotiations at Katowice.
Developed countries are delaying climate action until post-2020.
At COP 24, developed countries should focus on pre-2020 agenda to build trust among Parties and strengthen their faith in the multilateral process.
Finance is one of the critical enablers of climate actions in developing countries.
Developed countries must significantly increase their financial support for climate change after 2020. They should finalize a new collective finance goal in time for the global stocktake in 2023.

India looks forward to constructive engagement and meaningful outcomes from the Facilitative Talanoa Dialogue at COP 24 that will pave a way for a better starting point in 2020 for the implementation of the Paris Agreement.”

Dr. Ajay Bhushan Pandey takes over as Revenue Secretary.
Dr Ajay Bhushan Pandey took over as the Union Revenue Secretary upon superannuation of Dr Hasmukh Adhia.

During his 8-year stint in UIDAI, he played a key role in establishing and steering Aadhaar across the country and drafting the historic legislation for providing statutory basis to Aadhaar. He also helped the Government in successfully defending the Aadhaar case against 37 petitions in the Supreme Court. He was instrumental in scaling up Aadhaar in delivery of government subsidies and benefits.
Before joining UIDAI, he worked as Managing Director of Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company and Principal Secretary, Information Technology in Maharashtra.

An Electrical Engineering graduate from IIT Kanpur, he joined the University of Minnesota in 1998 to obtain his MS and PhD in Computer Science and was later awarded Distinguished Leadership Award for Internationals by the University of Minnesota for his outstanding leadership accomplishments in his professional career.

Dr. Pandey will help government improve Tax–GDP ratio, enhance tax compliance through integration of technology, stabilize the implementation of GST. He would welcome public's suggestions on tax reforms.

Government of India and Asian Development Bank (ADB) Signs $75 Million Loan to Improve Urban Services in 4 Karnataka Towns

Government of India and the Asian Development Bank signed a $75 million loan here today to provide 24 x7 water supply in Karnataka’s four coastal towns of Kundapura, Mangalore Puttur and Udupi and improve sanitation infrastructure for Mangalore town.

The signatories to the tranche 2 loan agreement of Karnataka Integrated Urban Water Management Investment Program were Mr. Sameer Kumar Khare, Additional Secretary (Fund Bank and ADB), Department of Economic Affairs, Ministry of Finance, and Mr. Sabyasachi Mitra, Deputy Country Director of ADB’s India Resident Mission.
The $75 million tranche 1 loan from ADB Board is being used to improve urban water supply and sanitation services in three towns of Karnataka.
The investment program is supporting four coastal towns in Karnataka to provide continuous piped water supply and promote efficient and sustainable use of water.
The Program is helping urban local bodies improve their water supply and improve sanitation services.

The provision of performance-based construct and operate contract (PBCOC) modality, piloted by ADB in another urban project in the state, will help ensure the sustainable water service delivery through the optimal risk allocation between the public sector and private water operator.

The project finances will be used to augment water treatment production capacity by about 16 MLD, lay about 90 km of new water transmission lines and feeder mains, construct 29 overhead tanks and four ground-level service reservoirs, establish town level supervisory control and data acquisition system, strengthen the centralized supervision and control of water flow and water pressure and provide 1,300 km long distribution network and connect 140,000 household connections with new meters.

Government of India and Asian Development Bank (ADB) sign $200 Million Loan to improve State Highways in Bihar

The Asian Development Bank (ADB) and the Government of India signed here today in New Delhi a $200 million loan on 26.11.20L8 to finance widening and upgrading of about 230 Kilometers State Highways in Bihar to all-weather standards with road safety features.

The signatories to the loan agreement for the Bihar State Highways III Project were Mr. Sameer Kumar Khare, Additional Secretary (Fund Bank and ADB), Department of Economic Affairs in the Ministry of Finance, and Mr. Rajeev P. Singh, Officer in-charge of ADB's India Resident Mission.
After signing the Loan Agreement, Mr. Khare said that this loan will complement the efforts of the Government of Bihar to upgrade all State Highways to meet the minimum two-lane standard.
ADB will provide a new loan of $1.5bn for improving roads in Bihar.
Since 2008, ADB has provided four loans to Bihar, amounting to $1.43 billion, to upgrade about 1,453 km of State Highways and to construct a New Bridge over the Ganga River near Patna.
The ADB Board approved the BSHP-III project to upgrade State Highways to standard two-lane width with road safety features and paved shoulders.

Government of India and the World Bank sign $310 million Loan Agreement forJharkhand Power System Improvement Projectto provide reliable, quality, and affordable 24x7 electricity to the citizens of Jharkhand

The Government of India, the Government of Jharkhand and the World Bank signed here today in New Delhi a $310 million Loan AgreementforJharkhand Power System Improvement Projectto provide reliable, quality, and affordable 24x7 electricity to the citizens of Jharkhand.

The Jharkhand Power System Improvement Project will help build new power transmission infrastructure and improve the technical efficiency and commercial performance of the state power sector utilities.

While a significant portion of the proposed investments are aimed at improving power transmission infrastructure, theProject will also focus on developing institutional capacities of State-owned power transmission and distribution companies and improving their operational performance.
The Project is part of the Government of India’s Power for All program launched in 2014.

The Agreement for the Project was signed by Mr. Sameer Kumar Khare, Additional Secretary, Department of Economic Affairs, Ministry of Finance, on behalf of the Government of India, Ms. Vandana Dadel, Secretary, Energy Department, Ministry Of Jharkhand, and Junaid Ahmad, Country Director, World Bank India, on their behalf.
Jharkhand and DEA have signed an agreement for the Project.
The World Bank has awarded a project worth Â£1.5bn to the government of Jharkhand for improving electricity supply.

The government of Jharkhand has achieved significant results towards electrification. According to data from the JHarkhand Distribution Company, more than 80% of citizens in the state have access to electricity. The per capita consumption of electricity in Jharkshand was 552 kWh at the end of FY16, which is half of the national average.
The project aims to build substations and transmission lines, improve the State Load Dispatch Centre and integrate renewable energy in the State grid.
The Project will finance smart meters for around 350,000 consumers in the capital city of Ranchi.
The World Bank is funding a project aimed at strengthening the institutional development of power transmission and distribution utilities in India.
The $310 Million Loan from the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD), has a 5-year grace period, and a final maturity of 25 years.

Government of India and the Asian Development Bank (ADB) Sign $105 Million Loan to Support Hydropower Transmission in Himachal Pradesh

The Asian Development Bank (ADB) and the Government of India today signed a $105 million loan to continue financing the transmission system upgrades in Himachal Pradesh for increased supply of hydropower to the state and the national grid.
The tranche 3 loan is part of a $350 million multi-tranche financing facility for Himachal Pradesh Clean Energy Transmission Investment Program.

The signatories to the loan agreement were Mr. Sameer Kumar Khare, Additional Secretary (Fund Bank and ADB), Department of Economic Affairs, Ministry of Finance and Kenichi Yokoyama, Country Director of ADB’s India Resident Mission.
Himachal Pradesh government has signed a loan agreement with the Indian government.

The last tranche of MFF funding for Himachal Pradesh will help build confidence among hydropower developers about the availability of transmission capacity for evacuation of power from hydropowers in the state.

The loan will have a 25-year term, including a grace period of 5 years, an annual interest rate determined in accordance with ADB’s lending facility based on the London interbank offered rate (LIBOR), and a commitment charge of 0.15% per year.
The Asian Development Bank (ADB) is a regional development bank. It is owned by 67 members.

Government of India and the Asian Development Bank (Adb) Sign $ 169 Million Loan to Provide Water and Sanitation Services in Tamil Nadu

Asian Development Bank (ADB) and the Government of India signed here today a $169 million loan as the First Tranche of a $500 million multi-tranche financing to develop climate-resilient water supply, sewerage, and drainage infrastructure in at least 10 cities in the State of Tamil Nadu.

The signatories to the loan for the Tamil Nadu Urban Flagship Investment Program were Mr. Sameer Kumar Khare, Additional Secretary (Fund Bank and ADB), Department of Economic Affairs, Ministry of Finance, and Kenichi Yokoyama, Country Director of ADB’s India Resident Mission.
ADB will help address water scarcity and urban flooding in India.
The ADB supports Tamil Nadu’s vision to develop world-class cities in high-performing industrial corridors.

Though Tamil Nadu is the most urbanized of India’s large States, urban service levels remain low, with less than half of households served by piped water, only 42% of households are covered by a sewerage network, with 43% of sewage disposed directly into waterways untreated.
The government of Pakistan has approved a $1.5bn program aimed at improving urban infrastructure and providing water and sewerage services to 4 million people.
The First Tranche Loan will be used to fund a solar energy pilot project in the cities of Chennai, Coimbatore, Rajapalayam, Tiruchirappalli, Tirunelveli, and Vellore.

The result of the auctions will be announced on November 16, 2018 (Friday) and payment by successful bidders will be on November 19, 2018 (Monday).
The Stocks will be eligible for “When Issued” trading.
Coherent response in financing of Disaster Risk Management by Public, Private and Multilateral insitutions needed – Shri N.K.Singh
The SDRF needs to be responsive to the needs of the states and availability of funds to SDR.
XVFC begins a two day International Workshop on Financing Disaster Risk Management in India.
The Chairman of the Conference on Disaster Management (DRM) highlighted the need for coherent response in financing of DRM by public, private and multilateral institutions.
Dr. P. K. Mishra in his remarks stressed that 'Business As Usual' will not work. India is a signatory of Sendai Framework which has identified investment in resilience as one of its priorities.
He urged XV FC to review the availability of funds for states' disaster resilience activities.
UNDP and Indian Institute of Human Settlement have presented on the topics of Development and Rural Development in India.
1. The data system needs to be publicly available.
2. Effective safety nets need to be included to speed up the movement of money to victims of droughts and floods.
3. Centre-state matching grants to prepare for the resilience should be made available.
4. A Hazard Risk index can be developed and the vulnerability score of the state can be measured.
The Workshop on Grants-in-Aid to the States is being organised by the Financial Commission (FC).
The Commission may review the present arrangements on financing Disaster Management initiatives.
Advisory to UIN Entities claiming GST Refunds
Consulates, Embassies and other UN Organizations will be entitled to a refund of GST paid. They need to file invoices level data in their FORM GSTR-11 on the common portal.
Many UIN entities are not reporting their place of supply as the State where they are registered.

For example, it was observed that Embassies registered in Delhi have been consistently declaring their place of supply as “New Delhi” even on hotel service consumed in the State of Maharashtra for which the place of supply is Maharashtra.
The place of supply determines the chargeability of CGST / SGST or IGST tax on an invoice.
Wrong invoice level data in FORM GSTR-11 or in the statement of invoice submitted may delay or reject refund claims.
Cabinet approves Laying down procedure andmechanism for sale of enemy shares
The Union Cabinet chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi has approved the mechanism and procedure for sale of the enemy shares.

‘In principle’ approval has been accorded for sale of enemy shares under the Custody of Ministry of Home Affairs/ Custodian of Enemy Property of India (CEPI), as per sub-section 1 of section 8A of the Enemy Property Act, 1968.
Department of Investment and Public Asset Management has been authorized under the provisions of sub-section 7 of section 8A of the Enemy Property Act, 1968, to sell the same.
Sale proceeds are to be deposited as disinvestment proceeds in the Government Account.
The process to sell shares of CEPI is to be approved by the Alternative Mechanism. The shares of 996 companies of 20,323 shareholders are to be sold.
The CEPI will certify that the sale of the Enemy Shares is not in contravention of any law or law.
The advisors/ intermediaries will be appointed by DIPAM for the disposal of movable enemy property.

In the Act of 1968, the definition of "enemy" was as follows: a person or country who or which was an enemy, an enemy subject or an enemy firm. In the amendment of 2017, it was substituted by “.... including his legal heir or successor”.
The decision will lead to monetization of enemy shares that had been lying dormant for decades since coming into force and the Enemy Property Act in 1968.
With the amendment of 2017, an enabling legislative provision was created for the disposal of enemy property.
The approval of the procedure and mechanism for sale of enemy shares has been given.
The government has decided to monetize movable enemy property.
The Enemy Property Act, 1968 provides for continued protection of enemy property.
The CEPI has been empowered for sale of enemy property.

“ Notwithstanding anything contained in any judgment, decree or order of any court, tribunal or other authority or any law for the time being in force, the Custodian may, within such time as may be specified by the Central Government in this behalf, dispose of whether by sale or otherwise, as the case may be, with prior approval of the Central Government, by general or special order, enemy properties vested in him immediately before the date of commencement of the Enemy Property (Amendment and Validation) Act, 2017 in accordance with the provisions of this Act, as amended by the Enemy Property (Amendment and Validation) Act, 2017”.
The Central Government may direct that disposal of enemy property shall be made by any other authority or Ministry or Department instead of Custodian.
The cabinet has approved strategic disinvestment of 100% of the government's equity in Dredging Corporation of India Ltd.

The Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs chaired by the Prime Minister, Shri Narendra Modi has given ‘in principle’ approval for strategic disinvestment of 100% Government of India's shares in DCIL to consortium of four ports namely, Vishakhapatnam Port Trust, Paradeep Port Trust, Jawahar Lal Nehru Port Trust and Kandla Port Trust.
The government of India has approved the merger of Dredging Corporation of India Limited (DCIL) with the country's ports.
The strategic disinvestment of DCIL shall be undertaken after conducting due diligence exercise by both the entities with the help of Advisors, appointed for the transaction.
No let-up in sanction of GST Refunds

There are concerns about growing pendency of GST Refunds. As on 31st October 2018, total GST refunds to the tune of Rs 82,775 crore have been disbursed out of total refund claims of Rs 88,175 crore received so far. The disposal rate of 93.8% has been achieved. The pending GST refund claims amounting to Rs. 5,400 Crores are being processed expeditiously.

In case of IGST refunds, about 93.27% of the total IGST refund claims (Rs. 46,032 crore) transmitted to Customs from GSTN as on 31st October, 2018 have already been disposed. The remaining claims amounting to Rs.3,096crore are being held up due to various deficiencies.

In the case of RFD-01A (ITC Refund) claims, out of the total refund claims of Rs. 42,145 Crore, the pendency is Rs. 159 Crore with the Centre and Rs 2,146 Crores with the States. Provisional/Final Order has been issued in case of refunds amounting to Rs. 34,602 Crore and deficiency memos have been issued by respective GST authorities.
Efforts are being made to clear all the pending refund claims.
Text of the Article written by the Union Minister of Finance and Corporate Affairs, Shri Arun Jaitley on “ Impact of Demonitisation”

Following is the Text of the Article written by the Union Minister of Finance and Corporate Affairs, Shri Arun Jaitley on completion of two years of Demonetisation entitled “ Impact of Demonitisation”:
“Today we complete two years after demonitisation.
Demonitisation is a key step in a chain of important decisions taken by the Government to formalise the economy.
The Government is prosecuting those who failed to bring back the black money from abroad.
Technology has been used for both Direct and indirect taxes to facilitate filing of returns and expanding the tax base.
The introduction of Jan Dhan Accounts and the implementation of the GST have significantly improved the financial inclusion of poor people.
In India, 17.42 lakh account holders suspected of illegally using cash were caught.
The entire amount of currency that was demonetised in India was deposited in the banks.

The value of UPI transactions has grown from 0.5 billion in October, 2016 to Rs. 598 billion in September, 2018. The Unified Payment Interface (UPI) was launched in 2016. It is used by 1.25 Crore people. BHIM transactions have grown from Rs. 0.02 billion to 70.6 billion in the same period. BhIM's share in overall UPI payments reached about 48% in June, 2017.
The amount of transactions involving RUPAY Card has increased since demonetisation.

Today Visa and Mastercard are losing market share in India to indigenously developed payment system of UPI and RUPAY Card whose share have reached 65% of the payments done through debit and credit cards.

The impact of demonetisation has been felt on collection of personal income tax. The collections were higher in Financial Year 2018-19 by 20.2%. Even in the corporate tax the collections are 19.5%. Direct tax collections have increased by 6.6% and 9% in the two years prior to and after demonitisation.
The number of tax returns filed in the year 2018-19 has increased by 54.33% compared to the previous year.
The number of filers of income tax returns has increased by more than 50% since 2014.

The implementation of the GST curbed cash transactions. The formalisation of the economy has led to an increase in the tax payer base. The actual consumption of goods and services being recorded as a part of the tax net has increased. This has benefited both the Centre and States.
The goods and services tax (GST) system has reduced rates of taxes and increased tax collections.
The resources available in the country are being used for development of infrastructure, social sector and Rural India.
’s objectives are: more formalisation, more revenue, more resources for the poor, better Infrastructure and a better quality of life for citizens.

Cabinet approves Allied and Healthcare Council of India and corresponding State Allied and Healthcare Councils
A landmark legislation that will provide employment to millions of youth in the country: J P Nadda
The Union Cabinet chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi has approved the establishment of an Allied and Healthcare Council of India and corresponding State Allied and healthcare Councils.
Shri Nadda has announced details of Central and State Councils for Allied and Healthcare.

Reiterating the government’s commitment to strengthen healthcare services, Shri Nadda said that Allied and Healthcare Professionals (A&HPs) constitute an important element of the health human resource network, and skilled and efficient Allied and Healthcare Professionals (A&HPs) can reduce the cost of care and dramatically improve the accessibility to quality driven healthcare services.
Shri Nadda believes that the new law will bring all allied and healthcare professionals on board within a few years.
Cabinet approves the Allied and Healthcare Professions Bill, 2018 for regulation and standardisation of education and services by allied and healthcare professionals

The Union Cabinet chaired by Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi has approved the Allied and Healthcare Professions Bill, 2018 for regulation and standardisation of education and services by allied and healthcare professionals.The Bill provides for setting up of an Allied and Healthcare Council of India and corresponding State Allied and Healthcare Councils which will play the role of a standard-setter and facilitator for professions of Allied and Healthcare.
Establishment of a Central and corresponding State Allied and HealthcareCouncils; 15 major professional categories including 53 professions in Allied and Healthcare streams.
The Bill provides for structure, constitution, composition and functions of the Central Council and State Councils.

The Central Council will comprise 47 members, of which 14 members shall be ex-officio representing diverse and related roles and functions andremaining 33 shall be non-ex-officio members who mainly represent the 15professional categories.
The State Councils are also envisioned to mirror the Central Council,comprising 7 ex-officio and 21 non-ex officio members and Chairperson tobe elected from amongst the non-ex officio members.
Professional Advisory Bodies under Central and State Councils will examine issues independently and provide recommendations relating to specific recognised categories.
The Bill will also have an overriding effect on any other existing law for any of the covered professions.
The State Council will undertake recognition of allied and healthcare institutions.
Offences and Penalties clause have been included in the Bill to check mal­practices.
The Bill also empowers the Central and State Governments to make rules.
Central Govt. has the power to issue directions to the Council, to issue regulations and to add or amend the schedule.
An Interim Council will be constituted within 6 months of passing of the Act holding charge for a period of two years until the establishment of the Central Council.
The Council at the Centre and the States are to be established as body corporate with a provision to receive funds from various sources.
Councils will be supported by Central and State Governments.
Major Impact, including employment generation potential:
Bring all existing allied and healthcare professionals on board during thefirst few of years from the date of establishment of the Council.
Opportunity to create qualified, highly skilled and competent jobs inhealthcare by enabling professionalism of the allied and healthcare workforce.
High quality, multi-disciplinary care in line with the vision of AyushmanBharat, moving away from a 'doctor led' model to a 'care accessible and team based’ model.
Opportunity to cater to the global demand (shortage) of healthcareworkforce which is projected to be about 15 million by the year 2030, asper the WHO Global Workforce, 2030 report.
The Central Council's budget for the first four years will be Rupees 75 crores for States.
The Bill on Allied and Healthcare Professions Bill, 2018 is aimed at strengthening the healthcare delivery system at large.
In the current state of healthcare system, there exist many allied and healthcare professionals who remain unidentified, unregulated and underutilised.

Allied and Healthcare Professionals (A&HPs) constitute an important element of the health human resource network, and the skilled and efficient Allied and Healthcare Professionals (A&HPs) can reduce the cost of care and dramatically improve the accessibility to quality driven healthcare services.

Globally, Allied and Healthcare Professionals attend undergraduate degree programme of a minimum of three to four years to begin with and may attain up to PhD level qualification. However, most of Indian institutions offering such courses lack standardisation.

Majority of the countries worldwide, have a statutory licensing or regulatory body that is authorised to license and certify the qualifications and competence of such professionals, particularly those involved in direct patient care (such as physiotherapist, nutritionist etc.) or those whose occupation impact patient care directly (such as lab technologists, dosimetrists etc.).

Though such professionals have existed in the Indian healthcare system for many decades, a considerable gap in the allied and healthcare space is because of a lack of a comprehensive regulatory framework and absence of standards for education and training of A&HPs.
The Bill seeks to establish a robust regulatory framework which will play the role of a standard-setter and regulator for Allied and Healthcare professions.
Shri J P Nadda addresses the 3rd meeting of the “National Council on India’s Nutrition Challanges”
The Health Ministry has taken up several focused and targeted schemes for addressing nutrition challenges in the country: J P Nadda

“The Health Ministry has taken up several focused and targeted schemes for addressing nutrition challenges in the country in a convergence mode with the other Ministries.We have focussed on Immunisation, detection and supplementation.” This was stated by Shri J P Nadda, Union Minister for Health and Family Welfare at the 3rd meeting of the “National Council on India’s Nutrition Challanges” in presence of SmtManeka Sanjay Gandhi, Minister of Women and Child Development.

Dr. Rajiv Kumar, Vice Chairman, NITI Aayog, Dr.Vinod Kumar Paul, Member, Health & Nutrition, Niti Aayogi, ShriRakeshShrivastava, Secretary (WCD), SmtPreeti Sudan, Seceratry (Health), Shri Rajesh Kotecha, Secretary AYUSH, representatives of stakeholder Ministries and States of Chattisgarh, Tamil Nadu and Bihar attended the meeting.
ShriNadda has assured that the Health Ministry will proactively address the challenges of nutrition in the country.

Health Minister ShriNadda has said that during POSHAN Abhiyaan (September 2018) 1.83 lakhs of activities have been conducted by MoHFW and Department of Health in the States and UTs with involvement of 2.58 Cr participants.
ShriNadda's ministry organises National De-worming Day twice a year. Around 26.7 Cr of children were administered Albendazole during February 2018.
ShriNadda also stressed on the need for involving local leaders and sensitising them towards nutrition initiatives of the Government so that they can raise awareness about it amongst the people.

The Meeting Discussed Action Taken Report on the recommendations of the last National Council Meeting and the brief on POSHAN MAAH outcomes, Specifications of smart phones and growth monitoring devises, third Party outcome based evaluation of PoshanAbhiayan, roll out of e-ILA (e-incremental learning approach- Technology developed to support the field functionaries to improve their knowledge and skills in an ongoing incremental manner) and many other issues concerning effective implementation of PoshanAbhiyan.
Zika Virus strain that causes microcephaly not found in Rajasthan
ICMR-NIV, Pune has sequenced 5 Zika virus strains collected during the Jaipur outbreak. The current strain that has affected Rajasthan is not related to the previous strain.

However, the Government is maintaining high vigil of the possibility of adverse pregnancy outcomes in women exposed to Zika virus as the strain may mutate in future or some other unknown/host factors may play a role in microcephaly /other birth defects.
There have been 159 positive cases of Zika virus confirmed in the area of the Health Ministry's jurisdiction.

Zika virus disease is an emerging disease currently being reported by 86 countries worldwide. Symptoms of Zika virus disease are similar to those of dengue fever, skin rashes, conjunctivitis, muscle and joint pain, malaise, and headache.

In India, the first outbreak was reported in Ahmedabad in January/February 2017 and the second one in July,2017. Both these outbreaks were successfully contained through intensive surveillance and vector management.
The disease remains on disease surveillance radars of Union Health Ministry.
The situation continues to be monitored regularly.
Smt Anupriya Patel delivers the key note address at the ‘1st Annual Senior Care Conclave - Igniting Industry for India’s Ageing Sector’
Urges Corporates to Explore Opportunities of Investment in the Emerging Field of Senior Care
Corporate leaders should explore opportunities of investment in the emerging field of senior care.
The demand for senior care services is increasing due to changing global demographics and increased life expectancy.

The National Programme for the Health Care of Elderly addresses various health related issues of the elderly people and the basic thrust of the programme is to provide dedicated health care facilities to the senior citizens (>60 years of age).

A loan of Rs. 101.58 crores has been approved for the payment of salary and wages of Nepa Ltd. employees. A sum of Rs 90.83 crores for the voluntary retirement scheme of 400 employees and the strategic disinvestment of the company on completion of the RMDP have been approved.
Nepa Ltd. is a pioneer news print company located in Burhanpur district of Madhya Pradesh. NepaLtd. was set up in 1947.

Dr. Anandswarup Gupta was the founder director of the Bureau of Police Research & Development. In 2003, the Bureau instituted the Dr. Anandwarup Guptel memorial lecture series.

Rajnath Singh launched Emergency Response Support System (ERSS) for Himachal Pradesh at Mandi today.
Himachal Pradesh became the first State to launch single emergency number 112 under ERSS project. Rajnath Singh urged other States and Union Territories to follow suit.

Jai Ram Thakur expressed his gratitude to the Union Home Minister for inaugurating the 112-single emergency number, 112 India mobile app and ERSS website. He also thanked him for approving a dedicated NDRF Battalion for the State of Himachal Pradesh and 4.71 Crore for the project.
The launch of a single number based 112 emergency services is taking place.
The project aimed at improving emergency response services in the State of India has been successfully implemented.
The SHOUT feature has been introduced in the 112 India mobile app to seek immediate assistance from registered volunteers in the vicinity.
The Central Government has allocated ₹321.69 Crore for ERSS project across the country.
BPR&D will organize the Dr. Anandwarup Gupta Memorial Lecture and the 2nd National Conference of Heads of Investigating Agencies tomorrow.

Bureau of Police Research and Development is organizing the Dr. AnandSwarup Gupta Memorial Lecture and 2nd biennial National Conference of the Heads/Chiefs of Investigating Agencies here tomorrow. Shri D R Kaarthikeyan, former Director CBI will deliver the lecture on the topic “Inclusive Policing in the Era of New Age Crimes” during the inaugural session on November 29th, 2018. Justice Madan B. Lokur, Hon’ble Judge, Supreme Court of India, will deliver Valedictory address on November 30th.
The conference on capacity building of police investigators in the era of new age crimes is being held.
The heads of the state and central police investigation agencies will attend the conference.
The Conference on Investigation and Prosecution is being organised in collaboration with several Central Investigating Agencies, Academia, States and Industry.
Some of the major themes of the Conference and their collaborating Knowledge Partners are as follows –
Investigation of Terrorism related Crimes : National Investigation Agency (NIA)
Investigation of NDPS Cases :Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB)
Best practices from States on investigation and prosecution
Investigation of Wildlife Crimes : Wildlife Crime Control Bureau (WCCB)
Financial Intelligence and Investigation : Financial Intelligence Unit (FIU)
Investigation of Economic Offences : Enforcement Directorate (ED)
Use of Space based Technologies and Geo-spatial applications for Investigation : Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO)
Latest legal provisions and Supreme Court directives related to investigation : National Law University (NLU)

The Conference will have an Exposition of technologies and softwares related to investigation.

The Minister of State for Home Affairs, Shri Kiren Rijiju, inaugurated the 14th Formation Day of National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) here today. The theme of this year’s Formation Day is “Early Warning for Disasters”.
Shri Rijiju, the Minister of State for Home Affairs, inaugurated the National Disaster Management Agency (NDMA) conference.

The training programme aimed at improving CBRN safety at airports will improve the AEHs' ability to handle CBRN emergencies.
The training programme aimed at equipping AEHs to handle CBRN emergencies will also enable them to provide medical first aid and initial psycho-social support.

Centre for inter faith studies and Chairs in foreign Universities:

The 550th birth anniversary of Guru Nanak Dev Ji is celebrated in 2019.

Considering the significance of this occasion, the Prime Minister has constituted a National Implementation Committee (NIC) under the Chairmanship of Union Home Minister with Finance Minister and Minister of State for Culture as Members, for Commemoration of 550th Birth Anniversary of Shri Guru Nanak Dev Ji, in the country and abroad, in a befitting manner.
The third meeting of the National Implementation Committee for Commemoration of 550thBirth Anniversary of Shri Guru Nanak Dev Ji was held on 8th November, 2018.
The 550th birthday of Guru Nanak Dev Ji will be celebrated in November 2018. Ministries/Departments in the country and Indian Missions abroad will organise various activities.

The National Foundation for Communal Harmony promotes communal harmony and strengthens National Integration.
8th National Conference of Women in Police begins tomorrow in Ranchi

Unheard voices of Women in CAPF/Force – Gender neutral working places.
Empowered work space for conducive work environment.
Role of Women Police in Smart Cities.
Women in Community Oriented policing.

Sexual harassment at work places - Varied perspective and management.
