Liberalization of visa regime of India during the last one year
The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) has taken a series of steps to liberalize the visa process in India.
The number of foreigners visiting India on e-visa has gone up from 4.47 lakhs in 2015 to 18.78 lakhs till 30th October 2018.
E-visa is available for five categories i.e. Tourist, Business, Medical and Conference.
The local FRRO has been empowered to extend duration of electronic visas beyond 60 days upto 90 days. Moreover, e-visas can now be availed three times in one year against twice in a year earlier.
For foreigners who are already in India and who require consular/visa services, an online e-FRRO facility has been launched.

To promote cruise tourism immigration facilities have been provided at five major seaports where e-Landing Permits are granted to passengers for their onshore site-seeing. The condition of biometric enrollment for cruise tourists arriving at the ports of Mumbai, Cochin, Mormugao, Chennai and New Mangalore has been suspended till December, 2020.
Foreign nationals who fall sick during their stay in India can now avail medical treatment without converting their visa into Medical Visa.

Allowing conversion of any category of visa of a foreign national who is married to an Indian citizen/Person of Indian Origin/OCI Cardholder into an Entry Visa at any point of time by the FRRO himself
Facilities for extension of employment and business visas for foreigners up to ten years have been extended.
FRROs have been delegated powers for various visa related services.
FRROs have been delegated power for various visa related services.
The Ministry of Homeland Security (MHA) has rationalized issuance of restricted area permit and protected area permit to foreigners.
➢ Foreigners intending to visit a place covered under the PAP/RAP regime for activities
other than tourism on a visa other than Tourist Visa;
➢ Foreigners visiting a place for tourism purpose which is not opened for tourism;
Accordingly, the State Government concerned or the FRROs can now take decision and grant PAP or RAP to such foreigners immediately.

Andaman & Nicobar Islands have been excluded from the RAP regime notified under the Foreigners (Restricted Areas) Order, 1963. Foreigners will be allowed to visit 30 islands and 11 uninhabited islands without any RAP.
The grant of intern visa has been liberalized in order to attract more foreigners for internship in India.
The e-Event Clearance Module has been rolled out in April, 2018.
Cabinet condoles the demise of Shri Ananthkumar, Union Minister for Chemicals & Fertilizers and Parliamentary Affairs
The Union Cabinet met today to pay tribute to the late minister Ananthkumar.
The Cabinet observed a two-minute silence and passed a condolence resolution in his memory.
Ananthkumar was born on 22 July, 1959 in Bengaluru. He earned his BEng in English literature and his LLB in Law from Karnataka University.

Shri Anantkumar started his public activities as a student activist. He later became a member of the BJP and was the Organising Secretary of the Party's Karnataka Unit. He was later the President of the party in Karnataka. Later he was the National General Secretary of BJP.

In 1996, he was elected to the Lok Sabha from Bengaluru South for the first time. In 1998, he became a minister in the Vajpayee Cabinet and was appointed the Minister for Civil Aviation. He has been an MP for 6th time.
Former Union Minister Jagmohan Jain has died.
Shri Ananthkumar was an active social worker. He was involved in many social service projects. He launched an initiative to increase the green cover in Bengaluru.
The Cabinet extends condolences to the bereaved family of Shri Ananthkumar.

The first phase of the main exercise on urban earthquake search and rescue is being held in Shanghai. The main exercise is scheduled for 21-24 February, 2019 in Delhi by India's National Disaster Response Force.

The flagship missions of the MoHUA are anchored in the ideals of sustainability.
’s 40th CSMC meeting, Hardeep Puri stressed on the need for climate action.
Shri Hardeep Singh Puri, Minister of State (I/C) of Housing and Urban Affairs has said that the flagship missions of his Ministry are anchored in the ideals of sustainability.

Pointing out that we can no longer think of socio-economic development in isolation from the environment, Shri Puri emphasized that growth cannot be devoid of climate action – we have to get over this zero-sum mindset which pits development against our responsibility towards the climate.
India has effectively committed to achieving the SDGs even before they were fully crystallized.
Shri Puri, the minister responsible for sanitation, has said that over 60% of the total number of toilets built under the Swachh Bharat Mission in urban areas has been built.

Implementation of Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (Urban), Atal Mission for Rejuvenation and Urban Transformation (AMRUT) and Smart City Mission, all launched on June 25, 2015 and Swachh Bharat Mission (Urban) launched on October 2, 2014 besides the continuing 10% Lump Sum Scheme for North-East and North-Eastern Region Urban Development Programme(NERUDP) and DAY-NULM besides progress of RERA will be reviewed over two days.
The government has approved construction of 2,30,000 affordable houses for urban poor in the last 4 years.

Twelve towns of north-eastern Indian states have been included in the Atal Mission for Rejuvenation for Urban Transformation (AMRUT). The aim of AMRUT is to provide water supply to all urban households and improve sanitation and drainage networks. The government supports 90% of the project costs in towns of N-E States.
There are 98 towns in the NE that have become Open Defecation Free (ODF) under the Mission.
Under Day-NULM 13332 Self Help Groups were formed and 48,827 candidates imparted training.

BEML won the contract for 378 Metro Rail Coaches for Mumbai Metro Corridor 2a, 2b & 7.

BEML, a public sector undertaking of the Government has won a contract for Rs.3.015 crn. for manufacturing of 378 Metro cars of 6 cars each for Mumbai Metro Corridor 2A, 2B & 7. BEML will manufacture them from October 2020 and complete them by December 2022.
The train will operate on 25 KV AC traction.
Ø Equipped with CCTV surveillance for passenger security and real-time track monitoring.

There are over 600 km of metro rail network in India.

The Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs (MoHUA) has made efforts for indigenisation of metro rail systems in the country. It has standardised the specifications for metro rolling-stock, signalling, telecom, electrical and civil components. The Public Procurement Order, Make in India (PPO/MII) 2017, has also stipulated that minimum 75% of the coaches procured against any tender have to be manufactured in India.

BEML has won a contract for the supply of metro rail coaches worth Rs.8.00 Crs per coach. Seven international manufacturers of rolling stock participated in the bid. The contract for metro rail coach is worth
Mumbai Metro line 2A will connect Dahisar to DN Nagar in Mumbai. Metro lines 2B and 7 will connect Mankhurd to Bandra and Andheri.

’s Sinjar is a movie about the Yazidi women and girls abducted by Islamic State (IS) militants and their escape to Lakshadweep Island.

Matthew Wilder, the director of 'Regarding the Case of Joan of Arc' at IFFI 2018, says that Indian Cinema is inspiring for him.
The film 'IFFI' had its World Premiere at Kala Academy, Panjim, during the 49th edition of IFFI.
Nicole Kidman plays Joan of Arc in a film by director Billy Wilder. The film is about a character who is a supporter of white nationalism.
Christopher Matthew Cook enjoyed working in the film with Matthew and Nicole.

Criteria for selection of movies are difficult as they have to meet UNESCO's objectives: Georges DupontIndia has the most vibrant film industry in the world: Eric FaltCinema and UNESCO have a long-standing love affair: Eric Falt
Goa organises international film festivals. ICFT is trying to get into festivals like Cannes to promote young film-makers.

The criteria for selecting films for the Gandhi Medal Section are difficult because they have to meet UNESCO's themes of peace, unity and international co-operation. Film critics of international repute are involved in the selection process. The movies are shortlisted in India and sent to Paris for jury to watch. The criteria for selection this year have been broadened. Silver Prize will be awarded as the 150th anniversary of Mah is celebrated.
ICFT is trying to get youth involved in film-making and international film festivals. UNESCO is also promoting media education.

UNESCO supports culture in all its forms and there is a long-standing love affair between cinema and the international organisation. ICFT is preparing for the 50th anniversary of the festival next year and to bring UNESCO closer.
UNESCO is proud to be associated with IFFI.
IFFI presents a special ICFT Prize consisting of the UNESCO Gandhi Medal.

The Gandhi Award is presented to the film that best represents Mahatma Gandhi's ideals of peace, tolerance and non-violence. The winner will be announced at the closing ceremony of the Festival on 28th November.

The Indian films competing for the prestigious ICFT UNESCO Gandhi Medal are ‘Walking With the Wind’ and ‘Baaram’.The foreign films in the fray are : Border, Capernaum, Dovlatov, Laugh or Die, Los Silencious, Rain of Homs, The Interpreter, The Mercy of the Jungle, The Rib and The Silent Revolution.
Georges Dupont is a Communication Expert & Member of the National Commission for UNESCO, Luxembourg & presently serving as DG ICFT.

Eric Faltis is serving as UNESCO Director and Representative for the region covering Bangladesh, Bhutan, India, the Maldives, Nepal and Sri Lanka. He was previously the Assistant Director-General for External Relations and Public Information at the UNESCO.

The film is about Banarasi silk art.
Akashaditya Lama, Director of Nani Teri Morni talks about his journey to Nagaland to explore the story of a seven-year-old girl who swam across a river to save her grandmother.

BUNKAR: THE LAST OF THE VARANISI WEAVERS
The film Bunkar presents the history of Bunkara handloom weavers of Varanasi in India.

‘Jharkhand’s film policy one of the most progressive in India’‘State will be turned into a filmmaking destination’
Jharkhand has been chosen as the State in Focus at the 49th International Film Festival of India.
The Secretary of Jharkhand has launched a film policy to attract the attention of the film industry to the state's rich mineral resources.

The Secretary of Jharkhand explains the details of the state's film policy. According to the policy, films made in local languages will be given a maximum 50% of the total costs. Films shot in Jharkshand for more than half of the shooting days will get Rs. 1.1 crores, and those for two-thirds of the days will receive Rs. 2 crores.

Jharkhand has a lot of talented local artists who can rise to national level if given a chance. The new film policy aims to streamline and unite all the efforts related to film shooting in the state under one umbrella.

The directors of the films in the World Panorama section of 49th IFFI-2018 - The Bra, A Sacred Gaucho, Phoenix, Autsajder and Nervous Translation addressed the media during the 49th International Film Festival of India, Goa today, November 24, 2018.
Veit Helmer, the director of the German film ‘The Bra’ proposes a Q&A session with the audience after every movie screening.
Cinema should be about visual storytelling and not about dialogue, as dialogue spoils the visual elements in narration. Latin American and European films should be released in India.
Joaquin Pedretti's film 'A Sacred Gaucho' will have its world premiere in IFFI.

Camilla Strom Henriksen, Director of Phoenix, describes the characteristics of her film. It is a dark quiet film about children forced to assume the responsibility as adults because their parents fail to do so.
Adam Sikora, Director of Autsajder and Dennese Victoria, Cinematographer of “Nervous translation” discuss the differences between their films.
Veit Helmer's latest film is a romantic comedy about a train driver who finds a bra on his train and goes looking for its owner.
Joaquin Pedretti's film "Sacred Gaucho" had its World Premiere at IFFI.

Phoenix is a Norwegian film directed by Ms. Camilla Strom Henriksent. It tells the story of Jill, a caring teenager in family who handles her mentally ill mother. Jill's father visits Jill on her birthday.

A Polish film directed & written by Mr. Adam Sikora. It is about Franek, a student of painting, who gets involved in the cogs of a horrific totalitarian machine.
Adam Sikora is a director, screenwriter, and cinematographer. He is also a photographer and painter.

Nervous Translation is a Filipino language film written, directed & edited by Ms. Shireen Seno. It is about an eight-year-old girl who wants to spend all her savings on a pen that can "translate" the thoughts and feelings of nervous people.
Shireen Seno's second feature film Nervous Translation won the prize for Best First Film at the Festival de Cine Lima Independiente in 2013.

‘Na Bole Wo Haram’ is a directorial debut film by Nitish Patankar.
INDIAN PANAROMA (NON-FEATURE) DIRECTORS HIGHLIGHT THE CHALLENGES AND THE IMPORTANCE OF NON FEATURE FILMS

Children channelize their raw energy on to the Screen- Rajdeep Paul, Director, MalaiWe as directors also enjoy working with the children who work with utmost honesty- Shekhar Rankhambe, Director, PamphletAs they indicate stability in the Ladakh habitat, the snow leopards became the focus of our documentary - Doel Trivedy, Director, Gyamo-Queen of the Mountains

The directors of the three non-feature films, Gyamo-Queen of the Mountains, Malai and Pamphlet, under the Indian Panorama Section of 49th International Film Festival of India, Goaaddressed a press conference today.
Children are the best actors, because they channelize their natural talent on to the screen.
The co-directors of the film Malai talk about the harsh reality of Indian society.
Shekhar Rankhambe made a film with local child actors about a young boy who is traumatized after reading a religious pamphlet.
Ms. Doel Trivedy, co-director of the documentary, Gyamo-Queen of the Mountains, talked about the state of snow leopards in Ladakh region.
The director Gautam Pandey believes that more than the duration of the film, the content and the message behind it should be of utmost importance.
All the directors discussed the possibility of short films being screened in multiplexes apart from film festivals. Rajdeep Paul talked about his experience at IFFI 2018.
Open Forum Discusses the Digital Dilemma of Archiving Process
The urgent need for digitization, restoration and preservation of cinema for posterity came to the fore at the Open Forum of International Film Festival of India.

The director and technical committee chairman of IFFI 2018, Shri A. K. Birnoted that technology has helped in restoring the films that suffered from aging, chemical changes and other defects over the long years. However, the amount of enhancement depends on the restorer's ethical sense.
The Ingmar Berman Centre in Sweden is working on the restoration of the Swedish film archive.
Films have to be selectively digitized in order to preserve them longer.
ShriSubhash Chheda, Head-Archival Acquisition, Mumbai talked about the importance of sound preservation in film restoration.

Shri Kiran V. Shantaram, President, Federation of Film Societies of India, was the main speaker at the event. Film Directors Shri. R Dhanraj and Shri Karthik were also present. A book on late K.B. Tilak written by Shri N. Sasidhara was also released.
‘To the Desert’ is a movie showing contradictory emotions: Ulises Rosell
To the Desert is a documentary film about kidnapping in Patagonia.
The shooting for the movie was quite difficult as the weather conditions were hard; I always wanted to show Patagonia on the cinema and my wish is fulfilled through this film

Rosell and Bassi were addressing a joint press conference at the 49th International Film Festival of India, Goa today, November 23, 2018. To the Desert is being screened under the World Panorama section at IFFI 2018.

“I was very happy when I heard that my film got selected in World Panorama section of IFFI which was like an opportunity to take my film to the other side of the world and we are really grateful for this opportunity”, Rosell said.
Julia in the movie is trapped in a vast open space with a captor and she is afraid to tell anyone about the incidence.
The film is thus also a story of a secret that should not be shared, added Rosell.
Rosell is an award-winning Argentinian filmmaker and his wife is an Argentine actress.
To the Desert is a film about Julia and Gwynfor, a casino worker and his offer of a job at the oil company in Patagonia.
Without showing the gory details of the war, the story of World War II is depicted here through the mental trauma of a handicapped postman: Jayaraj

I would rather celebrate kindness of one percent people than talking about the cynicism of ninety nine percent: Srijit Mukherji“Realistics are done on sets and reals are done on real location": Kamakhya Narayan SinghSystemic failure has infiltrated the family: Priya KrishnaswamyIt’s good that alternate cinema is getting good OTT platforms: Priya Krishnaswamy

Jayraj, Kamakhya Narayan Singh, Director of Bhor, Nipun Dharmadhikari, director of Marathi film Dhappa, Srijit Mukherji, director Uma, and Priya Krisnaswamy, director Baram are among the presenters of the Indian Panorama section of IFFI- 2018. They believe that alternate cinema has great social transformative potential.
Bhayanakam is an adaptation of the Malayalam novel 'Coir'. It won three awards at the 2017 National Film Awards.

Jayaraj started his Navarasa film series with Karunam (1999). Shantham won the National Film Award for Best Feature Film. Bhayanakam released in 2017 is part 6 of Navarasasas. The story is set in Kuttanad and its backwaters in central Kerala during the World War II.
Jayaraj has been trying to do a panorama movie for 30 years. He believes there is no market for such movies.
Renji Panicker has made a dramatic transition from script writer and director to actor.
‘Bhor’ a film about a poor girl from Bihar’s Mushahar community, which was watched by Goa's Governor yesterday at IFFI-2018.

Since childhood, Kamakhya Narayan Singh has been fascinated by Musahar community, who live in villages near the cities. Kamakhtya Narayana Singh made a film about them. Bollywood actors couldn't spare 2 months from their schedule for this film, so he used new faces who lived there for two months to understand their situation. The music was recorded live after performing in the villages.
Marathi film Dhappa talks about children coming to terms with the stark contrast between the idealistic lessons taught in school and the harsh realities of the world outside.
Dhappa, a Marathi film on national integration, won the National Award for Best Feature Film on National Integration this year is going to be screened in theatres today.
Srijit Mukherji, the director of the Bengali film Uma, talks about the positive attitude of people.
Srijit has made a film based on the story "The Boy Who Moved Christmas". He changed the story to reflect the realities of his hometown Bengal.
Priya Krishnaswamy made her directorial debut with Gangoobai produced by NFDC in 2013. Baaram is a Tamil film about a night watchman and his sons.

“When I read news about elderly infirm parents being despatched with a cold head-bath (‘Thalaikoothal’) and getting killed, and heard this had social sanction, I could not believe it; until I saw Satyameva Jayate by Aamir Khan who foregrounded the issue.”
Krishnaswamy is making a documentary about the practice of killing elderly.
Baaram is based on true events. It had social sanction, there were traditional killers and it was done for free. Nowadays it is a business with brokers and commissions.
Krishnaswamy is making a movie about the breakdown of the family.
The elements of the story are rooted in the Cuban reality but they also speak aboutthe international scene of the time: Rodrigo Barrriuso

Maine is about how you easily connect with people who are in the same place in life as you are: Matthew BrownI feel, the transgender issues need to be told and that the movie could genuinely spin a dialogue: Mr Sivam
Rodrigo Barriusso, the director of the film ‘A Translator’, has made a film about his family life. The film is rooted in the Cuban reality and has lessons to offer to the world.
Malin is a professor of Russian Literature at the University of Havana and a translator between Cuban doctors and child patients after the Chernobyl nuclear disaster.
Rodrigo's film has already won the Golden Goblet Award at the Shanghai International Film Festival.
‘Maine’ a film in the World Panorama section of IFFI is directed by Matthew Brown. His previous film “In the tree-tops” was world-premiered at the Los Angelos Film Festival in 2015.
“Maine” is a movie about introspection and self-discovery based on personal experiences of director Michael Brown.
Maine is a film directed by and written by Dustin Brown.
Transgender issues need to be told in the hope that it will open up a genuine dialogue on this sensitive issue, according to the director of the film Roobha.
Amrit Sandhu plays Roobha in a new film which is about transgender women.
Both director Lenin Shivam's feature and short films have won many awards.
Uronchondi is all about road, sky, and nature: Director Abhishek Saha
I love their approach to life, they think very positively about everything, despite not having anything: Saha, on people in villages.
Abhishek Saha, the director of the Bengali film Uronchondi, wants to talk about rural and village people.
Saha's new film is about three women from three generations who need a break from their daily lives. The entire film is shot on the road.
Amartya believes the film Saha made is important because it talks about fringe characters from society who are unspoken about.
Amartya and Rajnandini are debutants. They went through a lot of mental and emotional homework to play the character.
Amartya praised the director for representing the culture of Purulia and Bengal’s fringe districts in a new movie.
Saha and his team visited a village in which all women work and women draw paintings on the walls.
Rajnandini's Purulia film got appreciated everywhere and people liked the way it was shot.
The actress praised the subtlety of the film and the director's choice of male protagonist.
Uronchondi is a Bengali film about three women who are chased by the police.
The film 'SudiptaChakraborty, Chitra Sen, and Rajnandini Paul' is the debut film of the actress Sudipta Chakrabordy and the director Abhishek Saha.
It's passion, not education, which would help you get where you want to be: Deepti Sivan, Director, Decoding Shankar

"Follow your heart, follow your passion”"Shankar Mahadevan is Talent Unlimited, for him, music is everything, for him, it flows like water""Our films are not being distributed, that is the truth" - Sivan on non-feature films“Getting producers with the right intent is a challenge; we use non-feature as a platform to let the world know that we have the talent to deliver on feature as well”I have always dreamt to be a part of IFFI, this is my dream come true; always used to think Mera Bhi Number Kab Aayega?: Deepti SivanFilmmaking has always been my dream, it still is a dream for me”: Prabal ChakrabortyMeet the Director Press Conference: Decoding Shankar & Sampurak
The directors of Decoding Shankar and Sampurak addressed a joint press conference at the 49th International Film Festival of India, Goa today, November 22, 2018.
Sharing her experience about making of the film, Deepti Sivan says that it's the pursuit of one's passion that will help you get to where you want to be.
Shankar Mahadevan is the only Indian musician with a pan-India presence and is welcomed in Bollywood.
Prabal Chakraborty is making a film about women's work and home.
Prabal Charaborty has worked in the US. He believes that working abroad broadens one's outlook and views.

Speaking about Prabal, Deepti Sivan said, “It is so nice to see that both of us are sharing the dais with a similar story: I have done a story about an engineer who followed his dream, and I have an engineer who has followed his dream sitting next to me.”
Prabal Chakraborty enjoyed making the short film.
Shankar is a new film about the life of a musician, singer, music composer, teacher and family man.

Sampurak, which means the other half is a Bengali film directed by Mr. Prabal Chakraborty. After their 5-day long business workshop, a woman and a man are declared as joint winners. The woman is expected to manage the household chores on her return.
Prabal Chakraborty has directed, written and edited a short film in Bengali.
IFFI 2018 Flash Briefing Skills launched on Amazon Alexa Smart Speakers
Cine Enthusiasts, Film Students Will Benefit From this Initiative
There are 390 million people using voice based communication around the world and this is expected to increase to 1.83 billion people in the next 3 years.
Press Information Bureau has launched IFFI 2018 Flash Briefing Skills on Amazon Alexa.

The initiative aims to supplement the publicity efforts of Government of India reach out to citizens with information of public interests through Press Releases, Social Media platforms and Live streaming of select events.
How to enable IFFI 2018 Flash Briefing Skill:
Alexa Users can go to https://www.amazon.in/Press-Information-Bureau/dp/B07KK373TD and enable the skill for their speakers.
Switch on the Speaker and Ask 'Alexa, what's in the news?'
Hope to be able to learn more about Indian film industry and collaborate with the great talents flowing from India: Celebrated actor Chin Han at IFFI 2018

Be open to the experience of working in Hollywood, even as you continue to tell stories at home: Chin Han to aspiring Indian actors“Storytelling is a universal impulse”“Hollywood is not the ultimate destination, though a very important destination”“Film is really like a dream come true” “Hospitality is amazing; the hotel staff kept remaking coffee until he got it right”“As the world becomes more global, there will be greater opportunities for Asian actors to be part of global stories”
Chin Han is excited about Indian scripts.
Singaporean-American actor Lee Kuan Yew was addressing a press conference at the 49th International Film Festival of India in Goa today.
He came to India to watch Dangal, which did well in India.
He started his career in the theatre and moved to the film industry in Hollywood. He never thought that he would end up starring alongside Dwayne Johnson.
There has been a change in the portrayal of Asians in Hollywood cinema since the late 1990s. Chin Han, an Indian actor, would like to work in Hollywood.
The actor has worked on Marco Polo web series.
Hollywood is an important destination for actors. Christopher Nolan used technology like I-Max in his film.
Mr Han believes Christopher Nolan has the whole movie in his head before he starts the shooting.
Mr Han wants to learn more about Indian film industry and collaborate with the great talents from India.
Mr Han chooses meaningful and well-written films based on his personal experience.
Mr. Han believes that meaningful stories will be told if more people are given the opportunity to tell their stories.
Han Han is a fan of Dwayne Johnson.
Mr. Han was impressed with the IFFI opening ceremony.
Chin Han is an American actor. He has been named by CNNGo as one of Asia's 25 all-time greatest actors.
Chin Han is a well-known Singaporean actor who has acted in many movies and TV series.
The problem is we have too many good movies:Consul General of Israel in Mumbai, Ya’akov Finkelstein

There are many similarities between Indian and Israeli Cinema and both countries need to explore their own cinemas deeper:Dan Wolman, IFFI 2018 Lifetime Achievement AwardeeThough I sometimes made movies to earn a living, I am a supporter of fringe cinema: Dan Wolman
Both Indian and Israeli cinema need to explore their own cinemas deeper, according to Dan Wolman. He was presented Lifetime Achievement Award at the 49th edition of IFFI in Goa.

Narrating an experience where he was interviewed by a person unaware of parallel cinema, Mr Wolman, who lost two-thirds of his family in holocaust said, he believes in portraying emotions in indirect and subtle ways.
Mr Wolman is interested in theatre and Israel's 18 film schools.
Diversity is a strength of Israeli film-making.
The Consul General of Israel in Mumbai, Ya’akov Finkelstein, said that India and Israel have vast business opportunities in the film sector.
IFFI will screen 10 movies from Israel as part of its Country Focus Section.
David Silber is a film producer. His latest movie is about two rebellious young women.
Finding your own voice is important in any creative profession: Prasoon Joshi at IFFI 2018

~The Masterclass titled, ‘Lyrical Imagination Unleashed’ saw Prasoon Joshi evoke the audiences’ emotional side by singing some of his timeless songs~~The exhibition on Mahatma Gandhi was inaugurated at the hands of Union Minister of State for Information and Broadcasting Col Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore~~The State Focus section on Jharkhand was also inaugurated~~The delegation from Israel, as part of the Country Focus on Israel at IFFI 2018, and singer Arijit Singh who is debuting as a director with his film ‘Sa’ at IFFI 2018, walked the red carpet with his wife, Koyel Singh~~A panel discussion on Ingmar Bergman – ‘Wild At Heart, Master At Craft’ was held at Maquinez Palace as a mark of tribute to the Swedish filmmaker~
The second day of the IFFI 2018 saw the inauguration of the Mahatma Gandhi exhibition.
Col Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore was promoting films of business and an exhibition on Mahatma Gandhi at the 49th IFFI in Goa.
This was followed by the inauguration of the State Focus section on the state of Jharkhand.
The IFFI is taking place in Jharkhand. The focus of the festival is on promoting the film industry in the state.
The delegation from Israel walked the red carpet at IFFI 2018. Arijit Singh made his debut as a director with his film Sa at the festival.
Maquinez Palace hosted a Masterclass and a panel discussion during IFFI 2018.
Prasoon Joshi, the CEO of McCann World group India and Chairman of the Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC), graced the audiences at IFFI 2018.

In this session, the National Award winning lyricist Padma Shri Prasoon Joshi talked about the factors that inspire his creative process, the difference and similarities between writing lyrics and poetry and the need to find one's true voice.
Mr Joshi believes that nature plays a significant role in inspiring his creative works.
It is okay to be confused and restless, if you want to express yourself in a creative way.
The Masterclass on how to get past the Writer’s Block was given by Mr. Joshi.
IFFI 2018 had on its schedule a panel discussion on Swedish master craftsman Ingmar Bergman as part of paying him tribute on his centenary.
In the 5th edition of 1001 Movies You Must See Before You Die, Ingmar Bergman's films are listed. He is the third best represented director and has the greatest number of writing credits.
IFFI 2018 is celebrating the birth centenary of this master filmmaker by showcasing 7 best films of his career.
Sunit Tandon was influenced by Ingvar Bergman as a child.
The social issues that Ingvar Bergman touched upon in his films are timeless. Most of his films age very well.
The panel discussion was followed by the screening of Ingmar Bergman’s film, Wild Strawberries.
The 49th International Film Festival of India begins on Tuesday, 20 November 2018 and ends on Wednesday, 28 November, 2018, in Panaji, Goa.
Cinema has got a universal language; I do not want to spoil the beauty of an original movie by dubbing it to another language: Director Shaji N Karun
Society hardly understands the sufferings of women, Kharwas is an attempt to spread awareness on this: Aditya Suhas Jambhle

Cinema is a universal language and the message conveyed by the Malayalam movie ‘Olu’ can reach the audience, irrespective of language barriers. Aditya Suhas Jambhle's Marathi film 'Kharvas' is an attempt to spread awareness on the sufferings of women.
Both the directors of 'Olu' and 'Kharvas' were speaking at the joint press conference on their films at the IFFI Wednesday 21st November.
The cast of the Bollywood movies Olu and Kharvas attended the press conference.
Shaji N Karun, the director of the movie Olu, says that dubbing into other languages spoils the originality of the film.
Karun praised the hard work of cast and crew on the underwater scenes in the film.
It took 20 hours to shoot the climax of the film Kharwas, which deals with motherhood and cow's milk.
Selecting the best among the brilliant films a common problem: Jury members of IFFI 2018 Indian Panorama

The day is not far when there will be no regional cinema, all cinema will be called just cinema: Chairman, Indian Panorama (Feature), Shri Rahul RawailA time will come when short films will dominate the space in Indian cinema: Chairman, Indian Panorama (Non Feature), Shri Vinod Ganatra“Need to develop infrastructure for distributing good films at low cost”“The strength of cinema is that visuals tell the entire story”: Chairman, Indian Panorama (Feature)“A mother accepting a son as gay is very progressive, very happy that films such as these are made”

The growth of regional cinema in India has been fantastic. Shri Rahul Rawail, Chairman of Jury, Indian Panorama (Feature), of the 49th International Film Festival of India (IFFI), said that the day will come when there will be no separate category for regional cinema.
Shri Rawail, a member of the International Film Festival of India's Feature Film Jury, has selected 22 films from a list of more than 100.
The jury of Indian Panorama - Non Feature were present at the media briefing.
Shri Rawail says that the collection of the festival includes some fantastic films with brilliant content.
The chairman of the jury in Indian Panorama has dismissed the controversy regarding omission of certain movies from the festival.
Shri Rawail believes that the biggest mafia ruling the industry is the multiplex mafia.

Shri. Vinod Ganatra, Jury Chairman, (Non Feature Films) said that with the advent of digital technology, short films with exceptional content are coming out in large number, but ensuring quality is the biggest challenge for film makers.
Shri. Vinod Ganatra believes short films are going to replace feature films in a short time. He advised young film makers not to compromise on script.
Major Ravi says that 18 transgender films were considered for selection in this year's edition of the Indian Panorama.
Shri. K.G Suresh, member of Feature Film Jury, is satisfied with the selection of movies in Indian Panorama section.
Smt. Parvathy Menon, jury member for Non feature films, appreciates the creativity of short film makers.
Shri Suneel Puranic, Member of Non Feature Jury, has praised films from Bengali and Marathi languages for their creativity.
NFAI book‘Women In Indian Cinema’ launched at IFFI2018
Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore launched a publication on women in Indian Cinema at the International Film Festival of India, Goa.
A pictorial book traces the story of women on the silver screen in Indian Cinema.
The author of a book on Indian cinema presents the story of Indian Women through the eyes of cinema.
The Publication Division and NFAI have collaborated to produce a book on various shades of portrayal of women in Indian cinema.
PrakashMagdum, director NFAI has launched a book dedicated to women in Indian cinema.
In recent years, Indian cinemas have reflected changing social and economic realities of emerging India.
The book on the works of NFAI's Director and Film Historian is going to be published.
India is a land of storytellers where every person has a story to tell: Col Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore at IFFI 2018 Opening Ceremony

~ IFFI 2018 opens to a scintillating display of myriad cultures, film snippets and on-stage camaraderie between celebrities Karan Johar, Minister Col Rajyavardhan Singh Rathoreand Akshay Kumar~~ Other stalwarts from the world of cinema who attended the opening ceremony include Randhir Kapoor, Subhash Ghai, Lulian Landais, Madhur Bhandarkar, Arijit Singh, Ramesh Sippy and more~~ The opening ceremony saw a sizzling performance by stars like Sonu Sood, Shilpa Rao and others~~The web portal of Film Facilitation Office (FFO) was launched by Col Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore at the opening ceremony~~Over its nine-day duration, IFFI 2018 will showcase 212 films from over 68 countries which consist of 2 World Premieres, 16 Academy Award nominated films, 6 Indian rare language films, 3 Indian films competing with 15 international films for the Golden and Silver Peacock awards, and many more interesting elements~

GOA, 20th NOVEMBER 2018:Ending the long wait, the opening ceremony of one of the most prestigious film festivals across the world – the 49thedition of the International Film Festival of India (IFFI) opened amidst the presence of film stars, filmmakers and cine-lovers from across the world amid pomp and gaiety in Panjim, Goa.
The opening ceremony of IFFI 2018 saw the presence of eminent Indian and international film personalities.

The inaugural ceremony of the festival saw dignitaries such as Union Minister of State for Information & Broadcasting,(IC) Colonel Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore, Governor of Goa Ms Mridula Sinha, Secretary Information & Broadcasting Mr Amit Khare, IFFI Festival Director Mr Chaitanya Prasad, Chairman Jury Mr Robert Glinski, PWD Minister of Transport & River Navigation of Goa Ramakrishna alias Mr Sudin Dhavalikar, Chief Secretary of Goa Mr Dharmendra Sharma and Chairman ESG Rajendra Talak who lit the lamp, thereby declaring IFFI 2018 open.
The Indian Film Festival of India (IFFI) is taking place in Goa. It is a platform for the young generation to showcase their talent and international filmmakers to see India's talent.
Goa is hosting the 49th International Film Festival of India.
Akshay Kumar paid a visit to the minister of education in Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore.
The inaugural ceremony of the festival of Indian films featured a medley of songs from some of the best Indian films and a dance performance by Sonu Sood.
The opening ceremony of the IFFI 2018 was attended by a minister, actor Mr Akshay Kumar and filmmaker Karan Johar.
Akshay Kumar and the Minister of Culture, Rajnath Singh are talking about the film Gold, which is screening at IFFI this year.

The opening ceremony of IFFI 2018 saw the launch of the website of the Film Facilitation Office (FFO) launched by Col. Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore, the Union Minister of State (I & B). The FFO was established by the Ministry of Information & Broadcasting in 2015 to promote and facilitate film shootings by foreign filmmakers in India.
This year IFFI is focusing on Israeli cinema.
The opening ceremony of IFFI 2018 saw a host of celebrities descend on the red carpet.
While speaking to the mediapersons at the red carpet, the celebrities expressed pleasure for being present at the glittering ceremony and said:
-“IFFI is a very inspiring place and it is a great place for people who worship art and it is a place that showcases high quality cinema from across the world.” –Arijit Singh
There is a lot to do in Indian cinema now. Akshay Kumar is one of the mega stars and has consistently pushed meaningful cinema along with commercial cinema.
Akshay Kumar and Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore are discussing the interplay between entertainment and education in India.
Randhir Kapoor is happy that Indian cinema is recognised globally.
Siddharth Roy Kapoor is optimistic about the future of VFX and animation.
Madhur Bhandarkar is happy to be a part of IFFI.
IFFI presents regional films from Ladakh and Lakshadweep.
Rakeysh Omprakash Mehra is a part of International Jury this year.

The49th IFFIwill showcase the best of recent International cinema, along with special sections such asRetrospectives,Masterclasses,In-Conversation sessions,Homages,Indian Panorama,International Competition, featuring the best of world cinema produced in the past year, with the aim of providing a platform for young creative minds to interact, view and learn.
The IFFI 208 festival opened with the World Premiere of The Aspern Papers and will close with World premiere of Sealed Lips.

This edition of the festival will showcase 212 films from over 68 countries, including 2 Worldpremieres, 16 Oscar-nominated films, 6 Indian rare language films and 3 Indian films competing for the Golden and Silver Peacock awards. The International Competition section will have 15 films from 15 countries, out of which 3 are Indian films. The jury is headed by renowned Polish Director Robert Glinski.
The Country of Focus for this year's IFFI is Israel. Ten films in collaboration with the Consulate General of Israel in Mumbai have been selected for the country focus package.

IFFI 2018 will feature a State Focussection that will focus on the films of one of the Indian States. Jharkhand has been selected as the State of Focus for 49th IFFI 2018. JHarkhand Day will be celebrated on 24 November 2018.

This year, IFFI has also collaborated with the International Council for Film, Audiovisual Communication (ICFT) Paris to present a special prize consisting of theUNESCO Gandhi Medal to a film, which reflects the ideals promoted by UNESCO. Two Indian films will be selected for this prize.
The Homage presentations at the 49th IFFI will include tributes to the late actorsSridevi, Vinod Khanna, Shashi Kapoor, M Karunanidhiand filmmakerKalpana Lajmi.
The feature film OLUdirected by Shaji N Karun will open the Indian Panorama 2018. Aditya Suhas Jambale's film Kharvasas will be the opening film of the Non-Feature film category.
The ceremony was held at the Shyama Prasad Mukherjee Indoor Stadium, Goa, and was aired live on DD National along with live streaming on the YouTube channel of PIB youtube.com/pibindia.
The opening ceremony was followed by the screening of the Opening film of IFFI 2018 – the World Premiere ofThe Aspern Papers, at Kala Academy.
The 49thInternational Film Festival of India began today, on 20 November 2018 and ends on Wednesday, 28 November, 2018, in Panaji, Goa.
It is a real honour for me to be in India to present my film at this prestigious festival: Julien Landais at IFFI 2018

The director of the opening film of IFFI 2018 – The Aspern Papers – was speaking at a press conference held by IFFIThe Aspern Papers tells a story of obsession, grandeur lost and dreams of Byronic adventuresThe screening of the opening film will also be its World Premiere at IFFI 2018

GOA, 19th NOVEMBER 2018: As cine lovers await with bated breath for the official opening of the 49th International Film Festival of India (IFFI), the international star cast and crew of the opening film of the festival – ‘The Aspern papers’ –made their presence felt at the press conference held this evening by IFFI.
Julien Landais was present with his actors Mr. Nicolas Hau, MsBarbara Meier and MsLois Robbins.
The Aspern Papers received a world premiere at the 49th edition of IFFI.
Julien Landais is in India to present his film The Aspern Papers at the festival. The film is an adaptation of a novella by Henry James.
Lois Robbins was present at the press conference. It is her first time in India. She loved The Aspern Papers and the costumes from the Dolce and Gabbana couture archives.
Lois enjoyed the first day of the shooting of the film in Venice. Jonathan helped Lois adjust her gloves and cape for every take.
The Aspern Papers is a film based on letters Percy Bysshe Shelley wrote to Mary Shelley's stepsister Claire Clairmont.
Juliana Bordereau's niece, Miss Tina, tries to manipulate Morton to get him to give over the letters of the Romantic poet Jeffrey Aspern to her.
The film based on Henry James' novel was shot in Venice. James Ivory, an old India hand and a recent Academy Award winner is one of the Executive Producers of the film.
The 49th International Film Festival of India will open with the World Premiere of 'The Aspern Papers'.
The 49th International Film Festival of India begins on Tuesday, 20 November 2018 and ends onWednesday, 28 November, 2018, in Panaji, Goa.
Relive the life and times of Mahatma Gandhi through the NFAI Exhibition at IFFI 2018
"Mahatma on Celluloid” Multimedia Digital Exhibition at IFFI 2018"
As India is celebrating the 150th Birth Anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi, IFFI '2018 will pay a tribute to him.

The National Film Archives of India in collaboration with the Bureau of Outreach and Communication is organizing a multi-media digital exhibition as a tribute to the Mahatma, who inspired countries around the world with his philosophy of Truth and Non-Violence (Satyagraha and Ahimsa).

Titled “Mahatma on Celluloid”, the exhibition provides a state-of-the-art digital experience to the viewers who can relive the life and times of Mahatma, and draw inspiration from his ideals and work.
The exhibition on Mahatma Gandhi and the freedom movement in India will be inaugurated.
The exhibition will be launched on 21st November.
49th edition of IFFI to open tomorrow with the gala opening ceremony
The International Film Festival of India will open tomorrow with the gala opening ceremony that will showcase the theme of New India.
Sonu Sood, Shilpa Rao and dancers will perform at the opening ceremony.
The ceremony will be held in Goa.
The ceremony is taking place. Akshay Kumar, Karan Johar, Julien Landais, Hrishita Bhatt, Madhur Bhandarkar, Subhash Ghai, Arijit Singh, Ramesh Sippy and Chin Han will walk the red carpet.
The opening ceremony of the PIB is being streamed live on DD National and YouTube.
The show will witness the launch of the Film Facilitation Office.

Glimpses of the festival opening film "The Aspern Papers", which tells a story of obsession, grandeur lost and dreams of Byronic adventureswill be screened for the audience and the Director of the Film, Julien Landaiswill address the audience on the occasion.

Clarification regarding Maternity Leave Incentive Scheme
The Ministry of Labour & Employment has clarified some reports about Maternity Leave Incentive Scheme.

The Maternity Benefit Act, 1961 applies to establishments employing 10 or more people. It regulates the employment of women in certain establishments for certain period before and after child birth and to provide maternity benefit and certain other benefits. It was amended through the Maternity benefit (Amendment) Act, 2017. It has increased the paid maternity leave to women employees from 12 weeks to 26 weeks.

The implementation of maternity leave provision is good in Public Sector but not so much in Private Sector. Private employers are not encouraging women employees to apply for maternity leave. Some contract workers are terminated on flimsy grounds when they do.
The Ministry of Labour & Employment is working on an incentive scheme for employers employing women workers. It is estimated that the scheme will cost about Rs. 400 crores.

Major Impact: The proposed Scheme, if approved and implemented, shall ensure the women in this country an equal access to employment and other approved benefits along with adequate safety and secure environment.

The Ministry of Labour & Employment is in the process of obtaining necessary budgetary grant and approvals of Competent Authorities. The reports that the Scheme has been approved or notified are incorrect.
Cabinet approves MoU between India and Italy for continuing training and education in the fields of Labour and Employment

The Union Cabinet chaired by Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi has approved the Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between India and Italy for training and education in the fields of Labour and Employment.
The MoU will facilitate expansion of the training and education activities to promote decent work in the world of work, through:
conducting joint training programmes on training methodologies and techniques;
developing new training modules for different social partners;
organizing customized training programmers in different themes on labour and employment;
undertaking evaluation of training methodologies;

exchanging of good practices in training programmes, particularly in the context of labour administration; assisting each other in the delivery and facilitation of the training modules and organizing study visits; and
exchanging of trainers for sharing of knowledge and information.
The V.V.Giri National Labour Institute and VVGNLI signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) aimed at enhancing technical capabilities of both institutions.

The V.V Giri National Labour Institute (VVVGNLI), NOIDA, an autonomous body under the Ministry of Labour and Employment, Government of India and the International Training Centre of the International Labour Organisation (ITC-ILO), Turin have signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) to formalize the professional collaboration.

International Training Centre (ITC) was established in 1964 in Turin. ITC has a vast reservoir of international expertise on employment, labour, human resource development and capacity building. One of its objectives is to forge partnership with premier institutions engaged in training activities in the field of labour and employment.

Consumer Price Index for Industrial Workers (CPI-IW) - September, 2018
The All-India CPI-IW for September, 2018 remained unchanged.

The current index shows a slight downward pressure from Food Group. At item level, Groundnut Oil, Eggs (Hen), Fish Fresh, Poultry (Chicken), Onion, French Beans, Gourd, Lady Finger, Potato, Tomato, Apple, Coconut, Sugar, etc. are responsible for the decrease in current index.

The year-on-year inflation based on CPI-IW remained unchanged at 5.61 percent between August and September, 2018 as compared to 2.89 percent during the corresponding month of the previous year. Food inflation also remained unchanged.

At centre level Puducherry reported the maximum decrease of 9 points followed by Goa (7 points). Jharia recorded the maximum increase of 6 points, followed by Nagpur (5 points). The rest of the centres' indices remained stationary.
The next issue of CPI-IW for the month of October, 2018 will be released on Friday, 30th November, 2018 and will be available on the office website www.labourbureaunew.gov.in.

MNRE circulates draft Indian Wind Turbine Certification Scheme (IWTCS)

Ministry of New and Renewable Energy, in consultation with National Institute of Wind Energy Chennai, has prepared a draft of new Scheme called Indian Wind Turbine Certification Scheme (IWTCS) incorporating various guidelinesTurbine Certification Scheme (IWTCS).

The IWTCS is a consolidation of relevant National and International Standards (IS/IEC/IEEE), Technical Regulations and requirements issued by Central Electricity Authority (CEA), guidelines issued by MNRE and other international guidelines.
The draft Scheme enlists the guidelines for the benefit of all the stakeholders.

The IWTCS is envisaged to assist and facilitate the following stakeholders; (i.) Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) (ii.) End Users -Utilities, SNAs, Developers, IPPs, Owners, Authorities, Investors and Insurers (iii.) Certification Bodies (iv.) Testing Laboratories

Wind energy has matured over the decades to be the mainstream source of renewable power generation in India. The Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (MNRE) Government of India through various policies and schemes has facilitated the healthy and orderly growth of the wind energy sector. The successful evaluation under the recognised schemes resulted in the wind turbines being listed in the Revised List of Models and Manufacturers (RLMM).
Type Certification of wind turbines plays an active role in ensuring that wind turbines in India meet the requirements of international IS/IEC/ICECRE standards.
The Ministry of Rural Resettlement (MNRRE) invites public comments till 5th December 2018 on draft Scheme.

Dr Jitendra Singh moots 'Heli-Clinics' for remote areas

Union Minister Dr Jitendra Singh, who is also a renowned Diabetologist, has mooted "Heli-Clinics" / Helicopter Clinics for remote areas, which could particularly be of great help to provide specialized medical care to people living in inaccessible hilly terrains of the States like Jammu & Kashmir and Northeast.
The leading private sector doctors should focus more on rural and remote areas as cities are almost saturated with private practitioners.
Corporate hospitals in hill states of India could provide helicopter-based super-specialty clinics.
The private sector is gradually taking a bigger role in healthcare in India.
Private sector can play a big role in tele-medicine and e-healthcare to reach the remote and inaccessible regions in India.
The CentralGovernment's focus on healthcare for all is commendable, as highlighted by Dr Jitendra Singh.

Shri Hemant G. Contractor, Chairman, PFRDA delivers 37th CVC Lecture.
Shri Hemant G. Contractor, Chairman, Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority (PFRDA) delivered the 37th lecture of the "Lecture Series" organized by the Central Vigilance Commission (CVC).

He differentiated between social security, social assistance and social insurance as concepts and discussed the concept of social protection as a broad idea, encompassing social security and voluntary welfare measures.
The history of social security schemes in the context of the emergence of the modern nation state and their implementation in India was discussed during the lecture.

The speaker explained many aspects of the National Pension Scheme (NPS), the role of PFRDA in regulating the pensions and social security schemes and spoke of the Atal Pension Yojana in the context of the opening of Jan Dhan Accounts and the implementation of the Direct Benefits Transfer (DBT) scheme by the government.
The lecture of Chief Vigilance Officers was webcast live.
GovernmentBrought Most Public Authorities Under RTI Act
The government has brought most of the public authorities under the purview of the RTI Act in the last four and half years.
Dr Jitendra Singh made these observations when the outgoing Chief Information Commissioner (CIC) Shri R.K. Mathur called on him today.

Lauding the achievements of the last over four years, Dr Jitendra Singh said, when the government came in, there were very few public authorities under the purview of RTI Act, but a fast - track process was initiated to make the RTI more effective and more inclusive.
The filing of RTI has become easier with the use of technology, Dr Jitendra Singh said.

The disposal time of the RTI application received in the Central Information Commission has been drastically reduced, said, Dr Jitendra Singh, and added that the pendency has also considerably reduced in comparison to what it was before 2014.
In the DOP&T, Dr Jitendra Singh said, there has been a successful effort to collect information from RTIs and prepare research manuals to improve upon the existing methodologies.

ISPRL Signs Memorandum of Understanding with ADNOC to explore storage of Crude Oil at Padur Underground Facility in Karnataka

Announcement comes within days of final shipment of ADNOC crude to India’s Mangalore strategic storage facilityMoU provides a foundation to explore opportunities to strengthen and expand the strategic energy partnership between India and UAE
ISPRL signed a memorandum of understanding with Abu Dhabi National Oil Company (ADNOC) to store ADNOC's crude oil at ISPRL's underground oil storage facility at Padur in Karnataka.

The MoU with ISPRL, an Indian government-owned company mandated to store crude oil for emergency needs, follows the arrival, on November 4, of the final shipment of the initial delivery of ADNOC crude to be stored in another ISPRL underground facility at Mangalore, also in Karnataka, which will store 5.86 million barrels of ADNOC crude oil.
The MoU was signed by Abdulla Salem Al Dhaheri, Director of Marketing, Sales and Trading at ADNOC and HPS Ahuja, CEO & MD ISPRL.
The framework agreement between the UAE and India on the delivery of crude oil to India was signed.
ADNOC is the only foreign oil and gas company, so far, to invest by way of crude oilin India’s strategic petroleum reserves program.
ISPRL will explore opportunities related to storage of ADNOC crude at Padur.

ISPRL has already built underground storage capacity of 5.33 million tonnes of oil at three locations - Visakhapatnam, Mangalore and Padur - that can store up to 9.5 days of the country’s oil needs. The government of India created two new reserves, a 4 million tonnes storage facility at Chandikhol in the eastern state of Odisha and an additional 2.5 million tonnes at Padur.
The existing and newly announced strategic reserve facilities put together will provide around 21 days of emergency coverage for India’s crude oil requirements.
Cabinet apprised of India joining as Member of Advanced Motor Fuels Technology Collaboration Programme under International Energy Agency

India will become a member of AMF TCP after becoming interested in advanced biofuels and other motor fuels.
The AMF TCP is an international platform for co-operation among countries to promote cleaner and more energy efficient fuels & vehicle technologies.
Ministry of Petroleum & Natural Gas, Government of India joined AMF TCP as its 16th member on 9th May, 2018.

MoU signed between OMCs and CSC SPV for collaboration in LPG Services

An MoU for collaboration in LPG services was signed here today between Oil Marketing Companies (IOCL, HPCL & BPCL) and CSC e-Governance Services India Limited in presence of Shri Ravi Shankar Prasad, Minister of Law & Justice and Electronics & Information Technology (MeitY) and Shri Dharmendra Pradhan, Minister of Petroleum & Natural Gas and Skill Development & Entrepreneurship.
CSC SPV and OMCs have agreed to facilitate their distributors to avail the following services through Common Services Centers:
· Booking new LPG connection (Ujjwala & General category)
· Booking of LPG refills (14.2 Kg cylinders)
· Supply & distribution of LPG cylinders (storage up to 100 Kgs,) through CSCs.
Common Services Centre will help beneficiaries to provide the above OMCs service near to their home, accessing through Digital Seva Portal.
The Minister of Petroleum, Dharmendra Pradhan, signed a MoU with the CSCs.
The Minister of Technology, Ravi Shankar Prasad, congratulated partners in the MoU on digital inclusion.
Following benefits will accrue to the citizens through this partnership:
Oil Marketing Companies (OMCs) and CSC SPV agreed to provide the benefits of Ujjawla connection,refilling of new connection and other services through CSCs for last mile access at their doorstep.
Beneficiary can visit the nearby CSCs across India to get the services of OMCs.
CSCs will help a beneficiary in booking a new gas connection request, refilling request and delivery of Gas Cylinder.
CSCs will help beneficiary to scan/upload her KYC documents for verification of his/her identity for new booking connection.
Beneficiaries can collect the Gas Cylinder from their nearby Common Services Centres.
CSCs will also provide requisite information about the scheme and promote it among citizens so that maximum number of beneficiaries can avail the benefit.
Ministry of Petroleum & Natural Gas is appointing 1 Ujjawala Didi for every 5 villages whose prime responsibility is to support and give service to Ujjawala Beneficiaries.

CSCs has supported in conducting training session in 100 LPG Panchayats where one hour of training and demo was given to Ujjawala beneficiaries on safety mode of using gas cylinders and on Refill option.
The incentive for Village Level Entrepreneur for delivery of services is as follows:
Booking of new gas connection (under Ujjwala & General categories)
Per transaction (with clear KYC under PMUY)
Distribution of Gas Cylinders through CSCs if the cylinders are to be delivered by distributor at POS / VLEpremises
Distribution of Gas Cylinders through CSCs if cylinders are to be uplifted by POS / VLE through its own vehicle, from the LPG godown
Common Services Centers (CSCs) are astrategic corner stone of the Digital India programme. CSCs are aimed at promoting rural development and building rural capacities and livelihoods.
“8 States achieve 100% household electrification under Saubhagya; total 15 States now have 100 % household electrification”, announces the Power Minister
“Nation expected to achieve 100% household electrification by 31st December, 2018” says the Minister
8 States have achieved 100% saturation in household electrification under Saubhagya. Fifteen states now have 100% electrification.

Saubhagya – ‘Pradhan Mantri Sahaj Bijli Har Ghar Yojana’ was launched in September, 2017 with the objective to provide access to electricity to all the remaining households in the country.The Minister informed that as many as 2.1 crore connections have been released under Saubhagya so far.
The electrification of the country is expected to reach 100% by the end of 2018.
The government is committed to provide 24x7 access to electricity for all by 31st March 2019.
The States which have achieved 100% household electrification have been asked to take up a campaign to publicise the achievement.

The first DISCOM/Power Department to complete 100% household electrification will be felicitated with cash award of Rs. 50 Lakh for employees and grant of RS.100 Crore for distribution infrastructure.
The States completing 100% household electrification by 31st December 2018 will get additional grant of 15% of the project cost.
Electricity in households has a positive impact on the quality of daily life for women and children.

With deeper penetration of electricity network, significant improvement is expected in delivery of other essential services like education, health, communication etc. and thereby more opportunities for economic activities leading to employment generation, increase in income and poverty alleviation.

"Energy efficiency saves the environment and makes businesses more competitive. India needs to grow responsibly. The government has taken several measures in this regard.

India's energy efficiency efforts are being lauded world over.

EESL and GAIL signed a MoU to develop natural gas based cogeneration and trigeneration projects in Commercial & Industrial Sectors in India.

IRSDC initiates series of steps to make this unique project more attractive & risk free to the developers
The Indian Railways Station Development Corporation (IRSC) has launched a project to develop a transport hub at Surat Railway Station.
Increased Built-up Area (BUA) - Proposed Commercial Development BUA increased from 5.07 to 8.40 Lakh sq.m.
BUA definition modified to exclude basement(s) or any upper floor(s) for satisfying the parking/ fire requirements as per local byelaws.
The estimated cost of the project has been reduced from INR 1,008 Cr. to INR 895 Cr.
The commercial area at ground level has been increased by 7.84% to 7.54% considering the local demand at Surat.
Increased Commercial Development on West Side along Ring Road - Commercial Area increased on West side by shifting the proposed Railway Quarters to Udhna.

Flexibility for Planning Explicitly - Flexibility has been given to the developer to modify the Commercial Development Plan without disturbing the arearequirements and intent of Mandatory Project.Master Plan has been revised to provide more commercial area on ground.
IRSDC being declared the nodal agency by Union Cabinet for Railway Station Redevelopment and given full powers for plan approvals over railway land and no change in land use required.

FSI of 4 is available as per Transit Oriented Zone (TOZ) without any charges.

In principle approval for Land Entrustment given by SMC & GSRTC for their respective lands.

Environmental Clearance is under process.
Flexibility in Commercial Development Project - 60% of the Commercial Development project to be completed in 15 years from the Effective Date.

Milestones of Project Development Fee Instalments payable by the Developer has been realigned to reduce upfront expenditure of Developer.

Running of freight trains in a Block through “Convoy Movement”

Shri Piyush Goyal chairs a review meeting with senior officers of Railway Board and Zonal Railways on this innovative Freight Convoy Initiative Shri Piyush Goyal has been closely following up on the implementation of this initiativeThis would help in improving mobility of rakes required for coal loading as well as other commodities
The minister of Railways & Coal, Shri Piyush Goyal, is closely following up on the implementation of Convoy Movement initiative.

This innovative way of running freight traffic has been successfully implemented on Korba-Bilaspur-Anupur-New Katni-Agasod-Bina-Jhansi-Kota routes, Ghaziabad-Allahabad-Pt. Deen Dayal Upadyaya Junction routes and Bilaspur -Jharsuguda-Rourkela sections. It was also tried on the Asansol-Jhalajha-Barauni section on 3rd/4th November, 2018.

During the coach free corridors, senior officers are deputed in the control offices to monitor the planning, ordering and running of freight trains in the convoy. Traffic inspectors and loco inspectors are deputing to foot-plate in the locomotives of the freight trains to ensure no time loss in the clearance of block sections.
Shri Piyush Goyal, Minister of Railways and Coal, chaired a review meeting of the senior officers of Railway Board and Zonal Railways.
The increase in freight throughput across identified key sections /interchange points of SECR, WCR, NCR, ECR and ER during the days of freight convoy system has been as under:-
Thus, both in the loaded direction and in the empties direction there was significant increase in freight trains and throughput.
Zonal Railways plan to introduce freight convoys system for 2 or 3 times a week.
RPF conducted Nation Wide Raid on Railway E-Ticket Touts
Unauthorized use of E-Ticket Personal User Ids were under constant Electronic Surveillance of R.P.F.
On2ndNovember’ 2018,simultaneous raids against e-ticket touting were conducted in more than 100 cities throughout the Indian Railways on ‘All India’ basis.
The Railway Board, Security Directorate and Railway Public Relations Foundation (RPF) have foiled a fraud involving the illegal sale of e-tickets.

Accordingly, out of more than 5 crore users, a list of most suspected personal user IDs was prepared at Railway Board, New Delhi. This list was shared with Zonal Heads of RPF (IG-cum-PCSCs) through secret communication.
Detailed instructions of the Director General/RPF were also conveyed regarding thorough verification of credentials & activities of all suspects at ground level well in advance of the proposed raid.
Though, the investigation is still going, information received so far is as under:-
185 people involved in touting activities were arrested during a nation-wide raid.
1875future journey e-tickets worth35.68 lakhforfeited.
Oneillegal softwarewas also detected in Mumbai.
1268Personal User IDs, which were being used to carry out touting activities, sent to IRCTC for deactivating them immediately.
166 cases under section 143 of the Railways Act’ 1989 have been registered at various RPF Posts and taken up for investigation.
The festival season is about to begin. Since 7th October 2018, more than 1,000 touts have been arrested and tickets worth more than Rs 5.75 crores recovered.
The drive and investigation of cases is still going on. Team RPF is committed to take strong and sustained action against touting elements in future.

As on 01.04.2018, there were 3479 Unmanned Level Crossings on Broad Gauge routes, of which 3402 UMLCs have been eliminated in last seven months12 Zonal Railways are free from UMLC

Indian Railway has taken a mission area to eliminate all Unmanned Level Crossings (UMLCs) on Broad Gauge and accordingly special efforts have been made so that elimination can be completed at the earliest.
As on 01.04.2018, there were 3479 unmanned level crossing on Broad Gauge routes. In the last seven months, 3402 UMLCs have been eliminated and another 77 are planned to be eliminated.

Ministry of Railways rolls out All-India Unreserved Mobile Ticketing facility (UTS on Mobile)

The facility of booking unreserved tickets, including season tickets and also platform tickets is available through the ‘UTSONMOBILE’ app available for Android, IOS and Windows phones.Booking of unreserved tickets on all non-suburban sections across all Zonal Railways has been made available from 1st November to enable seamless booking of unreserved tickets all over Indian Railways

Ministry of Railways has introduced Unreserved Mobile Ticketing with a view to promote three C’s- Cashless transactions (Digital payment), Contact less ticketing and Customer convenience and experience. It will be available on all non-suburban sections of Indian Railways from 1st November.
A pilot project for booking of unreserved tickets through mobile phone was started in December, 2014 on select railway stations.
Unreserved Mobile Ticketing was extended to suburban sections in metropolitan cities of Chennai, Delhi, Kolkata and Secunderabad between 2015 and 2017.

The process of booking a train ticket is as follows:. The user needs to download the application and register. After registration, the user is given a user-ID and password. They can book the tickets within the geofenced area and outside the gated area. The facility to make payments via digital mode has been introduced.
The UTSONMOBILE was introduced on Non-Suburban sections of Northern Railway in 2015.
Mobile Ticketing shall promote cashless transactions, contact less ticketing and customer convenience.
Seamless booking of unreserved tickets all over Indian Railways.
Obviate the need for passengers to wait in queues for purchasing the tickets and enhance the experience for booking unreserved tickets – journey, season tickets, platform tickets.
‘UTSONMOBILE’ application available for Android, IOS, Windows phones.
Application ‘in house’ developed by Indian Railway-CRIS.
App has 4 Star rating at Google play store.
Increase in Number of tickets sold: approximately 1900/day in 2015 to 83,000/day in October, 2018.
Increase in number of passengers: approximately 5400/day in 2015 to in 4.70 lakh/day in October, 2018.

Cabinet apprised of MoU between India and the Russian Federation for the development of cooperation in transport education; and MoC between India and the Joint Stock Company "Russian Railways" on technical cooperation in the field of railways

The Union Cabinet chaired by the Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi has been apprised of the following two instruments, namely, a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) and a Memorandum of Cooperation (MoC), with Russia on 5th October, 2018:
MoU with the Ministry of Transport of the Russian federation for the development of cooperation in transport education for the development of cooperation in transport education.
MoC with the Joint Stock Company "Russian Railways" (RZD) on technical cooperation in the field of railways.
The MoUs/ MoCs facilitate exchange of technical experts, reports and technical documents, training and seminars/ workshops focusing on specific technology areas.
The Russian and Indian governments signed a memorandum of understanding on cooperation in transport education.
The MoC will enable technical cooperation in the following areas:-

Implementation of the project for upgrading the Nagpur- Secunderabad section to raise passenger trains speed up to 200 kmph (Semi High Speed) with possible extension of the section including other directions of Indian Railway (IR) network;
Implementation of a Single Traffic Control Center to manage mixed traffic at the regional level, divisional railway and/ or at the upper network level uniting all the IR's zonal railways;
Customization, organization of joint manufacture and implementation of a competitive signaling and interlocking system;
Supply and localization of turnout switches for Semi High Speed and above;
Training and advanced qualification improvement of Indian railway employees with the involvement of Russian railway-related higher education establishments;
Best practices in Freight Cargo operations; and
Joint development of multi modal terminals in India.

Vice President Shri M Venkaiah Naidu will lay the foundation stone for the construction of Dera Baba Nanak - Kartarpur Sahib Corridor on the 26th of November, 2018

Vice President of India, Shri M Venkaiah Naidu will lay the foundation stone for the construction of Dera Baba Nanak - Kartarpur Sahib road Corridor (upto international border ) at a function in village Mann in Gurdaspur district of Punjab on Monday, the 26th of November, 2018.
Nitin Gadkari, Harsimrat Kaur Badal, Capt. Amrinder Singh, Chief Minister of Punjab will be present on the occasion.
Guru Nanak Dev ji established the Sikh community at Kartarpur and lived there for 18 years till 1539. The Gurudwara Darbar Sahib is built where Guru Nanakdev Ji took his last breath.
The Kartarpur road corridor will connect the international border between India and Pakistan.

India and Pakistan had announced on 15thNov 2018 that they will build Corridors on their respective sides to let Sikh pilgrims visit the holy shrine without visa and to help them walk across and come back without having to secure a visa.
The project corridor is a 4 lane with service road and all other appropriate amenities for pilgrims intending to visit Gurudwara Darbar Sahib, Kartarpur in Pakistan.
This corridor will be a historical landmark between India and Pakistan andwill also boost tourism as more pilgrims would visit the holy shrine throughout the year between two countries.
