CSIR-CRRI organizes a two day international conference on pavement technology and road infrastructure engineering

Shri Nitin Gadkari calls upon the experts to promote the use of indigenous building material and precast technology in the highways sectorSays the focus should be on improving quality while reducing cost
CSIR-Central Road Research Institute has organized a two-day international conference on pavement technology and road infrastructure engineering.

Shri Nitin Gadkari, Union Minister of Road Transport & Highways, Shipping, Water Resources, River Development and Ganga Rejuvenation has said in a video message that the mission of his ministry is to build high quality roads at low costs.

The ageing infrastructure, road congestion, growth in heavy vehicle traffic and insufficient maintenance have rendered the road transport inefficient in developing countries. Paving solutions to these problems are needed.

The conference is being attended by nearly 250 delegates including young researchers, entrepreneurs, academicians and field engineers. There will be more than 45 technical presentations by the researchers/ engineers.
Shri Mandaviya Says Bhoomi Rashi Portal has Changed the Process of Land Acquisition System in the Country
He Saysthe Portal has Made the Land Acquisition Processspeedy, Transparent and Error Free
The BhoomiRashi portal in land acquisition process for roads and highways sector in India is effective and efficient.

The Minister of State for India, Shri Mandaviyain, has informed that revenue records of about 7 lakh villages across the country have been integrated in the portal. The minister also informed that over 1700 land acquisition notifications have been issued in the first seven months of this financial year.
Shri Mandaviya said that the BhoomiRashi portal has brought a significant improvement in land acquisition process.
Shri Nitin Gadkari to attend Road Show on TOT in Mumbai on 15th November
4th Road Show by NHAI to invite investors for the second bundle of Toll-Operate-Transfer Project
Shri Nitin Gadkari, Union Minister for Road Transport and Highways, will attend a Road Show on the second bundle of Toll-Operate-Transfer (TOT) projects in Mumbai on the 15th of this month.

TOT is a model for monetizing operational National Highways projects. The investor makes a lump sum payment in return for long term toll collection rights backed by a sound tolling system. NHAI will conduct capacity augmentation at its own cost.

The first TOT bundle of 9 projects totalling 681 KM of roads in two states of Andhra Pradesh and Gujarat was awarded in 2018. Macquarie received a cheque for Rs. 9,681.5 Crore from National Highways Authority of India.
The second bundle of over 586 kms is now offered spread over four States.
The stretches offered are operational highways with a proven tolling history of at least 2 years
Chittorgarh - Kota &Chittorgarh Bypass
Swaroopganj - Pindwara&Pindwara - Udaipur
Salsalabari - West Bengal Assam Border Section
The deadline for submitting bids is 5 December 2018.
Prime Minister Hails the Spectacular Growth of Next Generation Transport Infrastructure in the Country In The Last Four Years
launches a series of highways, waterways and sewerage infrastructure projects in varanasiShri Nitin Gadkari says, enough water will be ensured in river ganga for its unrestricted flow
Prime Minister Narendra Modi is in Varanasi. He is happy with the progress of transport infrastructure in the country.

The Prime Minister launched a series of infrastructure projects in Varanasi today. He dedicated the inland waterways multi modal terminal on river Ganga to the nation. He said the project will connect Eastern Uttar Pradesh and North Eastern India. The Ring Road costing Rs 760 crn will ease traffic in the city.
There was a ceremony to mark the beginning of the river cleaning works on River Ganga.
The Prime Minister dedicated two important national highways in Varanasi.
The project for the Ring Road, with two ROBs and a flyover, aimed at reducing traffic congestion in Varanasi city and improving access to Sarnath is being approved.
The Prime Minister dedicated to the nation an inland waterways terminal on river Ganga in Varanasi. PM also received the country's first container consignment to be sent on inland waterways vessel.
Prime Minister Narendra Modi dedicated three sewage infrastructure projects costing Rs 425.41 crore for the city of Varanasi and laid the foundation stone for another project.
PM laid the foundation stone for Sewerage Management Scheme for Ramnagar. The project will increase the sewage treatment capacity in the city from 102 MLD to 242 MLD.
The project to build a sewage treatment plant at Goitha and 50 MLD STP at Ramana will increase the capacity of the city to 412 MLD.
Prime Minister to Inaugurate the Ring Road and Babatpur Airport Road in Varanasi Next Week

2833 KM National Highways Costing Rs 63,885 Crore Underway to Link Varanasi to Other Places in Eastern Uttar PradeshPM will also Dedicate to the Nation the Inland Waterways Terminal on River Ganga in Varanasi

Prime Minister Narendra Modi will dedicate two important national highways in Varanasi on Monday, the 12th of November 2018. He will be accompanied by UP Governor Ram Naik, Union Minister for Road Transport & Highways, Nitin Gadkari and UP Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath.
The construction of the Varanasi Ring Road Phase-I and the Babatput-Varanasi road on NH-56 has been completed at a cost of more than Rs 1.1 billion.
The Babatpur Airport highway will link Varanasi to the airport and go on to Jaunpur, Sultanpur and Lucknow.
The construction of the Varanasi Ring Road has begun.
The projects will improve the quality of life of people and improve the environment.
There are 15 road projects worth a total of Rs 63,885 crore to link Varanasi to other places in Eastern Uttar Pradesh.
Prime Minister Narendra Modi will dedicate to the nation an inland waterways terminal on river Ganga in Varanasi.
The PM will receive the country’s first container consignment to be sent on an inland waterways vessel.
Mou Signed Between WAPCOS and Doppelmayr for End-To-End Solutions for Passenger Ropeway Projects
Shri Nitin Gadkari Says, Ropeways and Cable Cars are the Future of Indian Transport, Especially in Hilly Terrains and Congested Cities
The country needs futuristic technology to develop its transport sector.
Shri Gadkari was at the MoU signing between WAPCOS and Doppelmayr for providing end-to-end solutions for passenger ropeway projects.
The MoU aims to develop a range of projects for road transport in various states.
Shri Gadkari, the Minister of Road Transport and Highways, announced the launch of cable cars and ropeways.
Shri Nitin Gadkari again called for the use of alternate fuels in transport sector.
Shri Nitin Gadkari says Government exploring the use of Hybrid Aero Boats on Rivers; Ropeways, Cable Cars in Hilly Areas
The Minister Releases India’s first ease of Mobility Index
The minister for road transport and highways, shipping, water resources and river development, Nitin Gadkari, has urged people to shift from personal to public transport.
Shri Gadkari has launched India's first Ease of Mobility Index 2018.
The government is considering using hybrid aeroboats for the Kumbh Mela next year and for the visit to Taj Mahal from Delhi.

Shri Gadkari also informed that the government is also looking at the possibility of using aerial transport systems like ropeways, pods etc, especially for hilly terrains and as a last mile connectivity option in congested cities.
Shri Gadkari, the minister of transport, urged taxi aggregators to consider using bicycles for transporting single passengers.
Shri Nitin Gadkari supports the use of alternate fuels in this sector.
The ease of moving in India has improved over the last five years. Most Indians use public transport. Most of them are willing to adopt electric mobility.
CSIR to establish a High-End Skill Development Centre in Chandigarh.
Merck will establish a new high-end skill development centre in Chandigarh in partnership with Indian scientists.
Merck and CSIR-IMTECH have signed a memorandum of understanding to establish a centre of excellence for life science research in Chandigarh.
The proposed centre will conduct workshops, trainings and seminars on cutting edges life science processes, tools and techniques.
The CSIR and Merck held an event on behalf of the government and private sector.
The collaboration between CSIR and the life science industry is aimed at improving employability skills of graduates and post graduates.
The CSIR-IMTECH signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with Merck.
The High-End Skill Development Centre for Life Science has been established.
Cabinet apprised of Agreement between India and Uzbekistan on Cooperation in the field of Science, Technology and Innovation
The Union Cabinet has been apprised of the Agreement on Cooperation in the field of Science, Technology and Innovation between India and Uzbekistan.
The Agreement on Science, Technology and Innovation between India and Uzbekistan will be signed.
MoU signed on India-UK Cancer Research Initiative for Affordable Approaches to Cancer.
The India-UK Cancer Research Initiative is a 5-year bilateral research initiative focusing on affordable approaches to cancer. Both CRUK and DBT will invest £5m each in this 5-years-long pilot.
The India-UK Cancer Research Initiative aims to develop new research alliances and undertake impactful research to improve cancer outcomes.
This is a follow up of the joint statement issued by the Prime Minister of India and UK during the visit of PM Narendra Modi to UK on April 18, 2018.
The India-UK Cancer Research Initiative was launched by the Department of Biosciences (DBT) and the Centre for British and British Cancer Research (CRUK).

Nick Grant, Cancer Research UK’s executive director of international partnerships, on the occasion said that no country escapes the impact of cancer, with millions around the world diagnosed with the disease every year and we need to bring together the brightest scientific minds across the world, breaking down barriers to address the challenge of cancer globally.
The India-UK Cancer Research Initiative was launched today at the Inaugural Researchers’ Summit in New Delhi.

The research phases of the India-UK Cancer Research Initiative will be overseen by a board of advisors composed of five cancer experts each from India and UK. Prof. David Hunter of Oxford and Dr. CS Pramesh of the Tata Memorial Hospital will serve as Chair and Co-chair of the Cancer Research Institute’s Advisory Panel.
The India-UK Cancer Research Initiative aims to improve cancer care and research.
Department of Biotechnology (DBT), India and Wellcome Trust, UK-(India Alliance), completes 10 year of partnership.
The next phase of the India Alliance should focus on encouraging more clinicians to carry out research.
The Department of Biotechnology and the Wellcome Trust celebrated 10 years of their joint partnership in New Delhi today.
The partnership between the Department of Biotechnology and the Wellcome Trust and the India Alliance is coming to an end.

The President said that there are four frontlines in the battle against diseases: environment, lifestyle diseases, infectious diseases and diseases of the brain. Preventive measures relevant to our genetics and lifestyle are needed.
The DBT Wellcome Trust partnership aims to promote biomedical research.
The partnership between India and Wellcome Trust aims to strengthen veterinary research and engage with other universities around the country to improve research funding.
The current fellowship grant scheme for biomedical research is a joint commitment of DBT and Wellcome Trust.
In the past 10 years, the India Alliance has awarded 320 fellowships to researchers in 93 institutions across 34 Indian cities. The majority of awardees are from India.
Two day Global Cooling Innovation Summit inaugurated in New Delhi today
3 Million USD as prize for Breakthrough Innovations in Cooling Technology
The winner of the Global Cooling Prize is a technology that will have at least five times less climate impact than room air conditioning.

The prize is supported by Mission Innovation, the Government of India through the Department of Science and Technology and its partner organizations namely Ministry of Power, Bureau of Energy Efficiency, and Ministry of Environment, Forests and Climate Change and will be administered by a coalition of leading research institutes

Inaugurating the Global Cooling Innovation Summit, the Union Science & Technology Minister, Dr Harsh Vardhan, said it is imperative for governments to provide thermal comfort for health and well being of their citizens.

Congratulating the architects of Global Cooling Prize and all its partners, the Union Minister stressed that the Government would ensure that funding for clean energy innovations is further ramped up and an eco-system of public-private-partnership offering value to both in the domain of clean energy is created.
Global Cooling Prize was inaugurated by the Secretary DBT.

John Loughhead Vice-Chair, Mission Innovation Steering Committee and Iain Campbell, Senior Fellow at Rocky Mountain Institute also present at the inauguration expressed delight at the launch of the Global Cooling Prize and congratulated the Government of India for its leadership
The winner of the competition for innovative cooling technology designs will be awarded at least US$1 million to support its incubation and early-stage commercialization.

The number of room air conditioning units in service around the world is expected to increase to at least 4.5 billion by 2050. India alone will see over 1 billion units deployed in the market by that time.
Global Cooling Innovation Summit to be inaugurated in New Delhi.
To achieve dramatic breakthroughs in cooling technologies ,Global Cooling Prize to be launched by Union Environment Minister.
The Global Cooling Innovation Summit will be held in New Delhi on 12th November 2018.
The summit will also see the launching of Global Cooling Prize
This awards programme will call world-wide attention to the most promising ideas from the clean energy research.
The Global Cooling Prize and Innovation Summit will see distinguished speakers from around the world.
The Summit on Cooling will focus on public policy tools and how they may be informed or enhanced as a result of new innovations in the space.
Shri Nitin Gadkari addresses the Sustainable Blue Economy Conference in Nairobisays Blue Economy a critical aspect of India’s economic development agenda

He also meets Kenyan Transport Minister, offered cooperation for building ships, coast guard vessels and fishing trawlersMinisters say Africa could be a good market for Indian electric vehicles and two-wheelers
India endorses the growth of the Blue Economy in a sustainable and inclusive manner.
Shri Gadkari, Minister of Shipping, Government of India assures that the Ministry of Shipping is committed to developing India's maritime resources.

Shri Gadkari talked about the government's ambitious Sagarmala Programme. He said the programme has identified 600 plus projects involving $120 billion (around Rs 8 Lakh crore) by 2020. It will create 10 million new jobs and boost port capacity by 800 million tonnes per annum. Coastal Economic Zones (CEZs) are being developed with a proposed investment of $ 150 Million per location.

Talking about the important role of the private sector for sustainable growth Shri Gadkari said the Federation of Indian Chambers of Commerce and Industry (FICCI), took lead in 2016-2017 by establishing a taskforce to develop a business model on India’s engagement in the blue economy sector.
Shri Gadkari invited the Kenyan Minister to visit India's Cochin Shipyard to see its capabilities in ship-building.
Shri Gadkari wants to encourage Indian car manufacturers to set up assembly plants in Kenya.
Kenyan Minister is keen on expanding bilateral cooperation with India. He suggested enhancing direct flights between Kenya and India.
Kenyan and Indian officials will meet in India later this year for a high level meeting.
Shri Gadkari says, India endorses the growth of Blue Economy in a sustainable, inclusive and people-centric manner
He will address the Sustainable Blue Economy Conference in Nairobi tomorrow
Nitin Gadkari has left for Nairobi today to attend the Sustainable Blue Economy Conference.
Shri Gadkari, the Indian Ocean Rim Association's chairman, has said that India endorses the growth of the Blue Economy in the region through the framework of the IIORA.

India's Sagarmala programme aims to save the country nearly six billion dollars per annum in logistics costs and create 10 million new jobs by 2020. Coastal Economic Zones are being developed under Sagarmalas with an investment of 150 million dollars per location.
Water front Development of Mumbai Port to be Inaugurated Tomorrow

Tomorrow, Shri Nitin Gadkari will inaugurate two floating restaurants under the ongoing water front development work of Mumbai Port Trust. He will also launch the Access Control & RFID System, develop the Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) and invite tenders for tenders.
Licenses have been awarded for three floating restaurants.
The project to build a ropeway over sea between Mumbai and Elephanta will cost around Rs.800 crores and will be completed by August, 2022.
The project to build a new super-specialty hospital for port employees and their dependents will cost more than Rs 693 Crores.

Mumbai Port Trust’s new Eastern Water Front will have an iconic building as its seaside terminal, a domestic cruise terminal, a skating rink, Ro Pax, seaside restaurant and walkway, amphitheatre and marina.

The Access Control System (Indoor & Outdoor) for visitors, employees and vehicles is designed and programmed to retrieve visitor information. Visitor and Vehicle Management System will be in place with online/office visitor and vehicle registration.
Tech Mahindra has been engaged for development of enterprise resource planning system for port operations.
Traffic Separation Scheme for the south-west coast

The Directorate General of Shipping has proposed the establishment of a Traffic Separation Scheme (TSS) off the south-west coast of India to prevent collision incidents between merchant vessels and fishing vessels.
The proposed TSS lanes will be located 90 nautical miles west of Mangalore in Karnataka and 40 nautical nautical mile south of Kanyakumari in Tamil Nadu.

The proposal for TSS on the south-west coast of India is expected to shift the density of merchant traffic away from the coast and concentrate it in the established TSS, which will benefit the fishing industry.
Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi will dedicate to the nation the Multi Modal Terminal on River Ganga at Varanasi on 12th November
PM will also receive India’s First Container Cargo being transported on an Inland Waterway
Prime Minister Narendra Modi will dedicate the first Multi Modal Terminal on River Ganga at Varanasi on Monday, the 12th of November 2018.

The Jal Marg Vikas Project is being implemented on the Haldia-Varanasi stretch of National Waterway-1 (NW-1). The project includes construction of 3 multimodal terminals (Varanaisi, Sahibganj and Haldi), 2 intermodal terminals, 5 Roll On – Roll Off (Ro-Ro) terminal pairs, a navigation lock at Farakka and assured depth dredging.
Salient features of Varanasi Mutli-Modal Terminal (MMT) are as follows
First Multi-Modal Terminal on National Waterway -1.
Cost of Phase-I of MMT: Rs. 206.84 cr.
Start date of the project: June, 2016
Completion date of the project: November 2018
The following are the main ingredients of the project, which are ready for operations:
Jetty: Length 200 m x Width 42 m with berthing and mooring facility.
Stone Pitching Works and bank protection
Shell structure of ancillary buildings, worker amenity building ready

The operation and management of the Multi Modal Terminal will be entrusted to a private sector operator on PPP model. The selection of the PPP Operator through an International Competitive Bidding is expected to be completed by December 2018.
The project of multi-modal terminal and proposed Freight Village at Varanasi are expected to generate 500 direct employment and more than 2000 indirect employment opportunities.

Prime Minister will receive India's first container vessel that sailed from Kolkata to Varanasi on 30th October 2018. It is transporting 16 truckloads of food and snacks. It will make its return journey with fertilizers from IFFCO.
On the same day, Prime Minister will also inaugurate two National Highways projects and some sewerage projects in Varanasi.
India Surges 23 Ranks in ease of doing Business with port-led Development under Sagarmala Improving ‘Trading Across Border’

As per the World Bank report on Ease of Doing Business, India has taken a big leap, increasing by 23 places from 100 to 77. One of the key indices which has contributed to this growth is ‘Trading across borders’ which has improved from 146 to 80th place.
The Ministry of Shipping has been taking initiatives to improve the parameter of ‘Trading across border’ as 92% of India's export and import trade is handled at ports.
India's continued reform agenda has made it the top-ranked economy in the region. The World Bank has recognized India as one of the top improvers for the year.
The Cost to Export and Cost to Import have come down.
“Focused efforts at improving cargo handling at major ports has contributed to improving the Ease of Doing Business in India.”
The Government of India wants to make India's EXIM logistics more competitive.

The focus has been on development of port infrastructure and capacity enhancement, improvement in last mile connectivity and development of multi-modal hubs to promote EXIM and reduce logistics cost and time. 266 port modernization projects worth more than Rs 1.45 Lakh Crore are being planned over the next 10 years.
The government has completed projects worth Rs. 13,701Cr and is under implementation of projects worth 2.39 Crore.

“In order to enhance last mile connectivity, 211 road-rail projects worth Rs 250,907 Crore have been identified under Sagarmala.15 multimodal logistic parks with an investment of Rs3,989 will help in improving efficiency in freight movement under the programme”, the minister added.
The Ministry of Shipping has taken several steps to improve operational efficiency at major ports.
The efficiency parameters at major ports improved in 2017-18.
The company has taken steps to improve business efficiency.
RFID system installed in 11 Major Ports to enhance security and remove bottlenecks for seamless movement of traffic across Port gates.

DMICDC's Logistics Databank system (LDB) for tracking & tracing movement of EXIM container in the Major Ports thereby enabling the consigners and consignees to track the movement of the Containers from portal.
Direct Port Delivery (DPD) and Direct Port Entry (DPE) enable direct movement of containers from factories / port without intermediate handling requirement, thus saving cost & time
Direct Port Delivery of Import Containers increased from 3% in November 2016 to 40.62% in July 2018.
The percentage of Direct Port Entry of Export containers increased from 60% in April 2017 to 82.66% in July 2018.
Installation of drive-through Container Scanners to save time at Major Ports
Reducing paper work- Issuance of e- Delivery orders, e-invoice and e-payment across all the Major Ports.
Upgradation of the Centralized Web Based-Port Community System (PCS) to provide global visibility and access to the central database to all its stakeholders through internet based interfaces
Shri Pradhan says that the Government has brought about paradigm shift in the healthcare sector
The Government has brought about a paradigm shift in the national healthcare system through Ayushman Bharat, popularly known as Modicare.

The Health Care Council, set up by the Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship, is aggressively pushing to provide trained manpower. The Government has fulfilled the demand for setting up a statutory body for Allied and Other healthcare services. Pradhan said that Indian pharmaceutical industry is already a global player and Indian healthcare industry can be a big league.
M.A. Naik has been appointed as chairman of National Skill Development Corporation.
Shri A.M. Naik has been appointed as the chairman of National Skill Development Corporation (NSDC). He is the Group Chairman of Larsen & Toubro Limited.
Shri Ram Naik has been appointed as the new chairman of National Skill Development Corporation (NSDC).
Mr. A.M. Naik has been appointed as the new chairman of National Skill Development Corporation (NSDC).
The appointment of Mr. Ram Naik as the chairman of NSDC underlines the importance of skill development on the part of the Indian government.
Shri Naik was awarded the Padma Bhushan, India's 3rd highest civilian award in 2009 for his outstanding contribution to the economic growth of the country.

The National Skill Development Corporation (NSDC) is a public-private-partnership organisation. It promotes skill development by catalyzing creation of large, quality and for-profit vocational institutions. It supports short-term skill training through a wide network of training providers and district nodal skill centres. It also caters to the skilled manpower requirement of overseas markets.
DAIC and JNU sign MoU to facilitate & enhance Research Activities & Policy Formulation aimed at Socio-Economic Transformation & Sustainable Development
Dr Ambedkar International Centre (DAIC) and Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) signed a memorandum of understanding today.
DAIC was inaugurated by the Prime Minister. JNU is a world-renowned centre for teaching and research.
The Parties have signed a MoU to enhance research activities and policy formulation.

The MoU aims to define the areas for fundamental, academic research in which both the Parties desire to work together in future for their mutual benefit to foster a collaborative framework between DAIC and JNU in the field with a view to benefiting from each other’s initiatives and working procedures and to support collaboration among the researchers associated with both the Parties.
Vice President to confer National Awards for outstanding work done towards Empowerment of PwDs on International Day of Persons with Disabilities On 3rd December

On the International Day of Persons with Disabilities on 3rd December, 2018, Vice President of India Shri M. Venkiah Naidu will confer the National Awards on Individuals, Institutions, Organizations, State/District etc. for their outstanding achievements and work towards empowerment of PwDs.
National Awards will be given under fourteen (14) broad categories, which are as under :-
Best Employee/Self-Employed Person with Disabilities;
Best Employers and Placement Officers and/or Agencies;
Best Individual and Institution, working for the cause of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities;
Best Applied Research or Innovation or Product, aimed at improving the life of Persons with Disabilities;
Outstanding Work in creation of barrier-free environment for Persons with Disabilities;
Best District in providing rehabilitation services;
Best State Channelizing Agency of the National Handicapped Finance and Development Corporation (NHFDC);
Outstanding Creative Adult Persons with Disabilities;
Best Creative Child with Disabilities;
Best State (i) in promoting Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities; & (ii) for implementation of Accessible India Campaign.
Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment, Department of Empoweredment of Persons with Disabilities (Divyangjan) invites nominations for National Awards in various categories.

For National Awards 2018, an advertisement inviting applications from persons belonging to 21 specified disabilities was published in the leading newspapers on 17th July, 2018. 1221 applications were received till the last date of receipt of applications. Screening Committees screened the applications and recommended 72 awards in 14 categories.

Till 2017, the Award Scheme was governed under the National Awards Rules, 2013. The number of specified disabilities was 7, but with the coming into force of the Rights of Persons with Disabilities Act, 2016 w.e.f. 19th April 2017, it was increased to 21. The new law provides for the recognition of 21 categories of disabilities. All 21 categories have been included under the new guidelines notified in the Extra-ordinary Gazette of India dated 2nd August, 2018.
NBCFDC organises Quiz & Cultural Programme for Children from slum areas to celebrate 150thyear of Mahatama Gandhi’s Birth Anniversary
National Backward Class Finance Development Corporation (NBCFDC) organized a quiz and cultural programme today to raise children’s self-esteem and promote healthy behavior.
Winners of drawing competitions and quiz programmes were presented with awards and certificates by Smt. Upma Srivastava, Additional Secretary, M/o Social Justice and Empowerment.
The key message of this programme was to engage with underprivileged children and support them to realize their aspirations.
The activities of Buds aimed at promoting the well-being of underprivileged children were held.
Cabinet approves extension of the term of the Commission to examine the issue of Sub-categorization of Other Backward Classes in the Central List till 31st May 2019

The Union Cabinet chaired by the Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi has approved the extension of the term of the Commission to examine the issue of Sub-categorization of Other Backward Classes in the Central List for six months beyond 30th November, 2018 and till 31st May 2019.

The Commission has held extensive meetings with the stake holders including the State Governments, the State Backward Classes Commissions, various community associations and general public belonging to various Backward Classes and Commissions and also obtained records, caste-wise, of OBCs admitted in higher educational institution as well as similar caste-wise data of recruits in Central Departments, Central Public Sector Undertakings, Public Sector Banks & Financial Institutions.

Based on the emanating information from the data as processed and analyzed, the Commission has expressed that a round of discussion with the States and their Backward Classes Commission was required before finalizing the sub-categorized lists and the Report.
55 Awards Presented to Youth with Disabilities at ‘Global it Challenge for Youth with Disabilities 2018’
Shri Thaawarchand Gehlot Calls Upon Nations to take all Steps for Enhancing it Skill of Youth with Disabilities
The Global IT Challenge for Youth with Disabilities, 2018 concluded today. Shri Thaawarchand Gehlot presented the awards.
Shri Thaawarchand Gehlot, the President of India, concluded the IT skills training event for youth with disabilities.
President, RI, Korea thanked the Government of India for hosting the event successfully.
This year 96 youth with disabilities from 18 countries took part in the Global IT Challenge for Youth with Disabilities, 2018.
The individual and group competition on e-tool and e-life mapping and the IT Forum were held.
The awards ceremony for the event was held in Londonderry.
Thailand won the most awards with six, followed by Philippines with five and India with 3.
Ms. Fayza Putri, Adila from Indonesia won the ‘Global IT Leader Award’.
The Global ICT Challenge for Youth with Disabilities is a capacity building project aimed at developing IT skills among disabled youth and promoting international cooperation and exchange.
India has been participating in the IT Challenge since 2013 and has been winning awards ever since. Last year the event was held in Vietnam.
Day 2 of ‘Global it challenge for youth with Disabilities 2018’
100 youth with Disabilities from 18 countries participating in ‘Global it challenge for youth with Disabilities 2018’
Youth with disabilities from 18 countries are taking part in the Global IT Challenge for Youth with Disabilities 2018.
The individual and group competitions on e-tool and e-life mapping and the IT Forum were held.
Today a cultural evening programme was organised by Government of India in honour of the participating youth with disabilities and other representatives from various countries.
The Global ICT Challenge for Youth with Disabilities is a capacity building project aimed at developing IT skills among disabled youth and promoting international cooperation and exchange.
India has nominated twelve youth with disabilities to participate in the National IT Challenge held in Kurukshetra in June, 2018.
100 Youth with Disabilities from 18 Countries Participating in ‘Global it challenge for youth with disabilities 2018’
Youth with disabilities from 18 countries are taking part in the Global IT Challenge for Youth with Disabilities 2018.

The Global ICT Challenge for Youth with Disabilities aims to develop IT skills among disabled youth and raise awareness about the application of ICT technology in enhancing the quality of life of disabled people.
India has nominated twelve youth with disabilities to participate in the National IT Challenge held in Kurukshetra in June, 2018.
The youth with disabilities are taking part in a competition aimed at strengthening their IT skills.
Global IT Challenge for Youth with Disabilities 2018 Begins

The Global IT Challenge for Youth with Disabilities, 2018 was inaugurated here today by the Minister of State for Social Justice and Empowerment. The three day event is being organised by the Department of Empoweredment of Persons with Dis disabilities (DEPwD), Ministry of Social Justice, Empowering and Powering and Rehabilitation International Korea and their associated partner LG Electronics.
The Global ICT Challenge for Youth with Disabilities is a capacity building project that helps youth with disabilities to overcome their limitations and challenge themselves for a better future.
This year around 100 youth with disabilities from 18 countries are participating in the event. India has nominated twelve youth with disability to participate in it.
The youth with disabilities are taking part in a competition aimed at strengthening their IT skills.
Shri Krishan Pal Gurjare, President of India, called for better ICT facilities for disabled people.

Smt. Shakuntala D. Gamlin in her address said that Information & Communication Technology is the prime medium for providing accessible platform for dissemination of information for persons with disabilities. ICT can reduce digital divide and expand social integration of people with disabilities across communities and counties.
She opined that holding of the Global IT challenge annually has made an impact on promoting the use of ICT among the youth with disabilities. DEPwD holds National IT Competition in concert with GITC.
LG Electronic India is hosting GITC (Global IT Challenge) for youth with disabilities in India this year.
DEPwD organises ‘Global IT Challenge for Youth with Disabilities, 2018’from 9th to 11th November, 2018
India is hosting the Global IT Challenge for Youth with Disabilities 2018.
Shri Thaawarchand Gehlot, Union Minister for Social Justice and Empowerment will inaugurate the event on 9th November, 2018 and present awards to the winners on 11th November 2018.
The competition will be held on the following aspects:-
E-tool (competition on application of MS-Excel, MS-Word etc) – individual event.
E-life map challenge (ability to respond to specific situation) – individual event
E-creative (ability to create animated story or game) – group event (country wise)
E-content (ability to make video) – group event (country wise)
About 100 youth with disabilities from 18 countries will take part in the National IT Challenge in June 2018. 12 participants from India will represent their country.

Participation of high Government functionaries at the event will showcase the commitment of Government of India at the political and administrative level towards creating an environment inclusive of persons with disabilities through application of ICT and also to fulfil our international obligations enshrined under UNCRPD and SDGs.

The Global IT Challenge was started in 1992 in Korea and has become a global event. It aims to enhance the information utilisation skill of youths with disabilities and to encourage their social participation.
The last youth with disabilities event was held in Hanoi, Vietnam in 2017.
The GITC is organised by the Government of India and Rehabilitation International Korea.
Some of the prominent personalities from Korea who would be representing Rehabilitation International, Korea, the main organiser are:-
Dr. In Kyu Kim, President of Rehabilitation International, Korea.
Mr Joon Oh, Professor at Kyung Hee University
Mr Yanghee Choi, Professor at Seoul National University
Mr Bong-kil Shin, Ambassador of the Embassy of the Republic of Korea in the socialist Republic of India

Estimatesof Gross Domestic Product for the Second Quarter (July-September) of 2018-19

The Central Statistics Office (CSO), Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation has released the estimates of Gross Domestic Product(GDP)for thesecond quarter (July-September) Q2 of 2018-19, both at Constant(2011-12) and Current Prices, along with the corresponding quarterly estimates of expenditure components of the GDP.
Estimates of GDP for Q2 of 2018-19 are presented below.
I ESTIMATES OF GVA BY ECONOMIC ACTIVITY

GDP at Constant (2011-12) Prices in Q2 of 2018-19 is estimated to be higher by 7.1 percent compared to the previous quarter. Quarterly GVA (Gross Value Added) at Constant Price) at 2011-2012 is estimated at `31.40 lakh crore, as compared to `29.38lakh crore in the same quarter of the previous year.

The economic activities which grew by over 7% in Q2 of 2018-19 over Q1 of 2017-18 are: Manufacturing, Electricity, Gas, Water Supply, Construction, Public Administration, Defence and Other Services. The growth in the other economic activities was estimated to be 3.8%.

The second quarter estimates are based on Agricultural production during Kharif season of 2018-19, abridged financial results of Listed Companies from BSE/NSE, Index of Industrial Production (IIP), monthly accounts of Union Government Expenditure maintained by Controller General of Accounts (CGA) and of State Government Expenditures maintained by Comptroller and Auditor General of India (CAG), and performance of key sectors like Transport.

The quarterly GVA at basic prices from the agriculture sector grew by 3.8 percent in Q2 2018-19 compared to Q2 2017-18. The production of Food Grains during the Kharif season of agriculture year 2018-019 grew by 0.6%.
Quarterly GVA at Basic Prices for Q2 2018-19 from Mining and Quarrying sector declined by 2.4%, as compared to growth of 6.9% in Q2 2017-18.

GVA at Basic Prices for Q2 2018-19 from the manufacturing sector grew by 7.4 percent compared to 7.1 percent in Q2 2017-18. Private Corporate sector grew at 7.5 percent during the same period. The Quasi-Corporate and Unorganised Segment grew at 5.5%.
Electricity, Gas, Water Supply and Other Utility Services

GVA at Basic Prices for Q2 2018-19 from the Electricity, Gas, Water Supply and Other Utility Services sector grew by 9.2%, compared to 7.7% in Q2 2017-18. IIP of Electricity grew by 7.5% in the same period.

The quarterly GVA at basic prices for Q2 2018-19 from ‘Construction’ sector grew by 7.8%, as compared to 3.1% in Q2 2017-18. Key indicators of Construction sector, namely, production of cement, steel and consumption of finished steel, grew by 12.5%, 7.6%, and 7.2%, respectively.
Trade, Hotels, Transport, Communication and Services related to Broadcasting
GVA at Basic Prices from the Trade sector grew by 6.8 percent in Q22018-19 compared to Q22017-18.
Financial,Real Estate and Professional Services

GVA at Basic Prices from the sector grew by 6.3 percent in Q2 2018-19 compared to Q2 2017-18. The key indicators of this sector are the quarterly growth of Corporate sector for Real Estate, Business Services andComputer Related Activities, AggregateBankDeposits, and Bank Credits.
Public Administration, Defence and Other Services

GVA at Basic Prices from this sector grew by 10.9percent in the second quarter of 2018-19 as compared to 6.1% in the first quarter of this year. Union Government Revenue Expenditure net of Interest Payments excluding Subsidies grew by 22.2% in Q2 of this season.

GDP at Current Prices in Q2 of 2018-19 is estimated to be higher by 12.0%. GVA at Basic Price at Current prices in Q 2 of 2018, is estimated at `41.46 lakh crore, as against `37.03lakh crore in the same period of 2017-18.
(c)  Price Indices used as Deflators

The Wholesale Price Index (WPI) in respect of the groups - Minerals, Manufactured products, Electricity and All Commodities has registered a growth of 8.2%, 4.4%, 6.4% and 5.0% during Q2 of 2018-19 over Q2 2017-18. Food Articles declined by 2.1%. The Consumer Price Index has shown a rise of 3.9%, compared to 3.0%, in the previous quarter.
The components of Expenditure on Gross Domestic Product, namely, Consumption Expenditure and Capital Formation are normally measured at Market Prices.
Private Final Consumption Expenditure
The government estimated the growth rates of PFCE and GDP for the second quarter of 2018-19 and 2017-18.
Government Final Consumption Expenditure

The government's final consumption expenditure (GFCE) at Current Prices is estimated to be higher in Q2 of 2018-19 as it was higher in the previous two quarters. In terms of GDP, the rates of GFCE at Current and Constant (2011-2012) Prices are estimated to13.1 and 12.4%.

Gross Fixed Capital Formation (GFCF) at Current Prices is estimated to be 13.28 lakh crore in Q2 of 2018-19 as against`11.37 lakh crore at Constant (2011-2012) Prices. In terms of GDP, the rates of GFCF at Current and Constant Prices are estimated to 29.2 percent and 32.3 percent, respectively.

Estimates of the GVA at Basic Price by kind of economic activity and the Expenditures on GDP in Q2 and H1 of the 2016-17, 2017-18 and 2018-19 at Constant (2011-2012) and Current Prices are given in Statements 1 to 8.12.
The next release of quarterly GDP estimate for the quarter October-December, 2018 will be on 28.02.2019.

Quick Estimates of Index of Industrial Production and Use-Based Index for the Month of September, 2018(Base 2011-12=100)

The Quick Estimates of Index of Industrial Production with base 2011-12 for the month of September 2018 are 4.5 percent higher than in the same month of last year. The cumulative growth for the period April-September 2018 is 5.1 percent.

The Indices of Industrial Production for the Mining, Manufacturing and Electricity sectors for the month of September 2018 show a growth rate of 0.2%, 4.6% and 8.2% compared to September 2017. The cumulative growth rate for these three sectors during April-September 2018 is 3.3%, 5.3% and 6.2%.
The manufacturing sector has shown positive growth during the month of September 2018 as compared to the corresponding month of the previous year.

Growth rates in September 2018 over September 2017 are 2.6 percent in Primary goods, 5.8 percent in Capital goods, 1.4 percent in Intermediate goods, 9.5 percent in Infrastructure/ Construction Goods and 6.2 percent in Consumer Durables.
There are item groups exhibiting larger variations in production.

Steel Minister condoles death of Union Minister Ananth Kumar
Ananth Kumar, a minister of Chemicals and Fertilizers and Parliamentary Affairs died.
Chaudhary Birender Singh recalled Ananth Kumar’s organising abilities and his leadership qualities and said as a veteran Parliamentarian he always left an indelible impression.
The Steel Minister said he stands by the bereaved family members in this hour of grief and joins them in prayers.
Ananth Kumar passed away today morning in Bengaluru.
Demand for Domestic Iron and Steel Products Witnesses Substantial Growth

The Ministry of Steel has ensured placement of orders for iron and steel products worth nearly Rs. 8129 crore from June 2017 to October 2018. Ministry of Railways, ONGC, GAIL, EIL, HPCL and others have placed orders with domestic iron and Steel manufactures for various categories of rails, pipe and tubes. Discussions are on to increase consumption of rails manufactured indigenously.

Ministry of Steel has a policy to give preference to domestically manufactured iron and steel products (DMI&SP) in Government procurement. To ensure that the Policy is implemented effectively, a Standing Committee under the Ministry of Steel chaired by Secretary Steel has been constituted to oversee its implementation.

The Ministry of Steel organized a Conclave in Bhubaneswar in October this year for domestic manufacturers of capital goods meant for the steel sector. A memorandum of understanding (MoU) worth more than Rs.39400 crore was signed between foreign capital goods manufacturers and technology providers and Indian capital goods producers.
Extension of Norms for Mandatory Packaging in Jute Materials

The Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs, chaired by the Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi has given its approval to expand the scope of mandatory packaging norms under the Jute Packaging Material (JPM) Act, 1987 as follows:
The CCEA has approved a policy mandatorily packing food grains and sugar in jute bags.
The government plans to auction 10% of indents of jute bags for packing foodgrains.

The decision will give a fillip to the development of jute sector; increasing the quality and productivity of raw jute, diversification of jute sector and also boosting and sustaining demand for jute product.
The government has been making efforts to boost the jute sector.
The jute industry in India is heavily dependent on the Government sector, which buys jute bags worth more than Rs. 6,500 crore for packing foodgrains every year.

The decision will benefit farmers and workers located in the Eastern and North Eastern regions of the country particularly in the states of West Bengal, Bihar, Odisha, Assam, Andhra Pradesh, Meghalaya and Tripura.
Measures by the Government to support the Jute Sector:
The government has been supporting jute farmers to improve the quality and productivity of raw jute.
Jute Corporation of India (JCI) has been given a grant of Rs. 100 crore for 2 years starting from 2018-19.
The National Jute Board has established a number of initiatives to promote the development of jute sector.

The government of India imposed definitive anti-dumping duty on jute imports from Bangladesh and Nepal. As a result of these measures, 13 tie mills in Andhra Pradesh had resumed operation and benefitted 20,000 workers. There will be an additional demand of 2.5 Lakh MT of jute goods for the domestic market.
Jute SMART, an e-govt initiative, provides an integrated platform for procurement of B-Twill sacking by Government agencies. JCI transfers 100% funds to jute farmers online.
Governor of Tripura Inaugurates 7thInternational Tourism Mart in Agartala, Tripura
53 foreign Delegates from 18 Countries are participating in Mart
The Governor of Tripura Prof. Kaptan Singh Solanki inaugurated the 7th International Tourism Mart for the North-East States in Agartala, Tripura this evening.
Prof. Kaptan Singh Solanki, a professor of tourism promotion in India, has delivered the inaugural address at the annual conference of the Indian Institute of Tourism.

The state government of Tripura has outlined a vision to transform the state into a model state in the span of next three years. The state government is taking steps for holistic development of the Tourism sector with the support from the Union ministry of Tourism.
In his address, Shri. K J Alphons stressed on the promotion of tourism in the North Eastern states.
The North East region is an attractive tourist destination. Tripura had the largest number of tourists last year.

A total of 53 foreign delegates from 18 countries are participating in the Mart. Besides the foreign delegates, 26 domestic Tour Operators from other parts of the country and 78 sellers from the North Eastern States are also present.

International delegates from the North Eastern States are visiting the region. Post-mart familiarisation tours to the states have been arranged for them. An exhibition by State Tourism Departments from the region has been organized to showcase the tourism products of respective States.
This is the 7th edition of the International Tourism Mart. It brings together the tourism business fraternity and entrepreneurs from the eight North Eastern States.
The International Tourism Marts are organised every year in the North Eastern States.
The North East Region of India is rich in tourist attractions and products.

41 foreign delegates from 18 countries to participate in the Mart

This is the 7th edition of the International Tourism Mart. It brings together the tourism business fraternity and entrepreneurs from the eight North Eastern States.

Two important North East Circuits under Swadesh Darshan Scheme of Central Tourism Ministry inaugurated in Arunachal Pradesh today
16.7% increase in Foreign Tourist Arrivals in 2017 over 2016 in North Eastern region.
Two important projects under Swadesh Darshan Scheme were inaugurated at PTSO Lake in Tawang, Arunachal Pradesh today.
The region received more foreign tourists than ever before in 2017. The number of domestic tourists also increased significantly.
The project Development of Bhalukpong- Bomdila-Tawang - Bumla Pass - Gritsang TSO lake, PTSO Lake, Thingbu and Grenkha Hot Spring are being developed.

The project Development of Nafra- Seppa- Pappu, Pasa, Pakke Valleys- Sangdupota- New Sagalee- Ziro- Yomcha was sanctioned by the Ministry of Tourism in December 2015 for Rs 97.14 Crores. The facilities developed under this project includes Helipad, Wayside amenities, trekking trails, Rafting Centre, Log Huts, craft bazaar, Eco Park, Tourist facilitation centres, parking, multipurpose Hall, festival ground etc.
The Ministry of Tourism is promoting development of tourism in North Eastern Region.

The Ministry of Tourism has given great impetus to the tourism infrastructure in the region under its flagship schemes of Swadesh Darshan and PRASHAD. It has sanctioned 16 projects for Rs. 1349.04 crores for development of Tourism infrastructure covering all North Eastern States. The Ministry is actively working with other Central Ministries for the development of the region.

Swadesh Darshan scheme aimed at developing thematic circuits in the country is being implemented by the Ministry of Tourism. The scheme has been launched in 2014-15 and as on date the Ministry has sanctioned 73 projects worth Rs. 5873.99 Crore to 30 States and UTs. 6 projects have been inaugurated as of date.

The Ministry of Tourism organizes International Travel Mart every year in one of the North Eastern states to promote the tourism products and its rich culture. It also set up Hotel Managements and Food Craft Institutes to create skilled manpower in the hospitality sector.
India and the Republic of Korea sign MoU for strengthening cooperation in the field of Tourism
The Ministry of Tourism signed a Memorandum of Understanding with the Republic of Korea for strengthening cooperation in the field of Tourism in New Delhi today.
The main objectives of the Memorandum of Understanding are:
To expand bilateral cooperation in tourism sector
To increase Exchange of information and data related to tourism
To encourage cooperation between tourism stakeholders including Hotels and Tour Operators
To establish exchange programmes for cooperation in Human Resources Development
To encourage Investment in the Tourism and Hospitality sectors
To exchange visits of Tour Operators / Media / Opinion Makers for promotion of two way tourism
To exchange experience in the areas of promotion, marketing destination development and management
To encourage participation in travel fairs/exhibitions in each other’s country
To promote safe, honorable and sustainable tourism
The signing of Memorandum of Understanding will increase tourist arrivals from the Republic of Korea.
Shri K J Alphons inaugurates Tourist Facilitation and Information Counter at IGI Airport, New Delhi
Tourism Ministry to open 24X7 Facilitation Counters in Mumbai, Chennai, Kolkata, Gaya and Varanasi soon
Shri K.J. Alphons, Union Minister for Tourism inaugurated the Tourist Facilitation and Information Counter at Indira Gandhi International Airport New Delhi today.
The Minister of Tourism opened a facilitation centre for visitors at IGI airport.
The Tourist Facilitation Counter at IGI Airport, New Delhi is manned by 2 staff and a Supervisor. It is stocked with high quality tourist literature and brochures.
Cabinet approves MoU between India and Korea for strengthening cooperation in the field of Tourism
The Union Cabinet has approved signing of a MoU between India and Korea for strengthening cooperation in the field of Tourism.
The main objectives of the Memorandum of Understanding are:
To expand bilateral cooperation in tourism sector
To increase Exchange of information and data related to tourism
To encouraging cooperation between tourism stakeholders including Hotels and Tour Operators
To establish exchange programmes for cooperation in Human Resources Development
To encourage Investment in the Tourism and Hospitality sectors
To exchange visits of Tour Operators / Media / Opinion Makers for promotion of two-way tourism
To exchange experience in the areas of promotion, marketing destination development and management
To encourage participation in travel fairs/exhibitions in each other's country and
Promoting safe, honorable and sustainable tourism.
India and Korea want to strengthen their diplomatic and economic relationship.
Korean tourists are one of the leading tourist generating markets for India from East Asia. The signing of the MoU with Korea will help increase arrival from this source market.

The issue of US national feared killed by protected tribes in Andaman and Nicobar Islands was discussed in the 108th meeting of the National Commission for Scheduled Tribes. to review the institutional mechanism to prevent the landing of the foreign national in the North Sentinel Island; and

Water storage level of 91 major reservoirs of the country goes down by two percent

The water storage available in 91 major reservoirs of the country for the week ending on November 29, 2018 was 98.353 BCM, which is 61% of total storage capacity. The percentage was 63% for the previous week.
There are 91 reservoirs in the country. 37 reservoirs have hydropower benefit and have installed capacity of more than 60 MW.
The storage in reservoirs under CWC monitoring in northern region is better than last year and better than the average storage in the last ten years.
The storage in the Eastern region of India's reservoirs is less than half of the total live storage capacity.
The storage in the Western region of India's reservoirs is less than half of the total live storage capacity.
The Central region has 12 reservoirs under CWC monitoring. The storage capacity of these reservoirs is 28.79 BCM, which is 68% of total live storage capacity.
The storage in reservoirs under CWC monitoring in Southern region is less than the previous year and the last ten years.

States having better storage than last year for corresponding period are Himachal Pradesh, Punjab, Rajasthan, Uttarakhand, Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Karnataka, Kerala and Tamil Nadu. States having lesser storage are Jharkhand, Odisha, West Bengal, Tripura, Gujarat, Maharashtra, Uttar Pradesh, AP&TG (Two combined projects in both states), Andhra Pradesh, Telangana.
Experts Exchange ideas on Ganga Museum
National Mission for Clean Ganga (NMCG) is planning to set up a Ganga Exhibition and Ganga Museum.
Expert from India and the European Union are meeting for two days on 29th and 30th November 2018 to hold an International Workshop on “Developing a Ganga Museum Concept”.
The Secretary Ministry of Water Resources River Developing and Ganga Rejuvenation Shri UP Singh said that the Ganga Museum should reflect all the aspects of the river.
The National Museum of the Ganga will be established in the near future.
The ideas gathered in the workshop on Ganga Museum and Exhibition will be compiled in a manual.
Also gets ISO 9001:2015 certification
National Projects Construction Corporation Limited (NPCC) has been granted the status of Miniratna : Category –I by the Government of India.
NPCC, a premier construction company, has been awarded ISO 9001:2015 Certification.
NMCG approves composite Sewerage Projects in Agra to help save Taj and reduce pollution in Yamuna
Namami Gange projects worth Rs. 1573.28 Crore have been approved.

The executive committee of the National Mission for Clean Ganga (NMCG) has approved ten projects worth Rs 1573.28 crore. The project for Rehabilitation / Renovation of Agra Sewerage Scheme (Interception & Diversion Works) is a total cost of Rs. 857.26 crore.
The project aimed at reducing pollution from Agra city into the river Yamuna and saving the Taj Mahal is being executed.
The project to build a 15 MLD capacity Sewage Treatment Plant (STP) at Kasganj has been approved by the Executive Committee at a cost of Rs. 76.73 crore.
The project to improve the water supply to Sultanpur town and reduce pollution in Gomti River has been approved by EC.

The EC approved projects worth Rs. 328.52 crore in Chhapra, Fatuha, Bakhtiyarpur and Khagaria in Bihar. The Chhaprra Interception and Diversion and Sewage Treatment Plant (IT&D) Project worth nearly Rs. 236.15 Crore includes STP with capacity of 32 MLD.
Fatuha I&D and STP Project has been approved at a total cost of Rs.35.49 Crore for treatment of sewage from Fatuha town. The project will reduce pollution load into the river Ganga.
Bakhtiyarpur I&D and STP Project was approved at a total cost of Rs.35.88 Crore. It aims to stop untreated sewage from flowing into river Ganga.

Khagaria I&D and STP Project has been approved at a total project cost of Rs. 21 Crore. The project involves developing an Interception & Diversion and Sewage Treatment Plant (STP) of 4.5 MLD capacity at Khagaria town for the treatment of sewage generated there.
The government of West-Bengal has approved a project costing more than Rs.234.31 for the purpose of cleaning up River Ganga.

There is no central sewerage system in the town and the entire wastewater from the upper and lower part of the municipal town flows into Banka River through surface drains. 38 main outfalls have been identified. The outfalls must be Intercepted and Diverted to the proposed lift stations, mains and a sewage treatment plant.
Sewerage scheme for Zone-II and III of Paonta Town, Himachal Pradesh has been approved at a total project cost of Rs.11.57 crore.
NMCG Organises Cleanliness Drive at New Delhi’s Kalindi Kunj Ghat with SDMC and Local Stakeholders
National Mission for Clean Ganga (NMCG) organized a cleanliness drive at the Kalindi Kunj Ghat in New Delhi today.
NMCG has organised a cleanliness drive at Kalindi Kunj Ghat as part of Namami Gange programme.
Water storage level of 91 major reservoirs of the country goes down by three percent

The water storage available in 91 major reservoirs of the country for the week ending on November 15, 2018 was 103.735 BCM, which is 64% of total storage capacity. The level of water storage in the country was 99% of the storage capacity for the previous week, 97% for the last year and 97% of storage for last ten years.
There are 91 reservoirs in the country. 37 reservoirs have hydropower benefit and have installed capacity of more than 60 MW.
The storage in reservoirs under CWC monitoring in northern region is better than last year and better than the average storage in the last ten years.
The storage in the Eastern region of India's reservoirs is less than the previous year and the average storage over the last ten years.
The storage in the Western region of India's reservoirs is less than half of the total live storage capacity.
The Central region has 12 reservoirs under CWC monitoring. The storage capacity of these reservoirs is 29.82 BCM, which is 70% of total live storage capacity.
The storage in reservoirs under CWC monitoring in Southern region is less than the previous year and the last ten years.

States having better storage than last year for corresponding period are Himachal Pradesh, Punjab, Rajasthan, Uttarakhand, Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Karnataka, Kerala and Tamil Nadu. States having lesser storage are Jharkhand, Odisha, West Bengal, Tripura, Gujarat, Maharashtra, Uttar Pradesh, AP&TG (Two combined projects in both states), Andhra Pradesh and Telangana.
NMCG brainstorms on G-governance of Namami Gange programme through Geospatial technology

Develops Bhuvan Ganga geo-portal and Bhuvan Ganga Mobile App in collaboration with ISRO’s National Remote Sensing CentreSurvey of India uses drones to capture 360 degree view of Kumbh Mela area to identify pollution sourcesIIT Kanpur working on project for reconstructing the Ganga of the past using Corona Archival imagery
National Mission for Clean Ganga organized a brainstorming session on World GIS Day 2018 in New Delhi yesterday on the theme ‘G-Governance of Namami Gange programme through Geospatial Technology’.
Lack of reliable data is the biggest challenge in the water sector. Geospatial technology can help improve river management.

The Namami Gange programme has high priority for research and evidence based decision making. Geospatial technology is widely used in river basin management. NMCG is already executing a number of research projects based on this technology.
The GIS cell of NMCG has brought about paradigm shift in visualisation of all crucial spatial and non spatial information of Ganga basin.
NMCG has developed Bhuvan Ganga Geoportal and a mobile application based on it.
Bhuvan Ganga Geoportal is a mobile application for water quality monitoring, hydrological monitoring, geomorphological monitoring, bio-resources monitoring and comprehensive geospatial database.

Using drones and vehicles with cameras, Surveyor General of India has captured 360 degree panoramic views of the Kumb Mela areas and identified polluted Nalas joining the river Ganga. NMCG has collaborated with Survey of India to facilitate the Ganga rejuvenation task by using Geographic Information System (GIS) technology for mapping Ganga basin.

IIT Kanpur is executing a project on ‘Reconstructing the Ganga of the Past from Corona archival imagery’ Deliverables of Corona project would be to make all processed Corona images available for upload on public portal such as Bhuvan, develop an Atlas of the Ganges River showing a comparison between 1960s and the present, establish the reference condition and land-use/land-cover of the river and propose a policy document on “desirable” land-used area within Ganga valley.
Survey of India is preparing a project on ‘Generation of Digital Elevation Model/ Digital Terrain Model for a corridor along the main stem of River Ganga’ by Survey of India.

The storage in reservoirs under CWC monitoring in northern region is 85% of total live storage capacity.
The storage in the Eastern region of India's reservoirs is less than the previous year and the average storage over the last ten years.
The storage in the Western region of India is less than last year and the average storage over the last ten years.
The Central region has 12 reservoirs under CWC monitoring. The storage capacity of these reservoirs is 31.47 BCM, which is 74% of total live storage capacity.
The storage in reservoirs under CWC monitoring in Southern region is less than the previous year and the last ten years.

States having better storage than last year for corresponding period are Himachal Pradesh, Punjab, Rajasthan, Uttar Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Karnataka, Kerala and Tamil Nadu. NMCG & UN Habitat organize a policy dialogue - Urban Cafe: ‘River for Habitat’ on the occasion of World Cities Day 2018

The Secretary of Water Resources, River Development & Ganga Rejuvenation expressed concern about people’s weakening connect with rivers and their bad health.
The National Mother Cleaning Campaign (NMCG) launched a project aimed at cleaning Ganga river.

Sikka, Prof Vinod Tare from IIT Kanpur, Shri Chetan Vaidya, Former Director SPA, Delhi, Shruti Das Meena from Ministry of Housing & Urban Affairs, Shrive Victor Shinde, National Institute of Urban Affairs and Dr. Rakesh Kumar from NEERI are among the participants in the conference.

WCD Ministry empanels 223 Institutes to conduct awareness programmes on Sexual Harassment at Workplace Act
50,000 participants have attended over 700 capacity building exercises held so far: Smt Maneka Sanjay Gandhi

The Ministry of Women and Child Development has empanelled 223 institutions/organisations to conduct awareness exercises on the provisions of the Sexual Harassment of Women at Workplace (Prevention, Prohibition and Redressal) Act, 2013.
CLICK HERE to access the list of Institutes.

The Sexual Harassment of Women at Workplace Act, 2013 requires all the workplace which include any department, organisation, undertaking, establishment, enterprise, institution, office, branch or unit which is established, owned, controlled or substantially financed by public funds or indirectly by the appropriate Government, local authority, corporation or co-operative society with more than 10 workers to constitute an internal complaint committee to receive complaints of sexual harassment.
Complaints about sexual harassment can be registered on SHe-Box, a government-funded online platform.

The Ministry of Human Rights (WCD) has published a Handbook and Training Module on the SH Act. Private organisations are encouraged to customize the Training Module as per their service rules and disciplinary procedures prescribed therein.
MWCD links Sexual Harassment Complaints Portal 'SHe-Box' to central/ state ministries & districts for speedy disposal of cases

The Ministry of Women and Child Development has linked SHe-Box, the online portal to report complaints of Sexual Harassment at Workplace, to all the Central Ministries, Departments and 653 districts across 33 States/Union Territories.

SHe-Box portal is an effort to provide speedy remedy to women facing sexual harassment at workplace. Smt. Gandhi said it is a proactive step taken by the WCD Ministry in the wake of the #MeToo campaign.
SHe-Box allows women employees to make online complaints of sexual harassment at workplace.
The portal can be accessed at the following link: http://shebox.nic.in/

The Ministry of Human Resources has published a Handbook and Training Module on the SH Act. Private organisations are encouraged to customize the Training Module as per their service rules and disciplinary procedures prescribed therein.

NITI Aayog holds Dialogue on Health System for New India
Day-long deliberations on a fifteen year vision for the health sector
The NITI Aayog organized a day-long dialogue on “Health System for A New India: Building Blocks”.
NITI Aayog hosted a dialogue on India’s developmental issues.
The inaugural session of NITI Aayog was held.
’s inter-ministerial dialogue on health is a sign that health has taken center-stage in the policy narrative.
The dialogue was aimed at strengthening and building on the existing blocks for Health Systems for a New India.

The dialogue also deliberated convergence of fragmented building blocks of financing and service provision, with each reinforcing the other, and moving from programmatic or schematic approaches to a systemsapproach to healthcare.
The roll-out of the ambitious Ayushman Bharat initiative is an opportunity to bring in systems thinking and de-fragmenting the various building blocks of healthcare systematically over time.

There was agreement that developing a healthy and efficient health system for India can lead to the growth of a healthy healthcare insuranceand health service provision industry and improved consumer experience and citizen trust in the healthcare system.
As Mr Kant stated in the inaugural plenary, it is time to bring the patient to the centre of the health care narrative and the time has come to evolve a world-class health system.
If the required decisions in terms of creating a functioning Health System are taken, it shall reduce adult deaths by up to 16% by 2030 and increase economic growth up to 32%.

It is also estimated that breaking programmatic silos and integration of various schemes within a systems approach will lead to reduction in avoidable out-of-pocket expenses to about 45%of total health spending by 2030, preventing at least 1.5 millionadditional households to go below the poverty line due to illness and unaffordable health care.

The discussions were guided by analysis undertaken by well-known international experts from multilateral organisations, along with over 25 national and international experts from over six countries and 150 participants representing government, private sector, insurance companies, third party administrators, research and academia.
The analysis and insights highlight that investments in strengthening and building on the current mixed health system will reap social and economic dividend for India.
NITI Aayog to Organise Dialogue on Health System for A New India
NITI Aayog will begin a series of Development Dialogues to engage experts, thought leaders and government stakeholders across key avenues of social and economic development.
The first event of the new initiative will be a conference on "Health Systems for A New India: Building Blocks" on November 30.

The idea of a health system pertains to integrating existing and future programmes, financing, human resources and policies related to all dimensions of healthcare within the fabric of an all encompassing, inclusive, long-term, stable system.
The conference is also an attempt by NITI to begin conversations around the mandated 15 year vision document for the country as a whole.

The discussions shall include topics related to achieving standardized delivery of health across all levels of care in India’s mixed healthcare system, leveraging IT for healthcare and importantly, in a fiscally constrained environment, how can existing healthcare funds be mobilized more effectively and efficiently.
NITI Aayog Organises Capacity Building Programme for Urban Water Management
Organised in collaboration with Singapore Cooperation Enterprise & TF International

NITI Aayog organized todaythe Second Phase of Urban Management Programme on ‘Water Recycling and Reuse’ in collaboration with Singapore Cooperation Enterprise and TF International at India Habitat Centre in the capital.
Amitabh Kant, Vice President, NITI, has presented a report on water management in India.
ParameswaranIyer attended a workshop on water management. He stressed the need for effective cooperation between the centre and state.

In order to develop recycled water as part of sustainable and diverse water portfolio, NITI Aayog has enteredinto a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with Singapore Cooperation Enterprise - Temasek Foundation International to launch the Second Phase of Urban Management Programme on ‘Water Recycling and Reuse’.

Eight States/UTs -Uttar Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Punjab, Chhattisgarh, Karnataka, Meghalaya, Puducherry and West Bengal - have been selected for capacity building workshops. The participants of the workshops included the senior officials from Municipal and parastatal bodies of these eight States/uts.
The programme launch was attended by senior officials from the Central and State Governments and representatives from the academia and think-tanks.
The capacity building programme of SCE and consultants from Singapore was held.
The urban population in India has gone up from 29 crore in 2001 to 37.7 crore in 2011. Due to rapid urbanisation, water demand in urban areas is increasing and water supplies are getting strained.
There is an urgent need for water diversification through introducing alternate sustainable water sources.
The recycle and reuse of water presents a potential solution for ensuring assured water supply in the Cities. Recycling and reuse has been widely practised in Singapore.
The AMRUT scheme drives cities to undertake water supplies on a business model. However, augmentation of water sources remains a challenge.
Cabinet apprised of the MoU between Atal Innovation Mission,India and Fund "Talent and Success", Russia for promotion ofscience & technology
The Union Cabinet has approved the Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) signed between Atal Innovation Mission, India and Fund "Talent and Success", Russia for promotion of science and technology.
The MoU will facilitate promotion of science & technology, strong foundation to the collaborative work through exchange of students, teachers, researchers and scientists between India and Russia.
The MOU aims to establish relationships with schools, universities, cultural institutions, science and technology institutions, high-tech companies, startups and innovation centers in both countries.

Prime Minister of India, Narendra Modi, during his visit to Russia in December 2015 proposed to invite Russian students to work with Indian students in an Innovation Boot Camp at IIT, Delhi. Ten Russian students visited India to work in this camp.
Through this MoU, it is proposed to continue the collaborative work between Atal Innovation Mission (AIM), India and Fund "Talent and Success", Russia.
NITI Aayog organizes South Asian Regional Conference on Urban Infrastructure
NITI Aayog, the think tank of the Government of India, is hosting a South Asian regional conference on Urban Infrastructure today.

The conference on urban infrastructure, being held on November 15-16, was inaugurated by CEO, NITI Aayog, Amitabh Kant, Secretary, Department of Economic Affairs, Ministry of Finance, Subhash Chandra Garg and UN Resident Coordinator in India, YuriAfanasiev.
Union Minister of State Hardeep Singh Puri addressed the closing session on Day One of the Conference on PPP and Municipal Financing.
In the inaugural address, CEO NITI Aayog, Amitabh Kant stressed upon the need to ensure adequate return on investments in infrastructure through properly structured Special Purpose Vehicles (SPVs).
The future areas of growth and development are infrastructure and digitalised delivery of goods and services.
According to the World Bank, an estimated $4.5 trillion will be required for urban infrastructure investment in South Asia by 2040.
There are an estimated 98 million people living in the slums of Indian cities.

The South Asian regional conference on Public Private Partnership (PPP) and Urban Finance aims to review overall issues and assess the sustainability of PPPs and urban finance in South Asia specifically India.
To improve the delivery of sustainable urban infrastructure and services, India needs to focus on the institutional environment and evaluate alternatives for long-term, predictable financing.
NITI Aayog Constitutes Himalayan State Regional Council
NITI Aayog has constituted the ‘Himalayan State Regional Council’ to ensure sustainable development of the Indian Himalayan region.
Five Working Groups were constituted by NITI Aayog on June 2, 2017.
These Working Groups were tasked with preparing a roadmap for action across five thematic areas namely,
Inventory and Revival of Springs in Himalayas for Water Security,
Sustainable Tourism in Indian Himalayan Region,
Shifting Cultivation: Towards Transformation Approach,
Strengthening Skill & Entrepreneurship (E&S) Landscape in Himalayas, and
Data/Information for Informed Decision Making.
The five thematic reports were released by the NITI Aayog in August, 2018.
The Himalayan State Regional Council will be chaired by the Dr VK Saraswat, Member, NITI Aayog.

The Himalayan States Regional Council will be the nodal agency for the Sustainable development in the Himalayan Region which consists of the twelve States namely Jammu &Kashmir, Uttarakhand, Himachal Pradesh, Arunachal Pradesh, Manipur, Meghalaya, Mizoram, Nagaland, Sikkim, Tripura, two districts of Assam namely Dima Hasao and KarbiAnglong and Darjeeling and Kalimpong in West Bengal.

The terms of reference of the Council states that it shall monitor the implementation of action points for Central Ministries, Institutions and 12 Himalayan State Governments in Indian Himalayan Region which include river basin development and regional cooperation, spring mapping and revival across Himalayas in phased manner for water security; develop, implement and monitor tourism sector standards as well as bring policy coherence, strengthen skill & entrepreneurship with focus on identified priority sectors, among other action points.
Government and Industry come together at a Workshop on Online Course on Digital Payments launched by NITI Aayog in collaboration with DoT and ITU
A workshop on the online course on digital payments was organised by FICCI and NITI Aayog on 12th November 2018.

Shri. SudhakarRamasubramanian, MD and CEO, Aditya Birla Idea Payment Bank and Co-Chair, FICCI Fintech Committee delivered the opening remarks at the workshop. Shri Ashish Narayan, Programme Coordinator, ITU Regional Office for Asia and the Pacific, shared the key learnings of the course and provided feedback to the Chair.
Based on the experience from the course, training and academic institutions from across India could plan/develop similar courses on Digital payments in their respective institutions;
NITI Aayog may explore the possibility of using this course as a benchmark and may develop future courses on ICT in collaboration with ITU, DoT and other Ministries on priority topics and
The project assignments that are successfully completed in this course could be considered for piloting and support by stakeholders in India.
Shri RatanWatal, Principal Advisor, NITI Aayog and Member Secretary, EAC-PM in his concluding remarks appreciated the collective efforts of institutions involved in this exercise.
NITI Aayog’s Atal Innovation Mission and UNICEF announce Young Champions Awards on occasion of Children’s Day

NITI Aayog’s Atal Innovation Mission (AIM) and UNICEF India, have come together this Children’s Day, to provide an open platform to young children of India, to contribute towards sustainable development.
The winners of the UNICEF Young Champions Awards were announced today.
The awards were presented to the top six most innovative solutions from across the country, which were shortlisted through the Atal Tinkering Marathon.
