Prime Minister's Speech at the Business-cum-Community Event, Singapore (May 31, 2018)
Members of Indian diaspora in Singapore,
Today, India and Singapore are celebrating the 70th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between their two countries.
Singapore's success lies in the harmony of its multi-cultural society.
Singaporean Indians are celebrating their cultural heritage.

Whether you are here through the chance of history or the opportunities of globalisation; Whether your ancestors came here generations ago, or you came here in this century; Each of you has become part of Singapore’s unique fabric, and its progress.
Singapore has embraced India.
That might also be true now for Indian food! I still remember the dinner Prime Minister Lee hosted for me in Little India.
It is a testimony to Singapore's spirit that school children can learn five Indian languages.
In India you have started a full competition in traditional Indian games.
There are 70 yoga centres in this city.
No other city in the world could have the Yogic intensity of Singapore. Institutions like Sri Ramakrishna Mission and Sri Narayana Mission reflect the values that bind India and Singapore.
In their journey through Singapore and the region, the greatest of Indian thinkers Swami Vivekananda and poet Gurudev Rabindranath Tagore found a common chord that connects India to the East.
Mahatma Gandhi’s ashes were immersed at Clifford Pier in 1948.
Mahatma Gandhi will unveil a plaque at Clifford Pier to mark that solemn moment of our history.
India and Singapore are building a partnership of their age.
Singapore and India have close political and cultural relations.
Singapore and India have strong defence relations.
Singapore and India send their soldiers and air force for training to train in India.
I am looking forward to visiting a Singapore Navy Ship and an Indian Naval Ship at the Changi Naval Base day after tomorrow.
In international forums, we speak in one voice in the cause of rules-based order, sovereign equality of all nations, and free and open pathways of commerce and engagement.
It is a partnership at the front-line of India's global engagement. India signed a Comprehnsive Economic Cooperation Agreement with Singapore.
Singapore is a major transport hub for Indian tourists.
In many area of India’s development priorities, Singapore is a key partner: smart cities, urban solutions, financial sector, skills development, ports, logistics, aviation and industrial parks.
India and Singapore are building new partnerships for the digital world.
Many talented talent from India will be the bridge of innovation and enterprise between India, Singapore and ASEAN.
It is natural for these to be launched in Singapore. Together, we will work for using the power of mobile and digital technology for governance and inclusion.
As Singapore shapes a new future for itself, India is the new global frontier of opportunities.
And we intend to stay that way.
In India, the present is changing rapidly. Economic reforms are taking place at a speed and a scale not known so far. India has moved up 42 places in the Ease of Doing Business rankings.
In India, foreigners can invest freely with up to 100% equity.
Two, Tax regime has changed: lower tax rates, increased tax base, faster resolution of tax disputes and electronic filing systems.
This was not an easy task but it was done successfully. The personal income tax base has also expanded by nearly 20 million.
Last year, we built 10 thousand km of national highways.
Pace of rail track addition has doubled. High Speed Rail Projects, dedicated freight corridors and modernisation of 400 railway stations will transform the rail sector.
The government has completed a number of important projects.
And, in renewable energy, we have become the sixth largest producer in the world.
There has been a sharp rise in foreign direct investment (FDI) in the manufacturing sector in the past three years.
The Indian government has launched a number of economic development programmes.
My favourite scheme is the micro credit scheme that offers micro loans worth more than 90 billion U.S. dollars to the poor and excluded. 74% of these loans have been extended to women.
The bank opened 316 million bank accounts for those who had never had a bank account. Now, 99% of Indian house-holds have a bankaccount.
It is a new source of dignity and identity for every citizen.
The beneficiaries of the banking expansion have access to affordable pensions and insurance.
Six is about the digital revolution sweeping through India.
Digital technology is transforming India's economy.

In 2017, just the UPI-based transactions grew seven thousand percent. In January, all digital transactions were valued at 2 trillion U.S. dollars. The government is building broadband connectivity to two hundred and fifty thousand village councils and setting up common service centres in each of them.
The government of India is opening 100 incubation centres and 24 hundred tinkering labs for children to become innovators and job creators.
India will experience the largest wave of urbanisation in the world over the next two decades.
We are working to transform 100 cities into Smart Cities, and 115 aspirational districts into new centres of progress.
Mass transit, waste management, pollution control, sustainable habitat and affordable housing are programmes of great priority for us.
Eight, we are investing in skills and raising the standards of higher education to give a life of dignity and opportunity for our 800 million youth.
The government of India aims to double the income of farmers by 2022.
For this, we are using technology, remote sensing, internet, digital financial system, soft credit, insurance, soil health improvement, irrigation, pricing and connectivity.
Ten wants to build 50 million new houses so that there will be a roof over every head in 2022.
All villages connected to the power grid are now connected to it.
AYUSHMAN Bharat, the National Health Insurance Scheme, will cover 100 million families or 500 million Indians with annual coverage of 8000 U.S. dollars.
Sustainable development is linked to quality of life.
It is a time of great change for India.

There is complete clarity and confidence about the pace and direction of economic reforms in India. The US will work for an open, stable and fair international trade regime. US engagement to the East will be among the strongest and economics will remain an integral part of the Act East Policy.
India and Singapore have just completed the review of the Comprehnsive Economic Cooperation Agreement.
Singapore will continue to serve as a gateway to ASEAN and the broader East.
In conclusion for Singapore, there is no better opportunity than India.
Singapore is proud of its democratic system, open seas, free trade regime, talented, dynamic, professional and committed Indian diaspora and its people.
The future is a world of unlimited opportunities. It is up to us to be ambitious and bold to seize it.
Shared Vision of India-Indonesia Maritime Cooperation in the Indo-Pacific
During the official visit of the Prime Minister of India to Indonesia, Joko Widodo and Shri Narendra Modi discussed the Shared Vision of the two countries on Maritime Cooperation in the Indo-Pacific.
Recalling the Joint Statement by the two countries on Maritime Cooperation on 12 December 2016 during the State visit of President Jokowi to India;

Noting that both India and Indonesia are maritime neighbours and sea faring nations, whose relations are rooted in civilizational contacts developed through the seas and who share similar perceptions of the evolving maritime environment in the region and world at large;
Desirous of strengthening their maritime cooperation for promotion of peace, stability and bringing in robust economic growth and prosperity to the Indo-Pacific region;
Indonesia and India are important maritime powers in the Indian Ocean and Pacific Ocean.

Adhering to the rights and obligations under the international law including the Charter of the United Nations, the 1982 UN Convention on the Law of Sea (UNCLOS) and the 1976 Treaty of Amity and Cooperation in Southeast Asia (TAC);

Reiterating the importance of achieving a free, open, transparent, rules-based, peaceful, prosperous and inclusive Indo-Pacific region, where sovereignty and territorial integrity, international law, in particular UNCLOS, freedom of navigation and overflight, sustainable development and an open, free, fair and mutually beneficial trade and investment system are respected;

Acknowledgingtheneed to maintain maritime safety and security for peace, stability and sustainable economic growth and development in the maritime waters of the Indo-Pacific region as enshrined by UNCLOS and relevant international laws;

Welcoming the elevation of bilateral relationship between the two countries to the level of Comprehensive Strategic Partnership and creation of new mechanisms like bilateral security dialogue, trilateral dialogue, signing of an enhanced Defense Cooperation Agreement and Framework Agreement on Cooperation in the Exploration and Uses of Outer Space for Peaceful Purposes;

Appreciating the leadership role played by Indonesia and India as previous Chairs of the Indian Ocean Rim Association (IORA) to build a more peaceful, stable and prosperous Indian Ocean region through enhanced cooperation as mandated in the Jakarta Concord and Plan of Action as the results of the IORA Leaders' Summit held in March 2017 in Jakarta to commemorate the 20th Anniversary of the IORA;
Noting that free and open seas, as regulated by UNCLOS, are essential for peace, stability and prosperity of the region and the international community;

Underscoring the importance to address the emerging maritime security issues facing the Indo-Pacific region including the smuggling of people, arms, drugs and money; illegal, unreported and unregulated fishing; and the movement of terrorists;

Emphasizing our collective interests in a prosperous Indo-Pacific region by enhancing connectivity for promoting regional prosperity based on universally recognized international norms, good governance, rule of law, openness, transparency, equality and respect for sovereignty and territorial integrity, and in this regard looking forward to the expeditious conclusion of ASEAN-India Maritime Transport Agreement;

Exploring the convergences and complementarities in the region between India’s Act East Policy and Security and Growth for all in the Region (SAGAR), and Indonesian Ocean Policy and Indonesia’s Global Maritime Fulcrum Vision, while reaffirming the importance of the ASEAN centrality and unity;
Recognizing of the importance of the Blue Economy as a driver of inclusive and sustainable economic growth and development in the region;

In pursuance to the above, the Leaders agreed to a Shared Vision for Maritime Cooperation in the Indo-Pacific region to harness the opportunities and to meet the challenges together as Comprehensive Strategic Partner and agreed to the following:
a. Enhancing Trade and Investment Cooperation:
Encouraging greater flow of goods, services, investment and technology between the two countries and the region.
Andaman and Nicobar Islands of India and Provinces in Sumatera Island of Indonesia are working towards enhancing connectivity.
Working towards human resource development on the basis of bilateral collaboration.
Development maritime infrastructure and promoting maritime industries, especially in fisheries and ship-building.
b. Promoting sustainable development of marine resources.
The Marine Life Conservation Programme aims to:
Combating climate change and ensuring protection of environment and natural resources.
Fisheries crime is one of the emerging crimes related to fisheries crime.
Promoting Blue Economy as a key source of inclusive economic growth and job creation.
Combating marine plastic debris through bilateral and regional cooperation.
c. Expanding cooperation in disaster risk management:
Strengthening disaster preparedness and disaster risk management in the region.
Improving geodetic data-sharing, methods and infrastructure and developing early warning systems in the region for forecasting and communicating disaster-related risks and hazards.
Revitalizing bilateral cooperation in disaster management.
d. Fostering tourism and cultural exchanges:
Increasing people to people contacts to promote regional economic growth.
Encouraging sustainable development of community-based tourism and eco-tourism.
Working towards creation of Andaman Sea tourism by improving connectivity between Sabang Island and Port Blair and Havelock Island.

Creating institutional linkages between Al-Muslim University of Bireuen, University of Malikussaleh of Lhokseumawe (Aceh), Jawaharlal University, New Delhi and appropriate institution in Port Blair for creation of a Centre of India-Indonesia studies at Al-Muslim University.
Promoting Maritime Safety and Security i.e.
Strengthening the existing security architecture in the Indo-Pacific which is anchored in ASEAN-led mechanisms
Establishing an open, inclusive and transparent cooperation aimed at delivering peace, security and prosperity to all associated with the region.
Strengthening the existing naval cooperation between the Navies of India and Pakistan.
Enhancing information sharing related to maritime security in the Indo-Pacific region.

Concurring to build on the existing maritime boundary agreements and reaffirming support to the Technical Meetings for expeditious negotiations for a mutually acceptable solution on the delimitation of maritime boundaries between the two countries.
Assigning expert level of both countries to continue explore ways in enhancing strategic technical cooperation on maritime security including in creating better and expanded maritime awareness.
Pursuing bilateral cooperation in the areas of hydrography and marine cartography.

Promoting cooperation in capacity building for maritime safety, including search and rescue and pollution control, through technical cooperation including the exchange of experts, provision of equipment and financial assistance.
Promoting cooperation between coast guards.
Further intensify cooperation for a safe and secure Indian Ocean within the framework of the Indian Rim Association Organisation (IORA).
f. Strengthening academic, science and technology cooperation.
Promoting cooperation between Indian Space Research Organization (ISRO) and National Institute of Aeronautics and Space of the Republic of Indonesia (LAPAN).
Developing research capacity and transferring marine technology among research and development institutions and academics.
PM addresses Indian Community in Jakarta
The Prime Minister, Shri Narendra Modi, today addressed the Indian community in Jakarta.
Indonesian President has been the Chief Guest at the Republic Day Parade in New Delhi in 1950.
Indians living in Indonesia are proud citizens of Indonesia, but they also want to stay connected with their Indian roots.
The Prime Minister said that in the last four years, India has witnessed unparalleled transformation. He talked about FDI, openness of the Indian economy, ease of doing business.
He and President Widodo are proud of their democratic ethos and diversity. He gave examples of cultural links between Indonesia and Indonesia.
The focus is now on “Ease of Living” in India. The government is creating systems that are development-friendly and corruption-free.
Both India and Indonesia share a common outlook on helping those in need.
The Prime Minister invited the diaspora to visit India to witness first-hand, the changes taking place here.
Text of PM’s Speech at Indian Community Event in Indonesia (30 May, 2018)
सलामत सोरे,तमान–तमान। (Good Evening Friends)
Logistics Performance Index में 19 अंकों का सुधार हुआ है।
रेलवे लाइनों को ब्रॉड गेज में बदलने की रफ्तार दोगुनी हो गई है।

India और Indonesia सिर्फ नाम से ही मिलते जुलते नहीं हैं। यह तालमेल सिर्फ तुक यानि Rhyme का ही नहीं, ताल यानि Rhythm का भी है। यह तालमेल हमारी संस्कृति का है, हमारी परंपराओं का है। हमारी आस्था का है, व्यवस्था का है। लोक संपर्क का है, लोकतंत्र का है।
English translation of Press Statement by Prime Minister during visit to Indonesia (May 30, 2018)
My first visit to Indonesia was warmly received by President Widodo.
I am deeply sorry for the killing of innocent people of Indonesia in the recent terrorist attacks. India strongly condemns such attacks.
Indonesia and Japan have agreed on a Shared Vision and Principles for the Indo-Pacific region.
India and Indonesia have signed a number of agreements aimed at enhancing their bilateral relations.

ASEAN-India relations are going strong. Next year in 2019, they will celebrate 70th anniversary of establishment of their diplomatic relations. A large number of Indian tourists visit Indonesia, especially Bali.
In a statement, PM Narendra Modi congratulates Indonesia on hosting the 18th Asian Games in August. He also praised India-ASEAN partnership.
English rendering of PM’s speech on the occasion of his interaction with Mudra Yojana beneficiaries
It is good luck that today I got the opportunity to speak to people involved in a scheme that is dear to my heart.

Today, the whole country is listening to me on a video conference. Only last month, I had the opportunity to spend some time with beneficiaries of the Mudra scheme at the Prime Minister’s residence. I had decided that if I get a chance, I would chitchat with them.

The contribution made by entrepreneurs like you is important for the country’s economy. There were loan fairs organised 25-30 years ago for political benefit. People who were politically affiliated, their minions, contractors and those doing vote bank politics got money from banks. No one cared what happened afterwards.
Since independence licence regime remained in place in our country, only those who had references were able to get loans. This system kept poor people out of the system.

There was a time in this country when the Finance Minister used to arrange loans for big industrialists and small entrepreneurs. Nowadays, small entrepreneurs have access to loans at much lower interest rates.
With trust and confidence; with the government’s faith in poor people, faith in their dreams and hard work of poor people…

Had the youth of the country got a scheme like Mudra Yojanadecades, migration towards cities would not have been so acute. Today, everybody has some skill in the country, so it is not necessary to have a special connection with the government to become an entrepreneur.
The Mudra Yojana has done the job of polishing the skills of the common man.
The amount lent for Mudra has exceeded the target.
Nearly Rs. 3.25 Lacs are being given to people who have started their own business.
The most satisfactory thing about Mudra Yojana is that 74% of beneficiaries are women. 55% of the total loan amount under the scheme has been given to members of backward communities.
Banks are giving Mudra loans to self-employed people. The process of obtaining the loan has been simplified.
PM interacts with MudraYojana beneficiaries across the country through video bridge
The Prime Minister, Shri Narendra Modi, has held a video conference with beneficiaries of Mudra Yojana.
The Mudra Yojana has become a job multiplier, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said.

The government has disbursed 12 crore loans worth Rs. 5.75 lakh crore under Pradhan Mantri MUDRA Yojana. 28% of the loans were given to first time entrepreneurs, while the rest was for women and other disadvantaged groups.
Prime Minister Narendra Modi has addressed the PMMY beneficiaries. He said that the scheme has transformed the lives of the poor.
Emphasizing on creating self-employment, Prime Minister said that being self- employed is a matter of pride now and has helped people in achieving things that were considered impossible before.

During the interaction, Prime Minister said that if Mudra Yojana was implemented a few years ago, it would have helped lakhs of people to set up their own businesses and would have stopped migration to a great extent.
Interacting with the Prime Minister, beneficiaries explained how Mudra Yojana has helped to set up their own business and thereby helped to create employment for others.
Pradhan Mantri MUDRA Yojana (PMMY) is a scheme launched by Prime Minister on April 8, 2015 for providing loans up to Rs. 10 lakh to the non-corporate, non-farm small/micro enterprises.
PM's Statement prior to his departure to Indonesia, Malaysia and Singapore
Following is the text of the Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi's departure statement prior to his visit to Indonesia, Malaysia and Singapore.
Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi will visit Indonesia, Malaysia and Singapore between 29 May and 2 June 2018.

On 29 May, Prime Minister Narendra Modi will arrive in Jakarta. He will meet with Indonesian President Joko Widodo. On 30 May, he will hold talks with President Widodo and participate in the India-Indonesia CEOs Forum. On 1 June, he'll address the Indian Community in Indonesia.
During my visit to Indonesia, I will also meet the leaders of India and discuss ways to strengthen bilateral ties.
On 31 May, on his way to Singapore, I will stop in Malaysia to congratulate the new Malaysian leadership and meet Prime Minister Dr. Mahathir Mohamad.
During my visit to Singapore, I will be focusing on enhancing India-Singapore partnership in areas of Fintech, skill development, urban planning and artificial intelligence.
On 31 May, I will visit the India-Singapore enterprise and innovation exhibition. I will address a business and community event and meet with select top CEOs of Singapore.
On 1 June, I will call on Singapore President Halimah Yacob. I will also meet with Singapore Prime Minister Lee Kuan Yew and Nanyang Technological University students.
That evening, I will deliver the keynote address at Shangri-La Dialogue. It will be the first time that an Indian Prime Minister would deliver this address.

On 2 June, I will unveil a plaque at Clifford Pier, where Gandhiji’s ashes were immersed in sea on 27 March 1948. I will also visit some places of worship that have civilizational linkages with India.

The last element of my programme would be a visit to the Changi Naval Base in Singapore where I will visit the Indian Naval Ship INS Satpura and interact with officers and sailors of the Indian Navy and Royal Singapore Navy.
I am confident that my visit to Indonesia, Malaysia and Singapore will provide a further boost to our Act East Policy and enhance our relations and engagements with all the three countries."
Prime Minister meets H.M. Queen Maxima of the Netherlands.
Prime Minister Narendra Modi met Her Majesty Queen Maxima of the Kingdom of the Netherlands today.
Queen Maxima is visiting India in her capacity as UN Secretary-General's Special Advocate for Inclusive Finance for Development.
Prime Minister Modi and Queen Maxima discussed the various initiatives taken by the Government of India for enhancing financial inclusion in India.
Queen Maxima appreciated India's efforts in global development finance.
PM interacts with Ujjwala beneficiaries across the country
The Prime Minister, Shri Narendra Modi, today interacted with Ujjwala beneficiaries across the country, through video conference.
Three Ujjwala beneficiaries were present at each of over 600 centres across the length and breadth of the country, for this interaction.
An estimated 10 lakh people viewed the interaction through various platforms, which included the Narendra Modi App and various television news channels and social media platforms, among others.
The Prime Minister is happy about the progress of the Ujjwala scheme.
Nearly 10 crore new LPG connections have been issued in the four years since 2014.
The Prime Minister has said that Ujjwala has brought benefits for women.

The Prime Minister emphasized that the Union Government has been paying attention to ensure that there are no middlemen involved in this scheme, and the beneficiaries are chosen through a transparent process.
He said that 69 percent villages in India now have 100 percent LPG penetration, while 81 percent villages have more than 75 percent LPG penetration.
Interacting with the Prime Minister, beneficiaries explained how the LPG connection had reduced time spent on cooking, and enhanced the quality of life for the entire family.
English rendering of PM's speech at the event marking the dedication of the Eastern Peripheral Expressway to the nation at Baghpat, U.P.
My dear brothers and sisters who are present here in large numbers,
The president thanks the people for their support.
The Prime Minister of India welcomes you.
The first phase of the Delhi-Meerut Expressway was dedicated today. The project costed about Rs. 11000 crores.
The first phase of the expressway up to Meerut has been inaugurated today. The distance between Delhi and the rest of India can be covered in 40-45 minutes.

Delhi NCR is experiencing heavy pollution. One of the major reasons for this is the traffic jam caused by the vehicles entering Delhi and the congestion caused by them. The government plans to lay down expressways around Delhi. I got the opportunity to inaugurate the first phase of the Eastern Peripheral Expressway.
The Eastern Peripheral Expressway will reduce the number of vehicles entering Delhi by almost 30%.

Modern Infrastructure plays a significant role in raising the standard of living of 125 crore people. Therefore, the government has given main thrust to infrastructure related to highways, railways, airway, waterway, power.

In his message, the prime minister tells the people of India that they have spent more than 3 lakh crores in creating more than 28000 kilometres of new highways in the last 4 years. Highways were being constructed at the rate of 12 km per day until 4 years ago, but now they are being built at 27 km/day. Under the Bharat Mala project, a provision of RS.5 Lakh crore has been made and highways of 35 thousand kilometer are being constructed. Railway lines are being laid.

A new UDAN scheme has been launched to make air travel cheaper and to open up new air routes. Last year, about one crore people travelled by airways, which is more than the number of people who travelled in air-conditioned coaches of the railways.
The new defence industrial corridor in UP will create nearly two and a half million jobs.

Everything for building a New India is being done on the basis of expectations of the youth and the middle class. Work is progressing at a rapid pace under the Bharat Net Plan for connecting every village of the country with internet. The UPA government connected less than 60 villages and more than 1.5 million Panchayats with Optical Fibre Network in four years.

The Micro, Small and Medium Enterprise or the MSMEs play a significant role in manufacturing and provide the largest opportunities for employment after the agricultural sector in Uttar Pradesh. The centre and the Uttar Pradesh government are working together to expand the business of MSME. The central government has prepared a road map for its contribution to the UP government's efforts in Skill India Mission.
Yogi ji and Manoharlal ji have worked hard to improve the law and order situation in UP and Haryana.

In the last four years, 7.5 crore toilets under Swachh Bharat Mission and 4 crore gas connections under Ujjwala Yojana have made the lives of women easy. 75% of the loans raised by Mudra Yojna were given to women entrepreneurs.
The government has taken several important steps for women empowerment in the past four years.
In my experience, one who is selfish and concerned about himself only engages in selfish politics, while the one concerned with Dalit issues engages in welfare politics.
The government has made laws to prevent atrocities against Dalits and tribals even more stringent. A special court is being set up for speedy trial of cases related to Dalits.
The government has formed a commission for sub-categorizing OBCs.

The government is willing to provide a constitutional status to the OBC commission. The OBC community has been demanding it for the past 25 years but the UPA government didn't bother about it. The Congress and its allies were an obstacle to it.
The Congress and its allies always create obstacles for anything done for the welfare of the poor, the Dalits, backward classes and tribals.
Today, the losing party is spreading lies for political gains. They are spreading rumours about 18% GST on farmers who will give their farm on contract or for share-cropping.
The government is working on the concept of Gramoday Se Bharat Uday. A provision of 14.5 trillion rupees has been made to strengthen the infrastructure related to village and farming.
The government of India is dedicated to the farmers. It has introduced new laws and introduced new MSE rules which have broken all the past records.
In the budget, the government announced a number of schemes aimed at improving the quality of foodgrains and improving supply chain system for farmers.
The government is promoting modern farming techniques.

The government has increased the support price of sugarcane by 11% last year. It has also approved 10% blending of ethanol with petrol. Recently, the government decided to provide a subsidy of Rs.5 and 50 paise per quintal of sugar cane to the sugar mills, but it will not be given to the owners of sugar mills.
The government in India is providing houses to the poor and preparing cities for the 21st century.
The government has started the Namami Gange programme aimed at cleaning up the Ganges river.

The government is working hard to clean the Ganga. It was the Congress culture of the previous government to construct sewage treatment plants that didn't work up to their maximum capacity and stopped working after a short span of time.
It is being ensured that the sewage treatment plants that are being built will work properly.
The people's trust in the NDA government has increased after four years.
The country is aware of how they had questioned the Election Commission of India and the EVMs. They have also questioned the Reserve Bank of India.
They question and criticise India even when international agencies praise it.
People are frustrated and they don't trust politicians.
The road inaugurated today is an example of what the 21st century India will look like.
Prime Minister inaugurates Eastern Peripheral Expressway and Phase-I of Delhi-Meerut Expressway
The Prime Minister dedicated to the nation, two newly built expressways in the Delhi NCR Region.
The Delhi Meerut Expressway will ease travel times from the National Capital to MeerUT and to other parts of Western Uttar Pradesh and Uttarakhand.
After the inauguration of the Delhi Meerut Expressway, the Prime Minister was greeted by people along the newly constructed road.
The Eastern Peripheral Expressway will divert traffic not destined for Delhi.

The Prime Minister has said modern infrastructure has an important role to play in raising the standard of living of the people. He gave examples of the increase in pace of infrastructure development.
In his speech, Prime Minister Narendra Modi talked about various schemes aimed at improving the lives of women.
The Prime Minister has mentioned the steps taken for Scheduled Castes and Other Backward Castes.
The Prime Minister has announced that a provision of 14.5 Lakh rupees has been made to strengthen rural and agricultural infrastructure in the Union Budget.
Text of PM’s address in 44th episode ofMann Ki Baat, 27.05.2018
Namaskar is speaking on Mann Ki Baat. He tells about the journey of six women commanders, who circumnavigated the globe for more than 250 days on board the INSV Tarini. They returned home on 21 May.
On the 16th of May, five tribal students from an Ashram School in Chandrapur, Maharashtra, scaled Mount Everest. They had been selected under the mission 'Mission Shaurya'.
Ajit Bajaj and his daughter climbed Everest.
A group from the BSF cleared the trash from the Ganga after climbing Everest.

My dear countrymen, especially my young friends, are getting involved in the ‘Fit India’ campaign. People from the film fraternity, from the world of Sports, common citizens of the country, members of the armed forces, school teachers and those toiling in fields are getting connected with this campaign.

My dear countrymen, I have mentioned sports and sportspersons many a time in “Mann Ki Baat” and in the last episode, our heroes of the Commonwealth Games shared with us their views on matters close to their hearts through the programme.
Chhavi Yadav ji received a phone call from a person who wishes to express his regret about the decline of childhood sports and games.
It is a matter of concern that sports and games will fade away to the point of extinction.
Magar mujhko lauta do bachpan ka sawan
Wo kagaz ki kashti, wo baarish ka paani
But do return the monsoon that drenched me as a child
The puddles & my paper boats, the magic of my rains.
And we will be forever reduced to listening to this song.
On 5th of June, India will officially host the World Environment Day Celebrations.
The theme for this year's World Environment Day is 'Beat Plastic Pollution'.
Whenever there is a bad weather, people talk about climate change.
In the past few weeks, there were dust storms in the different regions of the country, along with heavy winds and unseasonal heavy rains. There was also loss of life and property.
Mahatma Gandhi's teachings on living in harmony and in synchronicity with nature are still relevant today.

On this environment day, let all of us give it a good thought as to what can we do to make our planet cleaner and greener? How can we progress in this direction? What innovative things can we do? The rainy season is fast approaching; we can set a target of achieving record plantation of trees this time and not only plant trees but also nurture and maintain the saplings till they grow.
June 21st is celebrated as the International Yoga Day.
Yoga for unity and a harmonious society is a universal message.
A man whose father is patience, mother is forgiveness, and peace, and sister is compassion, brother is restraint, and food is knowledge is only knowledge is a Yogi.
Yoga is a form of spiritual discipline. Bhartahari has said that regular practice of yoga imbibes beneficial attributes.

It is the 27th of May, the death anniversary of the first prime minister of India, Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru ji. May is the month of May 1857 when Indians had displayed their strength against the British.
May 1857 was the month which witnessed the First Struggle for Independence. Veer Savarkar ji was born in this month.
Veer Savarkar was a freedom fighter, poet and social reformer. Atal Bihari Vajpayee wrote an account about him.
The daughters of slum dwellers in Sikar, Rajasthan are learning to sew clothes for themselves and other families.
In Sikar, India, there are many daughters who have overcome their circumstances to become self-sufficient and support their families.
There is always a discussion taking place in tea shops.
But there are some people who go ahead with their work, to bring about a change through their hard work and dedication.
Shriman D. Prakash Rao has been a tea vendor in the city of Cuttack for the past five decades. He has opened a school for poor children. He spends 50% of his income on this school.
The month of June is so hot that people wait for the rains. The festival of Eid is coming soon.
Eid ul-Eid is celebrated on this occasion.
English rendering of PM’s Speech on laying of foundation stone for various developmental projects in Dhanbad and Patratu

In the presence of the Governor of Jharkhand, the Chief Minister, Raghubar Das, his colleague from the Council of Ministers at the centre Mr. R.K. Singh, Mr. Sudarshan Bhagat, Minister of the Government of JHarkhand and their colleagues, the MP Mr. Prem Singh, MLA Mr. Fulchand and my dear brothers and sisters are present.
"I salute Bhagwan Birsa Munda ji and the land of sacrifice, struggle and Atal Bihari Vajpayee's dreams. Its mineral reserves are engines of development for the country."
I was told that you have been waiting for the past 2-3 hours. You have warmly welcomed us and showered us with blessings. I am grateful for your love and blessings.
The results of local body elections in Jharkhand show that the government and the Central government have the support of the people.
The steps taken by the Central government in Jharkhand show its commitment towards the development of the state.

Today, 5 projects worth nearly 27 thousand crores are being inaugurated in Jharkhand. The amount is more than the entire budget of the state governments. Over 50 projects worth approximately Rs.80 thousand crore are already going on in the state.
Jharkhand is rich in coal. A power project worth more than 18 thousand crores is being inaugurated at Patratu. The project will generate electricity and provide employment to the unemployed.
I am glad that today I have the opportunity to provide employment cards to some of the youngsters.
When I took charge in 2014, 18000 villages were still without electricity.

I am glad that we will be able to provide the electricity connections in 18000 villages before the due date. Before, no one had the time to visit the villages that were left un-electrified. Now, people are compelled to do so.

Even after 70 years of independence, there are 4 crore or 20% of the households do not have access to transmission lines or electricity. Modi disconnected electricity supply to those households that already had it. He is determined to provide electricity connection to 4 crore households under saubhagya scheme.

People who abuse the rich to show their empathy towards the poor keep repeating that Modi works for the rich. I want to ask them which rich section of society lives in the 18000 villages where electricity connections have been provided.
Today I have the opportunity to re-start the urea factory at Sindri, which was shut down for almost 16 years.
The factory which will use gas as a source of energy will be started in Gorakhpur of East Uttar Pradesh.
Sindri and Dhanbad can be divided like the pole of anchor city.
The government of India plans to set up 3 urea factories at Barauni, Gorakhpur and Sindri.
The urea subsidy was diverted to the factories instead of the farmers. Neem-coating of urea has started.
Urea can only be used for agricultural purposes if the Neem oil is applied.
The step has a positive impact on farmers. They no longer have to buy urea from the black market.
I will lay the foundation stone of the gas pipeline project in Ranchi today.
It was the dream of the Ujjwala scheme to make kitchens smoke-free. Next step is to provide gas through pipelines and clean cooking through solar energy.

Today I have the opportunity to lay the foundation stone of AIIMS at Deoghar. Many poor patients from eastern India have to go to AIIMM at Delhi for treatment. Deghar is a pilgrimage centre and has great potential for tourism.
The number of passengers travelling by plane last year was greater than those travelling by AC coaches.
The government's dream is to provide homes to the poor by 2022.
The chief minister of Jharkhand asks people to participate in the development of the state.
English rendering of PM’s address at the inauguration of Bangladesh Bhavan at Santiniketan in West Bengal
The Hon'ble Prime Minister of Bangladesh, Sheikh Hasina Ji, Hon'ble guests, Hon’ble Chief Minister, Hon’ble Governor and friends!
The Bangladesh Bhawan is a symbol of cultural bondage between India and Bangladesh. It was designed by architect Gurudev Tagore.

The history of this University and of this holy land is older than that of Bangladesh's and India's independence and even older than the partition of Bengal during the colonial era. The Ganga is a symbol of our shared heritage which the British could not divide. The respect for great personalities like Bangabandhu, Sheikh Mujibur Rahman and Swami Vivekananda is the same in India and Bangladesh.
The poetry and songs of Rabindranath Tagore and Kazi Nazrul Islam are popular in Bangladesh and West Bengal.
The university was established by Rabindranath Tagore.

The 'Bangladesh Bhavan' has been inaugurated here. The High Commission of India and other organisations and individuals are engaged in cultural exchange work between India and Bangladesh. The Indian Council of Cultural Relations is renovating Gurudev Tagore's residence "Kuthibari" in Kushtia district of Bangladesh.

Friends, the shared legacy and the sweetness of Rabindra Sangeet have smeared our relations with nectar. The struggle for the liberation of Bangladesh was across the border, but the seeds of inspiration were sown in this land. The spirit of millions of Indians was automatically associated with the campaign.
"Golden chapters" are being written down for the past few years in India and Bangladesh relations.
The air conditioned train service between Kolkata and Khulna was started last year. The train service is named Bandhan after the Hindu festival of 'Bandhan'.
India has a target to increase electricity supply to Bangladesh to 1100 MW this year.
The Northeast India is getting internet connection from Bangladesh. India has provided 1 billion dollars of line of credit for assisting the developmental priorities set by Bangladesh.
In India, the country is developing rapidly in the area of space technology. Recently, it launched its first satellite, Bangabandhu.
Sheikh Hasina is visiting India.
Both India and Bangladesh aim to provide electricity connection to every household by next year. Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina ji of Bangladesh aims to provide power to all by 2021.
The International Solar Alliance was held in Delhi in March this year. Many countries of the world have become part of this Alliance. Bangladesh is also a part of it.
Last month I met a hundred-member young delegation from Bangladesh.
Today under the leadership of Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, Bangladesh has fulfilled all the criteria for achieving the level of a developing economy.
Bangladesh has made significant progress in the field of social sector and has made the life of the poor easier.
Today, the thread of the journey of development of India and Bangladesh is intertwined like a beautiful garland. BIMSTEC promotes regional progress and connectivity.
The close friendship and collaboration between India and Bangladesh is a lesson for others to study and assess.
India offers Bangladesh full cooperation in achieving the development of Bangladesh by 2041.
Sheikh Hasina ji attended the inauguration ceremony of the Bangladesh Bhavan.
PM visits Sindri, lays Foundation Stone of various development projects in Jharkhand
The Prime Minister, Shri Narendra Modi, laid the foundation stone of various projects of the Government of India and Government of Jharkhand at an event in Sindri.
Revival of Sindri Fertilizer Project of Hindustan Urvarak and Rasayan Ltd.
Ranchi City Gas Distribution Project by GAIL
All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), Deoghar
Patratu Super Thermal Power Project
He also witnessed the Exchange of MoUs for Jan AushadhiKendras.
The Prime Minister paid homage to BhagwanBirsa Munda at the gathering.
The cost of the development projects for which foundation stones have been laid today is Rs. 27,000 crore.
Every household in India now has access to electricity, as announced by Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
Eastern India will benefit most from the revival of fertiliser plants which had stopped working.
The Prime Minister has announced that AIIMS will be established in Jharkhand.
The Prime Minister has said that the Union Government has made air travel accessible and affordable.
English rendering of PM’s address at the convocation of Visva Bharati University at Santiniketan in West Bengal
Professor Sabuj Kali Sen, Vice-Chancellor of Visva Bharati, Ramakrishna Mission Vivekananda Institute and Vice-Cham. Swami Swamyapriyanand are present on stage.
As the Chancellor of Visva Bharati, he apologizes to the people of Visvasa Bharati for inconveniencing them on his way to the convocation.
Just like one can feel the power of mantras in a temple, I am experiencing the same energy in the Viswa Bharati University.
Amarkunj congratulates all the recipients of the degree.

In the Vedic and puranic era, Sages had nurtured this tradition. In the modern era, it was carried forward by great personalities like Gurudev Rabindranath Tagore. Viswa Bharati is the expression behind this wonderful organisation.
Gurudev wanted the Vedas to be a proclamation which the whole world would make its home.

The Vedas and Upanishads are as relevant today as they were thousands of years ago. Today, Bangladesh's Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina ji is also present among convocation. India and Bangladesh are two nations with common interests.
At times, I am surprised when I see that not only Gurudev's personality but also his travels were extensive.
In Afghanistan, every Afghan mentions about the story of Kabuliwala with great pride. Three years ago, I inaugurated a statue of Gurudev in Tajikistan.
In many universities of the world Tagore is still a professor. His brother Satyendranath Tagore was a Commissioner of Ahmedabad.
Gurudev was a great believer in the importance of education. He wanted Indian students to be well-acquainted with the external world.
He once explained to his son-in-law that studying agriculture is not enough and meeting the local people is also part of education.
In the Indian National Movement, Tagore ji's educational and Indian philosophy became distant. He created a separate world of education in Visva-Bharati.
This institution will complete 100 years in 2021. The institution's president asks its members to develop 100 villages by the centenary of the institution.
You must be well aware of the fact that gas connections provided under Ujjwala scheme and toilets built under Swachh Bharat Mission are meant for easing the lives of women.
In the next 100 villages, you will work towards water conservation, air pollution prevention, organic fertilizer and cleanliness.

Today we are facing different types of challenges. 125 crore Indians have vowed to build a New India by 2022. Education and institutions of education like this one play a significant role in this endeavour. Young people from such institutions give new energy and direction to the country.

Gurudev's vision for India's education system is being implemented. A new scheme called Revitalizing Infrastructure and System in Education i.e. RISE has been announced in this year's budget. It will be spent on improving the education system of the country. Global Initiative of Academic Network has been started to invite the best teachers of the world to teach in Indian institutions. Higher Education Financing Agency has been created.
Gurudev has congratulated the students of Visva-Bharati on passing out.
The Institution will be proud of its students who would change the lives of 500-1000 people through innovation.
The government is ready to move four steps with public participation to move the country forward.
Gurudev had told Gandhiji that Visva Bharti is the ship where the most precious treasure of his life remains. It is the responsibility of all of us to preserve and enrich this treasure.
The institution, its students and the country send best wishes to them.
PM visits Santiniketan, attends Convocation of Visva Bharati University, inaugurates Bangladesh Bhavana
The Prime Minister, Shri Narendra Modi, today visited Santiniketan in West Bengal.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Sheikh Hasina met in Santiniketan. They paid homage to Gurudev Rabindranath Tagore and signed the visitors’ book. They attended the Convocation of Visva Bharati University.
Prime Minister Narendra Modi is in India. He is visiting the country of Rabindranath Tagore.
He congratulated the students who received degrees today.
The Prime Minister said that the teachings of the Vedas, which describe the entire world as one nest, or one home, are reflected in the values of Visva Bharati University.
Welcoming the Prime Minister of Bangladesh, Sheikh Hasina, he said that India and Bangladesh are two nations, whose interests are linked to mutual cooperation and coordination among each other.
The Prime Minister visited Tajikistan to unveil a statue of Gurudev Rabindranath Tagore.
The Prime Minister congratulated Visva Bharati University on its centenary year. He encouraged the University to work towards development of 100 villages.
The Prime Minister has said that institutions such as Visva Bharati University have a key role to play in the creation of a New India by 2022.
Speaking on the occasion of the inauguration of Bangladesh Bhavan, the Prime Minister described it as a symbol of the cultural ties between India and Bangladesh.
He said that this University and this sacred land have a history that has seen the freedom struggles of both India and Bangladesh.
Bangabandhu Sheikh Mujibur Rehman is respected equally in India and Bangladesh.
In the same vein, he said that Gurudev Rabindranath Tagore belongs to Bangladesh, as much as to India.
The Prime Minister of India and Bangladesh will meet in Bangladesh Bhavan.
The Prime Minister of Pakistan and the Pakistani PM have had good relations in recent years.
He asserted that the two countries have similar goals, and are taking similar paths to achieve those goals.
English translation of Prime Minister's Press Statement during visit of Prime Minister of Netherlands to India (May 24, 2018)
Your Excellency, Prime Minister & my friend,

India and Netherlands have held their third summit meeting today. Netherlands Prime Minister Mark Rutte and his delegation, including his four Cabinet colleagues, the Mayor of the Hague and 200 business representatives, came to India.
Today, both India and Netherlands reviewed the progress in their bilateral relations. Netherlands has become a member of the International Solar Alliance.

The Netherlands is a major source of foreign direct investment in India. Dutch companies have been working in India for many years. Dutch business community in Netherlands is enthusiastic about opportunities being created in India and I have assured them of my commitment towards economic reforms in India, especially in areas related to agriculture and food processing.
The Indian foreign minister appreciates the help of the Netherlands in evacuating Indian nationals from Sint Maarten during hurricane.
Once again I very warmly welcome you and your delegation in India.
PM to Visit West Bengal and Jharkhand on May, 25
The Prime Minister, Shri Narendra Modi, will visit West Bengal and Jharkhand on 25th May.

He will attend the convocation of Visva Bharati University and inaugurate the Bangladesh Bhavan at Santi Niketan. Sheikh Hasina, the Prime Minister of Bangladesh, will be present at both these events.
In Jharkhand, Prime Minister Narendra Modi will lay the foundation stone of various projects of the Government of India and Government of Jharkshand.
· Revival of Sindri Fertilizer Project of Hindustan Urvarak and Rasayan Ltd.
· Ranchi City Gas Distribution Project by GAIL
· All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), Deoghar
· Patratu Super Thermal Power Project (3x800 MW)
He will also witness the Exchange of MoUs for Jan Aushadhi Kendras.
The Prime Minister will address the gathering.
Later, the Prime Minister will interact with the District Collectors of Aspirational Districts of Jharkhand, in Ranchi.
The Prime Minister, Shri Narendra Modi, today chaired his twenty-sixth interaction through PRAGATI platform.
The 25 PRAGATI meetings so far have seen a cumulative review of 227 projects with a total investment of over Rs. 10 Lakh Cys.
The Prime Minister stressed on the importance of increasing digital transactions across postal and rail networks.
The Prime Minister has reviewed the progress of nine infrastructure projects in the railway, road, petroleum, and power sectors.
The Prime Minister has reviewed the progress in implementation of AMRUT Mission and the programme for End-to-End Computerization of Targeted PDS Operations.
Six women officers of the Indian Navy successfully circumnavigated the globe on the sailing vessel INSV Tarini called on Prime Minister Narendra Modi today.
The expedition, known as the Navika Sagar Parikrama, was the first-ever Indian circumnavigation of the globe by an all-women crew.
During the interaction, the crew made a presentation on various aspects of the mission, their preparation, training, and experiences during the journey.
The crew of the warship were congratulated by Prime Minister Manmohan Singh on their mission.
The vessel was skippered by Lt. Commander Vartika Joshi and the crew included Lt. Commanders Pratibha Jamwal and P Swathi.
Six women officers of the Indian Navy successfully circumnavigated the globe on the sailing vessel INSV Tarini called on Prime Minister Narendra Modi today.
The expedition, known as the Navika Sagar Parikrama, was the first-ever Indian circumnavigation of the globe by an all-women crew.

The crew of the warship were congratulated by Prime Minister Manmohan Singh on their mission.
The vessel was skippered by Lt. Commander Vartika Joshi and the crew included Lt. Commanders Pratibha Jamwal and P Swathi.
PM’s statement prior to his departure to Russia
Following is the text of the Prime Minister, Shri Narendra Modi’s departure statement prior to his visit to Russia.
Igor Gerasimov is visiting Sochi tomorrow and will meet with President Putin.
Am confident the talks with President Putin will further strengthen the Special and Privileged Strategic Partnership between India and Russia.”
English rendering of PM’s speech at foundation stone laying ceremony of PakalDul Power Project and inauguration of several projects in Jammu
Chamanlal Ji, the chief minister of Jammu and Kashmir, is taking part in a public programme.
The Zojila Tunnel, Kishtwar Hydro Power Project and Chinab River Project were dedicated today in Jammu & Kashmir.

Just a while ago, I got the opportunity to dedicate or lay the foundation for 4 infrastructure related projects for Jammu. Two of them are dedicated to the Divine Mother Vaishno Devi. One of them is Pakal Dul project. It is going to produce electricity equivalent to one third of the electricity produced in the state in a day.
The project of one thousand megawatt capacity is ready for launch. It is going to create several opportunities for employment.

Friends, our government has been working with a new approach towards the development of the country and this approach is: from isolation to integration. Now priority is being given to the areas which were isolated and development hasn't reached so far. I will try to visit North-East and Jammu & Kashmir. I have come to Jammu and Kashmir many times as a Prime Minister.

The central and state governments have been working together to build a ring road around Jammu. The foundation stone for the ring road was laid recently. It will be 50 km long and it will ease traffic congestion in the city and in the region.
Jammu has been selected under the Smart City Mission.
Brothers and sisters, for development, our entire focus is on infrastructure – be it highways or railways or waterways or i-ways or roadways, all these are compulsory things for the 21stcentury.

The government's thinking is clear that if we need to raise the standard of living of 1.25 billion people, we have to first make it easy and convenient for them. As a result, a network of highways has been developed at a rapid pace across the country under the Bharat Mala project.
The project to connect the country with a network of highways is one of the key priorities of the Indian government.

The work on several highway projects worth thousands of crores of rupees for connecting Jammu to Srinagar and other parts of the country has already been completed. Now the work is being done on several other projects.
Tourism is a big source of revenue for Jammu & Kashmir. The government has been making several efforts to provide facilities and employment opportunities to pilgrims.

Today, the train service has reached the Vaishno Devi shrine in Katra. I had dedicated the rail route to this shrine when I was Prime Minister. Now, the government wants to extend the service to other shrines and inaugurate two new projects.
Friends, now the devotees can reach to the shrine of divine mother Vaishno Devithra from Tarakota route.
Today, I inaugurated a material ropeway leading up to the doors of the mother goddess.

Friends, this kind of facility is also being developed for the devotees on the lines of material ropeway. Bhairon Ghati Bhawan, which is being built at the cost of Rs. 60 crore, is going to be completed soon. It will have the capacity to ferry 800 people per hour. When it is fully functional, it will carry 40-45 people within three minutes. The ticketing system will be similar to Delhi Metro.
The Central government has approved setting up of big institutions in the field of education in Jammu and Kashmir.
The government has launched several schemes for women empowerment in the last four years.

Friends, under the Clean India Mission, a movement to rid the country of open defecation has been launched. It is an issue of honour of women. The mothers and sisters of Jammu & Kashmir have been very active in this movement. I myself saw an 87-year-old lady constructing a toilet in Udhampur.

Friends, when efforts are made for cleanliness and dignity, the courage and conviction increase. The coverage of rural cleanliness has gone beyond 80%. Toilets in more than 8.5 lakh houses have been constructed in Jammu & Kashmir under the scheme.
Friends, financial and social empowerment of women will be incomplete unless attention is paid to their skill development.

When I came to Jammu &Kashmir two years ago, I had made an appeal to the youth of the state to take advantage of the various government schemes. Today, I am happy to inform that the youth have taken maximum advantage of these schemes. More than 20 lakh people have opened their bank accounts under the Prime Minister Jan Dhan scheme, and nearly 8,000 rupees have been deposited in these accounts. Also, more than 40 thousand people working in the un-organised sector have joined the Atal Pension scheme.
Friends, the youth of this area have always been ahead in joining in the armed forces.

Friends, this is the land of Dogras. It has valour and patience, it has sweet music and it has potential for development. It is a land of rice fields and potential factories. With the blessings of Vaishno Devi and the hard work of people, this state will scale the new heights of development and it will achieve success.
English rendering of PM’s speech at the Convocation of Sher-e-Kashmir University of Agricultural Sciences and Technology, Jammu on 19 May, 2018
My young colleagues and all the dignitaries present here.
This morning I got the opportunity to visit different parts of Jammu & Kashmir. Several projects of development have been dedicated from Leh to Srinagar and new ones started.
The university is nearly 20 years old. Since then many students have passed out from here and they have been making their contribution in the social life at some place or other.
The convocation ceremony of the university is taking place today. The certificates, degrees and medals have been awarded to more than 400 students.
"Daughters are doing wonders," he said.
The certificates that you are holding are full of hopes and aspirations of farmers.

Today I am among you because I consider it important to talk to you people. Technology has been changing with the time and this changing technology has changed the basics of things. The only ones who can cope with this fast pace are the youth of this country.
The central government has been promoting the use of modern technology linked to the agriculture sector.
The government has distributed soil health cards to 12 crore farmers in the country so far. 11.5 million farmers in Jammu & Kashmir have received these cards.
Farmers have increased production thanks to Neem coated urea.
Innovation in micro and sprinkler irrigation has been encouraged.
The government is working towards doubling the farmer's income.

After completing your education, you should play an active role in making the agriculture profitable venture with the help of scientific approach, technological innovation and research and development.
I have been impressed by the efforts of your people and the model developed by you and your university to raise the farmer’s income.
I praise the model of farming that you people in Jammu and Kashmir have developed. I would like to see this model promoted more in the area.
The government is promoting the development of new sectors of agriculture to increase income for farmers.
The government has created new funds of Rs. 10,000 crore for fisheries and animal husbandry to boost the income of farmers.
The government has announced a big scheme for reforming the agriculture sector. A lot of money has been allocated for this.
The Government is promoting the process of recycling waste into wealth.
The government has announced a scheme called GobarDhanYojana aimed at increasing the village cleanliness and increasing the income of farmers and people engaged in animal husbandry.
The government has made it easier to grow bamboo. Before, the country was importing billions of dollars worth of bamboo every year.
People in India have developed new varieties of 12 crops.

The quality of seeds is an important issue for the agriculture sector today. However, the challenges faced by the sector today are not limited to just the quality of the seeds. The climate change is also affecting the production of crops.

The climate change is having an impact on Jammu & Kashmir. Because of the impact of climate change, while on the one hand a rise in the temperature has been witnessed, on the other some parts are becoming rain deficient. Glaciers meet the need of water in Jammu and Kashmir, but they are melting at a fast pace, and as a result there is a water shortage in some areas and some other areas it has resulted in floods.
I came to your university to learn more about the FASAL project. The project aims to develop new technologies to deal with new challenges in agricultural production.
Sea buckthorn, a plant which is being found in the Laddakh region, has extremely valuable medicinal properties.
Sea buckthorn is one of the most valuable agricultural products.

In the past, I gave an example from the platform of emerging as an agriculture scientist from a student. Today, I am giving this example from this platform, I also say this thing because whichever area of the country will be chosen by you people as your workplace, you will find several products there.
The use of drones and artificial intelligence is going to bring about revolutionary changes in agriculture.
New technology has been used in soil mapping and community pricing. Block chain technology will play an important role in the coming days.
Block chain technology can help reduce the cost of agriculture.
There will be a complete network which will include farmer processing units, distributors, regulatory authorities and consumers. The technology can be developed on the basis of a smart contract.
This technology can help farmers to set their prices according to mutual understanding.
The government is making an effort to link the village markets across the country under schemes like e-NAM.
The technology like block chain will make our efforts more meaningful.
People will have to think about developing models that are friendly to futuristic technologies and appropriate to local needs.
I have been told that during your course you people have done a lot of work to link the local farmers with the organic farming at the local level.
The central government has approved several schemes for the farmers and horticulturists of Jammu & Kashmir.
The efforts made by the government to improve the farming situation in the state will further strengthen the farmers' situation.
The country celebrates 75 years of its independence in 2022. I urge the students of the university to set a target for themselves to establish themselves as good agriculture scientists.
The university students can pledge to increase crop production per hectare or take the modern technology to maximum number of farmers.
The development of quality human resources is a big challenge for the agriculture technology led and entrepreneurship driven society.

The country’s agricultural system is changing. The responsibility of all the institutions in the country, like your university, goes up. Five Ts - training, talent, technology, timely action and trouble-free approach - are very important for bringing about revolutionary changes in agricultural system.
In order to develop a better model for the farmers of the country, people must keep alive the mindset of a student.
In conclusion, I convey my best wishes and congratulate all my colleagues.
PM in Jammu: attends Convocation of Sher-e-Kashmir University of Agricultural Sciences and Technology; lays Foundation Stone of infrastructure projects

The Prime Minister, Shri Narendra Modi, has attended the Convocation of Sher-e-Kashmir University of Agricultural Sciences and Technology in Jammu. He also laid the Foundation Stone of the Pakaldul Power Project and Jammu Ring Road. He inaugurated the Tarakote Marg and Material Ropeway, of the Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Shrine Board.
In his address at the convocation, the Prime Minister said that technology is bringing about change in all spheres of life, and the youth of our country is keeping pace with these developments.
He said that even in agriculture, there is need to develop a new "culture" through infusion of technology, to benefit farmers.
The Prime Minister said that the policies and decisions of the Union Government are aimed at increasing the income of farmers.

He expressed confidence that through Scientific Approach, Technological Innovations, and Research and Development the graduating students would play an active role in turning agriculture into a profitable profession.
The Prime Minister laid the Foundation Stone of the Pakuldul hydropower project.
The Tarakote Marg will provide an alternative route to the Mata Vaishno Devi Shrine, which will facilitate pilgrims.
English rendering of PMs speech at event marking the dedication of Kishanganga Hydro Electric Project to the nation in Srinagar

In the presence of the Governor of Jammu & Kashmir Sriman N.N. Vohra, Chief Minister Mehbooba Mufti, Dr. Farrukh Abdullah, Member of Parliament Shriman Muzaffar Hussain Beg and other dignitaries, Srimani prays.
In his message, he thanked the people of Jammu and Kashmir for their love and affection. He also talked about Diwali celebrations in Srinagar and Ramzan.
In the holy month of Ramzan, I got the opportunity to dedicate Kishanganga Hydro Electric Project to the nation. The project will provide free electricity to Jammu & Kashmir.
The water supply to Bonar Nullah in Bandipora has been completed by digging a tunnel in the mountain.
Today, I got the opportunity to lay the foundation stone for a ring road for Srinagar. It will cost 500 crore rupees.

The development of the whole state of Jammu and Kashmir is essential. A package of Rs. 80,000 crore was approved for this purpose. Since then, projects worth more than Rs. 63,000 Crores have been sanctioned and more than    than  Rs. 20,000 Crates spent.
The government of Jammu and Kashmir is doing a lot of work to develop infrastructure in the region.
The government of Jammu and Kashmir wants to change the proverb that the youth and water of a hilly area never come to use.
The work will start soon on a hydro power plant in Kishtwar at a cost of Rs. 8,000 crore.
The government of Jammu & Kashmir is spending billions on modernizing the electricity supply network in the state.

The government is busy in providing electricity to every household in Jammu and Kashmir. It is also trying to reduce the burden of electricity bill on those households where electricity has already been supplied.
The tourism sector in Jammu & Kashmir is the biggest employer and the most productive sector in the state. However, the modern tourist wants better facilities.
The government is promoting tourism in Jammu and Kashmir.
Jammu & Kashmir is a major tourist destination in the world. Therefore, it is extremely important that the entire economy is focused on tourism.

There are a lot of efforts being made to improve the connectivity in Jammu & Kashmir. Almost half of the total package given to the state is spent on road sector. A network of national highways is being laid.
I inaugurated the work on the country's longest tunnel, Zojilla Tunnel, before coming here.
The government is working to develop Srinagar and Jammu into smart cities.
The government is spending a lot on improving water supply and sewage system in the cities of Jammu & Kashmir.
The people of Jammu & Kashmir are taking forward the mission of making villages and cities ‘smart’ by promoting cleanliness.
A five-year-old girl from Kashmir was seen cleaning the Dal lake.
The flood damage caused by the massive flood in the state has fundamentally changed your lives. The state government is making every effort to compensate for the losses incurred at various places.
The PDP-BJP coalition government and the union government have been working on the issue of displaced people. They have spent nearly Rs. 3,500 crore on their rehabilitation.

The youth of Jammu & Kashmir are becoming role models for the youth of other states. Tajamul from Bandipora won a medal in kick-boxing. The central government and the state government are working together to develop sports infrastructure in the state.
The government of Jammu & Kashmir is working hard to provide educational and employment opportunities to the youth.
The process of recruitment of five thousand youths for India Reserve Force is in its last stage in Jammu & Kashmir.
In his message to security forces in Jammu and Kashmir, Prime Minister Narendra Modi praised their performance.
Jammu & Kashmir can become the most shining star of this New India.
There are many powers that do not want the development of Jammu and Kashmir.
The coalition government of PDP-BJP and NDA-PDP-PDB in the state of J&K is working hard to bring back the youths who have been influenced by foreign propaganda.
The youth who have gone astray should come back to the mainstream and contribute towards the development of Jammu & Kashmir.
The situation in India is unstable. People who have been working towards development for decades are on the verge of disintegration.
Last year I celebrated Diwali in Gurez with Jawans. This year I am among them on the occasion of Ramzan.
Kashmir's problem will be solved by embracing every Kashmiri.
The government of Jammu and Kashmir has taken several important decisions for the development of the state.

There is a ceasefire in Jammu & Kashmir. The government appointed an interlocutor to take forward the process of stability. He has been meeting elected representatives and institutions to talk to people about their issues.
The government is doing everything possible to safeguard the alliance of democracy and Kashmiriyat.
There is only one solution for all the problems and differences in Jammu and Kashmir - development and development.
In his speech, Prime Minister Narendra Modi talks about the importance of peace and tranquility in India and Jammu & Kashmir.
Isi Bhawana Ke Saath Setha-Setha Shukriya, Aj Diyu Ijazat, Khudai Thai Nav Khoshat Khush-hal.

PM in Leh: attends Closing Ceremony of the Birth Centenary Celebration of the 19th Kushok Bakula Rinpoche; unveils plaque to mark commencement of work on the Zojila Tunnel.
The Prime Minister, Shri Narendra Modi, arrived in Leh on the first leg of a day-long visit to Jammu and Kashmir today.
He attended the Closing Ceremony of the Birth Centenary Celebration of the 19th Kushok Bakula Rinpoche in Leh and unveiled a plaque to mark the commencement of work on the Zojila Tunnel.
The construction of the Zojila tunnel between Baltal and Minamarg, on the Srinagar-Leh section of NH-1A costed Rs 6800 crore.
The life of the 19th Kushok Bakula Rinpoche was dedicated to serving others, Prime Minister Arunachal Pradesh said.
The 19th Kushok Bakula Rinpoche is an outstanding diplomat. He visited Mongolia.
Shri Narendra Modi expressed happiness that he is visiting the three regions of Jammu and Kashmir today.
He said the State of Jammu and Kashmir is going to get development projects worth Rs. 25,000 crore.
PM to visit Jammu and Kashmir on May 19, 2018
The Prime Minister, Shri Narendra Modi, will be on a day-long visit to Jammu and Kashmir on May 19, 2018.

The Prime Minister will attend the Closing Ceremony of the Birth Centenary Celebration of the 19th Kushok Bakula Rinpoche in Leh and unveil a plaque to mark the commencement of work on the Zojila Tunnel.
The construction of the Zojila tunnel between Baltal and Minamarg, on the Srinagar-Leh section of NH-1A costed Rs 6800 crore.
The Prime Minister will dedicate the Kishanganga Hydropower Station and lay the Foundation Stone of the Srinagar Ring Road.

At the General Zorawar Singh Auditorium in Jammu, Prime Minister Narendra Modi will lay the Foundation Stone of the Pakul Dul Power Project and the Jammu Ring Road. He will also inaugurate the Tarakote Marg and Material Ropeway of the Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Shrine Board.
The Ring Roads in Srinagar and Jammu are aimed at reducing traffic congestion at these cities and making road travel safer, faster, more convenient and more environment friendly.
The Prime Minister will also attend the Convocation of the Sher-e-Kashmir University of Agricultural Sciences & Technology, Jammu.
PM greets people on the beginning of holy month of Ramzan
The Prime Minister, Shri Narendra Modi, has greeted the people on the beginning of holy month of Ramzan.
The Prime Minister sends Ramzan greetings to everyone.
PM announces ex-gratia for the next of kin of those who lost their lives due to collapse of an under-construction flyover in Varanasi from PMNRF
The Prime Minister has approved ex-gratia of Rs. 2 Lakh for each of the victims of the collapse of an under-construction flyover in Varanasi.
The Prime Minister has approved a compensation of Rs. 50,000 each for those seriously injured due to the collapse of an under-construction flyover in Varanasi.
Members of Oman India Joint Business Council meet PM
A group of about 30 young business leaders from Oman, who are part of the Oman India Joint Business Council, called on Prime Minister Narendra Modi today.
They shared their perspectives on the long shared history and maritime links between the two countries.
The Prime Minister of Saudi Arabia and the Sultan of Oman met.
PM condoles the loss of lives due to capsizing of a boat in Andhra Pradesh’s East Godavari district
