Fifteenth Finance Commission constitutes an Advisory Council to advise on the matters related to its Terms of Reference
The Fifteenth Finance Commission has constituted an Advisory Council to advise and assist the Commission.
To advise the Commission on any issue or subject related to the Terms of Reference (ToR) of the Commission, which may be of relevance;
To assist in the preparation of any paper or research study which would enhance the Commission's understanding on the issues containing in its ToR; and

To help in broadening the Commission's ambit and understanding to seek best national and international practices on matters pertaining to fiscal devolution and improving the quality and reach and enforcement of its recommendations.
Advisory Council will have following members:
Arvind Virmani, President, Forum for Strategic Initiatives
Surjit S. Bhalla is a Senior Analyst for the Observatory Group and Chairman of Oxus Research and Investments.
Sanjeev Gupta, Ex-Deputy Director (Fiscal Affairs Department), IMF
Pinaki Chakraborty, Professor (NIPFP)
Shri Sajjid Chinoy, Chief India Economist, JP Morgan
Shri Neelkanth Mishra, Managing Director and the Credit Suisse India Economist and Strategist

CriSidEx Jan-March 2018 readings show Micro and Small Enterprises (MSEs) confidence largely intact; MSEs remain upbeat on growth prospects​;​Sentiment expected to continue through April-June 2018​ as well.​
The Second Quarterly Crisidex Survey shows Micro and Small Enterprises (MSEs) had a better January-March 2018 (called the Survey Quarter, or SQ),driven by gains in the
CriSidEx is a sentiment index based on a diffusion index of 8 parameters. It measures business sentiment among MSEs.
As in the First Survey, the Second Survey also gathered parametric feedback from 1,100 MSE respondents across India and sectors.

The CriSidEx score increased to 121 in SQ​ (January-March 2018)​from 107 in October-December 2017, which validates the expectation of higher optimism made by the first quarterly survey.For April-June 2018 (called the next quarter, or NQ), expectations continue to be positive.

Within Manufacturing, Chemicals, Auto Components, and Engineering and Capital Goods-related MSEs reported strongly positive sentiment in SQ, while segments with a significant presence of unorganised enterprises such as leather & leather goods, and gems & jewellery were subdued.
MSEs in Auto Components, Chemicals, and Engineering and Capital Goods were the most optimistic about NQ.

The outlook for the NorthQ is largely optimistic. Traders, health care providers, and human resource services firms are expected to continue doing well in NQ. IT/ITeS, traders and health careproviders had a healthy showing in SQ, but not so in logistics and construction/real estate-based MSEs.
According to SIDBI survey, companies are more positive than unorganised players.
MSEs in the manufacturing sector expect the situation to improve further in April-June 2018.
Unorganised MSEs with less than 10 employees reported a slight improvement in performance in the December quarter.
Meanwhile, lenders hold a neutral view for NQ, with 9 out of 10 saying the overall business situation will be satisfactory.
As many as 7 out of 10 lenders did not find any change in the situation of MSE non-performing assets (NPA) accounts in SQ and majority of lenders do not expect an increase in NPA accounts in NQ.
CBDT notifies the Protocol amending the Double Taxation Avoidance Agreement (DTAA) between India and Kuwait

A Protocol to amend the existing Double Taxation Avoidance Agreement (DTAA) between India and Kuwait signed on 15.06.2006 for the avoidance of double taxation and for the prevention of fiscal evasion with respect to taxes on income was entered into force on 26.03.2018 and was notified in the Official Gazette on 4.05.2018.
The Protocol updates the provisions in the DTAA for exchange of information as per international standards.
Auction for Sale (Re-issue) of Government Stocks
The Government of India has announced the sale of re-issue of 7.17 per cent Government Stock, 2028 for a notified amount of ` 4,000 crore throughprice based auction.

Up to 5% of the notified amount of the sale ofthe stockswill be allotted to eligible individuals and Institutions as per the Scheme for Non-Competitive Bidding Facility in the Auction of Government Securities.

Both competitive and non-competitive bids for the auction should be submitted in electronic format on the Reserve Bank of India Core Banking Solution (E-Kuber) system on May 11, 2018 between 10.30 a.m. and 12.00 noon.
The result of the auctions will be announced onMay 11, 2018 (Friday)and payment by successful bidders will be onMay 14, 2018 (Monday).
The Stocks will be eligible for "When Issued" trading.
Shri S.C.Garg Secretary, Department of Economic Affairs, attends Plenary Session ofAnnual Meeting of ADB ; Welcomes its Strategy 2030
Shri Subhash Chandra Garg, Secretary, Department of Economic Affairs, made an intervention at the plenary session of the 51st Annual Meeting of Asian Development Bank (ADB) in Manila.
Shri Garg has suggested that ADB's Strategy should focus more on West Asia and South Asia and there should be more focus on equity participation.

Shri Garg attended the Board of Governors meeting of Asian Development Bank (ADB). He praised ADB for focusing on poverty eradication, quality jobs and increased support for social sectors. He also called for ADB to focus more on its key areas of strength.

While welcoming ADB’s pledge to support an inclusive growth, Shri Garg highlighted the need to develop innovative financing instruments to cater to the specific needs and priorities of the member countries.
The Indian delegation also held bilateral meetings with the Japan Bank for International Cooperation and discussed a wide range of bilateral issues.
Two Group of Ministers Constituted to consider the issues relating to “Incentivizing digital payments in the GST regime” & “Imposition of Cess on Sugar under GST”.
Subsequent to the decisions taken in the 27thGST Council meeting held today (04.05.2018), two Group of Ministers (GoMs) have been constituted.
The first GoM is being constituted to discuss the issues relating to incentivizing digital payments in the GST regime.
The second GoM will consider the issue of introducing cess on sugar under GST.
Both the GoMs shall submit their reports within a period of 15 days.
Secretary, DEA meets president of ADB, Mr. Takehiko Nakao, and attends 12th informal meeting of SAARC finance ministers.

The Secretary of Economic Affairs, Ministry of Finance, has met the President of Asian Development Bank (ADB). He has asked him to expand ADB's operations in India and provide financial assistance worth $ 4 billion a year. The Secretary has also approved the proposal of ADB to issue additional INR bonds in the offshore markets.

Shri Garg attended the 12th informal meeting of SAARC Finance Ministers and highlighted the ongoing reforms in India and India's economic performance. He also reiterated India's support to SAARC Development Fund.
An Indian delegation is on a tour to Manila to attend the 51st Annual Meeting of Asian Development Bank (ADB).
The delegation from Hong Kong and Germany met.

Important Announcements and Approvals in Board Meeting of PFRDA

Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority (PFRDA) regulates and develops pension sector in India. PFRDA takes various initiatives to improve the operational issues of National Pension System (NPS).
The Board Meeting of National Pension System (NPS) took important decisions to improve the operational and regulation issues of the NPS.

The proposal to change investment grade rating from ‘AA’ to ‘A’ for corporate bonds was approved. There will be a cap on investments in the “A” rated bonds to not more than 10% of the overall Corporate Bond portfolio of the Pension Funds.
The proposal on adoption of Common Stewardship Code, as a measure of good Corporate Governance, was approved. The code will be circulated to all Pension Funds for compliance and implementation.

Partial withdrawals from National Pension Service (NPS) contributions will be allowed to NPS subscribers who wish to improve their employability or acquire new skills by pursuing higher education or acquiring professional and technical qualifications. Individual NPS subscriber who wishes to set up a new business will also be able to withdraw partial amounts from his contributions.
The proposal to increase cap on equity investment in active choice to 75% for Private Sector Subscribers has been approved by the Board.
NPS and APY have a cumulative subscriber base of over 2.13 crore with total Asset Under Management (AUM) of more than Rs. 2.38 lakh crore.
27th GST council meeting discusses change in GST rate for digital transactions and imposition of Sugar Cess
Incentive to promote Digital Transactions:
The Council has discussed in detail the proposal of a 2% concession of GST rate on B2C supplies for cheque or digital mode.
The GST Council has recommended setting up of a Group of Ministers from State Governments to look into the proposal and make recommendations before the next Council meeting.
2. Imposition of Sugar Cess over and above 5% GST and reduction of GST rate on ethanol.
The Council discussed the issue of imposition of sugar cess and reduction in GST rate on ethanol.
The GST Council has recommended setting up of a Group of Ministers from State Governments to look into the proposal and make recommendations within two weeks.
Change in the shareholding pattern of GSTN
The Goods and Services Tax Network - Special Purpose Vehicle (GSTN-SPV) was created as a private limited, not-for-profit company under Section 25 of the Companies Act, 1956 and Section 8 of the 2013.

GST Network (GSTN) is a government-owned company which handles a vast amount of IT-based transactions related to the Goods and Services Tax (GSTR) system. The Central and State Governments are holding 24.5% and 51% equity shares respectively.
In view of the above, GST Council in its meeting held today decided:
The government of India and the states will buy 51% of equity held by non-governmental institutions in GSTN.

GSTN Board shall be allowed to continue the existing staff at existing terms and conditions for the a period upto five years, and shall have the flexibility of hiring people through contract on the terms and conditions similar to those used by GSTN till now while hiring regular employees.
The existing financial commitments given by Centre and States to GSTN to share the capital and O&M cost of the IT Systems shall continue.
GST Council approves principles for filing of new return design based on the recommendations of the Group of Ministers on IT simplification
GST Council has approved principles for filing of new return design based on the recommendations of the Group of Ministers on IT simplification.
All taxpayers except composition dealer shall file monthly return. Composition dealers and dealers having nil transaction shall have facility to file quarterly return.
Unidirectional Flow of invoices: There shall be unidirectionally flow of the seller's and buyer's payments.

Simple return design and easy IT interface: The B2Bdealers will have to fill invoice-wise details of the outward supply made by them, based on which the system will automatically calculate his tax liability and input tax credit.
No automatic reversal of credit: There shall be no automatic reversing of input tax credit from buyer on non-payment of tax by the seller.
The process for recovery and reversal of input tax credit shall be online and automated.
Safeguards are being put in place to prevent non-payment of taxes.
The present system of filing of GSTR 3B and GSTR 1 is being replaced with a new system.

The dealer will be provided with information about gap between credit available to them as per invoices uploaded by their sellers and the provisional credit being claimed by them. After 6 months of this phase 2, the facility of provisional credit will be withdrawn and input tax credit will only be limited to the invoiced uploaded by the sellers from whom dealer has purchased goods.
The law committee will work out the details of the design of the return form, business process and legal changes based on the principles of simplified return design.
4th Regional Conference on ‘Futuristic, Resilient and Digital Infrastructure’ concludes in Bengaluru today;

Experts gave thrust on bottoms-up approach to bridge the gap of digital divide between urban and rural; Major Thrust was given on three Broad areas including Opportunities in the context of need for Futuristic, Resilient and Digital Infrastructure, Resource Mobilisation and Emerging Challenges among others.

The 4th Regional Conference on ‘Futuristic, Resilient and Digital Infrastructure’ organized by the Ministry of Finance, Government of India in collaboration with the Confederation of Indian Industry and CII concluded in Bengaluru today. The conference is a lead-up event to the 3rd Annual Meeting of the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank (AIIB) which is going to be hosted by the Government in Mumbai on 25th and 26th June 2018.

The two day Conference mainly gave thrust on three (3) broad areas including the Challenges as well as Opportunities in the context of need for Futuristic, Resilient and Digital Infrastructure, Resource Mobilisation and Emerging Challenges among others.
The main focus areas of the Conference are integration, transport, inclusion and resilience.

Congestion being treated as negative externality – Experts gave lot of stress was on use of futuristic smart technologies to decongest, emerging digital technologies, satellite based services, intelligent traffic and city management much beyond real time data generation and dissemination
Resilience - Much is understood in terms of damage protection and minimization in times of disasters.
The Futuristic Vision on Resilience should be able to focus on hazards, governance and institutions.
Early Warning Systems are needed to prevent the adverse impact of natural and man made disasters.
Integration and Agglomeration -
The concept of integrated city planning is related to having robust master-plans for city expansion and integration of multi-modal transportation.
Use of technologies, particularly digital technologies would be critical for integration and future in terms of multi-modal transportation.
The twin challenges of infrastructure development is to enhance agglomeration and reduce congestion.
The urbanization of economies is expected to drive productivity.
There is a growing need for policy planning aimed at urbanization and economic opportunities.
Sustainability of urban landscape is critical.
In terms of future of mobility, projects like high speed railway, metro railway, resource efficient public transportation, dedicated corridors etc. were analysed thread bare.

Technological Solutions, Digital Infrastructure and Digital Economy - As already highlighted, these have enormous potential to address the above three concerns in terms of minimizing social costs and improving well being.
Digital technologies are the best way to leverage the creativity and innovation of all citizens.

Devices and connectivity form the backbone of the future. Supply chains are getting transformed, inventory monitoring, assessment of depreciation and wear and tear can also be monitored in a precise way.

The fundamental issues around Industry 4.0 going ahead will be the capability to produce, ability to connect and capacity to use. In this framework, trade policy regime in the context of ITA has created unequal gains across countries and led to muted production of ICT goods in many countries including India.
The future Infrastructure can be funded through land value capture and pooled savings apart from using insurance and pension funds.
Rapid technological change poses a risk to society. This risk can be mitigated by public action.
The focus of infrastructure financing is fast shifting towards financing growth centres that promote agglomeration. Multilateral banks like ADB and VCIC are adopting this model.
Security and privacy in the context of digital technologies.
Future of Work –No direct answer, depends on the technological opportunities and sectors, for India wage based competitiveness would still remain relevant counter-actingthe job replacement effects
Market failures in positive, futuristic and relevant innovations – This issue is a major concern for disaster resilient infrastructure for obvious reasons.
Technology Choices and Effectiveness - Broadband versus Wireless Mobile Communication has huge implications for connectivity and digital empowerment in India.
Rural-urban gaps in internet access need to be plugged as soon as possible.
The Commission will consider sectoral allotments but needs of the Indian Economy can't be understood holistically without considering the needs of agriculture sector.

Finance Commission held an interactive session on Agriculture today.

GST Revenue collection in April 2018 exceeds Rs. 1.1 Lakh Crore.
The total Gross GST revenue collected in April 2018 is Rs.1.03,458 crore.

April was also the month for filing of Quarterly Return for Composition Dealers.Out of 19.31 lakh Composition Dealers, 11.47 lakh have filed their Quarterly Return (GSTR 4) which is 59.40% and have paid total tax of Rs.579 crores, which is included in the above figure of Rs.1.03 lakh crore of total GST collection.

The buoyancy in the tax revenue of GST reflects the upswing in the economy and better compliance.However, it is usually noticed that in the last month of the Financial Year, people also try to pay arrears of some of the previous months also and, therefore, this month’s revenue cannot be taken as trend for the future.
The total revenue earned by the Central Government and the State Governments after settlement in the month of April, 2018 is Rs.32,493 crore for CGST and Rs.40,257 crore for the SGST.

There is a local outbreak of Nipah virus disease, but it is not a major outbreak.
A team from the National Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) is in Kerala reviewing the situation of the Nipah Virus Disease.
The Central High-level Team is of the view that the Nipah virus disease is not a major outbreak and is only local occurrence.

The Central Team held meetings with the District Collectors and the medical and para-medical staff of the hospitals today to review the condition of the admitted patients and to consider further course of action to prevent the disease from spreading.
There has been an outbreak of norovirus in the affected areas. Central and State teams have been working round-the-clock to contain it.
The suspect cases admitted in Kozhikode Medical College and Trivandrum Medical College are being investigated.
The situation at the hospital is under control.
Details of cases and deaths, as on 24.5.2018, are as under:
Total number of confirmed cases: 14
Total number of deaths: 12 (9 from Kozhikode and 3 from Malappuram)
Activities undertaken by the Expert Central Technical team in Kerala for management of Nipah Virus Disease
A team from National Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) is in Kerala reviewing the situation of the Nipah Virus Disease.
Yesterday, the team from the NCDC visited Malappuram district and met with doctors and the general public to discuss the Nipah virus disease.

Another part of the Central Expert Team led by Dr.P.Ravindran, Director(Emergency Medical Relief) visited the Government Medical College, Kozhikode and reviewed the treatment procedure, infection control practises, use and availability of personal protective equipment and drugs.

The team responsible for the outbreak in Kozhikode has met with officials and discussed various issues related to the outbreak. It was decided to provide separate ambulances for transportation of suspects to designated isolation facilities.
The details of cases and deaths as on date are as under:
There are 16 suspected cases of suspected cases admitted in Kozhikode Medical College and Manjeri Medical College.
Total number of deaths: 11 (8 from Kozhikode District and 3 from Malappuram District)

Shri J P Nadda reviews Nipah Virus cases in Kerala
Situation under control; no cause for panic: J P Nadda

The Union Minister for Health & Family Welfare, Shri J P Nadda, is closely monitoring the situation arising out of reported cases and deaths due to Nipah Virus in Kerala. A team from National Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) is there reviewing the situation.

The NCDC team visited the house in Perambra from where the initial death was reported. 60 different samples have been collected from the spot and sent for examination. Two people with history of contact with the index case died of Nipah virus.
A public health team from NCDC Branch Kozhikode has been deployed to assist the State Level Team at the epicentre of the outbreak.
The minister for health has warned citizens not to believe in rumours posted on social media.

The field team has advised hospitals to follow intracranial pressure (ICP) guidelines, use personal protective equipment (PPE) for healthcare workers and sample collection; assist in enhancing active fever surveillance in the community; strengthen contact tracing in close contacts of cases, relatives, health care workers; ensure isolation facilities, ventilator support and hospital infection control practices; and coordinate with animal sector and enhance surveillance for unusual illness and deaths in animals.
Nine people are being treated for a virus outbreak in Kozhikode. The outbreak appears to be localised.
There is an outbreak of a virus in Kerala.
Shri J P Nadda leads Indian Delegation at World Health Assembly
India is firmly committed to achieving universal health coverage for its citizens: J P NaddaAddresses Commonwealth Health Ministers’ Meeting
India is committed to achieving universal health coverage for its citizens.

India has fast-tracked many initiatives aimed at achieving Universal Health Coverage (UHC). Prime Minister Narendra Modi launched Ayushman Bharat, which aims at providing comprehensive primary healthcare services to 500 million people.

Shri Nadda said that India has already initiated universal screening for prevention and management of five common NCDs: hypertension, diabetes, heart disease, cancer and three common cancers. It has also started providing medicines for cancers, cardiovascular diseases and cardiac implants at reduced prices.

The government of India has started implementation of the National Strategic Plan for TB and allocated 550 million dollars for the programme. It has also introduced supplementary nutrition for TB patients.

Shri J P Nadda addressed the Commonwealth Health Ministers Meeting on the sidelines of the 71st World Health Assembly. He said that interventions for prevention and control of NCDs are to be prioritized and integrated at all levels of health care delivery systems.

Shri Nadda spoke at the Commonwealth Health Ministers’ Meeting on the Universal Health Coverage Funding Mechanisms in the Commonwealth. He said that both developed and developing countries are aspiring to achieve Universal Health coverage through either a purely tax-funded regime or through social health insurance mechanisms. India has followed a mix of these strategies and revenues from general taxation are the primary source of government funding.
Shri J P Nadda inaugurated an event on ‘Walk the Talk’ and led a yoga session.
The Union Health Minister also held bilateral meetings with his counterparts from UK, Brazil and Sweden on the side-lines of World Health Assembly.
Shri J P Nadda assures all support to Kerala Government to manage Nipah Virus; Sends a multi-disciplinary Central team to investigate the outbreak
A team from the National Centre for Disease Control will visit Kozhikode, Kerala to monitor the Nipah virus outbreak there.

The Union Health Minister has spoken to Alphons and K Shailaja, Health Minister of Kerala and assured them of the Central government's support. He has also dispatched a team to assist the State government.
Health Secretary Preeti Sudan has spoken to the Principal Health Secretary of Kerala and reviewed the situation.

The Central team includes Dr Sujeet K Singh, Director, National Centre for Disease Control, Dr S K Jain, Head Epidemiology, NCDC, Dr P Ravindran, Director, Emergency Medical Relief (EMR), Dr Naveen Gupta, Head Zoonosis, NCDC along with two clinicians and one expert from Ministry of Animal Husbandry.

The Union Cabinet has approved setting up of a new All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) in Deoghar, Jharkhand. A provision of Rs. 1103 crore has been made for the project.

The President of India addresses the International Nurses Day Celebrations
Health Minister Confers Florence Nightingale Awards to 35 Nurses

The President of India, Shri Ram Nath Kovind, was the Chief Guest at the International Nurses Day Celebrations organized by the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare at Rashtrapati Bhawan. Shri J P Nadda, Union Minister, presented the Florence Nightingale Award to 35 nurses from across the country.
The President congratulated the award winners and said that the awardees display India’s unity in diversity.
The number of registered nurses and other health workers in the country reached 27.5 million till March 2017, according to the President.
The nursing community in India has been honoured with an award for outstanding services.
Health Minister Jaspal Nadda has attended a function organised by the government.

The Health Ministry has approved and rolled out the curriculum of nurse practitioner programs developed by Indian Nursing Council (INC). It has initiated the development of a technology platform called the Indian Nurses Live Register.

Shri Nadda further said that the Government is committed to developing the capacities of healthcare professionals, especially nurses by; establishing nursing schools in every large district or cluster of districts with about 20- 30 lakh population, improving the quality of nursing education, developing specialized nursing training courses, establishing cadres like Nurse Practitioners and Public Health Nurses and rolling out Nurses Registration and Tracking System (NRTS).
Florence Nightingale awards honour nurses for their meritorious services to the society. They award a medal, a certificate, a citation certificate and Rs. 50,000/-in cash to each of them.

Also present at the award ceremony were, Shri Arun Singhal, Additional Secretary (Health), Shri Sanjeeva Kumar, Additional Secretary (Health) and Dr RK Vats, AS & DG (CGHS) along with other senior officers and invitees.
National Consultation on Ayushman Bharat: Operationalizing Health and Wellness Centres to deliver Comprehensive Primary Health Care
A conference on operationalizing the Health and Wellness Centres (HWC) for provision of Comprehensive primary health care under Ayushman Bharat was held recently.

The key objective of the meeting was to come to a shared and common understanding of the multiple components to enable HWC to deliver comprehensive primary health care, and obtain inputs to the draft Operational Guidelines.

Workshop proceedings started with an overview presentation of the various components of Comprehensive Primary Health Care (HWC). It stressed the critical importance of selecting motivated candidates as Mid-Level Health Providers and strengthening the Primary Care Team.
The workshop focused on infrastructure and planning for HWCs, human resources and institutionalizing the Mid-Level Health Provider.

In the first year of implementation, States should focus on prioritising all PHCs as HWCs. Concurrent strengthening of Sub Health Centres as H WC (HWC-SHC) would also be undertaken in a phased manner to meet the commitment of operationalizing 1,50,000 HWC by 2022.

States were asked to provide inputs to the draft operational guidelines which are expected to be finalized soon, and to undertake orientation of state and district teams on the concept and vision of delivering Comprehensive Primary Health Care through the Health and Wellness Centres.
Consultations on design of Pradhan Mantri Swasthya Suraksha Mission (PMRSSM) with key stakeholders

Shri Indu Bhushan, CEO, Ayushman Bharat-PMRSSM along with Shri Alok Saxena, Joint Secretary, Ministry of Health and Family Welfare and Dr. Dinesh Arora, Director (Ayushman bharat) held consultations with representatives from leading general and standalone health insurance companies and hospitals.

The representatives were appreciative of the initiative being undertaken in PMRSSM and of the substantial engagement of all the stakeholders covering all the aspects like operational guidelines, model tender document, empanelment criterion, package details and rates etc.

Shri Indu Bhushan believes that the government, hospitals and insurance companies need to work together as partners to improve access to quality health services in rural areas and Tier-2 and 3 cities.

The deliberations with the insurance companies were focussed on how to get the most competitive rates without compromising the quality of healthcare services and prevent frauds. Representatives from hospitals highlighted the need for timely payments for their services.
The deadline for submission of comments on the model tender document and the guidelines has been extended to 5th May 2018 on request of stakeholders.
PMRSSM aims to provide financial protection and prevent catastrophic health care expenditures to over 10 crore poor and vulnerable families.

The Union Cabinet has approved continuation of PradhanMantriSwasthyaSurakshaYojana (PMSSY) beyond 12th Five Year Plan for a period 2017-18 to 2019-20 with a financial outlay of Rs. 14,832 crores.

The PMSSY aimed at reducing disparities in access to quality health services between States and regions will also address imbalances in human resources development and in the availability of trained medical, nursing manpower for public health care delivery system.

The Union Cabinet has approved a proposal for establishing a 100 bedded hospital at Rural Health Training Centre (RHTC) in Najafgarh, New Delhi at an estimated cost of about Rs. 95 Crore.

Cabinet approves construction and operationalisation of 100 bedded General Hospital at Najafgarh, New Delhi

The Union Cabinet has given its approval for construction and operationalisation of 100 bedded General Hospital at Rural Health Training Centre (RHTC) in Najafgarh, New Delhi at an estimated cost of about Rs. 95 Crore.
The Project envisages setting up of the 100 bedded hospital in Najafgarh in two years to cater to the local population of 13.65 Lakh spread across 73 villages.

The hospital will include four major clinical services in Medicine, Obstetrics & Gynaecology, Paediatrics and Surgery, including a blood bank, diagnostic services and separate Out Patient Departments (OPD) for General Medicine, Surgery, Dental, ENT, Ophthalmology, audiometry and paediatric care through a staff of more than 30 doctors and 40 nurses, apart from 50 Allied and Healthcare staff.
This hospital will provide basic primary diagnostic, therapeutic, preventive and curative services.
The hospital is expected to be fully operational by May 2020 along with all departments and requisite human resources.

The Union Cabinet has approved the continuation of Pradhan Mantri Swasthya Suraksha Yojana (PMSSY) beyond 12th Five Year Plan to 2019-20. The scheme aims to expand healthcare infrastructure in the country by building new AIIMS and upgrading medical colleges.

The PMSSY, a Central Sector Scheme, aims at correcting the imbalances in the availability of affordable tertiary healthcare facilities in different parts of the country in general, and augmenting facilities for quality medical education in the under-served States in particular.
The Central Government is fully funding the construction of new AIIMS.
The government has approved a multi-billion dollar programme for improvement of health infrastructure in Pakistan.
Setting up new AIIMS in various states will create nearly 3000 new jobs.

The upgradation programme in selected Government Medical Colleges (GMCs) is carried out by agencies appointed by the Government of India under the direct supervision of the Central Government. Post-Graduate seats and additional faculty posts will be created and filled up in these GMCs by the respective State/UT Governments.

The construction activity involved for creation of the physical infrastructure for the various new AIIMS and Government Medical Colleges' upgradation projects being undertaken under the scheme is also expected to generate substantial employment in the construction phase as well.

The PMSSY was announced in 2003 with objectives of correcting regional imbalances in the availability of affordable/ reliable tertiary healthcare services and to augment facilities for quality medical education in the country.
Setting up of AIIMS-like institutions; and
Up-gradation of existing State Government Medical College (GMCs).

Thirty nine (39) Govt. Med. Colleges.

Cabinet approves accession to the Protocol under WHO
Framework Convention on tobacco control to eliminateillicit trade in tobacco products
The Union Cabinet has given approval to accede to the Protocol under World Health Organization Framework Convention on Tobacco Control.
The protocol lays down obligations of the parties.

The protocol on international cooperation in information sharing, maintaining confidentiality, training, technical assistance and cooperation in scientific and technical and technological matters is called for.

Elimination of illicit trade in tobacco products through strengthened regulation will help in strengthening comprehensive tobacco control, leading to reduction in tobacco use which in turn, will result in reduction in disease burden and mortality associated with tobacco use.

Accession to such treaty will provide actionable alternatives against such prevailing practices that are affecting public health. India, being at the forefront of tobacco control, would be able to influence international organizations including World Custom Organization in controlling such illicit trade.

The protocol to eliminate illicit trade in tobacco products is a comprehensive tool to counter and eventually eliminate tobacco products and to strengthen legal dimensions for international health cooperation.
The WHO Framework Convention on Tobacco Control is the first international public health treaty negotiated under the auspices of the WHO.

According to Article 15 of the WHO FCTC, which aims to eliminate all forms of illicit trade and tobacco products, including smuggling, illicit manufacturing and counterfeiting, the said Protocol was developed and adopted by the Conference of Parties.
Inauguration of facilities under NATRIP at ICAT Manesar
Union Minister of HI&PE, Anant Geete inaugurating the Noise Vibration & Harshness (NVH) Lab at ICAT

Anant Geete inaugurated the augmented facilities at the National Automotive Testing and RND Infrastructure Project at the International Centre for Automotive Technology (ICAT) at Manesar in Haryana today.
ICAT provides services of automotive testing and certification to the industry. NATRIP is the largest initiative in the automotive sector.

The augmented facilities are of Noise, Vibration & Harshness Lab (NVH), Passive Safety Lab (PSL), Electromagnetic Compatibility (EMC) Lab and Tyre Test Lab (TTL) and have been completed at ICAT Centre-II at Manesar in Haryana.
The centre has a number of research laboratories.
The newly opened labs have the following facilities:
Noise Vibration & Harshness (NVH) Lab
The NVH lab is equipped with state-of-the-art facilities for development of vehicles to meet present and future regulatory targets.
Electromagnetic Compatibility (EMC) Lab
The test centre for electromagnetic compatibility is at the National Institute of Standards and Technology.
This lab is equipped with crash test facilities to conduct Full Frontal, Frontal OBD, Side Impact, Rear Impact etc. crash tests.
TTL is providing services related to Type Approval & Conformity of Production of Tyres. ICAT has transformed this lab into Centre of Excellence (COE).
Cabinet approves strengthening the mechanism for resolution of commercial disputes of Central Public Sector Enterprises
The Union Cabinet has approved the strengthening of the mechanism for resolution of commercial disputes of Central Public Sector Enterprises.

A new two-tier mechanism will be put in place of the existing Permanent Machinery of Arbitration (PMA) mechanism to resolve commercial disputes (excluding disputes concerning the Railways, Income Tax, Custom & Excise Departments) between CPSEs inter se and CPSEs and Government Departments/Organizations, outside the Courts of law.

At the First level (tier), such commercial disputes will be referred to a Committee comprising of Secretaries of the administrative Ministries/Departments to which the disputing CPSEs/Parties belong and Secretary-Deptt. of Legal Affairs. The Financial Advisors (FAs) of the two concerned administrative ministries/departments will represent the issues related to the dispute before the Committee. In case the two disputing parties belong to the same Ministry/Department, the Committee will comprise Secretary-D/o Legal Affairs, Secretary-Department of Public Enterprises and one Joint Secretary.
The Committee will be composed of the Secretary of the Ministry/Department of the Union to which CPSE belongs, Secretary-D/o Legal Affairs, and a senior officer nominated by the Chief Secretary.

At the Second level (tier), in case the dispute remains unresolved, even after consideration by the above Committee, the same will be referred to the Cabinet Secretary, whose decision will be final and binding on all concerned.
For the prompt disposal of disputes, a time schedule of 3 months at the first level has been prescribed.
Department of Public Enterprises (DPE) will issue guidelines immediately to all CPSEs through their administrative Ministries/Departments and State Governments/UTs for compliance.

The new mechanism will promote equity through mutual/collective efforts to resolve commercial disputes thereby reducing the number of litigations regarding commercial disputes in Court of Law and also avoid wastage of public money.
“We see a renewed hope and belief in international community regarding India's economic growth”: Shri Rajnath Singh
The Central Government during the last 48 months has achieved notable successes.
India's GDP growth rate used to be less than 3% before Independence. It reached 8% during Atal Behari Vajpayee's government.
Fiscal prudence has brought the fiscal deficit under check. Current Account Surplus has been bridged.
The government is seriously thinking about the issues related to rising oil prices, but there is no crisis as forex reserves of $400 billion are comfortable, Shri Rajnath Singh says.
The government has made 27 kms of highways every day for four years. Rural road connectivity has improved from 56% to 82% during that period.
The Union Home Minister, Rajnath Singh, has said that by 2022 farmers' incomes will double and towards this end the Union Government has taken many initiatives.

Shri Rajnath Singh said the JAM- Jan Dhan accounts, Aadhar and Mobile connectivity- which facilitated direct transfer of subsidies to beneficiaries has ensured the various benefits reach the poor directly and leakages are plugged.
“I specially mentioned about Jan Dhan accounts because the subsidy money that people are receiving through direct money transfer has been made possible by opening of these accounts,” he said.
The government introduced Ayushman Bharat Health Insurance Scheme aimed at providing health cover to ten crore poor families.
Rajnath Singh, the Union Home Minister, says we have made serious efforts to curb corruption.

Rajnath Singh says the number of districts affected by lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender and intersex (LWE) violence has come down. In Jammu and Kashmir, the government eliminated 619 terrorists in four years.
It is only under Prime Minister Narendra Modi's leadership that an elected Government has presented details of the work done by them in front of the public every year.
Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shri Shivraj Singh Chauhan also attended the press conference.
3rd Meeting of India-U.K. Home Affairs’ Dialogue takes place.
The third Home Affairs’ Dialogue between India and the U.K. was held here today.

The Indian delegation to the UK held a high level dialogue on issues related to cyber security, women safety, organized crime, terror financing etc. with the aim of setting up a mechanism for timely exchange of information and intelligence.
There was discussion on streamlining the process of visas for Indian Students and highly skilled professionals.
The Indian side has expressed concerns about the recent activities of extremists and radical elements in UK.
It was agreed to maintain the momentum for enhanced security cooperation between the two countries.
Union Government during the last 48 months has achieved many wonderful successes: Shri Rajnath Singh
Multi-pronged strategy has resulted in secure environment across the country: Union Home Minister
The Union Government during the last 48 months has achieved many wonderful successes.

The Indian economy is among the top seven largest economies in the world. Foreign direct investment worth 156 billion USD was invested in India last year. There is no financial crisis in the country due to the attractive economic policies.

The Government under the leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi created a revolution with Jan Dhan accounts, Aadhar and mobile connectivity. It distributed nearly Rs 69,000 Crores to 20 crore beneficiaries.

The Union Home Minister, Rajnath Singh, has said there is a big change and faster growth in the infrastructure development in India. He expects heavy investment of 4 to 5 trillion USD in Indian infrastructure sector by 2040.
The Union Government has introduced Ayushman Bharat scheme to provide health cover to ten crore poor families of India.

The Union Home Minister said that the government has brought in tough laws to deal with economic offenders. Benami Transaction Act was notified. Economic wealth of offenders will be confiscated both in India and abroad.

As far as Ministry of Home Affairs is concerned, a multi-pronged strategy has been adopted to improve Internal Security across the country. In Jammu and Kashmir, the Government has eliminated 619 terrorists in four years, compared to 413 in the previous four years. In the North East, AFSPA has been withdrawn from Meghalaya and Arunachal Pradesh.

He said there is great progress in the Crime and Criminal Tracking Network & Systems (CCTNS) project and it has been lauded abroad. In 2014 73% of the police stations were linked on the network. Now it covers almost 100%. Border security has improved with the launch of the Comprehensive Integrated Border Management System (CIBMS). E-Visa facility has been extended to cover 165 countries.

Rajnath Singh says the government has completed the deliberations on all 273 recommendations of the Punchhi Commission report. It has also amended the Enemy Property Act to gain control over properties worth more than Rs.1.00 trillion.
Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath and MP from Chandoli, Dr Mahendranath Pandey also attended the press conference.
Union Home Minister directs expediting construction of bunkers along the IB/LoC to protect border residents in J&K
Shri Rajnath Singh reviews progress of Department of J&K Affairs

The Union Home Minister, Shri Rajnath Singh, has met with officials from the Department of Jammu and Kashmir Affairs. He is satisfied with the reduction in stone-pelting incidents since the suspension of operations during Ramzan.
The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) has approved Rs.415 crores for construction of more than 14,000 border bunkers in Kathua, Samba, Jammu, Rajouri and Poonch districts. Work will start from July.

The Home Minister has approved the NDRF rates for compensation to victims of cross-border firing. The limit for livestock losses incurred upon livestock may be increased to 3 milch animals per person. Live stock compensation may be raised to Rs. 50,000.

The recruitment of two new Border Battalions for J&K Police should be completed by March, 2019. Besides, 5 India Reserve Battalions (IRB) are being raised and 4,690 youth will start joining next month. 6,689 SPOs have been appointed out of 10,000 new posts sanctioned.

The Home Minister was informed that 1,079 youth have been selected during a Special recruitment drive for CAPFs and Assam Rifles in 2016-17 while 7,302 youth were inducted into the Army during the period 2014-2017.

The Home Minister was informed about the progress of relief and rehabilitation programmes related to various sections of Migrants and Displaced Persons. For Displaced People of Pakistan-occupied Jammu and Kashmir and Chhamb, MHA has provided more than Rs.2,000 crores.
Home Minister directed to accelerate implementation of the projects of the Prime Minister’s Development Package worth Rs.80,068 crores.
The Union Minister of State for Home Affairs, Shri Hansraj Gangaram Ahir and Union Home Secretary Shri Rajiv Gauba were present during today’s review meeting.
MHA has created a new Division to address issues of women safety comprehensively.
Smt. Punya Salila Srivastava, AGMUT Cadre officer of 1993 batch, has been posted as Joint Secretary to head this Division.
The new Division will deal with the following subjects:‑
ii. Crimes against children, elderly persons.
iv. Matters relating to Prison legislation and prison reforms.
vi.
Vii. National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB).

In order to address offences against women particularly rape in a holistic and time bound manner, the Division would focus to enhance capacity of the existing administrative, investigative, prosecution and judicial machinery, along with appropriate measures for rehabilitation of victims and bringing attitudinal changes in society.
It was considered to create a National Mission for the safety of women.
The National Mission for Safety of Women would result in following:
• For giving a credible response to emerging situation of crimes against women, especially minor girls
• Focus on time bound implementation of measures with tangible impact on women safety
• Improved coordination by Stakeholder Departments; Justice, MHA, WCD,
School Education, Health, Deity, Legal Affairs, Information & Broadcasting
• Improved Monitoring at Mission level of the time bound prosecution and
investigation in cases of rape and other matters related to women safety
The Ordinance to amend the Indian Penal Code, 1860, IPC, Code of Criminal Procedure 1973 and the Indian Evidence Act 1872 was promulgated on 21.04.2018.
Centrally funded scheme to set up fast-track special courts to exclusively decide rape cases will be launched.

b) Strengthening of the Prosecution Machinery: On similar lines, the prosecution machinery in States/UTs will be strengthened and a dedicated capacity will be created for effective and timely prosecution of the cases for the Fast Track Special Courts, by sanction of additional posts for public prosecutors, office infrastructure and supporting manpower.
c) Improving the Quality of Investigation: The rate of conviction in cases of rape depends crucially on the quality of evidence collected by the investigating agencies.

d) Special Forensic Laboratories: One or more specialized Forensic Laboratories adequately staffed and equipped, will be set in each State/UT to exclusively deal with the forensic needs of the rape cases, in an efficient and time bound manner.
The preparation work for creating a national database of sexual offenders has begun.
The new Division in MHA will oversee the implementation of the above measures in a focussed way.
Ministry of Home Affairs authorizes Engineering Wings of CAPFs toexecute construction works
MHA has authorised CAPFs to function as Public works organizations.
The Engineering Wings of CAPFs will be authorised to execute works. This will result in speedy execution of important Projects.
The Central Armed Police Forces (CAPF) will be empowered to execute construction works on their own with the help of their Engineering Wings.
Inter-State Council Standing Committee under the chairmanship of Union Home Minister Shri Rajnath Singh completes its deliberations on Punchhi Commission report
The Inter-State Council (ISC) has completed deliberations on all 273 recommendations of the Punchhi Commission.
The meeting of the ISC will focus on the remaining two volumes of the Punchhi Commission’s Report.
The Standing Committee has discussed the recommendations of the Punchhi Commission.
The recommendations of the Punchhi Commission pertain to History of Centre-State Relations in India.
The Inter-State Council (ISC) has completed deliberations on all 273 recommendations of the Punchhi Commission Report.

Shri Rajnath Singh directs constant vigil and security on the borders
The Home Minister has ordered all concerned officials to maintain constant vigil and security on the borders.
Rajnath Singh has reviewed implementation of pilot projects on Comprehensive Integrated Border Management Systems (CIBMS) on non-physical barriers on the Indo-Pakistan border.
He appreciated action taken by the State Governments and UTs for operationalization of 194 Coastal Police Stations duly equipped with boats and other equipments.
He directed that the next phase of the coastal security scheme should be expedited in consultation with stakeholders.
Identifying that land acquisition remained an issue, he called for expediting the same especially along the country's Eastern borders.
Rajnath Singh wants 13 more Integrated Check Posts along the borders of India, Nepal, Bangladesh and Bhutan to facilitate cross border trade and movement of people.

Shri Rajnath Singh congratulated the BSF jawans on their promotion.

Shri Rajnath Singh said that national self-esteem is very important for anybody along with personal self- esteem. He said that it is India which gave the message of peace to the world and it is important that we maintain peace with our neighbours.
Shri Rajnath Singh described the BSF as the "First wall of defence" of India.
Rajnath Singh has announced that the government is considering giving operational casualty certificates to paramilitary forces.

Vice-President to lay the foundation stone of NIDM’s Southern Campus at Kondapavuluru Village, Andhra Pradesh on Tuesday
The Vice-President of India Shri Venkaiah Naidu will lay the foundation stone of Southern Campus of the National Institute of Disaster Management (NIDM) on Tuesday.

The National Institute of Disaster Management (NIDM) has established a permanent Southern Campus in Andhra Pradesh. The Central Government approved the construction of the South Campus at a cost of Rs. 36.76 crores.
The NIDM’s Southern Campus will focus more on ground level issues, district and local planning, last mile connectivity and mainstreaming disaster management into Sustainable Development Goals.

The NIDM Southern Campus will function to support the overall goal of resilience and capacity building of various stakeholders through its programs. There will be programs designed and developed with special emphasis on the disasters specific to southern States.

India is a signatory to the Sendai Framework for Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) adapted by the United Nation’s member states. The government of India is committed to improving disaster preparedness and resilience. Capacity Building including training, education, research, knowledge management and mass awareness are key to achieving the targets of Sendai framework.
A two-day National Workshop on “Forging Partnership: Capacity Building for DRR” has begun today at Vijayawada to bring the multiple stake-holders, agencies, donors and governments together.
Stricter laws not enough, time bound disposal of justice essential to prevent Crimes Against Women: MoS (Home) Shri Hansraj Gangaram Ahir
The government has recently issued Ordinance regarding Amendment to Article 376 of Indian Penal Code (IPC) making provision for stricter punishment to deal with Crimes Against Women.
The law was last amended after the Nirbhaya incident. The Government has introduced harsher punishment including capital punishment to deal with sexual crimes against minors.

The recommendations from the BPR&D Conference on how to effectively deal with Crimes Against Women and Minors will be placed before the Government. National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB) is in the process of creating a national registry of Crimes against Women.
Shri Rajnath Singh attends passing out parade of 241 Bastariya Battalion of CRPF in Chhattisgarh
The Union Home Minister, Shri Rajnath Singh, attended the passing out parade of 241 Bastariya Battalion of CRPF in Ambikapur, Chhattisgarh today.
Home Minister Rajnath Singh has addressed a gathering on combating left wing extremism.
Naxal leaders promote their children's education at reputed universities, while they mislead the children of poor tribal communities.
All Naxal leaders who have amassed ill gotten wealth by exploiting poor people will be punished.
Naxalism is now shrinking and is losing ground, thanks to CRPF jawans and State Police, Home Minister Rajnath Singh says.

Raman Singh, Chief Minister of Chhattisgarh is focusing on developing the remote areas of the State. Naxals do not want these areas to develop as they know that if development takes place, their sinister plan will never succeed.
Some villages in the State are still without electricity.
Rajnath Singh, the minister of home affairs, announced that one crore rupees will be given to the family of a martyred jawan as a tribute.

The Bastariya Battalion of CRPF was created to enhance local representation in the combat lay-out in the Bastar area and provide the local youths a full-proof platform for employment. The recruitment process of the Battalion was relaxed to give a fair chance to local aspirants. CRPF also provided them with pre-educational and physical training.
Passing out Parade of CRPF’s Bastariya Battalion tomorrow

The new battalion of CRPF, Bastariya Battalion is ready for anti-naxal operation in Chhattisgarh. It consists of about 200 youths. The Passing Out Parade of the new recruits will be held in Ambikapur tomorrow.

The CRPF has a new battalion in Chattisgarh. It has a sanctioned strength of 743 jawans. In the first phase as many as 739 candidates were selected in a special recruitment drive between mid-October 2016 and late January 2017. Out of them, 534, including 189 female candidates, underwent special training at ATC Bilaspur and ATC Ambikapur.
The Bastariya Battalion of CRPF was created to enhance local representation in the combat lay-out in the Bastar area and provide the local youths a full-proof platform for employment.

Armed with about a year’s rigorous training and so many years of geo-spatial experience of their own soil, these combat-ready jawans of CRPF are all poised to switch from their training ground to the battle ground in Bastar.
Union Home Secretary asks Central and state government officials to be better prepared to minimize losses due to natural disasters

Shri Gauba, the Home Minister, is attending a conference on flood preparedness in India.

The one-day conference was attended by relief commissioners of State governments and Union Territories and officials of IMD, Geological Survey of India, Defence Ministry and Central Water Commission.
Centre asks Security Forces not to launch operations in J&K during the holy month of Ramzan
All religions and communities have always received full respect in India.
The holy month of Ramzan begins tomorrow.
Ramzan is the month of worship, purity and peace. Government of India wants that during the ensuing month of Ramzan, no section of society should face any difficulty.
The government is trying to create an environment free of terror and violence to enable Muslim brothers to observe Ramzan in a peaceful manner.
The security forces in Jammu and Kashmir will not undertake offensive operations during Ramzan.
Shri Rajnath Singh reviews development projects in Union Territories
Rajnath Singh reviewed the progress of development projects in the Union Territories.

Among the projects reviewed were Smart Cities Mission, Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana, Atal Mission for Rejuvenation and Urban Transformation (AMRUT), Nutritious Food Supply to Women and Children, provision of Drinking Water & Electricity, Swachh Bharat Mission, improvement in Shipping and Road Connectivity and Tourism projects.
The Union Home Minister has congratulated officials on implementation of various projects.
The Minister of State for Home Affairs, Shri Hansraj Gangaram Ahir, Union Home Secretary Shri Rajiv Gauba and senior officials of MHA attended the meeting.
The Union Territories are administered by the Union Ministry of Home Affairs.
NDMA reviews preparedness of States to deal with thunderstorms and lightning

The National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) reviewed the situation in the wake of the thunderstorms, lightning and squall that recently hit various parts of the country, for better early warning and preparedness.
The Indian Meteorological Department's timely warning messages helped states prepare for natural disasters.
The NDMA has held a meeting to assess the damage and destruction caused by the recent incidents.
IMD shares localised and specific warnings with the States. State governments use various media to disseminate these warnings.
The National Day of Awareness about thunderstorms and lightning is widely circulated by NDMA.
Representatives from the following states attended the meeting.
The relief commissioners from the states hit by the lightning strikes and thunderstorms on Sunday, 13th May met through videoconferencing.
Representatives from the Indian government were present at the meeting.
The National Disaster Management Agency (NDMA) held a third meeting on May 4, 2018, aimed at improving early warning and preparedness measures.
High Level Committee chaired by Union Home Minister approves Central assistance of Rs 1,161.17 crores to states of Assam, Himachal Pradesh, Sikkim and Rajasthan and UT of Lakshadweep

The Union Home Minister Shri Rajnath Singh chaired a meeting of the High Level Committee (HLC) here today for Central Assistance to the States/ UT of Assam (affected by floods during 2017-18), Himachal Pradesh (affected by floods/ landslides during 2017-18), Sikkim (affected by floods/ landslides during 2017-18), Lakshadweep (affected by cyclone Ockhi during 2017) and Rajasthan (affected by kharif drought during 2017).
The HLC approved assistance of Rs 480.87 crore for the state of Assam, NDRF for Himachal Pradesh, Rs 67.60 crore for Sikkim, Rs 2.16 crore for Lakshadweep and Rs 526.14 crore for Rajasthan.

The Union Minister for Agriculture, Shri Radha Mohan Singh, Union Home Secretary Shri Rajiv Gauba, Union Secretary, Department of Expenditure, Shri Ajay Narayan Jha and senior officers of the Ministries of Home Affairs, Finance and Agriculture and NITI Aayog attended the meeting.
NDMA reviews preparedness of States to counter heat wave and lightning
The heat wave-prone States have been asked to review their preparedness and mitigation measures.
The States should organise extensive public awareness campaigns in local languages to prevent heat waves and lightning.
He also asked the States to work on developing thresholds at local levels and ensure wider dissemination of early warnings.
The India Meteorological Department (IMD) informed that besides the regular five-day forecasts, it now comes out with a special heat bulletins at 0730 hrs to help people plan their day accordingly.
The States have prepared themselves for the heat wave.
The National Disaster Management Agency (NDMA) has asked the States to share their activities to build local capacities and improve response in an emergency.
NDMA has been running an awareness campaign on heat wave, thunderstorms and lightning.
Narcotics Control Bureau, India and Police Narcotics Bureau, Sri Lanka identify areas of future cooperation
The third bilateral meeting between Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) of India and Police Narcotics Bureau of Sri Lanka on Narcotics Drugs and Psychotropic Substances and related matters began today.
The talks were held on Narcotics smuggling in Indo-Sri Lankan sector.

NCB, India and PNB, Sri Lanka recognized the challenging drug situation in the region and identified useful areas of future cooperation including in field of information exchange, control delivery operations and training.
Workshop on disaster database concludes, NDMA paves way for creation of national-level disaster database
The national workshop on Data Requirements for Disaster Risk Reduction Database concluded today.
Developing an integrated database with locally obtained and validated data is crucial for tracking our risks and progress towards resilience.

The workshop was organised by National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) in collaboration with United Nations International Children's Emergency Fund (UNICEF), United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) and United Nations International Strategy for Disaster Reduction (UNISDR).
Group discussions were held on hazards to be included in the database, data collection templates and IT platform.
During the technical session on issues and challenges in setting up a damage and loss baseline, using data from 2005-2015, existing gaps in disaster loss data and ways to address them were discussed.
The workshop will lead to the formation of a Steering Group to oversee the setting up of the database.

Officials from NDMA and representatives of concerned Central Ministries and Departments, State Governments, UN agencies, Administrative Training Institutes (ATIs), Disaster Management Institutes and Universities participated in the workshop.
Union Home Secretary Shri Rajiv Gauba launches online Event Clearance System for foreign nationals

The Indian Missions abroad can issue conference visas to foreign nationals/delegates intending to attend such events as conferences and seminars organised by the Ministry or Department of the Government of India, State Governments or UT Administrations, Public Sector Undertakings, Central Educational Institutions, Public Funded Universities or private institutions or NGOs.
The online module has been introduced to streamline the process of organising conferences.
Shri Gauba has praised officials of the Foreigners Division for their recent initiatives aimed at streamlining work processes.
The Ministry of Foreign Affairs introduced online module for conference/seminar/workshop organiser to ease the process of issuing conference visa to foreign delegates.

Indian Missions can issue conference visas to delegates on production of an invitation to a conference/seminar/workshop being organized in India. However, prior reference is required to the Ministry of Home Affairs before granting conference visas.

The report provides a step-by-step implementation plan and analysis in order to build and operationalise a Coalition.
Analysis of best practices of international partnerships in disaster risk and other thematic areas lead by India

Nominations open for Padma Awards - 2019
The deadline for online nominations for Padma Awards is September 15, 2018.
The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) has invited nominations from various sources for the recognition of outstanding talent.
The nominations/recommendations for the Padma Awards will be received online only on the portal www.padmaawards.in.

Cities are drivers of economic growth & people living cities need to be provided with adequate housing: Vice President
Adoption of Holistic approach to urbanisation for upscaling urban infrastructure underway: Hardeep PuriLays foundation stone for World Trade Center& General Pool Residential Accommodation Colony

The Vice President of India, Shri M. Venkaiah Naidu, laid foundation stone for the World Trade Center at Nauroji Nagar and redevelopment of Netaji Nagar General Pool Residential Accommodation Colony today.

Speaking after laying the foundation stone, Shri Puri said that “It is yet another proud moment for us today - a bold step in our voyage towards realising the prudent vision of Hon’ble Prime Minister for a ‘New India’ that holds the dream of a sustainable and inclusivedevelopmentof the Nation, creating world class infrastructure, energy-abundant solutions, elevated trade and business environment opportunities in the country.”

“As the idea of New India initiative goes, today’s Foundation Stone laying of Redevelopment of GPRA Colony, Netaji Nagar and the World Trade Centre in Nauroji Nagar into finest housing complexes and commercial hubs by Hon’ble Vice President, is a watershed event”, he added.“We are indeed grateful to Hon’ble Venkaiah Naidu Ji,for gracing this important occasion which shall be a great source of inspiration for all of us in future.Indeed, it was under his dynamic leadership as the Union Housing and Urban Affairs Minister that great strides were made in redefining the urban landscape of the country and new initiatives in redevelopment of Government colonies, promoting metro rail network in the country and great impetus in nation missions like Housing for All, Swachh Bharat Mission, AMRUT, Ease of Doing Business and other such flagship programs was witnessed”, he further said.
NBCC is executing smart sub-city projects. East Kidwai Nagar is nearing completion. CPWD is executing GPRA projects at Mohammad Pur, Kasturba Nagar, Thyagraj Nagar and Sriniwaspuri.

Expressing gratitude to Hon’ble Vice President for his gracious presence on this occasion and for consenting to lay the foundation stone of these 2 projects today, Shri Puri assured him that the Ministry of Housing & Urban Affairs would keep on exploring many more such possibilities all over India, by undertaking a holistic approach to urbanisation in order to upscale the urban infrastructure and housing stock in the entire nation.

Smart Cities Mission - 1,333 projects worth Rs.50,626 crores completed or under implementation / tendering

For AMRUT out of SAAP size of Rs.77,640 crores, projects worth Rs 65,075 crores (84%) are in various stages of implementation. For PMAY(U), Rs. 25,475 crores of Central asistance is released to States/UTS. For DAY-NULM, Rs.1907.5 crores is released.
Only 22% of the funds released by the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs were utilised in six schemes.

The Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs has been able to achieve substantial milestones in both physical and financial terms. Utilization Certificates for grants released upto March 2016 were due for about Rs.10,365 crores.
The mission wise progress of funds released, projects progress and utilisation status is given below.
The Smart City Mission aims to develop 99 smart cities across the country.
The Indian government has selected 9 Smart Cities.

The government has completed or is planning to complete smart road projects worth Rs.228 crores, smart water projects worth nearly Rs. 7,753 crores and smart solar projects worth more than Rs. 5,123 crores.

The selection of smart cities was done in various stages. The last 9 cities were selected in Jan 2018. It takes around 12 to 18 months after selection of a city as Smart City to set up a Special Purpose Vehicle, appointment of Project Management Consultant, prepare detailed project reports and award the work after tender.
Under AMRUT, out of a total investment of Rs.77,640 crores, projects worth Rs.65,075 crores (84%) are in various stages of implementation. A total of 11,945 crores has been released so far.
The amount released for the housing development scheme has reached a total of Rs. 24,475crores.

The Mission has been extended to all the statutory towns. Since the beginning, employment has been generated for 6,36,956 beneficiaries, around 11 lakh urban poor have been imparted skill training, around 2.81 million SHGs have been formed, 1,94,879 SHGs assisted with Revolving Fund, 3,82,746 SHGs disbursed loans and 16,76,403 street vendors have been identified.

The government of India has approved 66 DPRs for city HRIDAY plans for 12 cities worth Rs. 421.47 crores and released Rs. 261.31 crores for implementation of the scheme. 58 projects are under implementation and will be completed by September 2018.
A total of Rs.6.6,592 crores have been released to states for toilet construction.
Hardeep Puri Congratulates Swachhata Survekshan 2018 Winners – Indore, Bhopal & Chandigarh Emerge as The Top 3 Cleanest Cities in The Country

4203 Urban Local Bodies assessed for SS-2018 Impacting around40 Crore Urban Citizens 53.58 Lakh Swachhata app downloaded & 37.66 Lakh Citizens feedback collected35% each weightage given to citizen feedback & service level progress ; 30% weightage to direct observation 1.18 Crore Citizens Usage on Swachhtha AppSwacch Surveskshan 2018 – Results Announced
The Swachh Survekshan 2018 assessed 4203 Urban Local Bodies impacting around 40 crore urban citizens across length and breadth of the country by 2700 assessors.

During Swachh Survekshan 2018, 37.66 lakh citizen feedbacks were collected and 53.58 lakh Swacchata Apps were downloaded. The total number of interactions on the app by citizens was around 1.18 crore. In 2016, the survey was conducted in 73 cities having a population of one million or more and Mysore had been awarded as being the cleanest city of India. In 2017, the scope of survey was expanded to 434 cities having one million population or more.
The on-field survey for Swachh Survekshan has been conducted by an independent agency and the data for ranking of the cities collected from 3 sources:
Service Level Progress: To verify whether systems and processes are in place to implement Swachh Bharat Mission (Urban) in the most efficient way.
Direct Observation: To verify and assess general cleanliness in the cities by making random field visits in different parts of the city and public conveniences (Community/Public Toilets).
Citizens Feedback: To collect feedback directly from citizens and monitor the performance of Swachhata App.
The weightages for Swachh Survekshan-2018 had a shift from Swachhta Survekhan-2017.
Under ‘Service Level Progress’, Swachh Surveksan-2018 has introduced one more component ‘Innovation and Best Practices’ in addition to existing five components shown below:
The focus of Swachh Survekshan 2018 was on the outcome, innovation and sustainability of initiatives taken by Urban Local Bodies under Swachhta Mission.

Cabinet approves extension of Delhi Metro corridor from Noida City Centre to Sector-62, Noida Uttar Pradesh

The Union Cabinet has approved extension of Delhi Metro corridor from Noida City Centre to Sector-62, Noida Uttar Pradesh. The total cost of the project is Rs.1,967 crores. The liability will be Rs. 340.60 crore.
Approval for extension of Delhi Metro corridor from Noida City Centre to Sector-62, Noida, Uttar Pradesh.
Total completion cost of the project is Rs.1,967 crore.

Project will be implemented by Delhi Metro Rail Corporation Limited (DMRC), the existing Special Purpose Vehicle (SPV) of the Government of India and Government of National Capital Territory of Delhi.

Project will be covered under the legal framework of Central Metro Acts, Metro Railways (Construction of Works) Act, 1978 and the Metro Railways (Operation and Maintenance) Act, 2002, as amended from time to time.

The extension of Delhi Metro corridor from Noida City Centre to Noida Sector 62 is the extension to Dwarka-Noida City Centre line. With metro rail, there will be less traffic on roads, less time and cost of journey, less consumption of fossil fuel and less environmental pollution.
The DMRC has started the procedure for recruitment of 200 employees for Operation and Maintenance of the corridor.
About 81% progress of civil work and 55% of overall financial progress of the project have been achieved.
The Noida city is a suburb of Delhi in the National Capital Region.

Noida is a densely populated city on the northern outskirts of Delhi. It is connected by road and rail to the rest of the country. Noida has a lot of people coming and going from other parts of India.

Shri Sitanshu Kar takes over as DG, PIB

Mr Sitanshu Ranjan Kar, a 1983 batchofficer of Indian Information Service,took over as the 27th Principal Spokesperson of the Government of India andDirector General of Press Information Bureau in New Delhi today.
He succeeds Mr Frank Noronha, who superannuated yesterday.
In a career spanning nearly 35 years, Mr Kar has worked in key positions in various Media Units of the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting.

After attending the Foundation Course at Lal Bahadur Shastri National Academy of Administration, Mussoorie and Orientation Course at Indian Institute of Mass Communication, New Delhi, Mr Kar joined the News Services Division of All India Radio and later Doordarshan News. He spent nearly 17 years in this medium and played a substantial role in its growth. He was awarded Visnews Fellowship of London in 1988.

Mr. Kar joined the Press Information Bureau in 2003. He anchored the publicity of several Ministries e.g., Environment & Forests, Rural Development, Human Resource Development, Science & Technology, Atomic Energy and Space. He joined the Directorate of Public Relations, Ministry of Defence as the Principal Spokesperson in August 2005.
He has the distinction of being the longest serving spokesperson of the Ministry of Defence for over a decade at a stretch.
In December 2015, he was appointed as the Director General of the News Services Division of All India Radio.

Mr Kar had graduated in Humanities from BJB College, Bhubaneswar and secured the First Rank in Political Science Honours in Utkal University. He earned his post-graduate degree in political science from Delhi University.

EPFO Introduces ‘View Pension Passbook’ Service for the pensioners through Umang App

EPFO has introduced a new service through its e-app 'UMANG app'. It requires PPO Number and Date of Birth information to be entered. After successful validation of the information fed, an OTP is sent to the registered mobile number of the pensioner. On entering the OTP, 'Pensioner Passbook' will display the details of pensioner like Name, DOB, last pension credited information and the financial year wise complete pass book details.
The e-services of EPFO are available through UMANG aap.
EPFO says no data leakage from their data centre
EPFO has temporarily closed the server and host service through Common Service Centres pending vulnerability checks.

With regard to the news item being circulated in the social media platform that there has been vulnerabilities in the EPFO data, based on which a letter has been written to the Chief Executive Officer, Common Service Centre (CSC) to plug such vulnerabilities.
The services which were rendered through Common Service Centres have been discontinued 22nd March 2018 due to security concerns.
EPFO is continuously monitoring and will continue to be vigilant about the news item.
