Union Minister for Road Transport and Highways Shri Nitin Gadkari and Minster for Labour & Employment Santosh Gangwar are celebrating International Labour Day.
Shri Gadkari inaugurated a number of new initiatives by EPFO and Central Labour Commissioner (CLC) at the programme organized by Ministry of Labour & Employment.

These include the Concurrent Audit Software launched by EPFO which will allow instantaneous real time audit of the transactions taking place in its centralized data base system including process of remittances, receipts and settlements of claims, payments of pension, transfer of PF accumulations.
Redevelopment project of Bhavishya Nidhi Bhawan, Malviya Nagar, New Delhi was inaugurated today.

Metlife Global Operations Support Centre and IDFC Bank Limited were felicitated as model employers in the exempted sector. Gujarat State Fertilizers Co. Ltd. (VP/BRD/5238) was felicitate in the un-exempted sector.

The two employers from Un-exempted sector are those who have more than 5000 employees and have made timely payment of Provident Fund dues in the previous 12 months and have outstanding contribution in providing ‘Aadhaar’ verified employee details.
The establishment has secured maximum score in 7 months since the introduction of online ranking system.

Many initiatives like Filing of online Annual Return under 8 labour laws on Shram Suvidha Portal (SSP); Transparent and accountable system of inspection through SSP; Issuing of Online Registration Certificates under BoCW act 1996, ISMW act 1979 and Contract Labour act 1970 were launched by CLC.
M/S the Leprosy Mission Community Hospital Nandnagri, Delhi, M/s Welspun India Ltd. Vapi, Gujarat and M/S Lucas TVS Puducherry have been selected by ESIC as model employers for felicitation.
At the occasion five construction workers were provided monetary benefits.
Shri Gadkari has launched a quarterly newsletter on child labour.
The programme was attended by representatives of labour organisations and International Labour Organisation.
Cabinet approves MoU between India and Morocco in the legal field

The Union Cabinet chaired by chaired by Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi has given its ex-post facto approval for signing of the MoU for cooperation in the legal field between India and Morocco, in order to share their experience and expertise in the field of law and legislation.

The MoU signed by India and Morocco will give opportunity to the lawyers, law students and other professionals to participate in seminars, symposiums and workshops arranged by authorities of India and Morocco.
Cabinet approves MoU between India and Suriname forcooperation in the field of electoral management and administration
The Union Cabinet has approved the Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between India and Suriname on cooperation in the field of electoral management and administration.
The MoU will promote bilateral cooperation, aimed at building technical assistance / capacity support for Suriname envisaging cooperation in the field of electoral management and administration.
Global Benchmarking helps National Aluminium Company Limited (NALCO) double its Net Profit
NALCO registers more than 100% growth from Rs.1342 crore in 2017-18 against Rs.669 crore last year

On achieving the global benchmark of low cost producer in Bauxite Mining and Alumina making, National Aluminium Company Limited (NALCO), a Navratna PSU under Ministry of Mines, Government of India, has proved its mettle by registering high in terms of both physical and financial performances.

According to the audited financial results for 2017-18, NALCO has registered more than 100% growth i.e., increase of more than Rs. 1342.19 crore compared to the previous financial year. In the 4th quarter of the same year, the Company has earned a net profit of Rs.257.06 crores. Net sales turnover for the year is 9,377 crn.
NALCO has achieved record production, highest sales and turnover in the year 2017-18. The company is introducing a new business model which will bring additional Rs.935 crore net profit.
Dr. Chand congratulated NALCO Collective on setting up Angul Aluminium Park and promoting micro and small industries downstream.
NALCO has been rated as the lowest cost producer of alumina in the World consecutively for the last 2 years.
Panchpatmali Bauxite mines of NALCO rated as the 2nd lowest cost producer in the World in 2017 as per report of Wood Mackenzie;aiming to become the lowest in FY 2018-19.
Bauxite Mines (North-Central block of Panchpatmali Mines) achieved 100% capacity utilization with transportation of 68.25 lakh MT for the second consecutive year.
Bauxite transportation from South block of Panchpatmali Mines is highest ever since inception.
Alumina Refineryachieved 100% normative capacity (i.e. 21.06 Lakh MT of alumina hydrate capacity.
Aluminium Smelter production consistently increasing over the last 5 years and achieved highest cast metal production of 4.26 lakh MT (in last 5 years), registering a growth of 9.8 % over last year.
CPP achieved ‘Net Power Generation’ of 6,547 MU, registering a growth of 7.9 % over previous year.
Wind Power: 4 wind power units at different location of the Country generated 252 MU against 206 MU last year, registering a growth of 22 %.
Five Star Rating for Panchpatmali Bauxite Mines by Ministry of Mines for 2nd consecutive year.
SCOPE Award of Excellence in Institutional category (Navratna/Maharatna) & SCOPE Meritorious Award for CSR from Hon’ble President of India.
National Energy Conservation Award in Aluminium Sector for the year 2017 from Bureau of Energy Efficiency (BEE).
In FY 2017-18, NALCO achieved highest net profit of Rs. 1342crore compared to Rs. 669crore in previous year.
Third highest Net Foreign Exchange Earning CPSE in the Country.
The net sales turnover for the year is Rs. 9,377 crore, a growth of 26% over last year. Export earning is highest ever since inception.
For 2017-18, the Company paid a dividend of 94% amounting to Rs. 908 crores to the government.
The government has paid 27,468 crore towards taxes, duties, royalties, dividends, dividend etc. till now.
In FY 2017-18 there will be a 23.5% increase in CAPEX over last year.
The project costed 5.540 cr. for the 5th stream Alumina Refinery at Damanjodi is expected to be completed in April 2021.
Development of Pottangi bauxite mines at Koraput, Odisha.Project cost included in 5th stream Refinery, Expected Completion: April,2022
The development of Utkal D&E coal mines at Angul, Odisha is estimated to cost Rs. 534 cr. Construction is expected to be completed in three years.
Upstream Integration of Caustic soda plant in JV with Gujarat Alkalies& Chemicals Limited (GACL) is estimated to cost 1.999 cr and is expected to be completed in 2020.
Estimated project cost: Rs. 100 cr, Expected starting: FY 2019-20.
The project to build a new Rs. 131 cr. capacity Alloy wire rod plant at Angul smelter will be completed in September, 2019.
Renewable Energy Projects:Two wind power plants of 25 MW capacity each in Tamilnadu. Estimated cost: Rs.310cr. Expected completion: 2019-20.

Efficiency Improvement Project:HRD-DCW in place of existing settler- washer at stream- 1,2,3 of Alumina Refinery to improve productivity and efficiency. Estimated project cost: Rs. 355 cr. Expected completion: FY 2020-21.
Establishment 6 lakh TPA brownfield Smelters in Odisha
Establishment 6 lakh TPA greenfield Smelters in Odisha
1320 MW Thermal power plant at Angul Odisha
Cluster of downstream units of Rolled Products / Foil / Wheel / Extrusion
KABIL (KhanijBidesh India Limited): JV Company with HCL and MECL to identify, acquire, develop, process and make commercial use of strategic minerals in overseas locations for supply in India.
JV Company with MIDHANI for establishment of high end aluminium alloy manufacturing plant for meeting the requirement of defence, aerospace, automotive and transport sector.
Upstream Integration: CT Pitch plant in JV with NINL in Odisha
The Company has a new Corporate plan with a new vision to develop a sustainable growth path.
It provides a roadmap for multi-fold growth in revenue to the sum of Rs.18, 171 cr and Rs.31,248cr by the year 2024 & 2032 respectively.
NALCO filed 35 patents, granted 15 of them and commercialized 5 of them.
Emmrion's defluoridation plant for treating effluent water of smelter plant and making it potable achieved success on commercial scale.
Waste to wealth creation is a business initiative of the company.
Corporate Social Responsibility:Wealth to Welfare
The CSR Expenditure for the year 2017-18 is Rs. 29 cr against the target of Rs. 27 cr.

Health Care: 2 full-fledged Hospitals and 8 Mobile Health Units accessible to people of periphery villages benefiting more than one million patients every year. Construction of modern Eye Hospital at Angul is in progress. AIIMS, Bhubaneswar is building Night Shelter for attendant of indoor patients and OPD patients availing long term treatment.
Indradhanush says that 855 children from Maoist-infested villages of Koraput have received free residential education in reputed schools.
‘BetiBachao, BetiPadhao’: Total 277 meritorious girl students of BPL category have benefitted till date under the scheme.
Two villages have been completed in Koraput district to make it ODF.
Mobile Medical Unit :5 in Angul & 4 in Damanjodi footfall morethan one lakh
PM’s Iconic Shrine Development Programme:
13 projects have been taken up at Shri Jagannath Temple, Puri & surrounding to upgrade the infrastructure & maintain cleanliness.
Both sides of VIP road in Puri were painted with thematic painting based on Jagannath culture.
Renovation and beautification of Gandhi Park is aimed at promoting eco-tourism.
Installation of clean water posts at different strategic location of Puri and renovation of museum inside Jagannath Temple is taken up.
Launch of battery-operated vehicle service free of cost for senior citizens, differently-abled passengers and sick people at Puri railway station.
428 local youth have been placed in various job roles by skilling them.
A Centre of Excellence for Skill Developmentwith simulator facility is being established at Bhubaneswar.
Shri Ram Nath Kovind, Hon’ble President of India, presented the National Geoscience Awards for the year 2017 to a host of dignitaries.
Shri Tomar received the award for excellence in geosciences from the President.
The National Geoscience Awards ceremony was organised by the Ministry of Mines.

Eleven National Geoscience Awards for the year 2017 were presented by the President to 22 geoscientists. Dr. ShibSankarGanguli, Indian Institute of Technology, Kanpur, received the Young Scientist Award for his meritorious contributions in the field of applied geoscience.
At the end of the function, a Group Discussion amongst the present and earlier awardees on the challenges faced by Indian Geoscience was held.
Cabinet approves MoU between India and Moroccoin the field of Mining and Geology
The Union Cabinet has given its approval to the signing of MoU between India and Morocco in the field of mining and geology.
India and Morocco have signed a MoU on geology and mining cooperation.
The MoU aims to strengthen cooperation between India and Morocco in the field of mining and geology.
NALCO inks MoU with Government of India for FY 2018-19
Sets 100% capacity utilization in Alumina, Rs.1100 cr CAPEX & Higher Targets in production& productivity
The Ministry of Mines, Govt. of India and National Aluminium Company Limited (NALCO) have signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) setting revenue target of Rs 9350 crore for 2018-19.
The MoU has set a target of production of Alumina with 100% capacity utilisation and optimum Aluminium production of 4.15 lakh tonnes.

The Company has set a challenging CAPEX target of Rs.1100 crore for the year 2018-19. The CAPEX will be incurred in several projects like the 1 million tonne 5th stream of Refinery, Utkal-D&E coal blocks, wind power projects, JV projects and modernization & up- gradation of plant equipments. In another strategic move, targets have been set for assessment of employees and implementation of online human resource management system.
Cabinet approves Restructuring of the Indian Bureau of Mines (IBM) – creation, abolition & upgradation of posts of Joint Secretary-level and above
The Union Cabinet has approved the restructuring of Indian Bureau of Mines.
IBM plans to restructure its organization to improve its function in the regulation of the mineral sector.
The proposal will create direct employment opportunities for technical personnel with higher responsibility for contribution in development of mineral sector.
The upgradation, creation and abolition of certain posts of Joint Secretary-level in IBM consists of:
Creation of 1 post of Chief Controller of Mines in Level 15 and 3 posts of Controller of Mines in Level 14;

Upgradation of 11 posts i.e. 1 post of Controller General from Level 15 to 16, 2 posts each of Chief Controller of Mines and Director of Ore-Dressing from Level 14 to 15 and upgradation of 8 posts (5 posts of Controller of mines, 1 each Chief Mineral Economist, Chief Ore-dressing Officer and Chief Mining Geologist) from Level 13A to 14.
Abolition of 1 existing cadre post of Deputy Director General (Statistics), an officer of Indian Statistical Service in Level 14 in pay matrix.

IBM was set up by the Government of India in 1948 as an advisory body to help formulation policy and legal framework for mining sector and advising Central and State Governments on development and utilization of mineral resources.

Ministry of Mines had constituted a Committee for comprehensive 'Review and Restructuring of the Functions and Role of IBM' in the light of the 'National Mineral Policy' (NMP) 2008 The Committee submitted its report on 04.5.2012 which was accepted in the Ministry.
The Ministry of Mines has taken a number of initiatives through IBM for effective facilitation and regulation of the mineral sector:

implementation of the Sustainable Development Framework (SDF) and Star Rating of Mines for their efforts and initiatives encompassing the scientific, environmental and social aspects of the mining activity;

development of Mining Surveillance System (MSS) in association with Bhaskaracharya Institute of Space Application & Geo-informatics (BISAG) to detect illegal mining within 500 metres zone of lease boundary of major minerals using satellite imageries; and

thrust on R&D activities on mineral processing including process development for upgradation of low grade ore; (iv) development of IT enable Mining^ Tenement System (MTS) for computerizing the mineral sectors activities.
IBM has restructured its organisation to be able to take up the responsibilities entrusted in the role. IBM is also engaged in handholding the States for auction of mineral blocks.

The relocation of offices of IBM has already been effected. New Regional Offices at Raipur and Gandhinagar have been opened and the sub-regional office at Guwahati upgraded to a Regional Office. The existing Regional Office at Kolkata and Udaipur have been upgraded to the Zonal office (East) and Zonal Office (North). For the purpose of Skill Development, an Institute of Sustainable Development Frame Work at UdaIPur, a Remote Sensing Centre at Hyderabad, National Level Training Centres 'Institute of Sustainable Mining' at Koloata and 'Skill Development Centre' at Varanasi are being opened.
Secularism, Social-Communal Harmony and Tolerance is in the DNA of India: Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi

Union Minister for Minority Affairs Shri Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi today said that "secularism, social-communal harmony and tolerance" is in the DNA of India and compared to the entire world, constitutional, social, cultural and religious rights of minorities are more safe and secure in India.

During a meeting with a delegation of “Diocese of Delhi- Church of North India” Shri Naqvi said that the Central Government led by Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi is working with commitment to “Sabka Sath, Sabka Vikas” and “Development with Dignity” with complete honesty and without any discrimination.
The government has broken every barrier and is moving forward towards inclusive growth, according to Shri Naqvi.
Shri Naqvi said that Prime Minister Narendra Modi is working for all religions and castes without any discrimination. He praised the government's welfare schemes.

The Minister said that he regularly meets with various delegations of Minority communities to take a stock of ground reality to ensure that schemes aimed at their socio-economic-educational empowerment are implemented effectively.

The delegation led by Revd. Dr. Suresh Kumar, vice-president of Diocese of Delhi (CNI), comprised of people from various fields such as Revd Kamal Jerald Rodgers Mall, Revd Mohit Heinz Hitter, Mrs Anuradha Amos, Principal; Mrs Poornima Lall, Mrs K Sudha,  Ms Swati Paul, and Ms Olivia Biswas, Teacher.
Promotion and Progress of meritorious youths from Minority communities is the priority of the Government
Union Minister for Minority Affairs Shri Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi felicitated youths selected in civil services through Minority Affairs Ministry’s free-coaching

Union Minister for Minority Affairs Shri Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi said that the Ministry of Minority Affairs has been putting effective efforts for “promotion and progress” of meritorious youth from Minority communities.
Shri Naqvi congratulated the youth who have cleared civil services 2017 with the help of Minority Affairs Ministry's free-coaching programmes.

Shri Naqvi praised the success of Muslim youth in the UPSC. He said that there is immense talent in minority communities. Prime Minister Narendra Modi's government has given an atmosphere to protect and promote talent of youths from Minority communities.
Shri Naqvi says that for the first time in the history of the Central Government, record 131 youth from minority communities, including 51 Muslims, have been selected in the Civil Services.
The Minister of Minority Affairs has been running a large scale free-coaching programme for meritorious youths belonging to notified minority communities preparing for UPSC examinations.
This year, free-coaching will be provided to more than 15,000 youths from across the country for UPSC prelims.
National WAQF Conference Reviewed the Progress of WAQF Related Schemes and their Implementation
Union Minister for Minority Affairs Shri Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi Says- PMJVK will Accelerate the Utilisation of WAQF Properties for the Benefit of the Society

The Minority Affairs Ministry will construct schools, colleges, ITIs, skill development centres, multi-purpose community centres, hospitals, business centres, etc on waqf properties across the country.
The Union Cabinet approved a scheme to utilise Waqf properties for various infrastructure for socio-economic-educational empowerment of the society.

Shri Naqvi said that the rules governing Waqf properties are being simplified to improve their utilisation. He said that Central Government will award Mutawallis who will perform well in management of waqf property for betterment of the society especially educational empowerment of girls.
Shri Naqvi said that Central Waqf Council is providing financial help to state waqf boards for digitalisation of waqF records.

Shri Naqvi said that the Ministry of Minority Affairs and Central Waqf Council is also helping those institutes which are being established and those who are running on waqf properties and are engaged in educational activities especially educational empowerment of girls.
The National Waqf Conference was held in Islamabad.

The conference reviewed the status of “Quami Waqf Board Taraqqiati Scheme” implemented by Central Waqfi Council. It was clubbed together with two other schemes aimed at strengthening the financial resources of the State WaqF Boards.
The government has earmarked about Rs 48 crore for the "Quami Waqf Board Tarakkityat Yojana" aimed at creating a digital record of waqf properties.
Cabinet approvesrestructuring of Multi-sectoral Development Programme for its continuation during remaining period of 14th Finance Commission as Pradhan Mantri Jan Vikas Karyakram

Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs (CEEA) has approved renaming and restructuring of Multi-sectoral Development Programme (MsDP) as Pradhan Mantri Jan Vikas Karyakram (PMJVK). CCEA has also approved its continuation during the remaining period of the 14th Finance Commission.
The restructured programme aimed at improving infrastructure facilities for minority communities will be implemented more effectively.

The criteria for identification of Minority Concentration Towns and Clusters of Villages have been rationalized by lowering the population percentage criteria of Minority Communities and fulfilment of backwardness parameters in the following manners:-
The list of MCTs has been expanded.
The criteria for selecting Cluster of Villages with at least 25% minority population has been lowered.
· These rationalization of criteria would facilitate the inclusive growth of communities and social harmony,
The area to be covered under PMJVK would be 57% more than the existing MsDP.
The MsDP covered 196 district of the country whereas PMJVK will cover 308 districts of the country.
The Expenditure Finance Committee, Department of Expenditure, has recommended to continue the PMJVK programme at the cost of Rs. 3,972 cr. as per layout below.
Cabinet approves MoU signed between India and Francein the field of Renewable Energy

The Union Cabinet chaired by Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi has given its ex-post facto approval to the Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) signed between India and France in the field of Renewable Energy on 10th March, 2018 in New Delhi.

The National Institute of Solar Energy (NISE), India and Commissariat a I'Energie Atomique et aux Energies Alternatives (CEA), France signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) on co-operating on research and development in solar energy.
The MoU will help in strengthening bilateral cooperation between the two countries.
Cabinet approves between India and Morocco on India-Moroccocooperation in Renewable Energy
The Union Cabinet has given ex-post facto approval for the Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between India and Morocco on Cooperation in Renewable Energy.
Both sides have signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) on new and renewable energy issues.
The MoU will help in strengthening bilateral cooperation between the two countries.
MNRE issues National Wind-solar Hybrid Policy
The Policy provides framework for promotion of large grid connected wind-solar PV hybrid systemA scheme for new hybrid projects under the policy is also expected shortly.
Ministry of New and Renewable Energy has issued National Wind-Solar Hybrid Policy.
The Policy provides for integration of both the energy sources i.e. wind and solar at AC and DC level. It also provides for flexibility in share of wind energy components in hybrid project.
The Policy seeks to promote new hybrid projects as well as hybridisation of existing wind/solar projects.
The Policy provides for procurement of power from a hybrid project on tariff based transparent bidding process. It also allows for use of battery storage in the hybrid project.
The Hybrid Policy aims to improve availability and efficiency of renewable energy resources.
MoS Dr Jitendra Singh addresses press conference in Vijayawada
Minister highlights initiatives taken by the Government during last four years
The Centre is according importance to peripheral states like never before, according to the minister.

MUDRA, Ujjwala and Jan Dhan Yojana are success stories of the Central Government, according to the Minister. PMJDY is one of the world's largest financial inclusion programmes, and about 80% of adults and almost all households now have access to banking in the country, he added. GST brought 1.8 million more people into the tax net.

Dr. Jitendra Singh said that the latest researches need to synergize with the requirements to evolve an effective and efficient Counter-Insurgency strategy. He said that India's vision of ‘New India’ can become a success if ‘safe and secure’ India becomes the ‘mantra’. Cyber Security needs to be revisited with renewed vigor so that the country is not lagging in global technological advancement sphere.
The Minister of Andhra Pradesh interacted with the editors of news agencies and media.
The minister Dr. Jitendra Singh was speaking to radio jockeys in Vijayawada.

The Union Government allocated Rs. 64,000 cr for Development of National Highways in Andhra Pradesh state and a Naval Air Base will be established in Bobbili, Andhra state at a cost of Rs.3,300 cr. The Centre also provides 100% financial assistance to Polavaram Project and already provided a financial benefit of Rs 2,25,000 Cr to the state.
Shri E. Mariappan, ADG, PIB SCR explained about the achievements of 4 years of NDA government through a power point presentation at the press conference.
Dr Jitendra Singh visits DARPG premises during observation of Swachhata Pakhwada

The Union Minister of State for Development of North Eastern Region, Dr. Jitendra Singh visited the Department of Administrative Reforms and Public Grievances (DARPG) premises today. The DARPG is observing Swachhata Pakhwada from May 16 to 31, 2018.

The observance of Swachhata Pakhwada is a reiteration of commitment to cleanliness and hygiene. Since the Swachhta Action Plan was initiated, more than 7 crore toilets have been built across the country.
The Department has implemented 100 Swachhata Pakhwada.
Meenakshi Lekhi, MP (Lok Sabha) administered the Swachhta Pledge to the officers and staff of the Department on the occasion of launch of Swachhata Pakhwada on 16.05.2018.
The Appointments Committee of the Cabinet (ACC) has approved the following proposals:
Temporary upgradation of the vacant post of Additional Secretary in NSCS to Secretary level for a period of two years and designating the same as the post of Deputy National Security Advisor;
Shri Pankaj Saran, IFS (1982) is appointed as Deputy NSA for a period of two years.
MoS Dr. Jitendra Singh will visit the Department of Administrative Reforms & Public Grievances on Tuesday during Swachhata Pakhwada.

The Union Minister of State (Independent Charge) Development of North-Eastern Region (DoNER), Dr Jitendra Singh will visit the office premises of the Department of Administrative Reforms and Public Grievances (DARPG) at Sardar Patel Bhawan on Tuesday to see the implementation of the Swachhata Action Plan.

The Department carried out time bound activities during the Swachhata Pakhwada. The department has implemented 100% e-office. All records have been digitized and the physical files have been destroyed.
Meenakshi Lekhi, MP (LokSabha), New Delhi, administered the Swachhta Pledge to the officers and staff of the Department on the occasion of launch of Swachhata Pakhwada on 16.05.2018.
CVC calls for preventive vigilance to check malpractices
The Central Vigilance Commissioner (CVC) Shri K.V. Chowdary has called for preventive vigilance to check occurrence of corrupt practices.
Shri Chowdary, the chairman of the National Commission on Organized Crime, has said corruption is limited to a few areas.

The workshop on IT-based recruitment system, use of geospatial technology for infrastructure and planning, vehicle monitoring system, leveraging technology for preventive vigilance and digitising land records is being held.
Cabinet approves MoU between India and Singapore on Cooperation in the field of Personnel Management and Public Administration

The Union Cabinet chaired by chaired by Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi has approved signing of the Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between India and Singapore on Cooperation in the field of Personnel Management and Public Administration.

The MoU aims at improving the current system of governance, particularly in the areas of Workforce, Workplace and Jobs, Public Service Delivery, Human Resource Management, Public Sector Reform, Leadership/ Talent Development and E-Governance/Digital Government.
An MoU has been signed between India and Singapore on Public Administration and Governance Reforms.
It aims at achieving excellence in public administration, good governance and public service reform, which in turn, would ensure and promote greater public accountability.
The project aims to improve online public service delivery.

NDMA reviews preparedness of States to counter heat wave and lightning
The heat wave-prone States have been asked to review their preparedness and mitigation measures.
The States should organise extensive public awareness campaigns in local languages to prevent heat waves and lightning.
He also asked the States to work on developing thresholds at local levels and ensure wider dissemination of early warnings.
The India Meteorological Department (IMD) informed that besides the regular five-day forecasts, it now comes out with a special heat bulletins at 0730 hrs to help people plan their day accordingly.
The States have prepared themselves for the heat wave.
The National Disaster Management Agency (NDMA) has asked the States to share their activities to build local capacities and improve response in an emergency.
NDMA has been running an awareness campaign on heat wave, thunderstorms and lightning.
J&K Health Minister calls on Dr Jitendra Singh

Jammu & Kashmir Minister for Health & Medical Education, Dr Devinder Kumar Manyal, called on Union Minister of State (Independent Charge) of the Ministry of Development of North Eastern Region (DoNER), MoS PMO, Personnel, Public Grievances & Pensions, Atomic Energy and Space, Dr Jitendra Singh here today and discussed a wide range of issues related to healthcare and medical education in the State.

Dr Jitendra Singh brought to the notice of the Health Minister, the widely prevalent complaint of non-availability of doctors at various Primary Health Centres and also at several district hospitals. He suggested a mechanism to address the shortage of doctors.

Dr Jitendra Singh also referred to the Maharashtra pattern where any Medico, who wishes to leave the State after obtaining MBBS or MD degree from a State Medical College, is expected to deposit a heavy amount as compensation to the State ex-chequer, in lieu of the loss caused as a result of his departure from the State after obtaining a degree.
The State Government could depute its Physicians for short-term training to carry out dialysis for kidney patients.
During the meeting, the issue of having more transparency and accountability in allotment of fair price shops within hospital premises also came up.

Dr Manyal wants Dr Jitendra Singh's help in arranging Central funds for purchase of hi-tech equipment for the State-run hospitals and opening up a chain of generic medicine outlets at affordable prices.
Dr Manyal also gave Dr Jitendra Singh an update about the current status of the teaching faculty in the Government Medical Colleges of the State.
Smt. Meenakshi Lekhi, MP launches a project aimed at improving public hygiene.
Smt. Meenakshi Lekhi, MP (Lok Sabha), New Delhi, launched the “Swachhata Abhiyan” of the Department of Administrative Reforms and Public Grievances.
Smt. Lekhi, the chairperson of Public Grievances Authority, has called for better cleanliness in government offices.
The Department has prepared a chronological plan of activities during the ‘Swachhata Pakhwada’.
The Department has implemented 100% e-office and digitised all records.

The Union Minister of State (Independent Charge) Development of North-Eastern Region, Dr Jitendra Singh, MoS PMO, Personnel, Public Grievances & Pensions, Atomic Energy and Space, and a senior officer from M/o Drinking Water & Sanitation are scheduled to inspect the implementation of the Swachhata Action Plan at the office premises on May 29, 2018.
Bharatiya Mazdoor Sangh discusses Insurance and Pension related issues with Dr Jitendra Singh

A delegation of Bharatiya Mazdoor Sangh (BMS), represented by its Pratiraksha (Industrial) unit called on the Union Minister of State (Independent Charge) of the Ministry of Development of North Eastern Region (DoNER), MoS PMO, Personnel, Public Grievances & Pensions, Atomic Energy and Space, Dr Jitendra Singh here today and discussed wide range of issues related to Central Government employees, including Insurance, Pension, promotions and other matters.
The delegation to the BMS demanded the government to notify the customized Group Insurance Scheme for Central Government employees with low premium and high risk cover.
The memorandum expressed discontentment of a section of employees for being left out from the provision of minimum guaranteed pension under National Pension Scheme.
The delegation raised a number of issues, including one-time relaxation for compassionate appointments.
The delegation from India demanded better transfer policy in favour of single woman/single mother employees.

Dr Jitendra Singh said that he will direct the DoPT to process the issues related to them, while other issues related to other Ministries will be referred for the perusal and views of the respective Ministries.
Dr Jitendra Singh releases ‘Indian Guidelines for Diabetes Management’

The Union Minister of State (Independent Charge) of the Ministry of Development of North Eastern Region (DoNER), MoS PMO, Personnel, Public Grievances & Pensions, Atomic Energy and Space, Dr Jitendra Singh, who is also a nationally renowned Diabetologist, released here a compilation of "Indian Guidelines for Management of Diabetes Mellitus", prepared by "Research Society for Study of Diabetes in India" (RSSDI).

At a function held here and attended by RSSDI National President-elect Dr Rajeev Chawla, National Secretary Dr B.M. Makkar and all the National Executive Members, MoS Dr Jitendra Singh congratulated the office bearers of RSSDI on releasing a book on diabetes management.
The first set of guidelines for management of Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus was prepared in the 1990s by a team of medicos, of which Dr Jitendra Singh was a member.

In one of the RSSDI Annual Meetings nearly two decades ago, the theme was "Screening for complications at the time of diagnosis of Diabetes Mellitus". Dr Jitendra Singh is happy that the new guidelines released today have devoted sufficient attention and elaboration to this aspect.

The Prime Minister Narendra Modi recognized the importance of Yoga in the management of diseases like Type2 Diabetes Mellitus and successfully persuaded the UN to observe the International Day of Yoga annually.
With more than 70% of India's population below the age of 40 years, Dr Jitendra Singh said, a tight management of Diabetes Mellitus, particularly in the young, has become a national priority.

Minister urges young civil servants to be the architects of ‘New India’
The minister of state for development of north east region felicitated the toppers of Civil Services Examination (2017).
Dr Jitendra Singh congratulated the successful candidates and urged them to use the opportunities available to them for building a “New India”.
Dr Jitendra Singh, a senior officer in the Indian government, congratulated all the candidates on their selection.

The first consignment of 2 million barrels of ADNOC crude for Mangalore was loaded today.
ISPRL has built 5.33 million tonnes (around 39 million barrels) of strategic crude oil storage at three locations: Vishakhapatnam, Mangalore and Padur.

The retail selling price of LPG (non-subsidized) at Delhi has come down by Rs.650.50 in the month of May 2018.
The effective cost of LPG refill after subsidy has come down from Rs.495.69/- in December 2017 to Rs.491.21/- in May 2018.
LPG Penetration in Odisha has reached to 58.55 % says Dharmendra Pradhan

LPG penetration in Odisha has reached 58.55% by 1st May 2018, up from 20% in June 2014. Pradhan added that 24.23 lacs connections have been released under Prime Minister Ujjwala Yojna and 1000 new LPG distributors added to the list in the last two years.
There are currently 4 LPG bottling plants in the state of Odisha. Three new plants are planned to be set up in Khorda, Bolangir and Rayagada districts.

The Union Minister said that there are 400 villages saturated with LPG connections and 670 LPG Panchayats conducted on Ujjawala Diwas on 20th April and 400 LPG panchayat conducted from 3rd-5th May. LPG penetration in Khurda district is 100% as on May 1st 2018.

LPG Panchayats are being observed to promote learning through peer group interaction - Kuch Seekhein, Kuch Sikhayein, where apart from experience sharing, it also aims at safe and sustained usage of LPG, to maximize customer is demonstrated.
Women who have cooked with LPG can now share their experiences to encourage others to do the same.
India’s OALP maiden Bid Round takes off spectacularly: 110 bids received for 55 exploration blocks
The OALP Bid Round - I was concluded on May 2, 2018. It was the first ever auction of blocks under the Open Acreage Licensing Programme (“OALP”).
The process for OALP for exploration and production of oil and gas in India was opened in June 2017.
HELP policy paradigm on which OALP is based has following reform components:
Provides Unified Licensing for Conventional and Unconventional Hydrocarbons
Blocks have been carved out by investors based on data from National Data Repository (NDR)
Market Pricing and free access to the market for the product
MoPNG and DGH held interactive sessions and road-shows in India and abroad to disseminate the process and benefits of OALP to E&P investor community.
There are 21 bidders for the Discovered Small Field (DSF) exploration block.
The response to OALP Bid Round-I has been very favourable.
HELP and DSF have taken over 60% of Mining Lease Area.
The response to the OALP Bid Round has been overwhelming as compared to the previous round of E&P auctions under the NELP regime.

The technical bid documents (online and hard copies) were opened on 02 May 2018 at DGH’s Noida office in the presence of the bidders. The evaluation of the bids will be undertaken in a time bound manner. The decision on award will be taken by Empowered Committee of Secretaries and Group of Ministers after the commercial bids are opened.

The government will award blocks by June 2018 to expedite the exploration activities to establish some part of the huge prognosticated conventional hydrocarbon resources of the order of 230 billion barrels of O+OEG in India.
The award of these blocks would be a boost for the E&P activities in India.

PRAAPTIApp and Web portal launched by Minister of State for Power, Shri R.K. Singh, aims to bring transparency in electricity payments to Generators.
A Web portal and an App aimed at improving transparency in power procurement has been launched today by the Minister of State for Power.
PRAAPTI App and web portal has been developedto bring transparency in power purchase transactions between Generators and Discoms.
The App and Web Portal will capture invoicing and payment data for PPAs from the Generators.
The app will also allow users to know the details related to the payments made by the Discoms to the power generation company and when they were made.
PRAAPTI will also enable the consumers to evaluate financial performance of their Discoms in terms of payments being made to the generation companies.
The Portal would also help DISCOMs and GENCOs to reconcile their outstanding payments.

The portal would facilitate relative assessment of various State DISCOMs on “Ease of making payments” to various Generation Companies, and will also help make transactions in the power Sector more transparent.
NTPC Ltd.- profit after tax up by 10.21%
The annual and the fourth quarter financial results of NTPC Ltd. have been released.
For FY 2017-18, NTPC Ltd. generated 265.80 Billion Units, an increase of 6.19%. For Q4 of the previous year, it generated 68.56 Billion Units.
The generation during Q4 FY 2017-18, is the highest quarterly generation, surpassing previous highest quarterly generation of 67.78 Billion Units during Q3 FY 2017-18.
NTPC Coal stations achieved PLF of 77.90% in FY 2017-18 as against National Average of 60.72%.

For FY 2017-18, Audited Total Income is Rs. 85,207.95 crore compared to Rs. 79,342.30 crore for the previous year. For Q4 of the current financial year, Unaudited Total income is Rs 23,617.83 crore compared with Rs. 20,886.85 crore for Q4 FY 2016-17.
Audited and unaudited profit after tax for FY 2017-18 have risen by 10.21% and 2.9% respectively.

The Gross Generation of NTPC Group for financial year 2017-18 is 294.27 billion units as compared to 276.77 billion units during previous year. The Audited Total Income of the Group is Rs. 89,641.59 crore compared to Rs. 83,009.31 crore in previous year and the Audited Profit After Tax is Rs 10,501.50 crore compared with Rs. 10,713.94 crore in the previous financial year.

NTPC Ltd. has recommended final dividend for the financial year 2017-18 @ 23.90% of paid-up share capital i.e. Rs. 2.39 per equity share of the face value of Rs. 10/- each. Interim Dividend was paid at the rate of 27.30%. The total dividend for Financial Year 2017/18 will be 51.20%. The Annual General Meeting is scheduled for September 2018.
Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi lays foundation stone for Patratu Super Thermal Power Project
Prime Minister Narendra Modi laid the foundation stone today for the first phase of Patratu Super Thermal Power Project in Jharkhand.
Shri R.K. Singh, Union Minister of State (I/C), Power and New & Renewable Energy, and eminent dignitaries from Jharkhand and the Centre were present on the occasion.

NTPC's PVUNL is developing a 3,400 MW (3x800MW) power project in two phases. It will be developed in Phase-I and 1,600 MW (2x800 MW) in Phase II. The total amount of power generated will be allocated to Jharkhand.
The project complies with the new emission norms.

BHEL has been awarded the contract for the construction of the project. The commissioning of the first unit is envisaged in 2022 and the other two units after an interval of six months each from the preceding unit.
NTPC's project PVUN aims to improve the quality of life in neighbourhood community.
Prime Minister inaugurates Kishanganga Hydroelectric Project; lays Foundation Stone of the Pakal Dul Power Project in Jammu & Kashmir
Both Projects to bring immense benefits to the people of J&K by way of improved power supply, employment generation and infrastructure creation
Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated Kishanganga Hydroelectric Project and laid the Foundation Stone of the Pakal Dul Power Project in Jammu & Kashmir today.
The annual generation of the Kishanganga Hydro Electric Project is 1712.96 MU. The Project has been proposed to be completed at a cost of Rs. 5882 crore.

The NHPC Project in Jammu and Kashmir will provide a free power to the state. It will also provide a lot of benefits to the people of J&K. The project engaged about 1850 local persons during construction stage and 750 local people during operation stage.

The project cost of Pakal Dul is Rs. 8112.12 crore and it is supported by the Government of India and the Governments of J&K. It is a storage project. It shall be leading to additional Generation of 650 MU in downstream projects.

Pakal Dul project will have immense benefits for J&K. Around 3000 people will be employed during construction phase of the Project and 500 more during operation phase. Govt. of J&J will get 12 per cent free power after 10 years of commissioning and additional 1 per cent for local area development fund (LADF).
Shri R K Singh, Minister of State (IC) for Power and New & Renewable Energy, Government of India was also present at the occasion.

Head Race Tunnel (HRT):1 No, Horse shoe/Circular shaped ,5.2 m dia, 23.2 km total length

The dam has been constructed at Gurez to divert water of Kishanganga River. The water is being diverted through a tunnel of 23.20 km.

The project to build a road in Kishanganga is proposed to be completed at a cost of Rs. 5882 crore. Government of India has already extended a support of Subordinate debt of RS. 2380.44 crore for the construction of the project.
The project has been completed on 30.03.2018.
Chenab Valley Power Projects (Private) Limited is implementing the Pakal Dul (1000 MW), Kiru (624 MW), Kwar (540 MW) HE Project and investigating Dul Hasti Stage II HE Project.
MOP has conveyed the sanction for implementation of Pakal Dul by CVPP.

Head Race Tunnel (HRT) 2 Nos, Horse shoe/Circular shaped,7.2 m dia, each 9.6 km long.
Power House: Underground, 4 Units of 250 MW each (1000 MW)
Tail Race Tunnel (TRT) is a horseshoe shaped tunnel, each 125 m long.
Power House Package: Letter of Award has been issued on 21.02.2018. Mobilization is in progress.
Tendering of other packages is in progress.

The project cost as per CCEA sanction is Rs.8112.12 Cr. The project is supported by the Government of India as well as Government of J&K. GoJK has sanctioned waiver of 12% free power and water user charges for first ten years.

NTPC signs MoU with Government of Bihar; aims to improve performance of Power Sector in Bihar
The government of Bihar and NTPC signed a memorandum of understanding to improve the performance of power sector in Bihar.
NTPC will transfer Barauni Thermal Power Station (720 MW) and BSPGCL’s equities to NTPC.
NTPC will take over three power stations from the effective date of the Statutory Transfer Scheme.
Power from all the three power station shall be available to State of Bihar as before after approval by the Ministry of Power, Government of India.

Energy Minister of Bihar Shri Bijendra Prasad Yadav; Principal Secretary, Department of Energy, Bihar Shri Pratyaya Amrit and CMD, NTPC Limited Shri Gurdeep Singh were among the dignitaries present at the occasion.

NTPC, a Maharatna Company under Ministry of Power, Govt. of India is the largest power generating company of India with a total installed capacity of 53651 MW (including JVs). It has 21,071 MW capacity under construction.
NTPC is the contractor for Barauni Thermal Power Station (720 MW) which is under construction.
Nabinagar Super Thermal Power Project is being developed by NTPC and Bihar State Power Generation Company Limited.
NTPC and BSPGCL owns and operates Muzaffarpur Thermal Power Station (MTPS).
Environmentally Healthy and Clean India is at the Core of the Government’s Long Terms Goals: RK Singh
NTPC inaugurates conference on Agro Residue and Municipal Solid Waste to Power.
The National Electric Power Corporation (NTPC) organises a conference on inter-sectoral issues.
NTPC Dadri will receive 200 tonnes of agro residue based biomass pellets per day. It will generate 150 MU of renewable electricity annually.
NTPC is organising a workshop on Agro residue and Municipal Solid Waste to Power.
Shri R K Singh lays the foundation stone of the of the Underground Cabling Project in the Kumbh area of Haridwar
Shri R K Singh laid the foundation stone of the Underground Cabling Project in the Kumbh area of Haridwar today.
The project aimed at improving the aesthetics and safety of pilgrims during Kumbh Mela in Haridwar has been laid.
The project to install underground cables for electricity generation in Haridwar will be implemented under the government’s flagship scheme.
Several dignitaries from Power Ministry and Uttarakhand Government graced at the occasion.
Power Grid sets Capex Target of 25,000 Crore for 2018-19
Power Grid Corporation of India Limited (POWERGRID) has signed Memorandum of Understanding for the year 2018-19 with Ministry of Power, Government of India.
The Power Grid Corporation of India (POWERGRID) has signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with the Indian government.

POWERGRID, a Navratna CPSE and the Central Transmission Utility (CTU) of the country, has been consistently receiving the highest rating i.e. “excellent” since the signing of the first MoU in 1993-94. Powergrid owns and operates over 148,800 ckt. km of transmission lines, 236 EHV sub-stations with transformation capacity of more than 322,000 MVA. Availability of this gigantic transmission network is consistently maintained over 99.5%.
NTPC Targets 268 BU Power Generation for the Year 2018-19

NTPC, India’s largest power generating company is aiming at generating 268 billion units (BU) of electricity during the fiscal year 2018-19, under a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) signed between NTPC and Ministry of Power today in New Delhi.
Revenue from Operations is targeted at Rs 85,500 Crore for the year 2018-19.

NTPC has total installed capacity of 53651 from its 21 coal based, 7 gas based, 11 solar PV, 1 hydro, 1 wind and 9 subsidiaries / joint venture power stations. NTPC is currently building an additional 21,000 MW at multiple locations across the country.
Clarification regarding electrification status of certain villages

Village electrification targets under‘Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Gram Jyoti Yojna’ (DDUGJY) have been achieved well before time.The Union Government, State agencies and all other stakeholders involved directly or indirectly in this program deserve appreciation and applause for putting in unprecedented efforts to ensure completion of task within the targeted time frame.
The electrification of the remaining villages is unlikely to be completed soon.

The progress of village electrification in three years from 2012-13 to 2014-15, prior to commencement of Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Gram Jyoti Yojna (DDUGJY), on an average was only 1730 villages per year, including lowest ever figure of 1197 villages in 2013-14.

There are reports in some sections of media that some villages are still un-electrified despite the government's claim of achieving 100 per cent village electrification. The electrification of all the villages has been reported complete by all the concerned States.

The Government has already launched ‘Pradhan Mantri Sahaj Bijli Har Ghar Yojana’- ‘Saubgaya’ to provide last mile connectivity and service connections to all remaining households in both rural and urban areas to achieve universal household electrification.All the remaining households including located in the habitations/hamlets/Dhanis/Majras/Tolas associated with the Census villages and households attached to urban settlements would be covered under ‘Saubhagya’.
Most of the villages reported in the news reports are in fact habitations / hamlets / Dhanis / Majras / Tolasand not the Census village, as described below-

Jhandana, Amba and Chameli villages in Alirajpur District are situated in the submerged areas of SardarSarovar. Some of the villagers have been shifted to Kakrana village, electrified, while others have been relocated to another nearby habitation.

In Raisen District, Khananpura village is already electrified and intensive electrification of associated Tola is under progress. In the forest villages, Jaitgarh, Bili, Pond, Ramgarha and Gopalpur, households have been electrified with solar power.

All inhabited revenue / census villages in Dholpur district are now electrified. Intensive electrification works of GolekaPura and Shankar PuraDhanis have been completed. The works in remaining Dhanis are in progress.
The Rajghat village is presently covered under municipal area of Dholpur and as such the households in urban areas are having access to electricity unless disconnected.
The Saprumvillage reported in the news reports is an electrified village but power is disrupted since long.
9th India-Japan Energy Dialogue held in New Delhi; both countries agree to work together for energy security, energy access and climate change issues
Both countries agree to initiate the discussion on Electric Vehicles (EVs) and commit to work together in promoting well-functioning energy markets
The 9th India Japan Energy Dialogue was held in New Delhi today.

Both Japan and India, as the third and the seventh largest economies respectively, recognized that having access to reliable, clean and economical energy is critical for their economic growth and in achieving this, both Ministers agreed on further strengthening of bilateral energy cooperation for energy development of both countries, while also contributing to worldwide energy security, energy access and climate change issues.

Both India and Japan with a view to implement Nationally Determined Contributions (NDCs) under the aegis of the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) recognized the importance of development and deployment of next generation technologies including hydrogen to realize de-carbonization.
Both India and Japan agree on the importance of grid stability.

Both India and Japan reiterated the continued importance of coal-based electricity generation in the energy mix in both the countries and also agreed to promote the cooperation on environmental measures for coal-fired power plants.

Both India and Japan further confirmed their commitment to work together in promoting well-functioning energy markets and affirmed to promote transparent and diversified Liquefied Natural Gas (LNG) market through the relaxation of destination clause.
Indian Railways revises Passenger Reservation Form to extend the VIKALP option to passengers booking tickets through reservation windows
Also, mentioning Aadhar number is made optional for the passengers
The VIKALP scheme option will be available on booking made through reservation windows.

In the revised reservation form, passengers are given an option either to avail the option of VIKALP scheme or not to. If the option is availed, the passenger has to mark his/her choice of alternate train departing within 12 hours, 24 hours, 48 hours or up to the next available date.
It is important to note that a scheme called Alternate Train Accommodation Scheme (Vikalp) was introduced by Indian Railways.
Now, the benefit of Vikalp option has also been made available through PRS counters and not just online bookings.
Ministry of Railways organizes a one day workshop ‘Mission Raftar’ aimed at raising the average speed of freight trains and coaching trains

The workshop aimed at raising the average speed of freight trains and coaching trains in New Delhi was inaugurated by Shri Rajen Gohain, Minister of State for Railways and Shri Ashwani Lohani, Chairman, Railway Board.

The Indian Railways held a workshop on increasing speed of freight and passenger trains. Also, issues related to punctuality, rolling stock, removing bottlenecks and elimination of Unmanned Level crossings were discussed.
Indian Railways has been focusing on capacity building and increasing train speeds.
The workshop on improving train services of Indian Railways was inaugurated by the chairman of Railway Board.
It aims at doubling the average speed of freight trains and increasing average speed of coaching trains by 25kmph over a five year period.

Average freight train speeds are ~24kmph and average passenger train speeds (excluding suburban trains) is ~44kmph.Increasing average speed of trains is considered essential for reducing the travel time for passengers, transit time for cargo, operational cost, improving revenues and railway’s market share.
The government wants to increase the share of rail transport to 45% in the transport basket.
Major constraints to mobility have been identified and a multi-pronged strategy has been developed to overcome them.
The railways are focusing on the Golden Quadrilateral route for improving average speeds.
Ministry of Railways Launches New User Interface of its Next Generation e-Ticketing System
Railway's Online Travel Portal - irctc.co.in has launched beta version of its new User Interface.
The new online ticket booking system of Railways is aimed at automating the journey planning and purchase of tickets.
E-ticketing today constitutes about two third of total reserved tickets on Indian Railways.
Salient features of the New User Interface:
With the launch of new interface of e-Ticketing Website, user can now enquire about trains and check availability of seats without login.
The new look and feel will have enhanced class-wise, train-wise and destination-wise filters for facilitating customer while planning their journeys.
In addition, more features such as new filters on ‘My Transactions’ where user can also view their booked tickets based on Journey Date, Booking Date, Upcoming Journey and completed journey.
To enhance customer’s booking experience, interesting features like ‘Waitlist prediction’, etc. have been introduced.

The new look and feel is providing the facility for the user to find out the availability up to the entire Advance Reservation Period i.e. 120 days. In the new system, user can perform multiple activities through booked history.
Railways will introduce a new interface for its e-ticketing portal.
Ateli- Phulera Section of Dedicated Freight Corridor to be Open from 15th August, 2018
Shri Ashwani Lohani, Chairman, Railway Board Inspects the Ateli- Phulera Section
Ateli-Phulera section of Western Dedicated Freight Corridor will be started on 15 August 2018.
Shri Lohani, the chairman of CRB, visited a construction project. He was impressed with the latest construction methods.

DFCCIL will run freight train at the maximum speed of 100 km/per hour as against the current maximum speed of 75 kms per hour on Indian Railway tracks whereas the average speed of freight trains will also be increased from existing speed of 26 km/ph on Indian Railways lines to 70 km/ph on Dedicated Freight Corridors (DFC).

DFCCIL, a special purpose vehicle (SPV) is engaged in planning, construction, operation and maintenance of the Dedicated Freight Corridors and in the first phase, the two corridors, namely Eastern Corridor from Ludhiana to Dankuni (1856 Kms) and the Western Corridor from Dadri to Jawahar Lal Nehru Port (JNPT) (1504 Kms) are being constructed for exclusively movement of Goods Trains.

The Eastern Dedicated Freight Corridor from Ludhiana to Dankuni near Kolkata is traversing states of Punjab, Haryana, Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, Jharkhand, West Bengal and Maharashtra. The Western Dedicated freight corridor from Dadri (Uttar Pradesh) to Jawaharlal Nehru Port Trust (Mumbai) is passing through Uttar Pradesh.
The Western Corridors is being funded by Japan International Corporation Agency (JICA), while the Eastern Corridor from Mughalsarai to Ludhiana is being funded by the World Bank.
Shri Ashwani Lohani reviews The Food Safety System over Indian Railways
Series of Reformative Steps to be Initiated in a Month periodAll Vendors to be Covered Under Online Food Licence Registration System
All vendors who sell food articles of food himself or through temporary stalls will be banned from the railway station catering facility.

FSSAI and Indian Railways have held a meeting. Food Safety Officer (FSO) will cover in each Division of Indian Railway. 300 Health Inspectors will be deployed to assist the FSO and assist them in their work. There will be a data bank with details of caterers and food suppliers over Indian Railwayways by 15th July 2018.
The Ministry of Railways and BCL sign an MoU for 2018-19

Ministry of Railways and Braithwaite & Company Limited (BCL), a CPSE, have signed a memorandum of understanding. BCL's core competency is in the field of manufacturing new wagons, repairing of wagons and steel structural fabrication and manufacturing of cranes.
The MoU was signed today i.e. May 23, 2018 by Railway Board Secretary, Shri Ranjanesh Sahai, and BCL, Chairman and Managing Director (Additional Charge), and Director (Finance), Shri P.P. Bose.
BCL has set targets under MoU with BCL.
Ministry of Railways and RCIL sign an MoU for 2018-19
Ministry of Railways and RailTel Corporation of India Limited (RCIL) signed a MoU. RCIL is implementing several Rail projects all over India.
The MoU was signed on May 22, 2018 by Railway Board Secretary, Shri Ranjanesh Sahai and RCIL, Chairman and Managing Director, N. Kashinath laying down targets for 18-19 important Projects.

As per targets under MoU, RCIL has projected revenue from operations of Rs. 1200 crore and several other target regarding CCTV & Wifi at Stations development of Content on Demand (CoD) services on trains etc.
Ministry of Railways and IRCON sign an MoU for 2018-19
Ministry of Railways and Indian Railway Construction Company, International Ltd (IRCON) signed an MoU. IRCON is implementing several railway construction projects in India and abroad.
The MoU was signed on May 22, 2018 by Railway Board Secretary, Shri Ranjanesh Sahai and IRCON, Chairman and Managing Director, S.K. Chaudhary laying down targets for 18-19 important Projects.
IRCON has targets for revenue from operations of Rs. 4200 cr. for important National projects.
Ministry of Railways and MRVC sign an MoU for 2018-19

Ministry of Railways signed a memorandum of understanding with Mumbai Railway Vikas Corporation Ltd (MRVC). MRVC is implementing Rail projects on Mumbai suburban system under Mumbai Urban Transport Projects (MUTPs).
The MoU was signed on May 22, 2018 by Railway Board Secretary, Shri Ranjanesh Sahai and Chairman and Managing Director of MRVC, R S Khurana, laying down the targets for suburban projects.
MRVC will spend Rs. 1464 crore towards completion of various suburban projects under MUTP.
Ministry of Railways invites Online Applications for recruitment to 9739 Posts in RPF/RPSF

Ministry of Railways has invited online applications from eligible candidates for recruitment to 8619 posts of Constables (4403 Male & 4216 Female) and 1120 posts of Sub-Inspectors (819 Male & 301 Female) in the Railway Protection Force/Railway Protection Special Force.

Candidates are requested to see the employment news edition of 19-25 May, 2018 or visit the official website of Indian Railways mentioned below:- (http://www.indianrailways.gov.in/railwayboard/view_section.jsp?lang=0&id=0,1,304,366,533,2015) for authentic details.
130 years of Indian Railways iconic station:Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus building

Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (formerly Victoria Terminus) has completed 130 years of its construction on 20th May 2018. The present day Headquarters building of Central Railway is the most photographed building after Taj Mahal.

The Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus is a heritage building. It was originally named after Queen Victoria. UNESCO has declared it a World Heritage Site. It is open for public viewing on working days.
Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (earlier Victoria Terminus) was constructed at a cost of Rs.16.14 lakh and is in Italian Gothic style adapted to suit Indian context.

The station was constructed with 6 platforms in 1929. It was remodelled to 13 platforms in 1994 and now it has 18 platforms with a spacious east side entry. In April 2018, a heritage gully was inaugurated next to platform no.18.
During Centenary celebrations of Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus Building, a postal stamp was released in 2013.
Ministry of Railway & Rail Vikas Nigam Limited (RVNL) sign MoU for FY 2018-19
The target for revenue from operations for Rail Vikas Nigam Limited (RVNL) is set at Rs 7600 Cr for the FY 2018-19.
Parcel Cargo Express Train (PCET) begins operation, connecting Northeast to the West Coast
Parcel Cargo Express Train helps farmers to market their products at the retail markets in Mumbai, Bengaluru, Nagpur and Pune.
Northeast Frontier Railway has started operating one lease Parcel Cargo Express Train (PCET) on fortnightly basis, connecting Northeastern part of the country to the West Coast.

Parcel Cargo Express Train has emerged as a business tool and this has been done without any additional strain on the resources of the railways. The unit transportation cost of PCET is relatively less than road transportation. PCETs are leased for 6 years each.
Several other zonal Railways have also taken initiatives to lease out Parcel Cargo Express Train(PCETs) on round trip
Shri Piyush Goyal Reviews Coal Production and Dispatches to Generate Adequate Power Supply for the Country

Stressed on the Necessity for Pithead Power Plants to Run at 100 % PLF.Urged States to Use Provisions Under “Flexibility of Utilization of Coal” Rules.Emphasized the need to Improve the Turnaround Time of RakesOfficials of Railways, Coal and Power Ministries to Work in Close Coordination with Chief Secretaries and Power Secretaries of States.Urged that Team Work and Better Coordination among Ministries to Ensure 24X7 Power Supply for the People of India.
Piyush Goyal chaired a review meeting with R.K. Singh, Minister of State (IC) Power and New & Renewable Energy and with top officials of Ministries of Coal, Railways and Power in New Delhi today.
In the meeting, review of Power supply requirement during the ongoing summer and forthcoming winter season and measures to improve the coal stock position in Power Plants were discussed.
A comprehensive review of targets for coal production and dispatches by the coal companies takes place.

Shri Piyush Goyal wants to increase Plant Load Factor (PLF) of various Power Plants of the country. He wants to hold fortnightly meeting of the ministries involved to review the power situation in the country
He stressed on the need for States located far from coal mines to use provisions under "Flexibility of Utilisation of Coal" rules. Gujarat and Maharashtra have already been using these provisions.

He gave clear instructions to the officials of the three ministries to keep a close vigil on the power production and supply situation in the country and to keep in close touch with Chief Secretaries and Power Secretaries of the States for this purpose.
Shri Goyal wants to improve the turnaround time of rakes by better scheduling of trains and optimum utilization of traffic blocks.
He stressed on reducing terminal detention of wagons inside Power Plants and Coal sidings to generate extra capacity.

Last but not the least, he stressed that team effort, better coordination between Ministries involved and the rationalization of work procedures will lead to generation of extra capacity within the existing system and ensure 24X7 power supply for the people of India.
Indian Railways fits specially designed aerators in basin-taps of Tejas Express as a step towards water conservation
Aerators have been fitted in available basin-taps of Tejas Express (Train No. 22119/22120) to prevent water wastage.
Aerators have been fitted in taps of Tejas Express (22119/22120) to reduce water consumption by 1/4th.
Shri Ashwini Lohani launches “Guidebook for Creating a Child Friendly and Protective Environment for Children in Contact with Railways’
A guidebook for creating a child friendly environment for children in contact with Railways has been launched.

In the same event, Information Education Communication (IEC) Materials on child protection for children in contact with Indian Railways and those developed by Save The Children were launched to create awareness/alertness among the people and stakeholders.

Shri Ashwini Lohani, Chairman, Railway Board, has said that there is an urgent need to create mass awareness about the issue of distressed children. A large scale awareness campaign on sensitisation of railway staff and other stake holders like porters and vendors at stations will be launched from 8th June 2018.
On this occasion, Ms. Stuti Kacker, Chairperson, NCPCR, presented a book on child protection at railway stations.
The Rupa's Fund rescued 35,000 children in last four years.
Shri Navin Sellaraju, Director, Railway Children India, wants to strengthen child protection mechanism at railway stations.
A guidebook is being launched to improve child protection mechanisms at railway stations in India.
Cabinet apprised of MoU between India and Franceon Technical Cooperation in the field of railways
The Union Cabinet chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi has been apprised of the Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between the Indian Railways and SNCF Mobilites on Technical Cooperation.
The Indian Railways signed a number of MoUs with various countries.
The MoU will provide a framework of cooperation for focused approach in following key areas :-

2. Station renovation and operations.
3. Modernisation of current operations and infrastructure.
Ministry of Railways have signed MoU for technical cooperation in the Rail sector with various foreign Governments and National Railways.
International Rail Coach Expo to be hosted by Integral Coach FactoryChennai
An International Rail Coach Expo is being held in Chennai from 17th to 19th May, 2018.
The Integral Coach Factory is hosting an expo.
Exclusive Rail Coach and train sets for display for the first time in India
Conferences/seminars on specialized subjects on Rail Coach and Train sets

The Expo of Train Enthusiasts will be held on 17th and 18th May, 2018.

ICF Gives a Fresh Look to LHB Air-Conditioned Coaches

ICF, a production unit under Ministry of Railways, has produced one LACCN (LHB 3 Tier AC) Coach with continuous windows. It is planned to provide such continuous windows in all AC coaches in a phased manner.
The LHB Coaches made by ICF at present have been provided with split windows of size 1100 mm (L) x 680 mm (H).
However, there will be no change in the interior of the coaches that will be maintained as before.
Shri Shivaji, Railway Protection Force Constable to be decorated with “Railway Minister’s Medal” for Bravery
Shri Shivaji, Railway Protection Force Constable will be decorated with a bravery medal and a cash award of Rs. 1 Lac.

Shri Shivaji, an RPF constable, was escorting a train from Velachery station to Park Town Station when he noticed a man sexually assaulting a woman commuter. He overpowered the offender and rescued her. An FIR was filed.
Shri Shivaji, RPF constable, saved a woman commuter. Shri Ponn Manickavel, Inspector-General (Railways), gave him a cash award of Rs. 5000.
South Western Railway bags Safety Shield pertaining to Train Operations for 2017-18

South Western Railway (SWR) has made significant improvements in key areas of Safety pertaining to train operations. The number of accidents has come down in SWR from 11 in 2014-15 to 8 in 2015-16, 3 in 2016-17, and 1 in 2017-18. Shri Piyush Goyal, Minister of Railways & Coal awarded the Railway Minister's Safety Shield to SWR.
South Western Railway (SWR) has improved its safety performance.
Activities and consistent efforts taken upby SWR in direction of improving safety.
Budget outlay was increased to nearly Rs.3000 Cr. from Rs.1000 Cr. few years ago.
Gate Mitras round of the clock have been deployed at all unmanned Level crossing gates.
27 Unmanned Level Crossing gates eliminated by Construction of ROB/RUB/subway against target of 25 in 2017-18

Rashtriya Rail SanrakshaKosh (RRSK) (exclusive Safety Fund) has been established in 2017-18 Budget by Ministry of Railways. SWR could book funds to the tune of Rs. 687 Cr. in this head. It is being spent on track renewals for safety and up gradation of vital assets.
Infrastructure augmentation of maintenance facilities
SWR completed 202 Track-Km of rail renewal in 2017-18, which is highest ever in history of SWR about 115% more than that of corresponding figures in 2016-17.
Shri Piyush Goyal, Minister of Railways & Coal awarded Safety Shield to Shri A.K.Gupta, General Manager, South Western Railways
Ministry of Railways introduces new Humsafar train 22437/22438 Allahabad-AnandVihar (T) (Tri-weekly).

Artificial Intelligence to Monitor the Food Production in Base Kitchens
IRCTC has developed an artificial intelligence module to monitor kitchen operations using CCTV footage.
The IRCTC has installed a camera system to detect anomalies in its base kitchens.
An artificial intelligence system is being developed for catering.
An issue that has been captured through artificial intelligence will be automatically created and an alert will be sent to all concerned via email and through portal.
The module has been developed in association with New Delhi based company called WOBOT.
Alert Loco Pilot Saves Potential Disaster – displays exemplary devotion to duty Assistant Loco Pilot succumbs to his injuries while discharging his duties
Shri D. L. Bramhe, Loco Pilot, Nagpur, saved a train from a fire.
A condolence prayer was held at Nagpur and every other Division of Central Railway on the demise of Assistant Loco Pilot Shri S. K. Vishwakarma.
The Indian Railways is truly the Lifeline of the Nation.
National Rail Museum Now Open in Eveningsalso
National Rail Museum will be open in the evening also for visitors on weekends.
The CSMT is preparing a railway themed exhibition and restaurant.
The railway museum will be opened for evening visitors from May 2018.

National Rail Museum has undergone a comprehensive renovation in 2015. Many new features like virtual reality based coach simulators, diesel & steam loco simulators and renovated indoor gallery were added. Recently, the museum introduced combo tickets with 30% discount for visitors.
Ministry of Railways announces Awards for beautification of Station premises

Out of 62 entries, Balharshah and Chandrapur (Central Railway) bag First prize;Madhubani (East Central Railway) and Madurai (Southern Railway) adjudged second; Gandhidham (Western Railway) Kota (West Central Railway) share Third Prize with Secunderabad (South Central Railway)
The evaluation committee of the South Central Railway has reviewed 62 nominations for stations where local artists have done beautification work.

Balharshah and Chandrapur railway stations (Nagpur Division) of Central Railway have been awarded first prize for depicting the best art and refurbishing itself as the most beautiful station across Indian Railways.
Madhubani Railway Station under Samastipur Division of East Central Railway in Bihar has been declared the second best. The first prize winner will receive Rs 10.5 lakh.
Kota Station (West Central Railway), Gandhidham Station (Western Railway) and Secunderabad Station (South Central Railway) have been selected as the third prize winning stations in the competition.
Ministry of Railways to increase frequency of Gorakhpur- AnandViharHumsafar Train via Barhni and also via Basti
Shri Manoj Sinha will flag off train No. 02571 Gorakhpur-AnandViharHumsafar.
The frequency of Gorakhpur Anand Vihar Humsafar Express will be increased from 2 days to 4 days.

In order to provide comfortable & pleasant travel experience, Shri Manoj Sinha will dedicate to the Nation various upgraded passenger amenities like 07 new lifts, refurbished cab way at Pf no 1 at Gorakhpur station, renovated station building, portico, booking office & waiting room at Gorakhpur station over North Eastern Railway.

Indian Railways marks 26 years of Ladies Special Suburban Trains
The first ever Ladies Special train in the world ran between Churchgate and Borivali on 5th May, 1992
On 5th May Indian Railways will celebrate the 26th anniversary of Ladies Special Train.
The ladies special train service has been running successfully for 26 years.

To instill a sense of safety & security amongst the women passengers, Indian Railways has come up with various novel initiatives & measures since then. CCTV cameras and Talk-back System were introduced by Western Railway last year.
Shri Piyush Goyal discusses Rail Connectivity Issues with Chief Minister of Himachal Pradesh, Shri Jai Ram Thakur
Chief Minister of Himachal Pradesh Shri Jai Ram Thakur called on the Union Minister of Railway & Coal, Shri Piyush Goyal in New Delhi to discuss various issues.

Shri Piyush Goyal has assured that speed and frequency of trains running on Kalka-Shimla railway line will be increased and the journey reduced from 5 hours to 3 hours. Speed of Joginder Nagar-Pathankot train will also be increased. RLDA plans to provide multi-storey parking facility at Shimla Railway station.
Action Taken wrt Video in circulation in Social Media on Vendor seen coming out of train toilet with tea/coffee cans
There is a video of a vendor coming out of train toilet with tea and coffee cans with water mixed inside them.
An inquiry has been held to identify the wrongdoers who caused an incident in train No. 12759 Chennai Central - Hyderabad Charminar Express at Secunderabad Railway Station in December 2017.
The contractor for the section between Secunderabad and Kazipet has been fined Rs. 1.00,000/- (Rupees One Lakh) for selling unauthorised items.
An explanation has been called within 15 days from the issue of Show Cause Notice to M/s P Siva Prasad, Licensee, Train Side Vending as to why his contract for train vending shouldn't be terminated.
Two people seen hawking at Secunderabad Railway Station are not allowed to do so.
A strict vigil is continuously being kept at various level to ensure that no such incidents recur.”

Prime Minister to Attend the commencement of Work of Zojila Tunnel and ring roads in Jammu and Srinagar

Prime Minister Narendra Modi will attend the commencement of work on Zojila Tunnel on the Srinagar-Leh National Highway tomorrow. He will also lay the foundation stone for Srinagar Ring Road and Jammu Ring Road.
The Zojila tunnel will be India's longest road tunnel and Asia's longest bidirectional tunnel. It will cost 6800 crore.

The construction of a tunnel will provide all weather connectivity between Srinagar, Kargil and Leh. The route remains snow-bound for a large part of the year and is ravaged by frequent avalanches. Road connectivity to the Laddakh region is disrupted for long periods. The tunnel will bring relief to the people of this region. It will also cut the time taken to cross the Zojila pass from 3.5 hours to 15 minutes.
The construction of the tunnel is expected to bring about economic integration of the regions. The government is committed to development of manpower skilled for tunnelling jobs.
The Zojila tunnel is being planned as a smart tunnel.
The Ring Roads and Srinagar and Jammu are aimed at reducing traffic congestion at these cities.
The Srinagar Ring Road will link Galandar in West Srinager to Sumbal. It will be a new route from S Kashmir to Kargil and Leh.
The first phase of the Jammu Ring Road is being built.
Shri Gadkari to Inaugurate Two National Highwaysand Lay Foundation Stone of a Highway Projectin Punjab Tomorrow

Union Minister for Road Transport, Highways, Shipping, Water Resources and Ganga Rejuvenation Shri Nitin Gadkari will inaugurate the upgraded 4-lane NH-15 from Amritsar to Bhatinda and NH-64 from Zirakpur to Bhatinda, and will lay the foundation stone of 2-laning with paved shoulders of the Munak-Jhakhal-Budhlana section of NH-144B in Punjab tomorrow.
The stretch of the new NH-15 between Amritsar and Bhatinda has been completed. The project costed nearly Rs 2893 crore.
The 216 kilometre stretch of NH-64 has been completed in 24 months at a cost of Rs 2264 crore. The project includes an ROB, 12 flyovers, 22 underpasses and 42 large junctions.
The project to build a 2-laning section of the NH-144B in Haryana will reduce travel time between Bhikhi and Tohana by an hour and between Munak and Jhakhal and Buldhana to an hour.
