“Technology Is Destiny, but Technology must Also be Equity”, says President Kovind
20th National Technology Day is celebrated.
The President has said that technology must be an equal opportunity for all.

Shri Kovind believes that new technologies offer solutions that are necessary in the Indian context and contribute to the social and economic needs of the people. They achieve this at competitive price points and without compromise on quality.

The government proposed to establish Centres of Excellence to train young technologists in robotics, artificial intelligence, digital manufacture, big data analytics, quantum communication and Internet of Things.
National Technology Day is celebrated on the occasion.
Dr. Harsh Vardhan, the Minister for Science and Technology, has said that the country must build on the strengths of science and technology.
The Technology Development Board received awards from the President.
Category A - For successful commercialization of indigenous technology
M/s Agappe Diagnostics Ltd, Erankulam, Kerala for Mispa 13, an automated cartridge-based protein analyzer;
M/s Bharat Biotech International Ltd, Hyderabad, for Rotavirus vaccine - ROTAVAC.
Category B - For successful technology commercialization by MSME
M/s Synkromax Biotech Pvt Ltd, Chennai for Synkroscaff, a bovine scaffold for tissue engineering;
M/s ANTS Ceramics Pvt Ltd, Vasai East, Maharashtra for high-end Zirconia ceramic products and carbon sulphur analysis crucible;
M/s 3B Blackbio Biotech India Limited, Bhopal, has registered a product for TRUPCR.
M/s Envision Scientific Privated Limited, Surat, for Albuminus DES +, a drug eluting stent for diabetic patients; and
M/s Hind High Vacuum Company Pvt Ltd, Bengaluru, for 3-layer metallization on alumina substrate.
Category C - For Technology Start-up
M/s Astrome Technologies Pvt Ltd, SID, IISC, Bengaluru, for GigaMesh, a wireless communication solution;
M/s CyCa Onco Solutions Pvt Ltd, KIIT, TBI, Bhubaneshwar, for CyPlatin and CyGlo for delivery of anti-cancer drug cisplatin.
M/s Xcellence in Bio Innovation and Technologies (xBITS) Pvt Ltd, Jodhpur, for RightBiotic, a point-of-care device for testing the antibiotic sensitivity.
Dr. Harsh Vardhan launched an electric charger and launched a web portal to mark the celebrations.
The awards ceremony is taking place.
The theme of this year’s National Technology Day celebrations is “Commercializing indigenous Technologies: Journey from Benchside to Business”.
National Technology Day: A brief background

The celebration of National Technology Day is held on May 11th every year. The day celebrates technological innovations and their successful commercialization. It was on this day in 1998 that India successfully carried out nuclear tests at Pokhran and flew the first indigenous aircraft.
Technology Development Board on behalf of the Ministry of Science & Technology celebrates May 11 as the National Technology Day.
National Awards of Technology Development Board
Technology Development Board (TDB) gives annual awards to those who commercialise their innovations successfully.

The National Award for successful commercialization of indigenous technology was instituted in the year 1999. There are two broad categories: one for an Industrial Concern and one for Technology Start-ups with potential for commercialisation.

In the first category, two awards are given for the successful commercialisation of indigenous technology: Cash prize of Rs. 25 lakh and trophy to an industrial concern that has successfully developed and commercialized an indigenous technology. In the second category, Micro Small & Medium Enterprises that have commercialised a product based on indigenous technological innovation get a trophy and a cash prize of RS. 15 lakh.
In the second category, Awards are given to technology Start-ups for promising new technology with potential for commercialization.
Cabinet approves waiver of Penal Interest on Government Loans advanced to Visakhapatnam Port Trust

The Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs, chaired by the Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi has given its approval for waiving of Penal Interest on Government Loans to Visakhapatnam Port Trust (VPT) as per following:
Waiver of Penal Interest amounting to Rs. 250.89 crore.
VPT to pay penalty @0.25%of Penal Interest as on date of approval of waiver of Penal Interest;
VPT will pay the outstanding principal of Rs. 44.69 crore and outstanding interest in one single instalment in the Financial Year 2018-19.
Visakhapatnam Port Trust (VPT) started repaying the loan amount of Rs. 110.41 crore from 1990-91 onwards.
The Port has a loan liability of Rs.354.23 crore. It also has a future fund requirement of around Rs. 2671.79 crore for developmental projects and employees' pension liabilities upto 2018-19.
Cabinet approves waiver of Penal Interest on Government Loans advanced to Paradip Port Trust

The Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs, chaired by the Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi has given its approval for waiving of Penal Interest on Government Loans to Paradip Port Trust (PPT) as per following:
Waiver of penal interest amounting to Rs.1076.59 crore in respect of PPT as on 31.03.2017 and further accruals thereon till date of approval of waiver.
PPT to pay penalty @ 0.25% of Penal Interest as on the date of approval of waiver of penal Interest.
PPT will start the re-payment of outstanding principal of Rs. 387.74 crore and outstanding interest in two instalments in 2018-19 and 2019-20.
Paradip Port Trust (PPT) defaulted on a loan of over Rs.600 Crores.
The Port has a loan liability of Rs.1,743.69 crore. It also has a future fund requirement of around Rs.6,695 crore for developmental projects and employees’ pension liabilities upto 2018-19.
Shri Nitin Gadkari meets Indonesian Minister of Maritime Affairs
India and Indonesia to promote bilateral cooperation in maritime & infrastructure sector

Taking ahead the bilateral relations between India & Republic of Indonesia, Shri Nitin Gadkari, Union Minister for Shipping, Road Transport & Highways and Water Resources, River Development & Ganga Rejuvenation met General (Retd.) Luhut Binser Pandjaitan, Coordinating Minister of Maritime Affairs of Indonesia, in New Delhi yesterday.
Retired General (Retd.) Pandjaitan met Shri Gadkari to discuss bilateral cooperation in the maritime sector between India and Indonesia.
Developing a cruise tourism circuit between Andaman and Nicobar Islands and Indonesia and putting India on the global cruise market under its Sagarmala programme were the main topics of talks.

For developing collaboration in Maritime Training & Education between India & Indonesia, both the ministers were keen to draw up an MOU between Indian Maritime University & Indonesian institutes for maritime studies.
Indonesian technical teams will visit India to study the Indian experience on Ganga rejuvenation, development of National Waterways and training in the maritime sector.

Cabinet approves establishment of National Institute ofMental Health Rehabilitation at Bhopal
The Union Cabinet has approved the establishment of National Institute of Mental Health Rehabilitation at Bhopal as a Society under the Societies Registration Act, 1860.
The Union Cabinet has also approved the proposal to create three Joint Secretary level posts, which include one post of Director of the Institute and two posts of Professors.

The main objectives of the NIMHR are to provide rehabilitation services to the persons with mental illness, capacity development in the area of mental health rehabilitation, policy framing and advanced research in mental health rehabilitation.
The Institute of Mental Health Rehabilitation is being established. It will offer diploma, certificate, graduate, post graduate, M.Phil and post graduate courses.

The Institute for Mental Health Rehabilitation and Education will be established in Bhopal. It will provide rehabilitation services for people with mental illness and conduct courses up to Master's degree and M.Phil. degree.
NIMHR will be the first of its kind in the country in the area of mental health rehabilitation.

1149 Cochlear Implant Surgeries have been conducted Successfully during The Last 4 Years – Shri Krishan Pal Gurjar
DEPwD Organises ‘Cochlear Implant Awareness Programme’ in Faridabad

There have been 1149 Cochlear Implant Surgeries successfully conducted during the last 4 years. Ali Yavar Jung National Institute for Speech and Hearing Disabilities (AYNISHD), Mumbai is the Nodal Agency for Cochlear Implants Surgeries. It has empanelled 172 hospitals.
The Minister for Disabled People is organising an awareness program to promote Cochlear Implant Surgeries for Hearing Impaired Children.

Smt. Shakuntala Doley Gamlin, Secretary, DEPwD, Prabodh Seth, Joint Secretary, (Divyangjan), D.R. Sareen Managing Director, ALIMCO, Shri R.K. Sharma, General Secretary, Indian Red Cross Society (Haryana State), Dr Rakesh Gupta, Chairman, Sarvodaya Hospital, and Dr Ravi Bhatia are attending the gathering.
The Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment (DEDPwD) in India has introduced Cochlear Implant programme for children with hearing loss.
There have been around 1149 Cochlear Implant surgeries carried out across India.
The Ministry of Health empanelled 172 hospitals all over India to conduct cochlear implant surgery on deaf children.
Sarvodaya Hospital & Research Centre in Faridabad has operated 30 children on Cochlear Implant for last 2 years.
DEPwD to organise ‘Cochlear Implant Awareness Programme’ in Faridabad tomorrow

A Cochlear Implant Awareness Programme is being organized by the Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities (Divyangjan) in association with Indian Red Cross Society and Sarvodaya Hospital & Research Centre tomorrow. Shri Krishan Pal Gurjar, Minister of State for Social Justice and Empowerments will be the Chief Guest in the programme.

Smt. Shakuntala Doley Gamlin, Secretary, DEPwD, Prabodh Seth, Joint Secretary, (Divyangjan), Dr Ashok Kumar Sinha, Director NIHH, Shri R. Sharma, General Secretary, Indian Red Cross Society (Haryana State), Dr Rakesh Gupta, Chairman, Sarvodaya Hospital will attend the function.

Cochlear Implant is a modern technology to help deaf children who have severe to profound deafness in both ears. After surgical rehabilitation, they can hear normally in one ear and speak. Cochlear Implants were expensive and not affordable for all. Therefore, the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment introduced a scheme to provide them to poor people.

Since the implementation of Cochlear Implant Program by the Ministry of SJ&E through Ali Yavar Jung National Institute of Speech and Hearing Disabilities (AYJNISHD) in Mumbai, around 1149 cochlear implant surgeries have been conducted across India.
DEPwD to organise Cochlear Implant Awareness Programme in Faridabad on 6th May, 2018

Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities (Divyangjan) organises a ‘Cochlear Implant Awareness Programme’ on 6th May, 2018. Shri Krishan Pal Gurjar, Minister of State for Social Justice and Empowerments, will be the Chief Guest in the programme. Smt. Shakuntala DoleyGamlin, Secretary, DEPwD, will also participate in the program.

Under ADIP Scheme of the Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities (Divyangjan), there is provision for Cochlear Implant surgeries of Hearing Impaired children’s up to the age of 5 years at the cost of Rs.6.00 Lakhs per unit.After Successful Cochlear Implant Surgeries, the child is able to hear and speak like normal Children.Government has empanelled 172 Hospitals (both Government & Private) throughout the country for the surgeries.
AliYavar Jung National Institute for Speech and Hearing Disabilities in Mumbai is the Nodal Agency for Cochlear Implant Surgeries.
Highlights of Provisional Estimates (PE) of GDP, 2017-18 and Estimates of GDP for the Fourth Quarter, January-March (Q4), 2017-18

The Central Statistics Office (CSO) and Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation has released the estimates of Gross Domestic Product (GDP) for the fourth quarter of 2017-18 and Provisional estimates of National Income (PE) for financial year 2017- 2018.
GDP at 2011-12 prices grew at 7.7 per cent in the fourth quarter of financial year 2017-18. Rapid growth in agriculture, manufacturing and construction sectors contributed to the overall growth.
GVA at constant (2011-12) prices for agriculture, industry and services sectors is estimated to grow by 4.5%, 8.8% and 7.7% in Q4 of 2017-18.

The rate of growth of gross fixed capital formation at constant prices increased to 14.4 percent in the fourth quarter on account of 9.0 Percent growth in capital goods in Q4 of 2017-18 as against 0.8 percent, 6.1 percent and 9.1 percent respectively, in the first three quarters, Q1, Q2 and Q3 of 2017-18.
Provisional estimates of GDP for 2017-18

As per the Provisional estimates of national income, the growth rate of GDP at constant (2011-12) prices for the financial year 2017-18 is estimated to be 6.7 percent. At the sectoral level, the GVA at constant prices for agriculture, allied sectors, industry and services are estimated to grow by 3.4%, 5.5% and 7.9%.
Provisional Estimates of Annual National Income, 2017-18 And
Quarterly Estimates (Q4) of Gross Domestic Product, 2017-18
The Provisional estimates of national income for the financial year 2017-18 are presented in Statements 1 to 4.
The annual economic estimates for the current financial year are released by the government.
GDP growth rates for 2017-18 and Q1, Q2, Q3 and Q4 are given below.
I.

The second advance estimate of national income for the year 2017-18 has been revised incorporating latest estimates of agricultural production, index of industrial production (IIP), performance of key sectors like railways, transport, communication, banking, insurance and Government revenue expenditure. With the introduction of Goods and Services Tax (GST) from 1st July 2017, the total tax revenue used for GDP compilation includes non-GST revenue and GST revenue.
5.5 estimates are detailed below.
I.
GDP for the year 2017-18 has been estimated at `130.11 lakh crore, a growth rate of 6.7% over the previous estimate.
Gross Value Added (GVA) at Basic Prices
The growth rate of real GVA for the year 2017-18 is estimated to be 6.5% higher than the first revised estimate released on 31st January, 2018.

The sectors which registered growth rate of over 7.0 percent are public administration, defence, other services, trade, hotels, transport, communication and services related to broadcasting, electricity, gas, water supply and other utility services. The growth in the other sectors is estimated to be 3.4%, 2.9%, 5.7% and 5.8%.
The growth rate of the ‘agriculture, forestry and fishing’ sector has been 3.4% in 2017-18 compared to the previous year.
The private sector growth in the mining sector has been estimated using the latest available information on major listed companies for the financial year 2017-18.

The growth in the manufacturing sector was estimated at 5.7 percent in 2017-18 compared to previous year's 7.9. The private corporate sector grew at 9.0 percent during the same period. The quasi corporate and unorganized segment grew at 4.5 percent.
Electricity, gas, water supply and other utility services
GVA at basic prices from the electricity sector for 2017-18 is estimated to be 7.2 percent higher than previous year. IIP of electricity sector grew by 5.4 percent in April-March.
GVA at basic prices from the construction sector for 2017-18 is estimated to be 5.7 percent, compared to previous year’s growth rate of 1.3%.
Trade, hotels, transport, communication and services related to broadcasting
GVA at basic prices for 2017-18 from the Trade sector is estimated at 8.0%, as compared to 7.2% last year. GVA from the Hospitality and Restaurants Sector is estimated to be 7.9%.
Financial, real estate and professional services

The sector 'financial, real estate and professional services' has shown a growth rate of 6.6% compared to previous year. The key indicators of this sector are the quarterly growth of corporate sector for Real Estate, Business services and Computer related activities.
Public administration, defence and other services
The sector ‘Public administration, defence and other services’ has shown a growth rate of 10.8% compared to previous year. Union government revenue expenditure grew by 14.7%.
The Gross National Income at 2011-12 prices is estimated to have risen by 6.7% during 2017-18 compared to the previous year.
The per capita income in real terms during 2017-18 has increased by 5.4%.
The wholesale price index (WPI) has risen by 2.7%, 7.0%, 2.0% and 2.9% during April-March, 2017-18. The consumer price index has risen 3.6%.
GDP at current prices for the year 2017-18 is estimated to be `167.73 lakh crore, up 10.0 percent over the previous estimate of `152.54 lakh crore.

The sectors which registered growth rate of over 9.0 percent are mining, quarrying, trade, hotels, transport, communication and services related to broadcasting, financial, real estate and professional services.
The GNI at current prices is estimated to be higher during 2017-18 as compared to 2016-17.
The per capita income at current prices during 2017-18 is estimated to have reached a level of ` 112835 as compared to ` 103870 in 2016-17.
II ANNUAL ESTIMATES OF EXPENDITURES OF GDP, 2017-18
The CSO is releasing the Provisional Estimates of GDP by economic activity and Expenditures of the GDP at current and constant prices.
Private Final Consumption Expenditure
The current and constant prices of PFCE are estimated to increase by more than twice in 2017-18 compared to 2016-17.
Government Final Consumption Expenditure
The government's final consumption expenditure is estimated to be higher in 2017-18 than in 2016-17.
GFCF at current prices is estimated to be higher in 2017-18 than in 2016-17. GFCF as a percentage of GDP has also risen.
21. Expenditures of GDP are given in Statements 1 to 4.
III QUARTERLY ESTIMATES OF GDP FOR Q4 (JANUARY-MARCH), 2017-18
Estimates at constant prices for 2011-12.
GDP and GVA at constant prices at constant (2011-12) prices in Q4 of 2017-18 are estimated to have grown by 7.7 and 7.6% respectively.

Growth rates in various sectors in Q4 of 2017-18 are as follows: ‘agriculture, forestry, fishing, mining, quarrying, manufacturing, ‘electricity, gas, water supply and other utility services’ (7.1%, ‘construction’ 11.5%, 'trade, hotels, transport and communication', ‘financial, real estate and professional services‘ (5.0%, and ‘Public administration, defence and other Services’ 13.3%).
The IIP grew by 1.0% in Q4 of 2017-18 compared to Q4 in 2016-17.

The key indicators of railways have shown growth rates of 7.4 percent and 9.9 percent in Q4 of 2017-18 as compared to the previous year. In the transport and communication sectors, cargo handled at major ports has grown by 8.5 percent, while the trade, hotels, transport, communication and services related to broadcasting sector grew by 6.8%.

The PFCE and GFCF at constant (2011-12) prices in Q4 of 2017-18 are estimated to be `18.99 lakh crore and `11.19 lakh crore, respectively. The rates of the PFCe and G FCF as a percentage of GDP were 54.6 and 32.2% in Q 4 of 2017/18 compared to 55.2 and 30.3% in the previous quarter.
III . (b) Estimates at current prices.
GDP and GVA grew by 10.9 and 10.7% respectively in the fourth quarter of 2017-18.
The estimated PFCE and GFCF at current prices for Q4 of 2017-18 are estimated to be `26.21 lakh crore and `13.18 lakh crore, respectively.

The wholesale price index (WPI) has risen by 1.3%, 3.1%, (-)0.7%, 2.7% and 6.0% during Q4 of 2017-18. The WPI of minerals increased by 6.5%. The consumer price index has risen 4.6% during the same period.

Estimates of GVA at basic prices by kind of economic activity and the expenditures of GDP for the four quarters of 2015-16, 2016-17 and 2017-18 at constant (2011-12 and current prices) are given in Statements 5 to 8.30.
The next release of quarterly GDP estimate for the quarter April-June, 2018 (Q1 of 2018-19) will be on 31.08.2018.

Photo exhibition on Dynamic Schemes and Projects inaugurated
Union Minister Shri Vijay Goel lauds development initiatives
Vijay Goel inaugurated a photo exhibition on Dynamic Schemes and Projects titled, “Pragati Ke Path par” at Ambedkar International Centre in New Delhi.
Vijay Goel, Minister of State for India's Rural Development, has praised the strides in the infrastructure development under the leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

The photo exhibition of the schemes and projects aimed at improving quality of life of poor was held in the presence of the Union Minister for Human Resources Development, Shri Prakash Javedaker and Union Minister J P Nadda.
Payroll Reporting in India – A Formal Employment Perspective
The Central Statistics Office and Ministry of Statistics and Program Implementation has released the report on Employment Outlook of the country covering the period September, 2017 to March, 2018.
The Ministry of Labour has released the second series of employment related statistics in the formal sector covering the period September 2017 to February 2018.
The levels of employment are from various sources. Detailed information is separately published on the respective organizational websites for the period September, 2017 till March, 2018.
Please click here to access the detailed note related to Employment Outlook.
Photo exhibition on Dynamic Schemes and Projects to be inaugurated on 25th May

The Ministry of Statisitics and Programme implementation is organizing a Photo Exhibition on Dynamic Schemes and Major Central Sector Projects & Mega Cultural Programme on 25th-26th May 2018at Ambedkar International Centre (15, Janpath, New Delhi).
The exhibition of the schemes and projects aimed at improving quality of life of poor will be held on 25th May 2018.
General Guidelines on Quality Assurance for Official Statistics notified
The Ministry of Statistics & Programme Implementation has notified General Guidelines on Quality Assurance for Official Statistics.
The Guidelines for the Production of Official Statistics are designed to provide a framework for statistical collection and products.
All statistical agencies at the Centre and in the States/UTs have been advised to follow the guidelines.
Draft National Policy on Official Statistics (NPOS) placed in public domain inviting comments/views/suggestion by 31st May, 2018
The draft NPOS on Official Statistics is available at http://mospi.nic.in/announcements/suggestions/ suggestions/ suggestions.
